At QC Kinetix (Des Moines), we specialize in regenerative medicine solutions that help people find relief from chronic pain without invasive surgery or addictive medications. As a top-rated regenerative medicine clinic in Des Moines, our dedicated team creates customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our Comprehensive Services

include:

  • Joint pain management

  • Sports injury treatment

  • Arthritis pain relief

  • Non-surgical alternatives for knee, shoulder, and back pain

  • Personalized regenerative treatments

Located at 1903 EP True Pkwy Suite 301 in West Des Moines, our clinic combines expertise in orthopedic care, sports medicine, and alternative treatments to help you regain mobility and improve your quality of life. We're committed to providing compassionate care in a comfortable environment where your pain relief journey is our priority. Ready to explore how regenerative medicine can help you? Visit our website or call us at (515) 259-1227 to schedule your free consultation today.

Our goal is to help you find relief without resorting to invasive surgery or addictive pharmaceuticals. We'll customize a treatment plan that's tailored to your unique needs, so you can get back to living your life without pain.

column40: I felt quite relaxed in this office. Everyone was very friendly and considerate. I had injections in several joints and Jason's joyful, calming, and friendly personality helped make the injections bearable. I would recommend this site for anyone interested in trying the injections.|I was skeptical at first, especially with it all being out of pocket.  But, it worked!  I couldn't sleep at night with my shoulder pain. It's all gone now.  It actually started feeling better after the first few treatments.  I would highly recommend giving this a try especially if your doctor said there is nothing they can do.|Jason and his team are professional and caring.  The treatments I have received appear to be helping.  Three months from now will be the telling point.|I have had the best experience with QC Kinetics.  All of the staff is great and treats you like a valued customer!  When I started I could barely use my left leg and was in a ton of pain.   After just four injections, I feel like a brand new person!  My hip, knee, and ankle haven't felt this good since 2010!  Thanks for great care!  I would highly recommend this treatment with this team!|very pleased with the results so far. L2,3,4,5 & S1 have degeneration. In 6 months', time the healing has gone from pain level of 8 to a 2. I realize the treatments can't do anything for arthritis I pray the growth going on will work to off-set it. I would highly recommend QC Kinetix|Before going to QC Kenetix I was unable to walk long distances or stand for long periods of time due to severe back pain from arthritis. Cortisone injections didn't work. I was unable to enjoy playing with my grandchildren. I was extremely fatigued and didn't sleep well due to severe pain. The idea of having surgery frightened me. I have heard too many horror stories about surgery. Also the idea of long term down time does not work fork for due to being single and having many animals to care for. Instead of being able to carry hay bales or bags of feed I had to recruit friends to help me. I love my independence so it is very difficult to have to rely on friends. Now that I have had several treatments my sleep is better. My energy level is out of this world. I can again take my grandchildren to the park and enjoy it!!  I can also enjoy gardening and caring for all my animals. I highly recommend Jason at QC Kinetics. He is very knowledgeable and personable   He explains things well. Love my results|I am writing this review for my 75 year old dad.  He started this treatment because his mobility had diminished and it was affecting his daily life.  We were looking for a solution and he did not want surgery. He started treatment with QC Kinetix and it has already been a game changer for him. Jason and all of his staff are truly awesome! They provide a cutting edge type of medicine with a provider you can tell really does care.  I am so thankful that he went this route! He is back to taking his morning walks and back to his old self! It is more than worth the money! I highly recommend QC Kinetix!|Very satisfied. Started with severe pain in my knee. After all scheduled treatments I am 100% pain free. I was skeptical going into this but I am amazed at the results. Thank you to QC Kinetix for giving me my mobility back.

column38: Christopher Kelsey|Wendy Watson1
column40:
Was ushered in with a nice greeting and then 2 hours of back and forth fake smiles and wasted time. All the while choking down my flu issues. I went in simply to get a local source of my neurontin. I straigh up refused a shot and any discussion or notion of narcotics. I will make due, same as I have always done. I don't believe in a pill for every problem. But my nerve pain is getting intolerable.

Long and short of it, I was given one script after the doctor seemed unable to grasp my written, the Iowa City written, my pcp referral, or my verbal statement I had told him and the nurse on multiple occasions. 1 script, no refills. No clear idea on follow up. Glad I came to Dewitt over Iowa City....err

And btw, don't bother showing up or not showing up sick. If you show up sick, you will be greeted and coddled for half a second then all but told you are an idiot for coming. But if you don't, you will be potentially billed or not allowed to be seen. As I explained on multiple occasions. Explaining their own policies I got in the intake letter. And I'm the one with the memory issues....|They are always kind and caring. I have had chronic back pain for many years, and thanks to the treatments I get, I've been off pain meds for over a year.

column40:
I have gone to the Finley Pain Clinic to see Dr. Miller for 3 shots (two for thoracic and one recently for cervical). Dr. Miller has been nothing but kind and courteous to me. He took time to explain exactly what he was going to do.He did an excellent job with my procedure. I didn't even feel the needle go in. When he was done , he patted me on the arm and said that the procedure went well on his side, and he hoped that I thought it went well on my end. I would highly recommend someone see Dr. Miller.|Dr.Miller is extremely rude and prejudice he gives pain medicine to patients that abuse it and they clearly scream out drug addict but people that really need it he won't help you just rude.|Dr Miller has always treated me with expert knowledge. Always researching to alleviate pain

.|I can't understand all the bad reviews. I've been a patient of Dr. Miller's for years. He is direct but imagine all the people he sees just looking for pain pills and not a solution. I've never had a bad experience, I've always been treated with respect and felt like the whole staff cared.|Dr. Miller is so degrading. Makes you feel like a drug pusher or something. I've been dealing with spondylosis for the last 5-6 years and cannot find any relief. He is so rude and hard to communicate with I had to switch docters.|I was wheelchair bound from a ruptured disk in my lumbar section of my back and in constant pain. I went there with an appointment set up for an exam and medication refill, yet when I was taken to a room, I sat there waiting for 45 minutes. Miller walks in and seemed to avoid me completely then tells his nurse that he was going on to the next patient and to give me a paper on lower back pain. I heard that and said "um excuse me doctor Miller but I'm here for an examination and medication refill." He turned around and tells me that he's "not going to examine me and that I can leave." I'm like what the hell? I started to cry from how he was treating me and told him that I specifically made this appointment to be examined and determine if I should get a medication refill or do a cortisone injection. He told me "well I'm not going to examine you and you can either leave or he'd have the police remove me from the clinic." Omg why was I being treated like this? I refused to leave and even the nurse looked shocked at what he was saying. He told the nurse that I "either leave or she was to call police." I was his patient for over a year and he used to be caring and he knew I had a legitimate spinal problem causing severe pain. Reluctantly the nurse said "yes doctor". They pushed my wheelchair out through the waiting room and to the hall and walked away leaving me there. I ended up in the ER following this nightmare and they quickly saw the damaged nerve from the rupture.|Very degradiing. At the end you are treated like a drug user even if you never have.  Been through 3 different  cancers. And only wanted relief. Was put on muscle relaxer for bone pain neck pain and severe neuropathy. Doesnt help when getting up bending over walking. But it will let u sleep all day|I was nervous after reading other bad reviews. The doctor and nurses were all professional, friendly, and accommodating. They explained everything thoroughly.

column40:
Been seeing Dr. Moyse for years and he is the one doctor who has helped with my neck pain. Highly recommend. He did nerve ablations that helped me with the pain. Prior doctors just prescribed drugs but he addressed the root of my problem. Also he takes the time to listen to you and discuss things instead of hurrying along. Great physician.|Dr. Moyse has been nothing but amazing!!
He has worked hard to figure me out and never stopped when things didn't work.
Most people would give up but he did not!!
I highly recommend him!!|Dr. Moyse has been wonderful!  He is treating my very difficult disease with ketamine infusions.  He is so kind hearted & has not given up on my progress, though I was slow to respond.  The nurses & staff are also wonderful & caring!  I feel so lucky to have them as part of my care team!|Really enjoy Dr. Moyse. He listens to what I have to say. A doctor that actually listens:)  He will try different medical options till one works or at least reduces pain. I have stumped him a few times medically and he still finds a way to help. He has a great personality and treats you like family. If only all doctors could be like him.|He knew my history before he walked in the door! Kind to me, as well as my husband. Have told many I am so glad I finally decided to try the pain clinic, and to have gotten Dr. Moyse!|My cousin was not listened to by the staff nor Dr Moyse. She'd wanted to get off of methadone, which she'd been on for 30 + years due to chronic pain. She was very thin, weak and had suffered a brain bleed due to car accident.  Dr Moyse dropped her off of methadone in a week and a half.
She suffered massive withdrawal symptoms, until helped by any prescription meds to help.
I've threatened to contact the Iowa Med Board. Beware of their treatment code prior to going to see this clinic.|I have been seeing Dr. Moyse since June 2017. I have major back problems and the insurance company and Dan have  gone through the progress of helping me get out of pain. Friday I had the nerves on the left side of my back burned and in 2 weeks I will have my right side burned. Everyone has been so nice and professional. I have no complaints about Dr. Moyse. So far he has been a very compassionate and supportive Doctor. If something should change I will give another review. I want out of pain. I was on pain medication and I stopped taking it February 25th last year. This country has decided not to prescribe any form of pain relief for the many people who live in pain every single day of their life. I have the issues with my back and cause problems with my legs. So I am hoping this procedure works. I don't want to have to take pain medication.....WHICH I WILL NOT BE GETTING ANYWAY.  THIS SCREWED UP COUNTRY IS MORE COMPASSIONATE ABOUT ANIMALS THAN THEY ARE TO HUMANS. PEOPLE WILL TURN TO STREET DRUGS, ALCOHOL WHATEVER THEY CAN GET. THOSE OF US WHO ARE RESPONSIBLE SUFFER FROM THE IDIOTS THAT OVERDOSE. INSURANCE COMPANIES AND ALL WHO ARE INVOLVED SHOULD LET THE DOCTORS HAVE THE LAST WORD ON THEIR PATIENTS.|2 years and and only relief was 2 days at most !!
Changes nurses all the time always gotta explain over and over my symptoms! Found billing for services I never received

column40:
Would  not advise anyone to seek pain support from Chris Hanson. He does not look at past records for what he has performed. He is difficult to get an appointment with when you are truly in pain.  He travels and makes it it very difficult to see him at the same place and records do not transfer. He has student fellowship trainees come in, which he gets paid for, and he  is not in the room when they push and pull on your body parts which causes much more pain, as they have have not been privy to your xrays or MRIs. I do think Chris is a good person but had to move on after 6 years to someone who could truly help me with my pain.|Karen, an employee is refusing to help get my original records so that I, as a Post Traumatic Brain Survivor ( 2nd time going through the trauma from a severe head Injury ) to help me complete necessary healthcare forms for my Disability.  She argued with me on the phone and questioned why I as a patient would need my records from so long ago. She also insinuated that I did not know what type of doctor I was seeing.
My ex-husband and I were referred to the clinic and had driven from Sioux City, IA to Carroll IA.  I'm beside myself to get the help I need.  She is refusing to help me and told me no.  She also said she didn't have to tell me her last name and credentials.  This is not in the best interest of providing individual wellbeing health care to myself as a client. I requested the original hard copy file the doctor read to my ex-husband and I in order to help give the most accurate information to the health care providers and she blatantly denied me any help.

The Iowa laws are not being met;

Right to Access. The right to see and get a copy of your medical record.
Right to Amend. The right to have information added to your medical record to make it
more complete or accurate. The right to amend does not mean a right to have
information erased or removed.|

column40:
Went to the appointment with my elderly mother and we were told after my daughter dropped us off and went to her appointment that she had to "Check in" with them before she left. They knew she was dropping us off. I had told them this on the phone when i made the appointment but they said this was something new they started, so they would not take us for our appointment. We waited for an hour for my daughter to get back from her Dr's appointment to pick us up. While in the waiting room, the staff vacuumed, talked loudly and laughed.  They have always been very unprofessional there but we just put up with it. On our last visit 2 weeks ago the nurse and the receptionist ran to the window to "make sure" our driver was there and we didn't  drive ourselves. In the past they had told me they have chased people down in the parking lot because they were driving themselves and did not habe a driver. I just go and get a shot in my butt. I don't need a driver when i get  over  75 injections in the veins in my legs in iowa city!!! I guess they  think they know more than iowa city!!

They have used the word frickin on many occasions. They charge you a sur charge for using a credit  card. The only reason I kept going there is because this is where my Dr. Referred me to, but after today I am done!!! Oh, and to top it off, we had to wait outside in the cold the last minutes because they said they were closing. My mom is almost 80 and uses a cane and it was 37 degrees and no seating available outside!! Would DEFINATELY   NOT recommend  this place!!|I went here because I had a lot of extreme  pain in my upper back behind my shoulder blade.  The doctor there told me that he would give me shots to relieve the pain and after the 2nd one my pain was not relieved.  I mentioned it to the nurse and she said she would talk to the doctor and have him see me.  I have been there numerous times and had only seen the doctor my 1st initial visit.  He always came in after I was asleep and left by time I woke up,  I have called many  many times and they do not respond to my calls.  I feel that  the doctor doesn't care enough for his patients to get back with them!  There was a massage therapist that I went to inbetween visits and she was absolutely amazing!  I received a txt message saying that she had been let go.  She was the only one in that office that even cared about patients.  I do not reccommend this place what so ever!  The only reason I gave 1 star is because they wouldn't let me post otherwise!|I have had great success here with my knee pain. Staff is very friendly and there isn't much sitting around and waiting. I get right in and right out.    I have full confidence in them  and keep coming back.|Friendly staff, knowledgeable and accommodating as well. Very quick and painless procedure. Thanks!|They really help my pain to get it down to where I can focused.

column40: Dr Kari is by far my favorite Dr ever. He is compassionate and truly cares about his patients. His knowledge in treating chronic pain is phenomenal. I highly recommend him to anyone and everyone. His entire staff is a pleasure as well. It puts me at peace everytime I am going to him because I have so much faith in him and his abilities, I know he does all he possibly can to keep my chronic pain under control. Thank you, Dr Hottie & Crew, for all that you do!!|I have multiple issues with my neck and back. Dr Kari listens and together we have decided on courses of treatment. His staff has been exceptional!  I highly recommend Dr Kari and his team!|dr Kari and his staff are beyond the best. They have helped me for years and I wouldn't trust anyone else with what I have going on with anyone else. I have a spinal stimulator and he has went above and beyond to do the best in my care. All of them have been amazing!  He is hands down the best Dr!!!|Been seeing for Dr. Kari for about 2yrs now and my only complaint is not really a complaint but a suggestion. be sure to plan a couple hours for appointment for multiple reasons 1- very busy with a lot of patience (would you want a doctor who's schedule is wide open?) 2- he takes his time and really cares about you! He listens to you (which sometimes me trying to explain what hurts or how it hurts I'm not sure how he knows what I'm saying)|Started out really liking him! Then had to deal with 2 of his PA's. BOTH were seriously lacking in knowledge of my condition. Was pretty much told I had to try Lyrica if I still wanted my meds. I was adamant about NOT wanting it due to weight gain. None the less, 2 months later 20lb weight gain after losing 100 on my own and keeping it off for 6 years. After I read my Uchart notes by this PA? I was livid! Pay attention to the notes on your visit! I never ASKED for it.... The communication in the office is or was severely lacking. I was softly scolded for canceling my injections BECAUSE MY MOM WAS BEING REMOVED FROM LIFE SUPPORT! No one passed this on to him. So at my next one, he was he seemed a bit irritated on why I cancelled; this was the day after I buried her. I showed up for that one. The PA was asking me 3 months later why I was "still depressed"?!?!? It seemed like after those PA's left, it was SCS...every appt. SCS! I will NOT do them. I wanted to try other things. I found a doctor who would, he fired me as a patient. I wish things would've went better.|What can I say! Dr. Maruti kari. Takes the time to not only hear what his patients say, but actually takes into consideration that he can't feel what you do. That everyone knows their own body best. He makes sure you can atleast get yourself up and moving and living your life. Not crippled at home by you pain/pains... Dr. Kari is caring. If I had 3 thumbs thats how many I'd give him.|Naruto Kari is incapable of treating peripheral neuropathy. My wife was in more pain after meeting him. He would not return phone calls, and left my wife high and dry without any pain management. He is a quack and an a$$hole of a human being.|Consistently waited two hours past my appointment time to see the doctor, who wouldn't even be in the room for 5 minutes. He also dismissed me from care after only attempting one type of treatment (steroid injections) which was unsuccessful. He said the only thing he could do is recommend me for a spinal cord simulator. I'm 23 years old, and he literally tried nothing else. A recommendation for a stimulator at that stage was wildly inappropriate. Meanwhile I go to an out-of-system family medicine NP who prescribed me gabapentin and my symptoms have been greatly reduced. This option was not even discussed by Dr. Kari. There's no reason that a board certified anesthesiologist wouldn't know about this option or consider it unless he was just trying to shove a patient out the door. Do yourself a favor and see a different specialist. This one does not care about you whatsoever.

column38: Diana R|Emma Bach|Graceisfree Glory
column40:
If it weren't for Dr Wickle, I don't know where I'd be.  I was injured in school district, and faught to be able to get neck relief, since I was badly injured.  I could not even turn my head. My good friend Barb told me about him,  so after YeArS, I went.  He did a specific spinal to neck injection, and it was like- my life was totally different. I had to repeat it,and just kept getting better.
I can't thank you enough.|If I could give Justin Wikle 0 stars I would. I went in as a 19 y/o that had been dealing with moderate to severe low back pain for 3 years. After trying many rounds of physical therapy and medications, I was sent to Justin. He came into the room and immediately was confused why I was there. He would ask things like "who referred you?" and "if you were at sports medicine, why would you come over here?",  as if he didn't care to read any of the previous Doctors notes. He then proceeded to tell me, that even though the mri came back with MULTIPLE factors that were causing this pain including: 5 bulging discs, slipped vertebrae, facet anthropathy, and many many more, he concluded that I quote was " just uncomfortable and wasn't in any real pain". He then proceeded to say on my mychart notes that it had something to do with my history of mild anxiety that was causing me to have this pain. Then when I went in for my injection, he did not speak or say anything to me. Would rather do anything than recommend this Doctor.|Let's start at the beginning. This doctor thinks a patient who has broken 5 vertebrae in their back and has severe degenerative disc disease in their neck should take cymbalta or Lyrica. And if neither of these is a good fit, although the patient has clearly been a responsible patient and very conservative when it comes to narcotics, ie oxycodone or lortab, this doctor told me "You better hang onto the pills you have because you're not getting anymore." I tried to tell this doctor that people who need pain medicine might die from fentanyl because they bought it from an untrustworthy source. This doctor couldn't care less about people dying from fentanyl overdose. I asked him if I'm supposed to be in pain on a scale of 1-10 at an 8 while narcotics sit on the shelf of a pharmacy and he said "The world is full of pain." Wow! Sadistic bully! So I told him I'm disabled and I am asking for a reasonable accommodation according to the ADA. He said he was not going to grant a reasonable accommodation. So I told him that he has to enter the interactive process. He said he was not going to. So I informed him that I would be considering a federal civil rights lawsuit against him for disability discrimination. He smirked at me and told me we were done and opened the door for me to leave.

People are dying, committing suicide and taking fentanyl laced pills because of doctors like this man who thinks it's ok to deny pain meds for people with chronic pain that makes it impossible to work or socialize or live their lives. Pain is supposed to just be part of life and if your life is unbearable oh well too bad so sad. Some people get pain meds no problem. And others of us especially lower socio economic class just has to suffer.

We'll see what the local federal district court thinks about that. I intend to file a federal lawsuit to hold him accountable. This is not patient care. It's cookie cutter, assembly line, conveyor belt medicine. One size or drug fits all. That's corporate medicine not individualized patient care. You and I deserve better.

column48: How do I know if my knee pain is serious?
column49:
Knee pain can range from mild discomfort to severe agony, and it's often challenging to determine whether your symptoms are serious or not. Generally speaking, you should take your knee pain seriously if it:

Persists for an extended period - If you have knee pain that doesn't go away after a few days or even weeks, it's a sign that you should seek medical attention.

Limits your mobility - If your knee pain makes it challenging to perform regular activities like walking or standing, you should seek medical advice.

Causes swelling or redness - If your knee appears swollen or red, it may indicate an underlying injury or inflammation.

Occurs after a traumatic event - If you experience sudden knee pain after a fall, collision, or other traumatic events, you should see a doctor as soon as possible.

Accompanied by other symptoms - If your knee pain is accompanied by other symptoms like fever, chills, or a rash, you should seek medical attention right away.

column40: I was a patient here for several years. The care is not patient centered at all. I saw Shelley and she always acted like it was an inconvenience to partake in my 5 minute appointment that I personally had to wait 30-45 minutes to be called back for majority of the time. Anytime I called with a problem or when I needed a refill, Gina and Dion were extremely rude and unprofessional. I was yelled at countless times by both on the phone. Gina was talking bad about me to her coworkers after she told me she was putting me on hold. Little did she know I could hear her. I do not recommend coming to this clinic. They are a money hungry office with unprofessional staff. Shelley tried to force procedures on me countless times with no regard to existing medical conditions or my feelings towards the procedures. Please do yourself a favor and don't come here. It was a horrible experience for many years and I regret being a patient for as long as I was. I only stayed with the clinic because it was convenient at the time and because of the amount of pain I was in. I still have excruciating pain everyday but I made the decision to discontinue my care here earlier this year. It was a hard decision but the best one for me mentally. It's not worth the monthly battle. Your provider should care and want to help, or at least act like it considering it is their job after all.|The ladies at the front desk on 90th Street are wonderful and so helpful without even being asked. column40:
Nice staff and good clinicians. There have been only a couple of annoyances:
1.) two separate instances of prescriptions not being sent to the pharmacy, resulting in wasted trips to the pharmacy and time spent on the phone, trying to reach the clinicians and, ultimately, get the prescriptions sent.

2.) Surgery start time was delayed by two hours. Even though one hour was the initial estimate (upon arrival), a call/text letting us know (so as to avoid just sitting in the waiting area), would have been wonderful.

For timely service, I, unfortunately, have to recommend ignoring the automated prompts to leave a voicemail for the clinicians. Just follow the prompts for speaking with the scheduling department (to actually get through). Again, good people, just some processes that should be improved.|They have wonderful solutions here but it takes days for Dr Bell's nurse to get back to me and only if I beg her to actually correspond with me. Pharmacy always has to call multiple times for my monthly refill of a drug that isn't controlled and Dr won't put refills on it, which would help prevent this. They also do not do their proper due diligence with insurance. Tired of the victim blaming. When you and the insurance letter say it is covered and you tell me I only owe a copay what do you think I expect to pay? A copay only. You know it is impossible to fully understand an insurance plan but on your hand you know how much it will be... tell me why with insurance covering 100$ my botox costs MORE than what you said I owed without insurance!? I also keep asking for my invoice and don't get any response back... And I am noticing the unprofessional way these reviews are responded to. Please know it doesn't make the business look good to argue with patients and put their info out publicly. It's more graceful to take criticism with dignity and quietly. Screenshot is an example of the unprofessional way they reply to reviews when instead they could say NOTHING. Makes me think twice about going here now.|The front office staff and billing department are awful. They didn't bother to tell me I had to pay in advance. When I was trying to figure out how much I had on my HSA the office staff acted like I was inconveniencing them. Along with that the facilities were unclean and Dr. Ray is unprofessional. I heard her explaining to someone in the office they offshore their billing department to keep costs low. During another visit Dr Ray spent more time trying to decide what needed to be ordered for lunch than she did with me. I've never heard another Dr talk about anything other than my care. Steer clear of this place. I've called to cancel my next appointment which is a week away. I'm hoping they don't charge me a cancellation fee.|Dr Kneeman has helped my husband greatly! After multiple appointments and several Doctors that were unsuccessful, he is finally getting relief. Not only did he give him relief, he took the time to explain every step we were taking to resolve his issues. I would recommend him to everyone that has nerve pain in the neck!!!  Thanks, Dr. Kneeman!|I've been dealing with neck and shoulder pain for a year and a half.  It's gotten to the point where it has consumed my life.  Been to several doctors for this - 2 ortho doctors, physical therapist, chiropractor, psychiatrist, and a neurosurgeon.  None of them seemed to listen.  Just wanted to prescribe muscle relaxers, all to which never worked, and rush me out of the office.  Basically said it was just muscle knots and deal with it.  Hard to deal with when it consumes my life.  I started losing faith in doctors.  Seemed none of them truly cared about their patients.  Felt I was destined to live in so much pain. Then, I found Dr. Kneeman.  He takes the time to listen to your problems and trouble shoots what can be done to help alleviate the pain.  Was so impressed when he sat down next to me and took the time to explain the procedures and answer all questions.  Doesn't hurry up and rush out of the office.  When one type of treatment doesn't work, he trouble shoots other solutions.  It's so nice to finally have found a doctor that cares about his patients and wants to find a solution and won't stop until he does.|UPDATE 12/19/2024: The snappy receptionist vehemently refused to send a written confirmation that my appointment was canceled and now they're insisting I pay a "no-show" fee. She acted like it was going to kill her to have to send a single email or text message and now I'm getting asked to pay $25 because reception can't do their jobs properly (or even with a good attitude)?

ORIGINAL: Good practitioners, awful reception staff. Front office was snappy at me after they messed up MY appointment and booked it at the wrong place... after asking where I wanted to book the appointment. If you ask for follow-up or confirmation you'll get snapped at (and they won't do it).|I see Dr. Kneeman at the Overland Park and Lawrence locations for my challenging condition. His kindness and caring attitude is wonderful! He listens, accesses, educates, and treats to the best he can for my needs. He explains each procedure before and during, and really has great kindness for his patients. I know this service isn't easy with my situation, but we still tackle it together. He is the reason I continue with this clinic. Time is so appreciated. Attitude and effort is what we can control, and he does that well with my issues.|Dr. Dalal is my pain management specialist and she is an extraordinary doctor. She is patient, kind, and very thorough. She's been my doctor for many years and has helped me with excruciating back pain and won't give up until there is a solution for your discomfort. I highly recommend her at Kansas Pain Management.

At Genesis Pain Management Clinic of Overland Park, we provide advanced pain relief solutions that transform lives. Since 2015, our practice has been led by Dr. Raza Jafri, a board-certified anesthesiologist with specialized training in pain medicine. Our expertise lies in delivering personalized care using cutting-edge diagnostic testing and fluoroscopic procedures to address a wide range of pain conditions.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

  • Regenerative techniques for joint, tendon, and ligament injuries

  • Spinal cord stimulator implantation

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Migraine treatment protocols

  • Interventional procedures for low back and neck pain

We take pride in our patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans that focus on restoring function and enhancing quality of life. Our state-of-the-art facility in Overland Park is equipped with the latest technology to ensure precise diagnosis and effective treatment of chronic pain conditions. Visit Genesis Pain Management Clinic today and take your first step toward a pain-free future.

column38: shelby owings|Kingpink|Nicole Wilbourn|Brandon Spaeth|Carol Carter|Megan Casey|Vit C|Kelly Evinger
column40:
If you're seeking a professional, patient, and understanding doctor, Genesis Pain Clinic may not be the best fit for you. There have been numerous complaints from both staff and patients regarding Dr. Jafri's treatment of those around him, describing his behavior as disrespectful and rude. Additionally, the clinic often experiences staffing shortages, and there are concerns about the qualifications of some staff members who may not be licensed or adequately trained for their roles.
If you are looking for a professionals Genesis Pain Clinic is not what I recommend.|Dr. Jafri and his staff have been a huge help for me.  I was able to get into see him on short notice, and he and his assistants spent a great deal of time listening to my concerns and helping me.  I am now pain free, and couldn't be any happier.  I can't recommend him highly enough. (Of note:  insurance companies no longer pay much at all for these types of services, hence, an out-of-pocket amount will be assessed prior to getting treated.  When it comes to chronic pain, every penny was worth it!) Thanks again to Dr. Jafri and his friendly staff.|PLEASE SCROLL DOWN TO READ THE OTHER 1 STAR REVIEWS BECAUSE THAT IS EXACTLY HOW I WAS TREATED! I should have done more research before I went to this clinic. This is by far the most unprofessional doctors office I have been to. Dr. Jafri acts like he hates his job and gets offended if you ask him any questions. He guilt tripped me to pay everything out of pocket even though I have insurance. I paid everything out of pocket and did a couple rounds of trigger point injections (they were $350 each time and I got it done twice with no relief!) and he put me on the weight loss injection medication that was $400 a month! He had bullied me into getting the $400 medication. Little did I know I was going to end up in the ER because of it. He failed to mention that medication is for a type 2 diabetics and it helps them to maintain or lose weight because it suppresses your hunger, severely. If he would have asked me if I have ever had issues with my sugar, I would have told him yes! I have had some episodes in the past where my sugar was very low. He could have warned me to look for the signs when my sugar was getting too low. Because this medication made me so nauseous, I would go a long time without eating and he wanted me to up the dose. Unfortunately my sugar went dangerously low and I ended up in the ER on my vacation! After that incident, I cancelled everything with him. I cancelled my cervical epidural procedure because he wanted me to pay out of pocket for that, which is $1300. I told him I was going to follow up with my PCP because I was extremely sick and needed to figure things out. As far as pain goes, NO RELIEF. I spent over $2000 with his clinic and they did not help me at all. I saw my PCP and we stopped the weight loss medication because it was way to strong for someone that is hypoglycemic. I also got an MRI and it turns out I had a cervical spondylosis. I decided to get a second opinion by a different pain management. I also wanted to try out going to a chiropractor and the relief from the chiropractor has been amazing! I ended up cancelling my appointment with the new clinic. I didn't need all the trigger point injections and weight loss medication. Dr. Jafri is rude, has horrible bed side manners, and is all about money. It is truly unfortunate I didn't read the other 1 star reviews until after everything I went through with his clinic. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.|Dr. Jafri and the team at Genesis have helped me so much with chronic neck and upper back pain! They are all kind and truly want to help people in pain. We have tried multiple treatment methods which have all help reduce my pain level and helped me live an active lifestyle. I am very grateful for Dr. Jafri and his staff!|This business deserves more than 4 stars
I was there May 13-26 2024
Dr Jafri is an awesome Doctor who places his patients first

I fly from Canada because I trust him with my care
Thanks to his expertise I have my life back

No more shin or knee pain
Please go there for your treatments as you will receive the best care !!!|I have had Gastroparesis for years and been battling flare ups often the past year. I had a Dr treat me with ketamine in an ER and it immediately stopped my vomiting! I came to Dr Jafri interesting in finding a Dr willing to take this journey with me and give it a try. Just completed my sixth Ketamine infusion and to say it's life-changing is an understatement! It has truly helped me finally "live my life to its fullest" thanks to him believing in me and thinking outside the box. I am forever grateful for him and all of his incredible staff!|I recently visited the clinic for a stellate ganglion block procedure, performed by Dr. Jafri, aimed at addressing the loss of smell and taste I've been suffering from as a result of long covid. The results have been nothing short of miraculous, restoring my senses and, by extension, significantly improving my quality of life.

Dr. Jafri provided comprehensive care, taking the time to sit down with me both before and after the procedure to ensure I was fully informed about every aspect of the process. This level of patient care and communication was incredibly reassuring and greatly appreciated. I was hesitant in reaching out as this is a sensitive procedure with little information. He researched my situation and existing studies before proceeding.

I am forever grateful to Dr. Jafri and the entire clinic staff for their professionalism, expertise, and the life-changing outcome of my treatment. I almost lost my house one day because I didn't even smell a burning toaster next to me.

Their dedication to patient well-being has made a profound difference in my life, and I cannot recommend them highly enough.

If anyone has questions, I would be happy to answer them. I hope and pray that studies to discover damage from long covid continues.|Dr Jafri is very good about managing my pain and I have been able to decrease my pain medication tremendously. Amine and Michelle are both very nice, knowledgeable and always able to answer all my questions. I will continue to recommend Genesis pain clinic to my patients that need pain management.

I call and no one ever answers.  I am waiting on Insurance approval for some time now.  I have a lot of pain in my neck. I was misdiagnosed by doctors at St. Francis forcing me to rely on the pain clinic to function like a normal adult. I decided to try CBD (which was a legal grey area in Kansas at the time). I did this because I wasn't fond of having to take so many prescription pain killers. My doctor noticed a difference because it cut my pain pill usage in half. "That's great! Keep doing what you're doing." She didn't know I was using CBD. Unfortunately the CBD product I was using made me come up positive for marijuana on a drug test. They claimed there was a way to tell the difference and the nurse said I was definitely using marijuana. (Years later, medical research has shown that some cbd products can make you pop positive on a drug test.) The nurse went from being very nice to treating me like I was a disgusting drug addict. I was denied my medication and left to deal with debilitating pain on my own. I lost my job because I was in so much pain. I moved to another state and found a fantastic doctor that figured out what was actually causing my severe pain. I am now pain free. If you're reading this- avoid St. Francis and get out of Topeka.  I won't ever get the years that were taken from me back.|Dr Gaume and his staff are amazing!! Dr G has so much patience and actually cares about his patients. column49: Hi Michael - thanks for your question. Our clinic does prescribe medication, but does not automatically take over medications/prescriptions. Your neurologist can give you a referral and you'll need to schedule a consulatative appointment with a physician in the Pain Center for evaluation.

Dr. Sayed and his staff have managed my pain for over two years. I was in significant pain long before I was referred to his clinic. The simplest movement caused life changing spasms. On first visit, he was well acquainted with my history and showed me my MRIs to explain my pain. I still remember him telling me, "I can help you." And he has.

The staff has been outstanding.  Their compassion for my pain is always there. So, thank you Jessica, Jennife, Abby, Megan, and Laura. And I am sure I missed many. I can't say enough positive things about my experiences at Olathe Pain Management. They have given me back a life.|Dr. Syed has been so kind and empathetic. I had 2 epidural injections done today and they were quite uncomfortable but the nurses and assistants were so kind and took such good care of me.  They brought me warm blankets and encouraged me through it and really exemplified compassionate care.|They forgotten schedule an appointment for us, then they say we'll it was supposed to be last week, when they know better. This place is a joke, right along with their staff, who shouldn't be in this field. I would recommend going elsewhere for pain management, and quit lining these peoples pockets with money they don't deserve. Worst pain management center in erica.|Administrators are kind and friendly while promptly getting you checked in for your appointment.   Dr. Michael Tollette, Jennifer McIvor, APRN and nurses are fantastic|The people locally are wonderful and very caring. I cannot say enough good things about the doctors and nursing staff. The reason for only 3 stars is that I had a procedure scheduled for 12/6/22. This was arranged at my last visit on 11/7/22. Unfortunately this was not sent in to insurance for approval until 12/1/22 and was denied the day prior to my appointment which causes my schedule and those taking off work to care for me to also change their schedules. Thankfully the staff has worked me in prior to the new year but some may not have that good fortune. Those in charge of and responsible for submitting claims to the insurance company need to do a better job of submitting these claims in a reasonable timeframe to be approved.|After my Google review, I was suddenly able to schedule an appointment!! After months of calls, emails, and left phone messages.

I waited 30+ minutes for the doctor, who didn't even apologize for making me wait. Clear contrast to all other entities/offices that I have used within the Olathe Health Center umbrella....they should be ashamed of the service they provide for their patients.

column11: As an independent free standing pain clinic in Wichita, Kansas, Advanced Pain Medicine Associates offers unprecedented quality of care and dedication in the management and treatment of pain. column38: Janet Stanley|C E|Jennifer S.|Allie Billat|Liz Folsom-White|Tera Rau|Mary Williamson|Nancy Rilloraza
column40:
Dr. Parks has given me several epidural shots.  They have been very effective for a lumbar spine issue.  I highly recommend them.  The staff is friendly and caring. What a great outcome after a great amount of pain!|I absolutely love Dr. Park's team, I see Alex and her an Bonnie are 100%, hands down, the best!
I've been under their care for almost a year, and to say they have improved my quality of life is an understatement. I am able to work and not be at an 11 on the pain scale by the end of my day, all because they have helped me.
Now the first month or so was a doozy, trying to find the right combination of meds was trial an error at first. But we got that sorted out.
Some people are put off by the contract don't drink, don't use drugs, make sure u have the correct number of meds by the next months appointment.  It isn't hard if u want to be helped. Be honest with yourself an them an it all works out.
I definitely recommend this facility an the providers. Alex and Bonnie are wonderful.|Had a cervical steroid ESI yesterday and the process went so smoothly. Dr. Parks took his time, was caring, and walked me through the entire process as it was happening. The staff was awesome, a 10/10. I never once felt rushed or that I was just another number. If you are looking to be treated as a person and not just another insurance claim, this is the office for you.|I see Dr. Mindy.  She's awesome!!  I have also had steroidal injections administered by Dr. Parks with great results!  Excellent staff & excellent service!  I never have to wait more than 5 mins to see my doc. Highly recommend!|I am on the fence. The PA I was seeing retired, Dr. Parks is very good at what he does and deserves that credit. Front office staff has always been kind, Jennifer has been helpful for sure in another area of the office. Scheduling...uh not so much with their response to your questions. Rec'd a call today that was unexpected but I am so glad they called HOWEVER,   Scheduler: calling to get you scheduled for *** injection. I said: Oh, so my insurance approved the procedure? Scheduler: well that is why we are calling.  hmm, legit question for me, last visit was "scheduling for injection and it turned out to be just a consult when I came to the appt, was not what I understood it to be, I was sooo upset so this question was legit and definitely did not warrant some response like that but that is usually what I get from scheduling.  I am thankful for them getting me scheduled but the past responses have been what I would deem inappropriate for that position and kind of rude and some were a little evasive. As a patient, there are those questions that we are going to ask, especially if we have not gotten clear answers prior or have had problems with prior authorizations in the past, I feel the appropriate answer would of been YES, your insurance approved to procedure for ***** on this date **/**/2024.  How hard is that?  Just a suggestion, patients being called and schedule deal with alot more then some ppl have had to deal with themselves, try to be kind and understanding and just clearly answer our questions.  This steers patients away and effects the office as a whole and brings questions to light when we come there and do we trust? What else do we need to worry about. Step into our shoes for a minute.|My husband went here and they claimed he tested positive for alcohol ( which by the way isn't illegal) but apparently when you sign a contract with them, you can't drink, too controlling and very rude, and they cancel your contract and leave you hang out to dry|WARNING!! Please take caution before Epidural Steroid Injections!! This review is not personal towards any doctors or medical staff here, it's simply what happened to me, meaning it can happen to you too! In short summary, after participating in eight weeks of physical therapy sessions, I was told from professional medical staff that physical therapy didn't work for me and I should consider getting epidural steroid injections to alleviate my pain.  As a consequence to having these injections, I suffered excruciating pain that required ER visits, an enormous amount of pain medication, loss of physical independence and severe depression/anxiety.  I have spent over a year visiting medical specialists, and participating in quality physical therapy(s) recovering from my body rejecting to injections in my L4, L5, and S1 just to achieve pre-injection status. My story is too long for a review. Please read my other medical oriented reviews to receive a glimpse of other therapies and specialists I've had to rely on during this long pain journey to recover from my choice to have epidural steroid injections.  I'm wishing you the best of luck on your pain journey!!|I have been going to this office for several years. They have been very sympathetic to my pain issues. They have tried many different things to get me the best care. I have no problems being seen quickly. Mindy is great and discusses what works and what doesn't.  Dr. Parks has always been kind and professional.  He truly cares.

column40:
I haven't met with Dr. Scott yet today I saw Dr. Dean I think was his name (I'm sorry I am terrible with names) but he was absolutely amazing!!! The front desk ladies were awesome and helpful since we had some issues with the patient portal. The gentleman I met with today was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful, for first time in over a decade I actually felt like a medical professional LISTENED to me!! I teared up because he spent so much time with me and didn't brush off my concerns, he treated me like a fellow human being that was just in a lot of pain, not like a number on a chart to be billed for insurance. He didn't rush me, he understood my pain and is committed to finding the actual root of the problem and not just sticking me with needles to mask the symptoms. He saw the pain in my face, he saw how tired I am of being ignored and brushed off by other medical professionals... for first time in years I felt SEEN and HEARD!

My husband was in waiting room waiting for me, as I walked out I looked at him with tears in my eyes and just said "that man is a damn Unicorn!!" I actually cried on the way home because I have not seen a doctor who actually cared so much in so long. This doctor has actually given me hope, something I gave up on a long time ago when it comes to medical issues. This doctor has seriously saved my life, I had all but given up any hope of finding a medical professional that would take me seriously and not dismiss me, I was not far off from just giving up completely on even trying to get medical care. Thank you Dr. Dean.... Thank you for giving me hope, for seeing me and my pain, for being willing to tackle the challenges with my back and medical issues...|If I could give them a million stars I would. They are all like family now. Been going to them for my lower back and sciatica for years! I have long intervals when I don't need treatments at all. Highly recommend getting care here!|Loved Scott and his professionalism, kindness and determination to help his patients. With that being said, the gate keeper office staff are the exact opposite. Rude and lazy as in not doing their work as far as insurance authorization for payment. Easier for them just to bill the patient. Sorry Scott I wont be back. You need to get rid of some people in the insurance department  of your business.|I have had nothing but the BEST experience here at the Flint Hills Pain Management. I have had ongoing chronic back pain since a hospital visit in June. After trying everything and seeing every doctor within 2 hours of me I came here. Scott is amazing and is fantastic at talking through everything with me and staying so positive through the whole process. The Ladies at the desk are beyond professional and don't miss a beat. Every visit has been worth the 1 1/2 drive. I am so glad I got referral for this specific office. Couldn't be happier!|Have been getting treatment for several years for low back arthritis. Staff is great , provider is very gentle almost painless.  Usually not much of a wait. Also appreciate that they really have a passion for those who serve/served in the armed forces.  Best clinic in Manhattan|Scott really is the best pain management specialist around. I would highly recommend him and his staff is so wonderful and helpful. I really enjoy Mary she's super sweet. They really listen to you and your concerns and take the time to explain everything to you. The best bed side manner you could ask for they all make you feel so comfortable.|Dr. Neville is amazing. The whole staff is amazing. Mary is very kind and they both have great conversation. I was seeing them when I was active duty and now I am medically retired. I had to poke and prod the VA to get them to get me local pain management. I have had my pain injections and now nerve ablation with them. They make me feel comfortable. Almost like I am at a friend's office. He genuinely wants his patients to be as pain free as possible but he gives you all tue information up front and never pressures me. I have to keep getting the ablations done for a few years and I will continue coming here!|Dr. Kyle had up and leave due to better job opportunities. I really do love the new doctor there. HOWEVER, it is nearly impossible to get seen, because he bounces between clinics, not his fault, but the new receptionist is down right rude. She's the older woman. She lacks customer service completely, she speaks to customers rude, looks at customers rude and treats military members like they are dirt. She is unable to keep up with the work flow there, says she has called me several times in which I have never received a phone call from her, her response is maybe you should keep up on your referrals. Just plain rude! Get a new receptionist, I know plenty of people who are much more competent who would love to have this job!

At Heartland Pain Management, Dr. Peloquin takes great pride in delivering successful outcomes for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We provide comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's unique needs. Our practice is dedicated to reducing reliance on pain medications by implementing innovative treatment approaches and continuously advancing our techniques.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of advanced pain management modalities including:

  • Therapeutic Injections for targeted pain relief

  • Implantable Devices such as spinal cord stimulators

  • Intrathecal Pain Pumps for precise medication delivery

  • Stem Cell Therapy for regenerative treatment options

Dr. Peloquin's approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain and developing personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life. We work closely with each patient to ensure they receive the most effective care possible at our Manhattan location. For more information about our services, visit Heartland Pain Management Services or call us at +1 785-320-6700. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1133 College Ave Suite F-100, Manhattan, KS 66502.
column11: Dr. Peloquin takes great pride in the successful outcome of his patients. He provides many modalities for their pain needs. This includes injections, implantable devices as stimulators, intrathecal pain pumps, and the use of stem cell therapy if possible. Dr. Peloquin's primary goal is to reduce the use of pain medication by always learning new ways to proved pain management for his patients.

column40:
I'll start by saying Dr. Peloquin's steroid injections for my severe degeneration in my cervical spine were temporarily very affective for my pain. He is professional and kind and his assistant during the procedure is also a pleasure. He convinced me to pay over $14000 out of pocket for stem cell surgery in 2022 that sounded very promising for a long term solution. After being rescheduled a couple times, one reason being him catching Covid, I decided to hold off on the procedure. I was refunded my deposit with no problem. Fast forward to May 2023 my pain became unbearable and I asked my primary doctor for a referral to see him again. When I went to schedule the woman at the front desk was very rude and told me I had a balance. I paid it on the spot with no problem. It was only $140.00. Keep in mind after every appointment I attempted to pay my copay and would be told nothing was due. My mother even attempted to pay one time during one of my procedures and was told the same.
Anything I said to this woman was met with rudeness and arguing for no reason. She told me I missed an injection in Oct 2022. This would have been AFTER the scheduled Stem Cell surgery and unnecessary. The appointment should have never been scheduled. The Dr told me in July 2022, I couldn't have anymore injections until after Oct because my body needed a break. I never scheduled the Oct appointment because the stem surgery was scheduled for September.
I ended up getting scheduled for June 13 2023 for a follow up. I put it in my calendar for July 13 instead. Totally my fault the appointment was missed. But maybe if that woman wasn't so nasty during our interaction I may not have made that mistake. I left that interaction in tears and went to Lab Corp across the parking lot to complete some required labs.  One of the staff members said they had also been mistreated by this woman and had numerous patients come in with the same complaints . The other staff member said she had positive experiences with the clinic but had also heard numerous complaints. I called today to reschedule and was told I couldn't be seen.|Dr Peloquin has been my pain manager for at least 15 years or more.  I suffered from chronic severe pain due to an auto accident when I was 15 year old and a 20 foot fall about 25 years ago that dislocated my left SI joint. After it was corrected, the joint was hyper mobile so had three titainian implants inserted through the joint which helped with stabilization but they broke loose so was back in pain again.  After stem cell therapy, in both the SI joints and my degenerative/bulging discs in my upper back, I can drive to KC (2 1/2 hours) without sitting on a pillow or stopping to exercise.  I am 77 years old now, still live on my 400 acre farm, burn firewood for heat, clearing brush out of fence rows, repairing fence and cutting down nuisance trees to the extent the tree lovers are yelling at me.  I blame it all on Dr Peloquin.|Dr Peliquin and staff are very helpful and goes beyond the call of duty to make sure you are comfortable and taken care of.   I see him every year|I'm a medical professional and the only one I considered for injecting my back was Dr. Peloquin.  Efficient, compassionate and professional.|The front office lady was very rude. I am in tremendous constant pain due to scoliosis and she turned me away because I do not have a primary care physician. I'm losing hope.|Wonderful stat

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Overland Park

At Mid America Pain Clinic, we are dedicated to providing specialized pain management services for patients suffering from a wide range of conditions. We take pride in our comprehensive approach to treating:

  • Back pain and spinal conditions

  • Chronic headaches and migraines

  • Neuropathy and nerve-related pain

  • Fibromyalgia and widespread pain syndromes

  • Complex chronic pain conditions

We believe that successful pain management comes from a thriving partnership between our patients and our medical team. At MAPC, we encourage our patients to be knowledgeable about their health and take an active role in their treatment decisions. Our team of experienced physicians and staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 913-914-1234 to schedule an appointment at our Overland Park location at 7100 College Blvd.
column11:
We are a pain management practice specializing in diverse conditions; including back pain, headaches, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, chronic pain and other complex conditions.
At MAPC, we encourage our patients to be in charge of their healthcare. Success in good health comes from a thriving partnership between patients and our doctors and staff. We encourage patients to be knowledgeable about their health and be responsible about the decisions involved in their health care.

column40:
To Potential patients,
I have been with this pain care clinic since April 2024 coming from out of state Peachtree City, GA. Dr. Jenny Chandra reviewed the last six months of my complex spine injuries and the care I received in Georgia from my previous pain management Dr. She quickly accessed made changes in my treatment plan and I have my chronic pain under control. I now am seeing PRN Dorsey Paul who listens and is very responsive to questions and needs for the care provided.
I have had nothing but positive experiences from this clinic and would recommend it. If however, you are looking for a client to prescribe you opiates? This is not the clinic for you unless you have a documented history.  What this clinic will do like most clinics in the area, they will review your case, radiology and offer their recommendations and treatment plans tailored to your specific medical conditions.|I would Recommend to everyone Dr Ted Williams MD, his Nurse & Staff!

Dr Williams has a Genuine interest in Me, achieving and maintaining good Health & that is hard to fine!|Dr. Chandra is an AMAZING Physician !! She has Always been on of the Most Intelligent Doctors I know...She is Amazing !|Dr. Chandra recommends Lifewave X39, which is a product shilled by a pyramid scheme. It doesn't work, fyi. Really cruel to get patients hopes up. I also don't appreciate leaving a message for Dr. Chandra/her nurse and instead Mary Jane the scheduler calls me back about it? What kind of privacy is that? Did she even relay my message??|Waited over 2 hours for my 1st appointment should have known then this wasn't the office for me. PJ was rude and unprofessional with me she started laughing at me while I was crying! Instead of this provider giving me a warning they just dismissed me in such a rude manor. Office doesn't return phone calls called in on a Thursday and never got a call back until Monday when I had to call several times! They never once apologized for not returning the call. I recently had surgery and they seem not to care. Please stay far away from this place go to KS Pain Management instead do not go here..|Mid America Pain Clinic has always helped me in different ways. I started seeing the owner, Dr Chandra about 8 or 9 years ago. She's very helpful when it comes to any type of pain and doesn't just throw meds at you. There's also a new Dr there who's a functional medicine doctor, and he is truly amazing. Dr Williams. He has done tests that no other doctor I've been to has probably ever heard of. He says functional medicine is his calling. I have EDS, ME/CFS, POTS, and have had 28 surgeries to date. Dr Williams is digging deep to help me with my
ME/CFS, bc I've spent the last 5 yrs in bed - ever since I got Covid in January 2020. I highly recommend this office for chronic pain, and any unusual health issues that other doctors may not be able to help with. There are several doctors there and a PA & nurse practitioners as well. Sometimes you can wait for longer than expected, but it's only bc they all want to cover all their bases with your health.|I have been with Mid America Poly Clinic for several years.  My Dr listens to me, doesn't put me down,  and has tons of compassion. Some visits I go in crying, other visits cranky cause I hurt, and she's always understanding.  Yes, the new guidelines make u feel like a criminal, but that's not the clinics fault.  They are following State guidelines.  I highly recommend this clinic and can't thank Dr. Chandra enough for the treatment plan I'm under.|Don't like the fact that you don't see the same doctor for your appointments.

column48: And the 3 back Surgeries I've already had within the past 6-7 years have done nothing but make matters worse.  I'm a mother of 5 kids,  Including a 5 month old.  I need someone's help.  Is this place going to be a waste or help with my meds? PlzHelp
column49: I've suffered with chronic pain for over 20 years, and I've been going here for around 15 years (also after trying MANY other things for my pain). If you're looking for a place that will just hand you pain meds, that's not going to happen, and you wouldn't be able to take care of your children in that condition. But they will listen, and they will try to help you. If pain meds are warranted, they will follow CDC guidelines (which any doctor will who wants to keep practicing). I do understand where you are coming from-- keep your babies in mind, and give it a chance.

At Bodyguitar Clinic, we specialize in comprehensive pain management and sports medicine solutions for patients throughout Overland Park and beyond. Our practice, led by Dr. Sean Wheeler, takes a holistic approach to treating chronic pain conditions and sports-related injuries. We believe in addressing the root causes of pain rather than just managing symptoms.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our clinic offers:

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic back and joint pain

  • Advanced epidural injection therapies

  • Sports injury diagnosis and rehabilitation

  • Customized physical therapy prescriptions

  • Comprehensive musculoskeletal assessments

What sets us apart is our commitment to spending quality time with each patient, thoroughly explaining diagnoses and treatment options. We're proud to provide compassionate care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 913-291-2819 to schedule an appointment at our Overland Park location (11040 Oakmont St).

column40:
Dr Wheeler and all of his staff are very compassionate and caring people. Dr. Wheeler was excellent in taking time to explain the epidural injections and how they would help my extreme pain from 2 herniated discs. Each follow up visit, we discussed what my pain level had been. I needed 2 more injections to make the pain manageable. I highly recommend him|Dr. Sean Wheeler and his team provide outstanding medical service. Moreover, they treat patients with respect, kindness & decency. Dr. Wheeler genuinely cares about his patients and values you, your needs, and treatment goals. He views patient's conditions and treatment holistically and seeks to assist patients to attain relief from pain and functional improvement while tailoring treatment to the patient's individual needs & goals. I wholeheartedly recommend the Body Guitar Clinic and Dr. Sean Wheeler.|I was experiencing pain in my shoulder blade area. After months of chiropractor visits with no relief, I decided to take the next step.  Based on the recommendation of a co-worker I made an appointment and went in. After a few short visits and some PT I am now pretty much pain free and back doing all the things I was able to prior to the pain.|I had a compression fracture in my lumbar spine 30 years ago that has resulted in chronic arthritic pain. I received the injections 5 years ago and they really helped so I did them again this year and the relief was instant. An unrelated bonus was that I had absolutely NO seasonal allergies during my worst allergy season. My back is still doing much better and I'm sure I'll be back in another 5 years.|LOVE Dr. Wheeler and his staff, they are all outstanding!! They truly care about each patient and make you feel like family. They take time to listen and make sure you're taken care of no matter what. I've been going to Dr. Wheeler for almost 6 years and I wish I could clone him for every Doctor I see.
You have to be your own advocate these days with regard to your own healthcare. Unfortunately COVID caused the majority of good Doctors to stop practicing. With Dr. Wheeler and his staff you can relax, be a patient and know that Dr. Wheeler is your advocate.
You will NOT be disappointed.|Dr. Wheeler was able to diagnose my hip problem in less than 3 minutes!   He prescribed PT which has taken care of the issue.  I have referred him to many friends and highly recommend!|I have seen Sean Wheeler over the last 8 -10 years. I am always so pleased with the results of the care I receive.  He is kind and patient as we discuss my needs and what he thinks will be the best treatment for me.  I thank God for the man that Sean Wheeler is and how fortunate his patients are that receive his care. I pray God continues to bless Sean and his family.|I only visited Dr Wheeler once and he wrote an order for PT emphasizing breathing, posture and stabilization for my lower back pain.  I wanted to have PT at his office but my insurance didn't cover it.  But, I found a physical therapist, Kelly Bukaty at Overland Park Regional hospital, that fully understood what Dr Wheeler was recommending.  I had 15 sessions with Kelly and the PT helped a lot.  My last PT was 3/26/24.  I can do my long walks and yard work and hunting and fishing without much pain and I learned how to manage the pain when it occurs.  I still have bad pain when I get up in the morning but that goes away quickly once I get moving.  The morning pain is probably caused by a structural problem (6mm anterolisthesis at L4-L5) in my spine.  Kelly gave me several PT exercises for breathing, stretching and core stabilization.  It took awhile to improve due to my bad habits for breathing and lifting.  I am very happy with the results of my PT and I continue to do the exercises.
Thank you Dr Wheeler for providing the proper PT orders and thanks to Kelly for following them correctly.
Dan Gay

column48: Why in the world would you pray for somebody having surgery ?
column49:
Thank you for your question. We didn't even know there was an option for questions on here, so we apologize for not responding. 

Pain is hard. Having pain every day takes a toll on a person. A toll physically, mentally, financially, with relationships, with jobs, with activities. It also affects people spiritually. We can't always get people better, but we try. We also try to see the whole person and care for that whole person. A prayer is not something we do for everybody and it is not forced on anyone. It is an extension of the care that we feel and want to give. It is a realization that the people we treat are more than just patients. They are a whole person with many, many parts that make up that whole. 
Thanks again for the question.

column3:
At Saint Luke's Pain Management Center, we provide leading-edge pain management care in Johnson County from our state-of-the-art facility at Saint Luke's South Hospital. Conveniently located in south Overland Park at 7651 W 159th St, we offer accessible pain treatment to residents throughout the surrounding communities. Our center features the latest advancements in pain management technology and a team of specialized physicians dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic or acute pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Moderately Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD)

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Multidisciplinary approach to chronic pain

Our board-certified pain management physicians work closely with each patient to develop customized treatment strategies that address the root cause of pain while minimizing medication dependence. With our compassionate approach and professional environment, we strive to create a comfortable experience from check-in to follow-up care. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, visit our official website or call us at (913) 323-9060.

column40:
I was referred to Dr Rosenberg in July, no contact from them until Sept. I had called a couple of weeks after the referral and they responded by saying they are still reviewing my information.  In the Sept conversation I finally got my appointment for Oct 10 and the documents I needed to fill out prior to the appointment.  Filled it out and returned a few days later.  They waited until 1 day before the appt to let me know they didn't take my insurance.

With this I told my wife, if the front office is so careless with this I would hate to have to see the billing and finance operations.  I guess I am lucky not to see this doctor.|The nurse practitioner was nice. Received orders for an MRI. Had my MRI and called to make sure they got my results at the same time I did. The front office said she would not check to see if they had them because "if they ordered them they will get them". I never heard from them again until 6 weeks later when they called asking why I hadn't had an MRI yet. Very very difficult to maneuver through the process of even getting a live person on the phone. I had an appointment with another surgeon before they ever even called me back.|I have been seeing Dr. Rosenberg for 7 years now and I have been. Seeing Laura Texture also for the last 2 years. Both have been the very best that I have ever experienced in their field. Together through their help and treatment they have changed my life for the better. I now am able to live life happily again with little to sometimes no pain. I also have been able to reduce my dependence on prescription depression medicines. I am so happy to have them as my Doctors. They both are extremely caring and professional in their treatment, and care for others.|I have seen Laura Textor, pain management nurse,  for peripheral nerve pain for many years now.  She is compassionate, knowledgeable and available whenever I need to get  in to see her.  Dr William Rosenberg performed my needed back fusion surgery several years ago with great results. I can't imagine going anywhere else and have referred many people to them.|The greeting at the desk by Carmelita was wonderful. We had already shared a laugh by phone when I was setting up my appointment.
I found everyone so kind and encouraging when I entered and as I was being processed as a patient to meet Dr Rosenberg. He talked with me openly and also made me feel more encouraged than I had been in the years I have been struggling with this pain after seeing other doctors and therapists.
My Myelogram is scheduled for April and I am hopeful there will be a plan of action to address my pain and make life easier. I have become more and more limited in my movements, and there are just too many places to visit to give up now.
Thank you all,
Claudia Black|I have had the opportunity to use the Center for Relief of Pain two times in the past two years.  First I had back surgery which was extremely successful but l still had.pain in my right leg.  I returned and was recommended that I try a nerve stimulator.  The trial of this device was unbelievable successful and I am now scheduled for the permanent device.
Over the years my wife and I have been to many medical practices and have never found one more professional, competent and friendly!
I have recommended this practice to several friends and they had similar experiences. I will continue to recommend them to anyone that need their services.|The nurse practitioner experienced in the spine and nervous system, was very thorough and gave me hope that something will be done to relieve my numbness, tingling and pain! This is my second time with Laura Textor and Dr. WM Rosenberg. He did a fusion of my cervical vertebrae in 2020 and I never had a problem until now! I am counting on them to get to the bottom of this problem, as well, with hopefully the promptness and accuracy with their knowledge, and experience, as before! LEW|The experience with Dr. Rosenberg is always very professional, empathetic and direct.  Dr. Rosenberg's reputation is stellar within the professional teams and I have found his talents and expertise to be exactly what have needed to get my life back from the disability of pain.  The office and hospital staff team are fantastic.  Professional but also a lot of fun and energy.

column2: ClearPath Palliative Care and Pain Management
column3:
At ClearPath Home Health and Hospice of Wichita, we answer the calling to provide exceptional care for those in need of specialized pain management and end-of-life services. Our dedicated team delivers compassionate, professional, and personalized care to patients and their families in the comfort of their homes.

Comprehensive Palliative and Hospice Services

We specialize in managing pain and symptoms for individuals with various terminal conditions, including:

  • Cancer

  • Heart disease

  • Lung diseases

  • Kidney failure

  • Dementia

  • HIV/AIDS

  • ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis)

When your loved one chooses to utilize their hospice benefits, our team at ClearPath is ready to provide the highest level of care. Located at 1861 N Rock Rd in Wichita, our pain management physicians work diligently to ensure comfort and dignity for every patient with a terminal diagnosis. For more information about our services, please visit ClearPath Home Health and Hospice of Wichita or call us at +1 316-462-1070.

Specialized Pain Management Solutions in Wichita

At Kansas Spine & Specialty Pain Center, we are led by Dr. Jared T. Scott, a board-certified pain management specialist dedicated to finding the source of your pain and helping you regain control of your life. "With today's technology and the expertise of our specialists, we can greatly improve or possibly eliminate pain for many patients. When pain alters your daily living, it's our job to provide solutions," says Dr. Scott. We specialize in interventional pain management techniques to address a comprehensive range of conditions, including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Joint pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Our approach combines advanced diagnostic methods with personalized treatment plans to deliver effective pain relief. Located at 3223 N Webb Rd #3 in Wichita, we are currently welcoming new patients who seek compassionate, expert care. Contact us at (316) 462-5072 to schedule a consultation with Dr. Jared T. Scott and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
