column38: Cindy Boswell|John Ritter|Brad Ellis|K D|Eric Snyder|Renee Cooper|Connie Folk|JOHNNY SMITH
column40:
I know many people have had good experience with Kansas Spine Hospital.  We have not!  My husband had a procedure, Dr Scott told him to call the next day if he was in pain.  My husband called the next morning and had to leave a message, that was a Tuesday.  No response.  He was still in pain and I left a message on Wednesday again no response.  My husband's family doctor called in for something to help with his pain.  On Friday, my husband left another message. NO RESPONSE!
Four weeks later my husband dropped paperwork at their office and the receptionist told him to call the office manager, Megan, so he called and left a message. AGAIN NO RESPONSE.
Almost 2 months later and we have still not received a call back.
We received a letter saying they had been trying to call.  Not true!  His phone number has not changed and he has left his phone number each time he left a message as well.   Today we called in response to the  letter.  You ALWAYS have to leave a message.  Am sure we will not hear back.  My husband likes Dr Scott but this is unacceptable!   We will be finding another place that cares!!!|It was my first time being treated by Dr. Jared Scott. However, it was not my first time receiving thoracic epidural treatments. I had received 5 other treatments by another Wichita doctor. I will say that this is the absolute best experience I have had thus far. During my time with Dr. Scott I never needed cold towels to ease my experience or pain. He completely walked me through the process as he was conducting the treatment with constant updates on when it would be completed and I felt little to no pain during the process.
The nurse staff he has surrounding him are absolute 5 star athletes in the game of medicine. They knew the process incredibly well and provided Dr. Scott with what was needed before he even had to ask. He is extremely lucky to have that support staff by his side.

To all of you at the Kansas Spine and Specialty Hospital I want to THANK YOU for all your efforts in ensuring things went well and ensuring I had a good experience. I'll see you in a few months!|Dr. Scott and Rhonda are 2 of the most caring people i know! Over the years they have helped me with my severe chronic pain. I would absolutely recommend them to anyone who has chronic pain.|I don't recommend Dr. Jared Scott. In 2019 I almost died due to a surgical incision he performed. I've never spoken publicly about my experience till now due to the horrors I've had to deal with since. All I'm saying is really evaluate before you choose this provider.|I've had a few intercostal injections by Dr Ain. The communication between his PA at the time and Dr Ain was terrible. When I was sent to Dr Scott I thought we would have the same situation - seeing Dr Scotts PA (Rhonda) and then getting the injection by Dr Scott. I was fully expecting Dr Scott to not know what was happening when I showed up for the injection.

Not the case. Even though I saw Rhonda and not Dr Scott it was clear that they were communicating very well. When I went for the injection Dr Scott had full understanding and command of my history and I had complete confidence that I was getting good quality care.

Ultimately the therapy failed. This happens sometimes for a lot of reasons out of the Dr's control. With that said I would not hesitate to return to Dr Scott for treatment in the future.|I absolutely love Dr Scott and his nurse practitioner Rhonda! They are two of the most knowledgeable people I have come into contact with while trying to deal with my pain. They are kind as well and have never made me feel like just another patient, they take the time to listen to what I tell them I am feeling and they talk to me on a personal level even sharing their personal life stories with me. I am so thankful for them and the work they do!|I am the wife of a patient for Dr Scott. The only reason I rated him 2 stars is because he is very nice. As far as professionalism and caring about the patients I would rate him 0!!! We had been waiting 6 weeks on them to call and set up an appt, and that was after my husband had gotten out of the hospital. He has many health issues, which Dr Scott knew of all along! And he had told my husband he didn't have any problems giving him pain pills. My husband probably has 1 to 3 years left to live, and he just kept telling him that his PA is the one to prescribe those, that he doesn't. And he calls himself a pain management Dr?!?!??? Finally yesterday they called my husband and told him he needed to go somewhere else. That he was too much of a liability!!!! Really?!?!???! After wasting all this time, now we have to start over again!!!!! Such a joke!!!!!! Most people that need pain pills can't waste 6 weeks just for him to be turned down!!!!! Don't believe anything they tell u until you see it in person! And don't be in a hurry! It's not going to happen!|Dr. Scott does top-notch work. He is very professional. He makes it very easy  and  helps

column38: Rachelle Decker|Mysteri Wedman|Breanna Allender|Steven Himes|Robin Luckner|Cassy Dalbom|Betty Twigg|Sherrie Montgomery
column40:
Walked in with chronic pain the first day. After completing the individualized lower back program I'm able to complete tasks I hadn't been able to without aches and pains. So thankful for MPR for their consistent support through my needs!

The team has been and continues to aid in my pain relief as I begin a different phase to make a whole body change.|I went from having terrible headaches and on medicine from my doctor to help with them to now not having headaches and off my medicine within a month!  Very thankful for their services and being able to have my normal life back! Everyone there cares about helping you feel better and gives you the tools to do so. Also, the flexible hours have helped tremendously with my work schedule. Highly recommend MPR!|This team is phenomenal to work with! Julie and Hannah are always smiling and happy to see you as you check in! Jill and Katie are the absolute best to work with for your physical therapy and decompression sessions. They have the best attitudes and are so much fun to work with! Lisa, the team APRN is just amazing at everything she does for you! Dr Brian is always a joy to work with and does a fantastic job! Janelle completes the team and she is outstanding! These guys have truly transformed my lumbar and cervical spine and made it so much stronger! Cannot recommend them enough!|This clinic is nothing like I have ever experienced!   I have been to 3 other chiropractors and none of them have really put an effort into helping me like this clinic has so far. Julie greets me with a welcoming smile as soon as I walk in the door and always asks how I'm doing.   When I first called the clinic and wanted some information, Julie was the one that really helped making that first step to come on in.  Janelle, my case manager, spent a good time with me trying to figure out my pain and has worked up a program that is fitting to my recovery needs.  I was really impressed with how detailed she was setting up this plan. She still checks in on my current condition when she catches me in passing, which is nice to see.  Doctor Brian is always interested in my current condition as well and shows that he is here to help.  My last chiropractor could not get my neck to adjust like he has been able too.  The first time he adjusted my neck, I was in complete shock of what I heard and felt.  After adjustments are made I always feel like I just grew a couple inches!!!!   Lisa has really helped with the muscular pain as well by giving me injections in my pain areas!   I hate needles but she does a great job!  Her experience and attention to detail shined when she was examining me when she noticed muscle spasms in my shoulder during certain movements as I was not aware these spasms were even happening but impressed when she showed me!  I have not received the full experience in rehab yet, due to my scheduling, but so far the neck decompression machine is doing well and the rehab technicians are great people to work with.  After 4 visits I was already able to sleep comfortably in my bed.  I realize I still have more work to do.  But I'm confident this team will get me there.

The clinic structure is very welcoming and gives you that rustic country feeling.  But all in all this clinic is a gem out here in the country.  The staff all work as a team or better yet more like a family.  Oh and I can't forget the biggest sweat heart of all, Stella the clinic dog!!!

******************

Update!   I've completed my recovery journey!   I can't believe I went so long in pain.  I am a stubborn person and I need to get over that!  Dr. Brian and his staff of awesome ladies have got me feeling like I'm younger again.  I got my life back on track with zero pain.

Thank you Dr. Brian for the adjustments, our talks and creating this place with your team, Lisa for all the trigger point injections and creating my recovery with Janelle, Julie for your words of wisdom, Hannah for your support, and thank you to the most awesome rehab ladies Jill and Katie for all the laughs, support, teachings, and putting up with me! This whole team is great!   God Bless!  See you all on maintenance day!!!!!|The rehab girls are fantastic! Dr. Brian and Dr. Lisa are AMAZING!  And the front staff always greet you with a smile!  Fantastic team to make you feel better!|I recently had an amazing experience at Midwest Pain Relief Center. The staff there is truly the best! They are incredibly professional and go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction. What sets them apart is their dedication to building personal relationships with each individual. They take the time to understand your pain problems and work closely with you to find effective solutions. I highly recommend Midwest Pain Relief Center for anyone seeking top-notch care and personalized treatment. They are simply outstanding!|The Midwest Pain Relief team are incredible. Everyone has tons of knowledge about their specialties. There are smiles and laughter. All are so important to my physical  recovery. I am so glad I'm a part of the MPR patient family.|I met Julie, Hannah, Janelle, Lisa and Stella the dog. They were all so kind to me. They are all eager to help me on the road to feeling better. I will see Dr. Dopps on Wednesday.  I look forward to them helping me to get to a pain free life. You can tell that their office truly wants to help people. Sincerely Sherrie Montgomery. Dr. Dopps and his staff are excellent.  I enjoy seeing them all the time. I feel so much better.

They are all very concerned about your pain and are aimed to please. Recommend them highly.|First, I've never posted a review ever! My wife had a horrible incident were her leg and foot had to be amputated on February 7th. Dealing with Gupta office is almost impossible!  She first was denied pain medication after numerous attempts.  Second,  appointments have been hit or miss. She's in massive amounts of pain. Next since medication
Isn't working they they said next step is 3 lumbar injection into the back but the scheduled that 6 weeks out.  Then we see psychiatrist who my wife tells she had a great night sleep.  Taking 1 of my sleeping pills. Surprise,  when she's comes out of that meeting,  she's drug tested for the first time in her life.
Nurse says it's standard procedure and GUPTA FORGETS some times. Really we've been coming here for 4 months. Next they say let's do a katemine injection...great we'll schedule you out 5 weeks out....my wife had her leg amputated....this is just an over view there's so much more. column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Marion, Kansas

At Holistic Pain Management, we specialize in providing innovative and effective pain management solutions for patients throughout Kansas. Located at 535 S Freeborn St in Marion, our clinic is affiliated with St. Luke's Hospital Marion and offers a comprehensive approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of dedicated physicians combines traditional medical treatments with holistic approaches to address the root causes of pain, not just the symptoms. We're proud to offer specialized procedures including:

  • Stellate Ganglion Block (SGB) - effective for various conditions including long COVID symptoms

  • Interventional pain procedures - targeted treatments for specific pain sources

  • Comprehensive pain assessments - personalized evaluation and treatment planning

  • Holistic treatment options - addressing whole-body wellness

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take the time to develop individualized treatment plans for each patient. Our compassionate team works closely with you to restore function and improve quality of life. Patients travel from throughout Kansas and beyond to receive our specialized care. Contact us today at (620) 382-2177 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

column38: Michael Torgler
column40:
We are so appreciative of Holistic Pain and the staff of St Lukes. My 16 daughter has been suffering from long term covid symptoms since the beginning of the pandemic. We'd been through different ENT's, smell therapy's and steroid treatments with no support for her parosmia. Today we drove 2+ hours from Kansas City to Marion for what we thought was going to be her last chance at a normal life with a Stellate Ganglion Block procedure. It was amazing! The St Lukes staff and HPM staff were all incredible. They could tell our daughter was nervous and did everything they could to make the uncomfortable procedure bearable for her and we saw IMMEDIATE results. After the procedure she had her first hamburger in 2 years and for dinner had two plates of what used to be her favorite italian pasta and garlic bread.
The different KC based Pain centers who do SGB wouldn't even talk to me because of the age of my daughter and the fact this was for long term covid and not 'pain treatment'. HPM took my daughter as a patient, walked us through the medical procedure then the cost and payment options and helped us navigate insurance with the procedure.  This crew changed our little girl's life, and my wife and I will be eternally grateful

column38: Miss Miranda|Lydia Kitchin|Kara Washington|Lawrence Tucker|Nancy Smith|Jan Rowlett|Joyce Edlin|Marc J.
column40:
Dr. Eubanks & his team are incredible!!  Hats off to Dr. Eubanks by being the best doctor  on my care team.  He has tried to help get me pain free for the shortest amount of time.  However the most kindest through a difficult process.

Dr. Eubanks has the kindest eyes  and when he walks in the room, he smiles and puts you at ease!  He finds out who the support team is with you then goes into how he can try to help you.

I wished he was a PCP just so I could go back to see him and his team!  From the front desk to the back desk, everyone is kind, understanding, and patient.....since I shuffle in a slow pace 

I appreciate that when you have a bill, they aren't badgering you or stressing you out when you arrive.  They simply mail another bill.  When I'm already stressed due to pain, that's the last thing I want to deal with coming in.   Thanks you Pain Care for taking that into consideration...if you do.

The location is right off the highway so you don't have to shuffle through Metcalf traffic.  . The chairs are recliners so the driver waiting for you can sleep  in comfort 

Dr. Eubanks will walk you through the options he can offer until it's dwindled down to the very last.  If you're in search for an excellent office all the way around, this, is a hit!!!|I had a procedure and paid the bill way ahead of time. Months later I received a letter stating that my insurance accidentally used the wrong code and I may owe more money for the procedure. I reached out to their office to see if this was true and they said it was and that they would get me connected with someone in billing to set up a payment plan. No one from billing contacted me, nor did I receive an official new bill. I did receive a collections letter on my Birthday.|Dr. Eubanks saved my life. Seriously. I am early 30s. I haven't known anything other than pain down my entire spine and into my left leg. I have flinched every time someone touches my shoulders/neck, and spine over the last 15 years.
I feel like a completely different person with no anger of being in pain anymore.

I've spent thousands of dollars with chiro adjustments, massages, PT - and got recommended to Dr Eubanks by a friend to do steroid injections.
The entire office staff is so very kind, and will spend time on the phone answering any sort of questions or concerns.
I have had 4 visits - and had immediate results within 1-2 days after. Each visit being a different location for injections.
Thank you PainCare staff and Dr Eubanks for being so kind, caring, and understanding about pain.|I have been treated by both Dr Eubanks but 99% by Dr. Bruning. I'm a dentist and I have complete confidence in both of these guys. 8 years as a patient now and they are the best and are specialists! Same day out of pain every time I throw out my back bending over seeing my own patients.|Dr Eubanks has been so patient and diligent in identifying and treating my pain. He was not my first pain specialist but he definitely  will be who I trust and recommend! Bravo!|I had a 65% tear in my supraspinatus tendon. (Rotator cuff) I was told by an orthopedic that PRP probably would not be the answer I was encouraged by a chiropractor to see Dr. Eubanks. It's been almost a year. I was diligent in  physical therapy the first four months followed by my own weight training techniques. I have to say this was the best choice I could've ever made. My shoulder has gradually gone from 50% to 60% to 70% I would have to say it's at 90% now I've had no pain in the past 10 months. Surgery was the main option, PRP was the real answer. Dr. Eubanks was phenomenal! Eric in physical therapy was equally as great. He was very creative and giving me exercises that I could take home and always changed up each appointment with a new drill. It will be a year next month.  I wanted to wait before I made a report, to see if it was really going to work. Patience is the key! I would have to say I'm back to normal shoulder use! I'm grateful this pain  center offers alternative treatments for tendon tears.|This is what happened to me.

These doctors are only interested in making money off their patients injuries and pain.  Dr Eubanks and his associate, gave me 7 epidural injections in 1 year.  My thyroid and adrenal glands were damaged.  I suffered from weak bones, and most importantly, I lost my mind over those excess injections.  He should have handed me off to Dr Hess immediately, and did not.
These greedy Doctors, it's all about the money not the patients health.|I've had several injections here over the last 10 years. Facility is clean and well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful to answer my questions. Dr. Eubanks goes into detail about what will happen and puts me to ease about the injections.

column2: Lemons Center for Chronic Pain Rehabilitation
column3:
At the Lemons Center for Chronic Pain Rehabilitation, we specialize in a highly-personalized approach to chronic pain management that works effectively alongside traditional medical treatments. When pain persists beyond expected healing time, it requires a different strategy than acute pain treatment.

Our Holistic Approach to Pain Management

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life—physically, mentally, emotionally, and spiritually—which is why our comprehensive programs integrate multiple disciplines for effective treatment. Our team-centered approach combines:

- Psychology services for mental and emotional well-being

- Specialized physical therapy techniques

- Professional nursing support

- Comprehensive pain management education

Our holistic Wellness Program further enhances recovery through various therapeutic modalities including Stress Management, Tai Chi, Yoga, and Nutrition counseling. Located in Lenexa, Kansas, we're committed to helping clients develop sustainable pain management strategies for improved quality of life. Learn more about our innovative programs at www.lemonscenter.com or call us at +1 913-383-8977 to begin your journey toward effective pain management.
column11:
The Lemons Center's highly-personalized client care works very well in tandem with the traditional Medical Model approach. When pain has persisted long after the expected healing time it is considered to be chronic. Chronic pain does not respond to the same treatments that alleviate acute pain and a different approach is necessary. Chronic pain effects every part of someone's life, physically, mentally, emotionally, and spiritually. Chronic pain management requires a holistic approach.

We integrate psychology, physical therapy and nursing into our comprehensive programs for a team centered approach for pain management.
We have developed a holistic Wellness Program including Stress Management, Tai Chi, Yoga, Nutrition, and other programs.
column36: 8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|Closed|Closed
column38: Abbie Allen|Douglas McKean|Nick|Ralph Nyquist|Ryan Reilly|Tskm Nhan|Joanne Crabb|Teena Martinez
column40:
The Lemons Center was a life changing experience for me. I did not have chronic pain until a series of events from my late 40's to my current age of 60. But one incident by one I developed excruciating pain on a daily basis. Did the Lemons Center fix my pain?  No. It taught me how to manage it. It made me understand I'm not alone. It gave me confidence and hope for the future. I 100% recommend the program to anyone who is a chronic pain patient.|The Lemon Center Pain Management program was fantastic! So many life skills that I wish I had learned when I was young. Proper breathing, stress management, daily moderate exercise, and the list goes on. I went from needing Lidocaine patches every day to not needing them at all in just the 30 days of the program.|After sustaining a life-changing injury, The Lemon's Center helped me to learn how to deal with chronic back and hip pain. I still use the biofeedback and tai-chi techniques I learned there daily. If you would like to manage your chronic pain without using opioids or prescription medications, I strongly recommend reaching out to them. They are truly dedicated to helping people and, in my experience, worked within my budget to provide me with the assistance I needed to live my life under these new circumstances.|I went to Dr. Lemons around 8 years ago. It was the best experience i had with my pain management. I have been experiencing severe chronic pain for 17 years after a car wreck. I have practice my new found cognitive way of managing my pain for 17 years. It helps!! I recomend everyone i know to The Lemons Center. One thing i will say because i had to experience myself. If you think the 6 week course is unpractal the u havent hit rock bottom with your pain. I went to 45 doctors and the Mayo Clinic. They said yes you have pain and we dont know why. Dr. Lemons was my last resort.....and it worked. I have reduced my meds by 3/4. Im telling you this program works. Thanks Jim for the ability to have something the rest of my life i can use to MANAGE my pain and not fight it. Best pain management in the city.|The Lemons Center is not a magic pill. It's a more nuanced and comprehensive source of help that examines the science between cause and effect and how our pain is exacerbated by personal behaviors and physical limitations that sometimes go unseen. What we don't know always has the potential to hurt us.

Lemons makes attempts to put the knowledge of our pain management into an understandable framework so that we know more and are in a better position to take responsibility for a healthier life. Such thinking is sorely needed in this world and by those who need relief in understanding what pain is and what makes it worse. The Lemons Center is helpful to those who are trying to find ways to understand and manage the source of their pain. It's not going to get rid of the pain but it will help you in facilitating a healthier life and a healthier way of relating to pain, which can be a very personal process. It doesn't stop or end there.

The methodology and wisdom of Lemons is in mitigating stress response and implementing personal awareness of where the touch points between pain and stress intersect so that we can take back our lives. It is in promoting that awareness of how we move and how we think and how that process can help or hinder recovery that determines whether there is success in pain management. I found my time in the program to be very elucidating. I still hurt a lot but I know myself better and know that there are others like me and that I'm not alone.

As for personnel, everyone was incredibly helpful, patient and there is light and love there.  It's a good atmosphere for learning and changing bad habits and learning good ones.  After years in pain it's hard to trust that it's going to get better.  Jim Lemons is an incredibly wise guy, in just about every way.  (sorry Jim I couldn't resist)

A few last words, those expecting to go in and be magically cured of chronic pain are going to be very disappointed. Those that go in with realistic expectations of pain management and how to best help yourself will be greeted by a kindly crew of helpers and health facilitators who will do their best to help you be successful. If you go in with an open mind you will leave with a bit more peace. You will leave with knowledge and techniques that will serve you well for the rest of your life.  It will get better.|Words can not express the respect I have and hold for Dr. Jim Lemons and his fantastic staff. Dr. Lemons's dedication to helping you by listening and teaching you thru your own experiences is surreal. I was making a terrible chronic condition worse by feeding the fuel that took over my life and I had no idea. Unfortunately, chronic pain will never go away, but it will ALSO never take over my life again.
The program he created while working at the Mayo Clinic is practiced all over. This program is Hands down the Best kept secret in town.|I wish someone would have told me about Behavioral Pain Management long ago. No, it's not a cure but has helped me tremendously in learning how to live with chronic pain. Dr. Lemons and staff are kind and compassion and have given me tools to manage my pain.|Wonderful, professional staff and Dr. Lemons goes above and beyond to make sure you know what's available for you and your circumstance. I can't thank them enough for everything they did.
If you have more pain then what you can deal with, Dr. Lemons Center for Behavior is absolutely, 100%for you. Go, you won't regret a moment of it.

At the Marc A. Asher, MD, Comprehensive Spine Center, we are led by Dr. Dawood Sayed, an internationally recognized interventional and spine specialist dedicated to alleviating pain and restoring function through minimally invasive techniques. As part of an academic medical center, we provide comprehensive spine care for both adults and children, treating everything from chronic back pain and sports injuries to complex spinal tumors and structural defects. Our multidisciplinary approach brings together specialists from various fields who collaborate to deliver personalized treatment plans in one convenient facility. column40:
I started seeing Dr. Sayed for a bulging disc in my cervical spine that was giving me a great deal of pain.
He did some trigger point injections to start & an ablation procedure. My insurance was very difficult to deal with and didn't approve the procedure for 6 months. He kept re submitting forms and did a peer to peer & finally got my insurance to budge on the situation.
It's hard go find a doctor that'll go to bat for you and most people give up when their insurance company does what mine did.
I am grateful & thankful i was referred to him as my pain doctor. I am doing a million times better than i was a year ago.|Hi I'm Kelly. I have been a patient of Dr Sayed for 7 years now.  He has helped me so much.  I have a fracture in my lower back that is pinching my sciatica nerve. He did a procedure on my back and he put concrete around the tumor from the cancer that I have. So that the tumor won't spread.  I go to him to get relief from the pain in my sciatic goes down my leg.  He has talk toed me about different procedures that he could do. We were doing a steroid injection and then my insurance company was not wanting to approve them. Dr Sayed and I spoke and I decided to go with a nervous ablation. I'm so happy that I did that.  I haven't had any pain down my leg for 5 months.  I recommend him of you are having pains in your back.|Dr. Sayed took the time to really listen to me and helped to explore all options available to help with the nerve pain in my back and legs. I ended up having a lumbar nerve ablation.  I had a significant improvement in pain and function within a few weeks after the ablation!  I am so grateful for Dr. Sayed and his team and continue to trust him with my care.|Lucky to have this world class leader in the interventional spine and pain field in Kansas City providing top notch care. Dr. Sayed compassionately listened to what I was going through at a young age.  Only after conservative treatment failed, did we consider a  bit more invasive spine procedure, which truly gave me back my life. Now, I'm not just pain free but pain pill free.|Consider all of your options and ensure the correct scans have been completed prior to the procedure. Read all of the warnings before signing including loss of ability to walk and death. He has a God complex with a poor bedside manner.|Dr. Sayed is a truly an amazing doctor. I've referred several people to him. People that I've referred to him, call him a savant!|I would highly recommend Dr. Sayed. He has helped me manage pain for several years. He's amazing|Always concerned as to how the stimulator and I are doing. I feel comfortable with him and his staff.

column11:
The Pain Center at Kansas Spine & Specialty Hospital will be open during the COVID-19 crisis. We are being vigilant of delivering the most high-quality experience for our patients, visitors and staff. We will continue to comply with the guidelines and recommendations from both the CDC and KDHE.

Our mission is to help our patients achieve relief from pain, freedom from limitations and hope for a more active life.

column38: K White|Shawna Fullon|Kelly King|Matthew Marney|melissa Clark|Darold heape|Jaclyn Durk|Marshall Campbell
column40:
I have been a patient at this clinic for many years and have always had a wonderful experience with Dr. Scott, Rhonda, and their nursing staff. They are compassionate, understanding, and truly dedicated to patient care. Dr. Scott, in particular, is polite, considerate, personable, an excellent communicator, and an outstanding physician.

While scheduling appointments can be challenging due to his popularity, it is a testament to the exceptional care he provides. The only difficulties I have encountered have been occasional miscommunications with the office staff, likely due to the high turnover rate in such a busy clinic.

Despite this, I am extremely happy with the care I receive and will continue to trust Dr. Scott and his team with my healthcare for the foreseeable future.|My first appt was Aug 15th I saw one of Dr Scott's PAs she was great went over everything and convinced me to try another neck injection even though the previous one I had at another office made my pain worse. I went in yesterday on my birthday 11/21 for said neck injection. What I was told in the first at is I'd have a consult first with the Dr Scott then the injection procedure. That did not happen I have still never even seen Dr Scott's face and he had needles in my spine. The nursing staff took me back rudely told me to lay face down on the table didn't give me anytime to adjust comfortable before rudely say my face needed to be in the whole so I was laying uncomfortable the entire time. Then multiple people proceeded to talk around me and touch me repeatedly without asking or warning me first. They used tape to stretch out my shirt instead of offering a sterile gown. They only asked me one question my weight. The Dr came in after probably 15mins of me laying uncomfortable, in pain, and ignored like I wasn't in the room. Dr Scott was fine but I was already so upset and just wanted it done so I could go. After I got up grabbed my stuff told the nurses how rude they were and the entire experience was awful. They didn't look like they cared at all.

I received a call later to go over the after paperwork because I left without it and voiced my concerns again which again didn't seem like that nurse cared either and was blowing it off. I left feeling like I wasn't human to them just a task on their list.|I had the first phase of an RFA, before I had it I asked if they were sure I need prior authorization for my procedure for all phases with my insurance as I did NOT with any of my ESIs. The response was "we have never heard of that." So I had step one have been waiting almost 4 weeks for them to call me to schedule step 2. Called Friday left a message and decided I would just check with our insurance to see where we were at. They informed me with my diagnosis code I did NOT need ANY prior authorization for a RFA procedure. So why am I waiting all this time to wait for authorization that I don't need that they should of know the first time they contacted our insurance company when the Dr told me we only needed to wait 2 weeks in between procedures? And is is really necessary to do 2 "tests" to see if it's going to help that they told me were required by insurance when my insurance specifically told me I do not any type of prior authorization?? I understand doing one to make sure it's of benefit but 2??? I left 2 messages with my Drs person they said handles these things and my husband left 2 with the office manager. Neither of us received a return call. So disappointing as I really like my Dr and don't want to see anyone else but this is a very poorly ran clinic on the business side. Its almost like we are being punished for having good insurance.|Please find another doctor's office for your back and pain management!
From the very beginning, I had to follow up several times just to get an appointment.
After visiting with the nurse who saw me, we would determined we needed imaging. I waited two weeks to get a call back to schedule the imaging and no one ever called. Finally, I called and got it scheduled. The imaging ended up taking 2 hours. Most of that's time was spent waiting in the waiting room or in a gown for an imaging professional to show up and do the imaging.
After the imaging was finished, I waited another 10 days hoping to get a call back but never did. I called the office again.  This time I asked the nurses assistant if they had a procedure in place for calling people back after imaging is completed and she clearly said they did not. I don't understand how an office can function that way.
At this point I indicated to them that I would be finding another doctor's office, but would like to pick up a copy of my imaging for the other office. Later that day I received a call indicating that the doctor would like to do an injection. I decided to give them one more chance.
The day of the injection I was not informed of any side effects or risks involved, nor the amount of pain that would be involved in receiving the injection.  My pain is now worse than when I started.
At my follow-up visit, the nurse did not show up for 30 minutes after my appointment time. At this point I decided to walk away.  Very little, if anything, about my experience with this office has felt like health care.|I can't get anyone to help me after I had the stimulator implanted.  I called and they said I can't be seen even though my insurance paid most of this and I have paid payment every month for a couple of years. The wires moved I guess, I also know the temporary was amazing however the permanent is just no where near as good. In the beginning Dr. Scott and Rhonda were very helpful and attentive, however now I can't get any help! Maybe making this post will help! This is my body that you all put a device in, and now you will not help me! This is wrong very wrong!
I'm having issues with the devices and can't seem to get a call back to help me with them.  While in the beginning  Dr. Scott and Rhonda was very nice and helpful I just can not get help now..maybe a post will get me some!|Dr Ain and APRN Sarah have been great  They have been very helpful in helping me with my back problems and pain. The office staff has been very patient and kind.|Would give zero stars if I could. Office staff was rude. Was referred by my Dr. and it turned out because I was in an accident and sued they would not take me on as a PT. I have dual insurance and pay a lot of money for health insurance. This place had me in tears and very discourage of getting any kind of help for my back. I would recommend not wasting your time or money making an appt at this place.|Absolutely the most unorganized, unprofessional medical facility I have ever dealt with.  They obviously have a horrible work culture as they have a high turnover rate over.  My suggestion would be to go to a different pain management center. Update the medical staff were great!  They obviously need to make a change on the Business Management side.

column38: Dian Phillips|Autumn Lewis|Daphne Orebaugh|Adrian Langholz|Jared Holland|Carrie Hall|SE Confer|David Smith
column40:
Office staff & nurses are wonderful. Dr. Nguyen has ZERO bedside manner and is extremely condescending. He will not allow you to speak, or ask questions. He is VERY rude and hateful with his patients. Or, maybe that's only on the work comp side of things, which is all I have experience with. If you're on work comp, and you're looking for a provider that is compassionate and caring, find someplace else to go.|After waiting over a month for this place to deny my referral because my condition is not severe enough I am furious. I was already approved by another pain management clinic but they did not take my insurance so I got referred to ICT. Every time I called to check on my referral the receptionists were rude and short. I would not trust this place to take care of your pain and needs!|Don't waste your time with this place. They wasted weeks of my time claiming they couldn't take my file without more records. Then when they got the records showing my extensive disease spread, they kept telling the doctors they were looking at it and would call back.

They said the doctor had information in hand on October 8th and would call with a decision. Today, October 14th the primary advised me to try calling them. I did and suddenly they have an answer but it was so strange. They never called to give it to my doctors like they claimed.

They claimed the CDC doesn't recommend any of their treatments for my diagnosis? My diagnosis is rare and affects many organs. There's no one size fits all recommendation for it and any current treatment standards are definitely not coming from the CDC for such a rare disorder.

She kept repeating this rehearsed phrase like a robot. Very odd. Like I was a frequent caller or something. This was the first time I've ever called them. The phrase she said didn't really make sense. So I asked her to explain. She repeated it slower and louder. Like I was mentally challenged and hard of hearing. I said "no I don't need you to repeat it. I heard what you said. It doesn't make any sense no matter how loud or slow you say it." She gave super vague answers that were basically "we aren't capable of helping" or "we simply don't want to because this case would require actual work."

So yeah if you want to have them waste your time and give some nonsense unprofessional answer like that after months of runaround. Then sure call them. Maybe if you have something common like pawpaw's arthritis this place could work for you. Otherwise I would heed the other warnings and avoid this unprofessional place.|I take my mother here for pain management. The facility is very clean and comfortable. The staff at the front desk is extremely friendly and helpful. The providers are knowledgeable and have excellent bedside manner!|The doctors aren't interested in helping people. Just controlling you. I went in for a consultation and the doctor wouldn't even listen to me.|Dr Nguyen and the other providers are always prompt and fast. Good thing is you're never waiting. Bad thing is that they have a very set routine for what they do when they come in and they don't like it to be disrupted. Which I recently did by asking questions about my pain pump and suggesting that my liver pain, if my issues couldn't be fixed by liver Dr, would be chronic pain and could we adjust things to accommodate this? My provider responded by getting upset telling me to go to another one of the providers there or find somewhere else to go. Then she got up and left the room, slamming the door on her way out. After discussing what had gone on with the nurse she spoke with Teather, Dr Nguyen's nurse (also one of the 5 star reviews), who spoke with me before I left. Teather told me she'd get me in to see Dr Nguyen. Teather later said she called me with an appointment time and left VM on my phone but I never received a message on my phone. Due to my brain injuries I have memory issues so I save my messages. I've not had any from her. When I didn't hear from her I decided to look elsewhere. I had already been considering it anyway because of how far away they are from me now. I now live out in Augusta area and they are way on west side of town. But I never hid that I was looking at other Drs. I was always upfront about it. And I never took any medicine from another Dr. But I'd have had to go to 2 different Drs for the regiment I was on. So I decided to stay with Dr Nguyen and work my issues out with him. So I went to my appointment thinking I'd try to get in to see him ASAP. But I was confronted by Teather, his nurse, and told he'd only do my pain pump but that he was on vacation. Then when he returned from vacation I was told she'd get back with me that day Monday July 24. But by Thursday I had still not heard from anybody there. Then I get a call from my pharmacy saying they sent a script (not pain meds) and they were told I wasn't a patient there. I called to find out why but they would only say a letter was sent out Monday. Well, it's Friday and I still have no letter. So apparently it takes over a week to get a letter from west side of Wichita out to Augusta!? I emailed Teather requesting an email copy of the letter and a copy of my chart but I received no response. I believe it's just a power thing for him and I've never liked the way he treats people. They have UA samples that stack up in the lab. It would be so easy for anyone to tamper with anyone else's sample. I believe that happened to me before. I received a letter from them one time stating I'd had no opiates in my system. But I had taken my pain meds every day. So there HAD  to be some in my system. So the lab tech either mixed something up or someone tampered with something. Also, I'd like to point out that some of the 5 star reviews are from people who do work or have worked at the office. I'd also like to add that if you try to ask anyone a question at this office that they do not wish to answer (ie they know they are doing the wrong thing) they label you as "being rude". That's how my mess started because I asked questions of my provider and she didn't like it so I was "being rude" and she stormed out. Now that, over a week later, after I've received my 30 day notice from Dr that he's terminating our contract and I call in with questions. I'm again "being rude". The 30 days notice is a joke. He writes it in such a way that it LOOKS LIKE he is giving me 30 days more care but in reality it's "up to his discretion" and his discretion is "lifesaving meds only". So my broken pain pump bolus machine that I'd been waiting for him to come back from vacation and get it fixed. Yeah he won't fix it! He's a slimy POS liar! I'd run far and fast! His staff is no better. He's trained them well. Nothing but liars all of them! They do not have patient care at the top of their list. They don't care about anyone but themselves.|Best in Wichita, no, Kansas, no, The Heartland! & I know; I've seen many doctors over my 30 - 34 yrs of living with chronic pain & ICT group & staff are the most professional & compassionate in my experience. Am so very grateful   for ICT! Love 'em ad astra|Dr. Nguyen is one of the most compassionate, thorough, and patient doctors that I have. I am in a great deal of pain all the time. He has reduced my pain level tremendously and he keeps my safety in mind. He also is patient and listens to me when I need to talk. Also, I can't express enough  how professional his staff are and how kind and courteous they are to me as well. The nurses and Taylor the receptionist have helped me quite a bit and I wish I could remember the other staff members and the Nurse' names. My quality of life is back to where I am joyful, patient in listening to my spouse; I can concentrate and perform well at work again. I am more joyful at church and can sleep again at night. Thank you for salvaging my life Dr. Nguyen.

column3:
Specialized Spine Care & Pain Management in Wichita

At Pain Management Associates, we are dedicated to restoring your quality of life through comprehensive interventional pain management and world-class spine surgery. Our team of specialized physicians provides compassionate care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, spinal stenosis, herniated discs, and other debilitating spine-related issues. We offer a full spectrum of treatment options including:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Therapeutic spinal injections

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulator implantation

  • Minimally invasive spine surgeries

  • Decompressive laminectomies

What sets us apart is our patient-centered approach where we take time to listen, explain treatment options thoroughly, and develop personalized care plans. Our physicians, including Dr. Landers, Dr. Frimpong, and Dr. Jones, combine extensive expertise with genuine compassion to help you get back to doing what you love with the people you love. Visit our Pain Management Associates website or call us at +1 316-733-9393 to schedule a consultation at our conveniently located office at 825 N Hillside St STE 200, Wichita, KS 67214.
column11: Compassionately providing world-class spine surgery and interventional pain management. Get back to doing what you love with the people you love
column38: Glenda R.|Lauri Russell|James Moore|Charles Rogers|Ben Alexander|Sonja Orem|Ack Ley|Keith Johnson
column40:
I saw Dr Landers first in 2008 for shots in my neck.  He was so knowledgeable  and caring.  So impressed with him.  If you want to be impressed also, just go to the site that list all of his credentials and
related experiences.   Dr Landers plays music while giving you your shots !!  I love this about him. He ever sings along with them. And sometimes I did too !!  Takes your mind off the pain.  He is good to tell you every time he is going to touch you and exactly when you will feel pain or pressure.  This is very much appreciated.
Had to go back to him 7-2017 for pain in lumbar.  I could have used another doctor but I chose him. Had the very same experience. Love this doctor.  Recommend him 100% and the staff is GREAT !!!!|Dr Landers was phenomenal!  Sang to me during spinal injection.  He kept things light and fun to get me to relax. Nobody looks forward to a needle in the spine....staff rocks, too!|About 2 years ago I noticed pain in my legs,  glutes and thighs progressing to severe debilitating pain. I couldn't lift my legs up from a lying position. My family Dr. sent me for an MRI and then to Wichita Pain Management Associates. I met with Dr. Landers, who showed me the MRI illustrating severe narrowing in my my spinal canal.  Dr. Landers followed up with 3 injections, 1 every 3 weeks. They helped but the pain returned. Dr. Landers referred me to Dr. Frimpong.

Dr. Frimpong consulted with me, explaining how he would relieve the pressure on my spinal cord. He was thorough and concise assuring me that he has done 100's of these. I agreed to proceed.

After surgery, I awoke and was joined by my wife and Dr. Frimpong. He asked how I was and asked me to lift my legs. Fearing pain, I hesitated. He told me to go ahead and I did. There was no pain, gone, I was overjoyed. I was released the next day. Dr. Frimpong performed A decompressive laminectomy L4, Laminotomy L3-4 and L4-5, Bilateral foraminotomies L3-L4. Thanks to the great staff at Wichita Pain Management, Dr. Landers and the brilliant surgery by Dr. Frimpong. I highly recommend them!

In Gratitude
James Moore|I moved to central Kansas about a year ago. I have advance osteoarthritis with miltiple levels of spinal stenosis. I had been using Interventional Pain Management  and was pleased to find Pain Management Associates.
I had already been through injections, nerve ablations, even a decompressive laminectomy. I need to have my lumbar spine rebuilt, my right knee and hip need replacement. I needed a pain specialist who wouldn't throw medication at me and see me every 30 days. Instead, Dr Jones agreed with me, that my weight was a problem at 150 pounds overweight AND I couldn't even walk to exercise due to pain. We discussed using an implanted spinal cord stimulator. I appreciated the requirement to have a Psychology interview. That really helped me vocalize my understanding of the stimulator and my expectations of what I wanted it to do. Basically, I needed a way to control my pain so I could exercise and lose weight. I like the way Dr Jones listens to me. Sometimes, I get to make decisions with Dr Jones and other times he makes the decision with my advice.
The stimulator is working well. My pain level stays around 1-2, all of the time.|Horrible experance, staff was friendly but the Dr was a joke. He scheduled unneeded appointments to make more money, to in the end do what my pcp ordered anyway. Find a different Dr and save your money.|Karen Dr Jones nurse makes my PTSD happen. BP as well. It was very high and never rechecked or cared|MEH!!!!|Good luck,  I won't be going back

column3:
Compassionate Pain Management Solutions in Leawood, KS

At Ascentist Healthcare, we are proud to have Dr. Jeffrey Foster leading our interventional pain medicine team. Board-certified in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Dr. Foster specializes in advanced procedures that help patients suffering from chronic spine and nerve pain. We take a patient-centered approach to care, creating tailored treatment plans for each individual we serve. Our comprehensive pain management services include:

  • Spinal cord stimulator implantation

  • Intracept procedure for chronic back pain

  • Nerve ablation techniques

  • Steroid injections

  • DRG stimulator placement

Dr. Foster is actively engaged in research and teaching, constantly bringing innovative technologies and treatments to our practice. As a former University of Kansas football player and Orange Bowl Champion, he brings the same dedication to his medical practice as he did to the field. Our mission is to empower patients to reclaim their function and quality of life through effective pain management solutions. Visit us at Ascentist Healthcare or call us at (913) 491-3999 to schedule your consultation at our Leawood office.
column11:
Dr. Foster is a leader in interventional pain medicine who is board-certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. He specializes in utilizing advanced procedures to help patients who suffer with chronic spine and nerve pain. He is engaged in research, teaching and training other physicians, as well as bringing new technology and treatments to his patients. He has a compassionate and patient-centered approach to his care that leads to a tailored plan for the individual. Dr. Foster's vision is to empower patients to reclaim their function and quality of life.

Dr. Foster is a graduate of the University of Kansas and played football for the Jayhawks as an Orange Bowl Champion. In his spare time he enjoys live music, traveling, and exercise.

column40:
Great experience. The care was professional and individualized. Dr. Foster quickly identified the issue and clearly described the treatment plan. The results were more than I dared hope for. Strongly recommended!|Dr Foster performed the Intracept procedure on me and "I FEEL GREAT"! No more softball at the belt line of my back. Thank you, thank you, thank you, Dr Foster! I will tell everyone I know with back aches to consider this procedure. Everyone at the clinic and the hospital were fantastic, Thanks again.|Great bedside manner,  excellent support staff, and very accessible and knowledgeable. I received a spinal cord stimulator surgery, and he and his staff/support crew made sure that the experience was as smooth as it could possibly be!|Dr Foster and his staff at both the office and hospital are the best ever. I was in a lot of pain in my back for almost 15 years. I was referred to Dr Foster by my neurologist who took care of the kyphoplasty, however I was still in pain. Dr Foster was able to take all of my pain away with ablations to the nerves causing the pain. I would highly recommend him to anyone with chronic back pain, you won't be sorry. I am now able to do the activities I wasn't able to do before.
Thank you Dr Foster and staff for everything you have done for me.|Dr Foster is Awesome!! I would highly recommend going to see him for anything to have to do with your back, my stimulator he put in my back is amazing. He's kind, professional, and does everything he can to help relieve your pain. The clinic is very clean, very friendly, the nurses are great and check in is very fast and easy. The best Dr for the job to help you.|Dr Foster and his team are the kindest health care providers I have ever met. I went to him after a lot of other doctors who were less than kind to me and I had lost hope. Dr Foster was so wonderful and you can tell by how he listens to you and thoughtfully responds he truly cares about his patients. I had a DRG stimulator placed and it needed a repair but I didn't trust the doctor who originally put it in. Dr foster kindly took me on as a patient (not an easy thing to find in pain management) and fixed it. I now have almost no pain and I have my life back. It's also not only the clinic staff that is amazing it is also the surgery center team. I had a bit of a panic attack when anestesia was explaining the procedure to me because of a previous traumatic procedure. He took his time explaining everything and reassuring me the entire time. I never felt rushed and the team took it at my pace. They explained everything thoroughly before doing it and told me before touching me when I was laying face down so I wasn't startled. Every member of the team made sure I had no questions before moving on to the next step. They really eased my anxieties even before any medications were given. I cannot recommend Ascentist enough. Every staff member from the warm and friendly receptionist to the nurses. They're all just fabulous. Dr Foster and his team saved my life and I cannot thank them enough. I cannot imagine any provider at Ascentist healthcare being less than amazing.|I had an initial consultation followed a couple weeks later by a steroid injection in my lower back, it has been a HUGE improvement! I've had epidural injections in the past from other clinics and doctors, but not like this. Dr. Foster and his staff at Ascentist Healthcare and Ascentist Hospital have exceeded all my expectations. The thorough consultation, narrowing and pinpointing my pain to its exact location was the first step. Next, educating my family and I on all my options now and in the future. Finally, the procedure was extremely professional, the staff and the facility. I'm back on my feet again! My highest recommendation!! Thank you!|Dr. Foster has been caring for my father for the past 3 years and we are extremely grateful for his knowledge and expertise. He is always friendly, polite and shows concern. We couldn't ask for a better doctor anywhere! Thank you Dr. Foster for giving my father quality of life again!

column11:
Saad Ahmed Syed, MD

Dr. Saad Syed is a Pain Management specialist who treats patients who suffer from chronic pain and have not found relief from other modalities of treatment. He specializes in Acute and Chronic Pain Management.

column40: Dr Syed is one of the best doctors ever, he truly cares about his patients! He is so gentle and extremely knowledgeable. column3:
At Kansas Spine & Specialty Pain Center, we're dedicated to helping patients reclaim their lives from chronic pain. Dr. Robert J. Ain, our board-certified pain management specialist, brings exceptional expertise to every case with one mission in mind: finding the source of your pain and helping you regain control of your life.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer comprehensive pain management solutions including:

- Precise spinal injections and epidurals

- Interventional pain procedures

- Customized treatment plans

- Chronic pain management

- Non-surgical pain relief options

Dr. Ain understands that "For many people, pain has a way of taking over their life." His approach focuses on treating not just symptoms but identifying root causes to provide lasting relief. As both an anesthesiologist and pain management physician, Dr. Ain combines specialized medical knowledge with compassionate care to address complex pain conditions.

We're currently welcoming new patients at our Wichita location. Contact us at +1 316-462-5072 to schedule a consultation with Dr. Robert J. Ain and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11:
Dr. Ain, a board-certified, pain management specialist, is dedicated to finding the source of your pain and helping you get back in control of your life.

"For many people, pain has a way of taking over their life. I like to help people take control of their pain and get back to their life." -- Dr. Ain

He is currently welcoming new patients at the Kansas Spine & Specialty Pain Center.

column40: I was a little worried when reading some of the reviews. However,  I am one who tries to put logic to a situation.  Not knowing everyone's situation, I was not going to base my decision on how Dr.Ain might be able to help me. I was going in for the steroid injection into my spine. The last three months, I have been in severe pain. A pain would shoot down my leg and almost knock my feet out from underneath me. I would have to give myself a pep talk to keep walking. Dr. Ain asked me where my pain was? I told him exactly what was going on, where it hit. He said, I know exactly where to go.  I was there about an hour. Everyone at the Spine hospital was extremely nice and informative.  Dr. Ain wasn't chatty,  but I was not there to become his bestie or go out to dinner with him. I was there for him to help me with severe pain. I feel he did a phenomenal job, and did HIS job! Again, he is there to do a job. He did that and did it well and for that I am so very grateful.  Looking forward to another shot because if this will fix me and I don't have to have surgery, that will definitely be a win! After the first shot, the paper said it would take full affect in 7 to 14 days. It has been one week and my pain is 90%less. That is a very good ratio.|Very rude and not personable at all! Dismissive of pain and he only will see you during procedures and not as an office visit to discuss issues. Very rough with injections and walks right out after. I was told I had a low pain tolerance and was also not a surgical canidate for another surgery. Thank goodness for my amazing neurosurgeon who is educated and compassionate who reviewed my images again and I am now about to have my next surgery! Dr. Ain is the most horrible "Dr" I have ever encountered in my entire 40 years of my life! Rude, unhelpful and very unprofessional! The only good thing I can say is the other staff at Kansas Spine were all very nice, helpful and Amazing! I just recommend avoiding Dr. Ain at all costs! Note: There are even some of his staff that acknowledge his rude demeanor!|Dr. Ain was able to help me so much with my chronic pain. He was extremely kind and informative throughout the entire process. Unlike other other pain doctors I've seen in the past, I would highly recommend him to anyone in the Wichita area.|I was disabled by the first epidural I received from Dr Ain. My spinal cord was punctured and a blood patch was given that didn't work requiring an ER visit 2 weeks later because I was still leaking spinal fluid, confused, and had lost my vision. Multiple specialist visits in Wichita and Kansas City with lots of money and constant pain all with the prognosis of this being an  irreversible condition of Adhesive Arachnoiditis with progressive nerve damage . Dr Ain would not call back the hospital when they called repeatedly for me after the incident. He finally responded 5 days later saying "drink more caffeine" and never further followed up. This has affected my vision, my mobility and my ability to work. I wish I had never allowed him to treat me. My quality of life has been forever changed and he just went on with his life like nothing happened.|Dr. Ain screwed up my wife's epidural so bad she is now handicapped. He punctured her spinal cord and then did a blood patch without permission. She developed adhesive arachnoiditis.  She is in constant pain and could eventually be wheelchair bound.  Kansas tort law protects doctors not patients, so no lawyer would take the case.  He never followed up and didn't care about the damage he did.|Dr. Ain is incredible! He is so kind, good humored, thorough, efficient, and precise. He has a great bedside manner, he seems genuinely concerned with the well-being of his patients, and all around takes his patients' problems seriously. I cannot recommend him enough! I have my mobility and a pain-free life owed to him.|I had the pleasure of visiting Dr. Ain for my chronic pain management, and I couldn't be more impressed with the care I received. From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was welcoming and calming. Dr. Ain took the time to listen attentively to my concerns and thoroughly explain my treatment options. Their expertise and compassionate approach instilled confidence in me right away. Thanks to Dr. Ain's personalized care plan, I've experienced significant relief and am able to live my life more comfortably. I highly recommend Dr. Ain to anyone seeking top-notch pain management care.|Dr. Ain asked me specific questions about my pain which I appreciated.  He focused on what made my pain worse, how long I had the pain, and what treatments I had already received.  Dr. Ain was straight forward about his approach and gave me his percentages of his success, as well as, alternative therapies. He was patient and listened. I'm glad to report that after 3 injections I've dramatically improved. Dr. Ain gave me my life back.  Highly recommend.

Dr. Michael Gaume,   His bedside manners are caring, compassionate, amazing, soft spoken, he slips in his sense of humor just when you least expect him to!  My husband and I found out that Dr.Gaume likes fishing  and we started exchanging  fishing stories.

Compassionate Pain Management in Rural Kansas

At our practice, Dr. Adam Madl brings specialized pain management care to the rural communities of northeast Kansas. Born and raised in the region, we understand the unique healthcare challenges facing our patients and are committed to delivering advanced medical therapies close to home. Our approach focuses on interventional, opioid-free treatment options that address both chronic and acute pain conditions. With Dr. Madl's strong background in biology, we provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from minor to debilitating pain issues. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Critical access medicine

We're proud to serve the Iola community from our location at 3066 N Kentucky St. To learn more about our approach or to schedule a consultation, visit our Dr. Adam Madl's Provider Profile or call us at (620) 365-1205.
column11:
Adam Madl, DO, has a passion for critical access medicine and treating patients suffering from chronic or acute pain. Dr Madl was born and raised in northeast Kansas and has always been drawn to rural communities and the people who live there. He understands the challenges of rural medicine and looks forward to bringing the latest medical therapies to his patients right where they live.
Dr Madl utilizes his biology background to help improve the lives of patients, providing interventional, opioid-free options to achieve pain relief while treating minor to debilitating pain conditions.

column40:
The Bad: you see a doctor in 1st visit but he is not the doctor administering the shots; so you hope nothing gets missed.  Something did..they did an MRI but not a regular x-ray.  A regular x-ray would have shown a synovial cyst that they missed in an MRI.  After the 1st set of injections (alot of money) I told them that barely any relief.
So they did another round of injections....again alot of money.  After Zero relief I begged my PCP to refer me to someone else.  Who found the cyst immediately and problem was solved in 10 days.  I was in tremendous pain for almost 4 months from the time I scheduled an appointment till the 2nd injection.  4 months of wasted time in tremendous pain.  All fixed by a simple x-ray.  The 1st doctor did not listen to me; and the doctor who does the injections spends maybe 3 minutes with you in the injection never asking how it was working.  This place do not listen to the patient.

The good:  only the nursing staff seemed to care how I was doing.|They don't appear to ever answer their phones. And they don't have a voicemail set up. Like going back in time to 1978 when phones just rang indefinitely until the caller hangs up. Stay classy, Crimson!! If you're looking for a responsive, capable and available medical office, steer clear of this train wreck.|EXCELLENT||

column38: Alli|Patricia Gaunce|allison nauertc|merry glover|Barbara Hernandez|Stephen Hill|K O|Lucille Moriarty
column40:
I was in extreme pain for around two and a half years, after I was involved in a car accident I did not cause. The insane number of doctors I visited would not listen to me, because they said time had lapsed "too long" for the two to be related. This was said even though I sought out immediate treatment and had nonstop appointments. I gave up all hope of ever being my old self again, until I was referred to Dr. Khan.

Dr. Khan completely shocked me, as his treatments have turned my life around more than I could have ever imagined. He was the first doctor to believe that the amount of pain I experienced was real, and almost instantly had a solution to start with. He decided to do two rounds of injections into my upper and lower back. I finally had hope that I would be able to function like a normal person again, with longer term solutions. He also went above and beyond for me, an example of this is how he helped to get my insurance to see the treatments, as necessary. He tried multiple times, and I was finally approved.

The day after my upper back injection I woke up and was emotional. It was the first time I felt like I could be normal, and not live with a constant pain of 10/10. My pain level went down significantly, and I was able to do more activities I previously was not able to like bending down and reaching. The second injection that I got in my lower back, was mind blowing. I sat up from a nap that I had not long after my appointment, and I was crying my eyes out. It was the first time I had woken up in over 2 years, and I did not have severe crippling pain. I honestly forgot what it was like to live without the barriers that chronic pain creates.

To summarize Dr. Khan is an extraordinary man, that I have a profound amount of respect for. I would recommend him to anyone who is struggling with pain management, or doctors that do not want to listen. He taught me that you do not have to suffer in silence, and the pain your feeling is valid. Dr. Khan is also very understanding, you can feel that he cares about both his job and the people he takes care of. His personality is inviting and professional, and even after just meeting him for the first time I felt completely comfortable. He respected what I had to say; for the first time I was both heard and included in my plan of care for pain management. Dr. Khan is a live saver, and I will always be grateful for the life he was able to give back to me.

Another thing to mention is he is fast, precise, and amazing with the injection needles. I was pretty freaked out about the needles, but he always made sure I was okay and helped me calm down. He made a stressful situation easier to handle, and now I can honestly say that he has fully earned my trust. He is the only doctor I will ever trust with my injections, and pain management.|Dr Khan alleviated spinal and leg pain for both my husband and I with great success.  Ready to return since several years have passed and aging pains surfacing.|He has been my doctor for many years. Since about the time he came to KU. He is excellent. He has good bed side manner, listens, gives input, responds in a timely manner, genuinely cares for my over all health, and never is judgmental.  He also has relieved and worked with my specific situations. Zoohra is also extremely knowledgeable and faithful to guide and consult with Dr. Khan closely. What a wonderful team! Thank you Dr. Khan and Zoohra for all you have done for me over many years.|Dr. Khan genuinely cares about helping his patients with pain relief. Both my husband and I have seen him numerous times for procedures. He takes time to listen you.|Dr. Kahn takes time to understand your pain.
I have had 2 appointments and both were not a very long wait.   He comes in a greets you shakes your hand just an overall very polite Dr. And to mention his staff is incredibly polite as well.  Thank you all.|Dr. Khan is a pleasure to work with.
I had lower back pain and he provided relief
with precision applied shots which help
me get my life back.  I am very grateful.|Seen him 2x for epidurals for herniated disks.  I can stay pain free for 4 years.  Thanks, Dr Khan!|The best

She made it seem like suddenly this clinic appeared and it was news to her. They took my $60 specialist copay and said that's all I would have to pay for my initial visit to establish care when they first opened, but they still hadn't been approved by BCBSKS. I started getting bills for that visit for nearly $300 without deducting the $60 that I had paid. When I came to my initial visit, I said that I only wanted to do my next migraine Botox treatment and then I'd be transferring back to a neurologist due to other concerns. Nissa had her attending come in and they were trying to sell me on staying and it was incredibly uncomfortable. As I was finishing paperwork in the lobby after, I heard them talking about not thinking they'd get anymore patients out of Pinnacle closing and it was super tacky. No one answers the phone and they deny everything when confronted about wrongdoing, so I'm not surprised no one has returned my call about the bill. Definitely reporting to BBB.

Compassionate Pain Management in Lenexa, Kansas

At our pain management practice, Dr. Marvin L. Faulkner specializes in providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.
