column38: Lorrie Oldham|Misty Young|Weston Kaszer|Peggy Sanders|Tiffany Hernandez|Mara Decker|Coleen Small|Summer Patterson
column40:
I get in quick but worth ANY wait.
I posted this 3 years ago and Dr. Faulkner is now gone. Mish hospital is not interested in your pain management. Went from a reasonable dose of pain meds to 1/4 just because THC is illegal in KS. I live in Mo. It's legal here. I can't get out of bed to do things like before. HEY, YOU SUPPOSE SOME PEOPLE REALLY NEED THE HIGHER DOSAGE BECAUSE THEIR BODY CYCLES IT OUT FASTER THAN MOST. When I go to the dentist, the numbing shot wears out quickly. So did my pain pills. They messed up on my monthly drug test and accused me of having THC in my system. Yes I have smoked some but quit when told to. I waited 50 years for it to be legal before I smoked again. Several months in a row. Was nearly dismissed by the assistant Dr for getting my tests messed up. I now am in pain like never before. If I knew someone else to go to I'd be gone.|Doctor Faulkner is the very best pain management doctor out there. He and his staff are very good at what they do. He is very kind and will tell you in detail about your condition and treatment options and makes sure you fully understand everything. He is the only doctor I have found who actually helped me with my pain. He is awesome!|Dr. Faulkner is a wonderful doctor. I've been dealing with a myriad of painful issues for several years. When I was at Children's Mercy on dialysis, a lot of these issues were ignored so I learned to internalize them. A few years after being transitioned out of Children's Mercy, these issues kept making my quality of life terrible and nothing anybody ever tried seemed to work. I saw one pain management doctor who wanted to do physical therapy which seemed entirely irrelevant to the issues I have (interstitial cystitis-like pain and severe UTIs, moderate to severe IBS pain, bad restless legs and diffuse body pain). I got out of his practice and came to see Dr. Faulkner. Right up front I was amazed by his thorough and acceptable pain contract. I love his openness to discuss the limits he has because of the CDC, while also stating that he doesn't feel like the limits will help anyone (as any pain patient can tell you, they haven't). On my first appointment, he was very understanding and accommodating. As for right now, due to his understanding and willingness to help, he's getting five stars from me. Yeah, it was a lengthy wait, but in this day and age, I am more than happy to compromise wait times for better treatment.

Dr. Faulkner expects evidence, which is entirely understandable. He still treated me even though my urologist didn't send over the most comprehensive information, but the nurse asked where they can get more info from and it was as simple as telling them Children's Mercy. Simply put, if you have records to get to him, getting them to him quickly is beneficial. It'll help him and you in developing a treatment plan. One thing I found particularly superior to a lot of doctors is despite not having every record and only having a partial picture, he didn't approach it judgmentally, apathetically or with disbelief. He started a treatment plan based on what was presented and as such I was able to start something despite the timely process of getting all the records in.

As of November of 2019, Dr. Faulkner is hands down the best doctor I have and have had. He shows genuine interest in my case since it is atypical and he actually talks with me about my chronic illness in a way that is very humble--nephrology isn't his specialty (obviously) and while he is still a doctor and understands it, he talks with me like I'm the professional...asking me questions instead of vice versa. It's one of those little things that I like about him. He's a diamond in the rough, really. He treats my quality of life issues

Adding to my fondness of him is his activism and his transparency in discussing the lengths he goes to to try and advocate for the strained field of pain management. I've become an activist of sorts myself and have written on the topic of the opioid crisis and some misconceptions for a few of my college classes, and in particular I wrote a lengthy research essay for my English 102 class to which I gave a copy to Dr. Faulkner and he gladly accepted it and genuinely seemed interested in reading it (I'll follow up with him in December to see if he got a chance to read it ) and when I said I'm considering organizing the Don't Punish Pain Rally for KCMO next year, I believe I recall he said he'd be interested in speaking or helping in whatever ways he can.

If you take nothing else from this, know that Dr. Faulkner isn't like most doctors--he's not walking around in a white coat with stoic apathy. He can be tastefully crude in discussing certain topics, and he's not afraid to criticize on some larger picture things such as the crisis in pain medicine for patients and the policies which have made the field so stressful for many doctors...even better, he doesn't ignore them.|Dr. Faulkner is okay. The appointments are rushed, usually behind, but I have been to far worse for Pain Management.

My major issue is their administrative staff. Unnecessarily rude, dismissive and downright unprofessional. I "get" that they likely deal with a lot of issues, but I don't need nor deserve the general disrespect and attitude. Trust me, I don't want to talk to their scheduler any more than she wants to talk to me. I DREAD any time I have to call there.

If I acted the way the do, I would not have my job. None of their system is online and scheduling is a hassle.. I recommend they record some of the patient phone call encounters for QA/QC.|Ive had to see many doctors in my life being on dialysis and having the issues ive had and Dr Faulkner is hands down the best doctor ive ever met . he truly cares about his patients and will do whatever he can to help them but he also wont allow people to take advantage of him either. Pain managment is probably the hardest dr field because u can get alot of people who try to abuse the system and get drugs. Dr Faulkner is super smart and can weed those people out. He does require records before being seen to determine if he will take ur case and if u get that opportunity dont mess it up because u will NEVER find a better doctor than him|Won't coddle you so don't expect a pity party. He is a realist who is working within tough constraints. Staff is polite. I do see him in Lee's Summit and rarely wait. Unfortunately, a lot of ignorance in the world is torturing pain patients. He is doing what he can to be an advocate. Many pain specialists do not even prescribe opiates any longer which has no real scientific evidence to back that practice. Many have quit out of fear of losing their licenses or criminal prosecution. Finding someone who can treat you holistically is difficult. You have to abide by your contract as it is a two way street. Those who are abusers of medication and other drugs are identified quickly. This keeps those of us honest pain patients from being lumped into a statistic.|I've read through reviews. I spent two long years in pain with no answers from the medical world. So many test and "let's try this". The daily pain was so bad that I had broken my back and didn't know it until two months later. I had been to two emergency rooms and sent home because they "couldn't find anything wrong with me". Had finally made it to Mayo clinic in Phoenix for an appointment but before that date I ended up in Mayo's emergency room.  They were going to throw me out. I told them I would tie myself to that bed until they could find someone to fix me.  Only then did they keep me. Still no real answers and short term relief. Thankfully I had an appointment with Dr Faulkner a few weeks after getting back to KC. In those two weeks I was back to serious pain. In my first appointment with Dr Faulkner I was in a wheelchair and was using Lamaze breathing to try to control pain. I couldn't talk to him. He could see how bad I was and prescribed a few meds. I took the meds and a two hour nap. When I woke I did NOT have any pain. NO PAIN! After two years of daily pain it was GONE! I have stayed on my meds and have slowly weaned myself from them to where I am only taking one opiod a day, hopefully zero by year's end.
Dr Faulkner.Thank you!
Before I met you I was not living. Just because it can't be seen, pain is real!!
Now, because of who you are, I am alive again!   God bless you for caring!|Horrible doctor! He was very unprofessional, he rolled his eyes at me the entire appointment and acted like i was a burden on his day. That's definitely not the way you want to be treated when your in real pain; which he tried to tell me I didnt have. Ive had issues since 2012 and have lots of documentations My orriginal appointment was to be in August and they keept cancelling on me due to him having an Emergncy, they messed up my appointment time, he was sick, and he just didnt show up one time. I didnt get in until October and when he asked why my starting paperwork was dated in August, I expliained what happened and he said "Yea its allways my fault" and scoffed. He gave me a perscrition and told me i could have one refill. When i got home i noticed the bottle said that refills require authorization so when the time came I was told to contact my pharmacy and it would be filled. I did so on the 14th and its been denied 3 times! So now im stuck with no medication and no appointment to get  a new doctor till the 12th! I dont know how ill get through work let alone physical therapy. Super un-professional and horrible service. The only nice person was his nurse but she obviously has very little to do with the care i recieved. I wouldn't reccomend this doctor to my worst enemy and definatly don't for those seeking help and comfort in your struggles. Go to someone else.

column40:
Dr Fox ethics are questionable. He discharged me while suffering severe back pain just because of a video where I was trying to move my clothes to another apartment. When he was the one who  told me that I needed my back pain to be blocked with injections. He forgot that he was my Dr and his priority had to be my well-being, not the insurance company money. After he discharged me I went to New Jersey where another pain management Dr continue with my treatment. I was sent to see a neurosurgeon that told me that my condition will be for life. That my options were to have a spinal cord stimulation or surgery. All that after Dr Fox discharged me. All the physical and mental suffering I went thru because of him are irreparable. I was out of money and without work because I just couldn't work. Even my HR manager told me and told Concentra and Dr Fox that they couldn't have me back to work in my condition. If you have private insurance you're good with the good Dr. But if you go to see him for workers compensation he will discharged you in a blink of an eye.|Hey everyone, in 2022 I had an accident and had the opportunity to meet Dr. Foxx. Since the first time I met and talked to him, I knew he was the one that would help me with my injury. He was straight up and right away told me what he was going to do. This guy is not alone, he is working with higher power or whatever you believe in. Trust him and his work, he will heal you. Also, he's got the best team ever. The times I went to see him, his team treated me very well. I highly recommend him!|My accident happened in April 2016. I went to MANY Drs to find relief fron the daily neck pain and headaches. The neurologist I seen told me a had post concussion syndrome and migraines. He gave me medication and it did not help at all. When I finally went to see Dr Foxx, he ordered an MRI of my neck and discovered I had herniated discs. He immediately scheduled me in for epidural infections. After receiving my 3rd injection, I was finally headache free. I have now been headache free for 5 weeks! I can not tell you how much pain I was in before getting these injections. Dr Foxx explained everything in detail regarding my treatment plan and recovery. He has a great beside manner and you can tell he truly cares for his patients. If you're in pain and can not find anyone to help you find the sources of your pain, I suggest you try Dr Foxx. He will listen to your concerns and answer any questions you may have. I will recommend this Dr to others. He has made my days brighter! Thank you Dr Foxx and staff!! You are all great and deserve more thanks than you know! Truly grateful!!!|Dr. Foxx and his whole team  (shout out to Misty n Abby) are amazing, caring, thoughtful, and very attentive your needs. Dr. Foxx is very thorough with what he is doing during procedures walks you through each step and if he doesn't think something is good for you he will tell you truthfully. Doesnt push you to do things you dont want and is very understanding. I highly highly recommend him and his team they have the best bedside manners you can ever think of..|He was spot on in his diagnosis of my migraines after 5 months of many therapies  (vision, vestibular, physical therapy, medications ) I felt immediate relief after just the test to determine whether the treatment would work or not. Went from a 10 pain level and vomiting to a 2 in less than an hour. Highly recommend! !!!|Due to legal proceedings I can't say why, but I don't personally trust this doctor and think he needs to work on verbiage when discussing medical issues with patients.|He explains absolutely everything to you. So you have no worries!
He is a great dr!|They are very caring. Explain every thing so you know what is going to happen.

column3:
At Ascension Via Christi in Wichita, we provide specialized interventional pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Brian Goentzel, MD. As a board-certified anesthesiologist, Dr. Goentzel focuses on comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of chronic pain conditions that impact quality of life.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer advanced treatments for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Chronic headaches

  • Low back pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Lupus-related pain

Our treatment approaches are tailored to each patient's specific needs and may include minimally invasive procedures such as the Intracept procedure, spinal cord stimulation, nerve ablation, targeted injections, and medication management. We take pride in our thorough approach to pain diagnosis, ensuring we address the root cause of discomfort rather than just masking symptoms. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please visit our Dr. Brian Goentzel at Ascension Via Christi page or call us at (316) 613-4670. Our office is conveniently located at 1947 N Founders Circle in Wichita.
column11: Brian Goentzel, MD, is an anesthesiologist specializing in interventional pain management with Ascension Via Christi in Wichita, KS. He focuses on diagnosis and chronic pain treatments for arthritis, headache, lupus, low back pain, joint pain, post-surgery pain, and more. Treatments may include minimally invasive surgery, injections, medications, spinal cord stimulation, nerve ablation and more.
column38: Liz Hobson|Ed Burris|micheallynn romans|Tom Ragatz|Lindsay Evangelista|Theresa Smith|Pamela Ledington|Gina Weidner
column40:
I appreciated Dr Goentzel taking the time to explain my condition and ask the various options for treatment.  Plus, he ordered a Dexscan to help understand my bone condition better.   Highly recommend|Dr Goentzel performed Intracept procedure on my back 2 years ago, on Jan 2023, and I have been pain free ever since. I am forever grateful for his expertise.|Dr. Was very pleasant & knowledgeable. I enjoyed the visit & am ready to get my back taken care of.|Going through trial of a spinal cord stimulator.  Could not be happier with the experience.  Great communication and so far the results are promising.   Nobody needs to live with chronic pain.|The staff in the procedure room are horrible! This was the scariest and absolute worst experience I have ever had!!!! They don't wait for the anesthesia/anxiety meds to set in before starting the procedure. You try to tell them it's not working, and that you're still scared and in pain..they say it's fine and that you're supposed to feel it... if you squirm and cry when you are scared and in pain from the multiple spinal injections his sadistic assistant will tell you that you need  to just stop, lay still and learn how to breathe.. immediately following the procedure you will be expected to get yourself back up from the procedure table, and move yourself to another bed for transport...keep in mind, you better make it quick since they have been running late all morning and it's probably in your best interest  to not ask for help, otherwise you will catch a lot of attitude.

At this point I have lost all hope in getting relief and feel I am better off dealing with the day to day pain than to ever have to go through that again. Due to how everything went today and how it is currently going, I now fear the thought of any and all the other appts. concerning my spine.|I have been coming to Dr Goentzel for pain management. He is amazing! He just performed the Intercept procedure, I am feeling 100% better all ready! He is AMAZING!
Thank you Dr Goentzel!|Amazing provider, but once again another office who can't get staff who understand how to do things needed behind the scenes. Had ablation in Aug 2022 which helped amazingly. Went to schedule another one and it was a disaster. Turns out the one in August was never approved and hasn't been submitted to insurance for it to be denied. Also they performed another procedure recently that was also never submitted and was not approved. I have spoke to insurance, surgery scheduling, and office manager and gotten no where. I am now not able to have procedure again and am looking at a massive bill! Thousands of dollars that wouldn't have happened if one person's job was done correctly.|I went to see Dr. Goentzel several years ago and tried the shots for back pain.  They would work for maybe a week and the pain was back. I couldn't do anything without suffer with horrible back pain. I was told that the next best thing was back surgery, which I was totally against.  Then Dr. Goentzel told me about the Intracept procedure.  I had it done and it's the best thing I have had done.  I had it done on a Wednesday and was up and doing things by Friday.   I really recommend this procedure.  You will not regret it !!!
Thank you again Dr. Goentzel !

column38: Grace Cho|Kristina Wood|Ken Olsen
column40: Personally, I've had the absolute best experience with Dr. Dalal as well as the staff at Kansas Pain Management Overland Park office. I've suffered for a very long time with chronic pain, without a lot of relief- until I was referred to her. She's friendly, incredibly knowledgeable, thorough, spends time explaining things, as well as providing options for treatment. I highly recommend her for chronic pain management! The staff are also friendly, scheduling appointments for office visits as well as procedures is easy to do, and the wait time isn't long. For the first time in years, I'm getting mobility back, strength,  reduction in pain, and peace of mind.|I would give Dr. Dalal, her staff and the Overland Park office zero stars if I could. The office staff did not inform me of an amount of $1,100 I needed to pay at the time of my procedure. The receptionist told me one of her co-workers called me, but could not leave a message. But in fact this office called me just a few days ago and left me instructions for my sedation. I also called the day of the appointment verifying the time of my procedure. No one at the time of that call made the attempt to inform me of this money due. This was a waste of an hour drive and the pain I have endured the last week not being able to take certain medications because of this procedure that I can't get done now. I've had to practically beg to get a prescription for an anti-inflammatory (Meloxicam), because I can't take ibuprofen. I am so disappointed in this practice. I'm in so much pain and needed just some kind of relief. Especially to get back to work full time so I can pay these medical expenses. I've been seeing Dr. Dalal since April of 2022 with no relief for my back pain.|

column38: kelly schmidt|Richard Renner|Gary McManness|J M|marisa kartus|Lily G|Kelly Schmidt|Mandy Riley
column40: I was very pleased with the services in Dr. Harper's office. The receptionist called me and said there had been a cancellation and would I be willing to come for an appointment. I had been enduring a lot of pain and was very happy to be seen on short notice. The nurse was great! She asked me a lot or questions and wanted me to describe what was going on with me. Her name was Kristin. She was very knowledgeable and answered all of my questions. She explained what would take place in preparation for my epidural injection. I had been seen two days earlier by Dr. Harper in his office. He was very kind and friendly. He took a lot of time to listen to me. After we talked about what had been going on with my pain, he showed me my MRI images and pointed out the abnormalities and where he planned to make the injection. On the day of the epidural, Dr. Harper was very kind and patient. He explained every step during the procedure so I would know what to expect. The procedure was painless and it did not take long at all. I felt much better after the procedure. I would highly recommend Dr. Harper to anyone who has back pain.|Dr. Harper has helped us in an emergency situation with care, friendliness and concern. He's been very attentive after the treatment by calling and checking up on us. His staff was also very friendly and took time to explain what was being done.|Dr. Harper was very attentive and was very thorough with seeing the mri. I have a lot of pain and don't know exactly where the source is but I know some relief has been found. Some other pain has moved and I will definitely trust Dr. Harper again to help me get back to a bearable life. The lady who took me in his office also helped in the procedure. A great team for sure!|Dr. Harper is amazing!  I have seen him and have had 2 procedures which have helped my pain immensely!  Wouldn't see anyone else.  I love that he does not prescribe opioids.  Office staff is amazing and the nurses down in Pain Management.  Best Pain Dr. in my opinion.|Great care and his nurse Christina was amazing can't say enough about her and her care and dr Harper made me feel listened to and cared about my pain.|I see *a lot* of doctors and by far Dr. Harper is a favorite. He's willing to keep trying to find a solution that works best for you. Evidence based solutions. Highly recommended.|Probably the worst experience I've had. Was a complete waste of time. He let me down and basically told me my pain From my stenosis was in my head. Terrible person.|Thank you for being very thorough make sure I know all my opinions... column3:
Harvard-Trained Pain Management Specialist in Wichita

At Kansas Spine & Specialty Pain Center, Dr. Chandra Tokala leads our interventional pain management practice with a simple philosophy: "My wish for my patients is to do what they enjoy the most, either playing with their grandkids, or going back to work. Whatever it takes for me to help them out." As a board-certified anesthesiologist and Harvard-trained pain medicine specialist, we provide comprehensive care for a wide range of pain conditions. Our services include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulator implantation

  • Targeted pain management solutions

We specialize in creating personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain, not just the symptoms. Dr. Tokala's extensive training and expertise allow us to offer advanced interventional techniques that minimize medication dependence and maximize quality of life. Currently welcoming new patients at our Wichita location, we invite you to learn more about our approach to pain management or call us at (316) 462-5072 to schedule your consultation at our 3223 N Webb Rd location.

column40:
I have had lower back pain off and on for 30 years. During this period of time I've received multiple lumbar epidurals with multiple providers. I typically get good results. The last two were performed by Dr. Tokala and I must say he's a master of his technique. He has a professional demeanor, the procedure was quick and painless, and I've had excellent results. His staff at the Kansas Spine & Specialty Hospital were friendly and caring. I highly recommend Dr. Tokala.|I have been having neck pain for a few years now. I have been very nervous to move forward with a cervical epidural so I kept putting it off. The pain in my neck was keeping me up at night and limiting activities I could do. I finally gave in and went to see Dr. Tokala for an epidural. I am so glad I did! He was so kind and caring and made me feel so much better about the process. During the process of the injection, he let me know the feelings or sensations I may feel and he made sure to ask if I was still doing ok, and I really was. And within a few minutes, I was done. It was easier than I thought and now my neck pain is not near as severe. The staff was fantastic as well!
Thank you Dr. Tokala!!!|Dr. Tokala has helped me manage my shoulder/neck pain after a skiing injury.  He is knowledgeable and compassionate and I would highly recommend him to anyone. His goal is to improve your quality of life by helping you become pain free or reduce your pain levels as much as possible.|My first time seeing Dr Tokala was when I had a herniated disc after a laminectomy in an attempt to avoid another surgery, and manage my pain. I was afraid to have an epidural because in the past they were so painful. Dr Tokala assured that there would be no pain. I'm having back pain again 10 years after seeing him. The epidural has kept me out of surgery for years. However, the pain is back with a vengeance. I was excruciating pain during the procedure. Things have changed when it comes to the level of service. Phone calls go unanswered, it seems like an assembly line operation. I gave them a two because the nurse was so friendly.|Dr Tokala did my "pain management" all he did was the trial and permanent implant of my spinal cord stimulator. Once put in he basically handed me off to the Nevro reps and when I asked what would my next option be since the stimulator isn't helping at all. His response was "I don't know. I thought that would solve the problem" now he has washed his hands of me and my case. Also his office is extremely difficult to contact. Every time you call you only get the voice-mail and rarely get responded back to. I addressed this with the Dr and he acknowledged it and stated he knew about it, yet there was nothing he could do... So in the long run he is there to get his quick money and be done with you.|I've been a patient of Dr. Tokala for a while and have been trying different procedures to ease my back pain. Today I had an appointment with Tania Cox, APRN and it was enlightening! She was so informative, caring and compassionate. I left there with peace of mind that future treatment will improve my quality of life! I think they make a great team!|Dr Tokola has taken such good care of me. I have been seeing him the last 7 years. He has really managed my pain with epidural injections and radio frequency ablations. He is very smart.|So far this place doesn't deserve any stars. I have called many times to get my husbands first appointment. Left my number, work number with my direct extension... due to my husband drives truck and hard to get ahold of. They refuse to call me, even after I have left this as a detailed message. They have only tried to call my husband 2 times in 2 weeks. Sounds like if Dr is aware this is happening and should clean house if nobody wants to do their job.

column38: katherine Hedrick|Jereferol|Ashley Starbird|Renee Molbert|J B|Bonnie Marsh|Michele Greenwood|Tina Waltner
column40:
I've been seeing Dr Parks and Amanda for several years.  I've always been treated very well. I recommend this office for anyone who needs expert care for even the worst pain.|Doctor Parks, and the entire team, at the surgery center side, or the office side, are high quality people working to just simply take the BEST CARE for you. I have seen many and this office is amazing Thank you to all at Pain Management|Dr. Parks and his staff are amazing! I would and do recommend everyone I know to come to his office for pain care. I am truly amazed by the bad reviews and find it convenient since HIPAA prevents physician offices from defending themselves and refuting lies online when such inflammatory remarks are made by people who likely couldn't/wouldn't follow simple instructions and recommendations.|I've had a pain pump for over 22 yrs so this does not include all the time spent in pain mgmt before the pump but I can honestly say I've had my fair share of Drs and different clinics but this was not a pleasant experience. A pump has a shelf life of approximately 7 yrs and because I've traveled a lot and lived in many different areas I've had to find pain mgmt clinics in several different states. It was time to replace my pump for the 3rd time and I was a new patient. After 2 surgeries where the new pump was literally protruding out of the open incision that would not heal I questioned a 3rd surgery to move the pump to the other side of my abdomen. This created tension among the staff nurses. Keep in mind I had been a patient for over 2 yrs and the only time I met Dr. Parks was right before the two surgeries. I was beginning to feel he didn't really exist. When I finally did meet him for a few minutes before surgery he was pleasant but all my dealings were with the nurses for 2 yrs. I walking on egg shells around them because my incision was not healing over a period of 7 months. I did not want to be one of those patients that was asked to leave but that was exactly what happened. Because of the difficulty of the pump coming out of my body and the incision  not healing I was labeled and told by the nursing staff to find another Dr. I had to remove the pain pump of 22 yrs and walk out of that office with very few options available to me. The only thing I did was question why I wasn't healing and why they thought another surgery was the answer. It was a very unpleasant experience for a person with chronic pain of over 30 yrs, 15 back and neck surgeries, a broken neck and Adult Scoliosis with two rods in my spine with over 12 six inch screws in my back holding me together. This was my 1st experience in being turned away from pain mgmt which left me with a very negative feeling  and the only options left were to go out of state or drive over 3 hrs to another city in KS. I thought pain mgmt was about treating pain and caring about the patient but obviously that's not what's important here.|I am so grateful for Dr Parks and his staff. Never a problem with my health and this year amazingly excruciating back pain from nerves and degenerative disc's. I came back a few times before they were able to nail down the problem but they did. Very grateful for Dr. Jon Parks and his skill, my quality-of-life has improved significantly. THANK YOU DOC!|When it comes to procedures, Dr. Parks has the most gentle touch, like the hands of an angel. Every other injection I've had has been extremely painful. Dr. Parks must have wings under his scrubs, because I can't believe he is a mere mortal!|I cannot say enough about the help they were able to give me. I went to them for a super unique situation - teeth - they really don't do teeth; BUT they did have an answer for what they believe the problem to be but even better? After 5 weeks of barely being able to function, they were able to prescribe nerve-blocking medication and a stronger anti-inflammatory medication that has helped tremendously. So thankful for how quickly they were able to see me and provide relief from what has been incredible complications and debilitating pain. Highly recommend - their entire staff is kind, caring and professional.|Dr Parks is very kind and caring. He is very gentle giving injections. I have had several injections. His are the best compared to others.
The staff is kind, they have helped me with pain very well.

column40:
Are there businesses so shameless that they prey on people in pain, making grand promises only to deliver nothing? Absolutely.

I was misled into trusting this so-called clinic, believing their treatment would provide real relief. I spent $5,000 over three months, expecting results, only to be met with excuses, delays, and a complete bait-and-switch. They lure you in with big claims about pain relief and healing, but once you've paid, all you get is a long string of ineffective treatments that leave you in the same--or worse--condition than before.

I had multiple meetings with their second-in-command guy and his less-than-qualified team, each time hoping they would offer real solutions. Instead, they fed me the same scripted responses, the same weak justifications, and the same refusal to take accountability. And when I pressed them for answers? "It takes time." Right--just enough time to string you along until you've drained your wallet.

Speaking of money, expect to pay thousands for a service that does not deliver. And when you realize you've been scammed and ask for a refund? Too bad. They've already locked you into an agreement that protects them while leaving you with nothing but frustration.

Their entire operation is a bait-and-switch scam, preying on people desperate for relief. They bank on your trust, but trust me: you'll get nothing but disappointment, wasted money, and no improvement.

Avoid this place at all costs.|I am most of the way through my near "bone on bone" knee treatment with stem cells and other therapeutic methods. Already I am experiencing vast improvement, and once treatment is over I will be beginning a new treatment on my lower back compressed vertebra and pinched nerves. Thank you one and all for the wonderful time I've had trying to restore my health! I highly recommend Renuva for everyone suffering with constant knee and back pain.|Are there people who swindle people at the risk of their health? The answer is yes.
I went to this Renuva Back & Pain clinic because I made a wrong decision and received 3 treatments, but it didn't work at all and now I'm worse than before. The reason I'm writing this is because I hope that there won't be any more victims based on my experience. While I was receiving 3 treatments, I kept asking, "When will I get better?" The answer was a year later. Who would do this kind of treatment if they paid close to 9,000 dollars and kept getting worse? Even if you ask them to return the money after deducting the cost of 3 treatments, they won't give it back. The clinic makes you sign this paper so that they don't take responsibility for anything.
"The procedure is not guaranteed to relieve my pain, partially or totally" It doesn't get better at all and it actually makes you worse,  so why do you keep doing it? Don't be fooled any longer. This is medical fraud.|As a veteran who's tried many different treatments, I would say this worked the best. The doctor was clear and concise in his explanation of the problem he will look to address( based on my pain, and the path to a solution to help me improve my range of motion and relieve me with some of my pain I've experienced since exiting the military.

I was also offered a military discount which allowed me to start my treatment immediately.

to top it off, the staff is very friendly and helpful.

I would highly recommend this type of treatment and this clinic for your pain management needs.|Told me they couldn't help me.  They didn't tell me why , but I think they thought I expected Medicare to pay for any treatment.
I was NOT going to use their services on my own.  Usually Medicare covers all my health problems, so Reuva may be on their list for a NO  GO.|I paid $10,000 for treatment in Renuva, but I have still pain and unfortunately it didn't work at all for me. Don't waste your money . If you lose your weight and do physical therapy and exercise, it is much better and very helpful for you if you have knee arthritis.|Well I did the $49 special for my shoulder and a heat treatment and Xray that showed a small tear. He was explaining stem cells to me and baby etc. I said it really comes from a baby ?  Then he looked irritated and said Wert you listening ?     well that's rude 

Then he started out with price $10,000 and it got lower and when he was pushing for a sale , after I said no ( in a normal tone voice ) " No I have to check this out first  with wife , google , ask my Dr. THEN he says " Don't get aggressive !   ? I didn't sound aggressive ??

That guy was pushy ,  Not your normal visit with normal acting people. I get this treatment when I buy cars ,  didn't expect the attitude and pressure he was applying.I got 5k I got 10k but I don't make a rush decision on things and that irritated him.

I did not appreciate the Don't be aggressive statement when I was clearly was not. and didn't like the Weren't you listening ? Comment either.

At the end he wrote Decline need to talk to wife etc. so

It's a no .for me .. Randy ? Paula?|The regeneration therapy has given me my life back!  I had severe shoulder pain for 3 years.  I had tried everything.  NOTHING gave me any relief until I started receiving this therapy.  I am so thankful for this treatment!  Want your life back?  Give this a try!

column40: I couldn't be more happier after my visit with Dr. Tyler Concannon.  The whole staff was inviting and very helpful.  I was comforted before my procedure and after.  They did a wonderful job.  I recommend using them if you are experiencing pain and need relief.|I've been to two different doctors here spanning a year. It is evident that they don't care about a patients quality of life, or the pain they are in. They refused to look at records from a prior pain management doctor who'd seen me & treated me for 11 years. Although I'd told them that injections have provided no relief, they offered an injection. I proceeded with that with Dr Elliot, and got no relief. I require surgery to remove a cyst that's pushing on my nerve, causing tremendous pain. I was referred here by the surgeon who's performing the surgery. His hope was that they could provide pain management until my surgery. I saw Dr Elliot again, and I don't know what the point of it was. She refused to prescribe a medication I'd been on previously that helped my pain, because SHE didn't like it. Um, it helped me, so why not try? She kept trying to give me meds that I'd tried previously and hadn't gotten relief. She wouldn't give me anything of substance,  because in her opinion it would make my surgery recovery rough. The surgeon sent me to you to PROVIDE relief until my surgery. She mentioned yet another injection, which I can't have prior to the surgery. It is quite apparent that she only cares about the $ from injections, and also mentioned a device today, that is also for the $. She didn't look at the diagnosis the surgeon sent over, nor look at any of my recent images. A doctor who will not be thorough while "treating" a patient has no business being a doctor. I will not return to this "clinic" and waste more time and money. I would not recommend this clinic to anyone who has any type of chronic pain, whose quality of life both physically and mentally is suffering due to the pain. Horrible bedside manner & did this recent visit in front of a student. Self medicating with Marijuana is a better option at this point.|I was amazed by the services provided to me by Dr Concannon and all of the staff in the office. I can't say enough about how friendly, professional, and thoughtful Dr C was .... I am feeling 90% better 2 days after getting my sciatic area injected and couldn't be more grateful! Truly an incredible experience :)|Dr. Foster is is the best pain management Dr I have ever seen. He is very kind and sat next to me and explained my X-rays and walked me through everything he was seeing and answered all of my questions. He did not rave through the appointment and assured me that we were going to get to the scourge of pain from my Motor vehicle accident. The staff went above and beyond! During my procedure one of the nurses sat right on the floor and held my held and talked me through everything. Finally a Pain Dr that cares and understands!  I am in the right place!|I've been to quite a few hospitals and dealt with countless numbers of doctors over the last couple of years. Not one physician or nurse has shown me the kindness, compassion, or understanding that St. Luke's has shown. Not only that, but they are the only ones to give me real answers! No one has ever dismissed me or doubted me, and that speaks volumes.|This office does not communicate with patients or physicians and list my medical records. I had an appointment Dec 30 and was supposed to be contacted for a return visit. I left my medical records there at their insistence, being told they would send them to me after copying. My MRI on CD was never returned, nor was written report. The initial appointment took 8 weeks weeks to get in and paperwork for referral was incomplete, yet neither I nor the referring MD was informed by their office. My treatment was never received and I had to find another office to  receive treatment. They do not know how to run an office. I wouldn't ever recommend them due to office staff incompetence.|I'm so very grateful for this place and the people all staff are wonderful amazing people Dr Tyler Concannon  nurse Joan Becky scrub Tech Wes Radiology Tech Shawn all receptionists in front all nurses I thank you all for changing my life for the better I feel like a new person with a brand new back I love each and every one of you and who ever you all boss is please give these wonderful people a raise cause they go over and beyond to get the job done right and good  again thank you all for everything from the bottom and top of my heart  Shante P|My grandfather was referred here for his leg and foot pain. As far as we are concerned his physician, Dr. Fraizer, isn't an issue. However, one of his staff was extremely unprofessional and impolite over the phone. Earlier the office asked to reschedule my grandfather's nerve block, which he did for a week later but by then would be out a medication Dr. Fraizer had prescribed him so when he called to ask if it was possible it could be refilled (as was written on the bottle) he was met with indignation and hostility for asking. I can understand if something is not possible, or that it might be frustrating to have someone not understand what you mean or what can/can't be done but her tone, language, and behavior were unwarrented, especially so early in the very brief conversation. I was privy to both sides of the conversation and was completely thrown off by her reaction to his questioning.

column40: I just had an epidural in my neck by him and he and his staff were amazing. They were always making sure I was comfortable or asking if it hurt. I'm a big believer in treating people as you would like to be treated... don't go in there expecting overnight miracles and or drugs.|Dr. Malburg is very professional and has not treated my symptoms with harsh drugs. I really appreciate him not throwing drugs at me as the solution.|Dr. Malburg is an amazing doctor.  I had been to countless specialists and they had no idea on how to treat my symptoms. Saw Dr. Malburg for a separate issue, and he inquired about what I was seeing the specialists about and after the 1st procedure,  he took care if the problem. The entire time he tore her down, belittled her, he consistently cut her short everytime she attempted to answer a question that he asked her, he wasn't interested in anything about her except to mention that she doesn't need to inform him of any medical conditions she has (even though he asked for them) because HE is the medical professional and doesn't need her to tell him these things. They really care about your well being and it certainly shows!|Dr.Giroux was so helpful, and tried to do everything he could for my condition. His staff was very kind and helpful. Dr.Giroux had great bedside manner and very knowledgeable. I had a great experience with him and would recommend anyone to him!|This is a very pleasant and helpful pain management office.  All of the people working there are efficient and pleasant.
Dr Giroux is very thorough and excellent at determining what his patient's need.|Dr. Giroux is so down to earth.  He comes in and has answers to your questions and you can understand him.  He puts everything in lay terms.  Yet he will not do a procedure if he does not feel it will help.  And is ready to refer you on if you need it.|Best pain guy I have ever been to. I have had issues with my back for years. Seen numerous doctors and specialists only to spend money with zero results.
On my 4th visit I was fixed. I have not felt this good since I was 20.
The entire process up to the procedure he did was well explained and happened in a timely professional manner.
Highly reccomended.|Fantastic doctor. He took the time to explain everything in a way that was very easy to understand. Answered all of our questions and concerns and made sure we were as informed as we want to be. Excellent bed side manner: friendly, personable, and professional.  Highly recommend!|Staff is excellent. Dr Giroux explained everything before procedure. Great experience.|Doctor n staff were pleasant. Explained everythg in detail so i understood.

At Kansas Spine & Specialty Hospital, we've been a premier regional center for spine, neck, and joint disorders since our founding in 2003. Located in Wichita, KS, our facility stands as a distinctive healthcare experience on the Great Plains, where we're committed to enhancing our patients' quality of life through exceptional care.

Our Specialized Team & Services

We employ a collaborative, team-based approach with specialists including:

  • Board-certified surgeons

  • Experienced anesthesiologists

  • Pain management experts

  • Internal medicine physicians

  • Dedicated nursing staff

Our comprehensive facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic capabilities, diverse treatment options, and cutting-edge imaging technology. We're particularly proud to utilize one of the nation's first digital records and charting systems, keeping us at the forefront of advanced care. Visit Kansas Spine & Specialty Hospital or call us at +1 316-462-5000 to discover how we can help improve your quality of life through specialized spine and joint care.

column40:
I went in to get my back operated on was there 3 nights while I was there they are absolutely amazing. Everyone was so nice even the cleaning crew came in they were great and fun to visit with. Everybody went out of their way to make sure I was ok and made sure my husband had anything he needed.  The people that work there make this please wonderful|Hands down this was the best experience I have had medically. Dr. Barks is pleasant to work with. I had surgery and everyone from the receptionist, to the housekeeping staff (I wish I had asked the young lady's name but your head of housekeeping works harder than anyone!) are so friendly. Every person I encountered made me feel better, if not physically then mentally/spiritually. Courtney in pre op set the tone. Sara was one of the kinder people I have met. Please also thank Sammie, Taran, and Holland. They all took what could have been a rough time and made it as easy as possible on me.|Pre-surgery the staff was efficient and friendly. They were clear with the order of things to expect, post -surgery the nursing and CNA staff were so friendly and helpful. If I hadn't just had major surgery I would think I was at a resort being pampered.|My spine surgery was in late May, 2024. I could barely walk when I went in (Dr Ashley Barks was my surgeon). Now in October, my back feels wonderful!  I am so glad I went to this hospital for this procedure. From day one,  to the day I left, it was a good experience. Everyone I encountered was pleasant and explained everything. The nurses and staff that cared for me were the best!  If ever I needed this type of surgery again, I would not hesitate to go back.
It's a great hospital!|I have been an establishing patient since 2022. When I first started coming here, I loved the APRN Rhonda and Dr. Scott a lot! They were very personable and super thorough in their communication about my treatment. I lost my insurance in 2023 and had a pretty hefty bill to pay. I called to get options on payment plans to get it paid off but constantly kept getting transferred from the front office to a voicemail that no one responded back too. Soon enough I was sent to collections. I still needed to continue my treatment after I got a new insurance but because of my bill they made it very difficult to get established again (a year before they would get me back on the schedule). They kept calling saying they needed a new proof of insurance but when I would call they had my correct insurance on file just wouldn't get me scheduled. Fast forward to being seen today for an epidural injection, the front desk lady asked for my insurance and drivers license and with an attitude said "have you ever even been seen here?". She said she was new and kept apologizing because she didn't have any answers to my questions and had to call on her PERSONAL cell phone for help. I've had multiple epidural injections and have only needed a driver on the first ever one, she would not let me get checked in unless I called someone to come drive me. After frantically finding someone, I checked in with Chandlier and he was a saint! Made me feel so much more at ease telling me he could get me checked in even after 20 mins after my scheduled appointment. I asked one of the assistants if they changed their policy on a driver after injections and she said they got a new patient manager and it is now more reinforced. Anyways, I highly recommend Dr. Scott and Rhonda Janzen (APRN) but DO NOT recommend the business staff. If you need more accommodating and personable front desk I do not recommend coming here.|The positive reviews for this place are either paid or they had different staff years ago. My spouses experience today was beyond subpar, leaving in tears and they never cry. Her early appointment with the PA was wonderful so we had high hopes that they could help her but dam we were wrong. The nurses didn't verify who she was, didn't ask or tell her they were going to touch her, nothing was explained about the procedure, they ignored her when she asked if she was able to adjust positions because the one she was in was painful. Instead all they did was complain about office drama and their children while treating her like a piece of meat on a table. If you have the ability to visit another clinic do it.|Nursing staff and care is excellent.  The business office, specifically patient accounts is horrible. I've been called a liar, that I was "wasting her time". Has been very rude and totally unprofessional.  These actions have been from the Billing/Office manager Roberta Ryan. Issue being my account (which I owe and have been willing to pay) went to collections. I've made payment arrangements with this company AND also notified Roberta I had made arrangements to pay monthly. The amount I offered to pay was not of her liking and canceled the agreement with this company and demanded a payment of 3 times what I can afford. I admit I owed and will pay, it was not to her liking.  Issue being I'm recovering from stage 4 lung cancer and also have financial responsibilities to these providers. I'm disabled and on a fixed income. I had a long awaited surgery with fusions, the stenosis I had almost caused me loss of use of my legs. I don't want sympathy but MAYBE-JUST MAYBE some empathy and certainly not this unacceptable,  unprofessional treatment. Roberta demanded her terms for payment OR I wouldn't be allowed to see my pain management provider!!?? Talk about being held financially hostage. I had surgery in April and needed to be seen to ensure my course of treatment was headed in the right direction.  It's almost criminal, and certainly medically negligent on the business office part to be able to impede my medically necessary care. I understand the hospital policy is to have any balance payed off within 6 months of the first billing statement.  I'm sorry that saving my life from cancer is also important. Or maybe I should file for bankruptcy to avoid this hassle of being held hostage and treated in this manner. Patient's be ware. I've worked in Healthcare for 30+ years and have never heard of or seen such treatment.  I pray I'm able to make the payments being demanded or I won't see my provider, unable to be medically monitored and end up medically and physically "Back sliding " causing me to be hospitalized. The pain management practice is top notch, The surgeon's office and Dr's. are top notch. Any further testing, imaging and/or procedures will NOT be provided at the facility.  May the staff in the billing department have the day(s) they deserve.|Doctor Grundmeyer did a wonderful job on my mother's laminectomy. Her spinal stenosis was severe and surgery took a little longer then expected but she came out standing taller and no longer hunched over, she was up walking the first night and has had manageable pain. The nursing staff, physical therapist, occupational therapy were all wonderful, knowledgeable and helpful. Everyone was very nice, the receptionists were very nice as well. Nothing bad to say at all. The entire experience was a good one. THANK YOU Kansas spine and specialty. Doctor Grundmeyer and his team have given my mother her back back.

column38: Alan DeMoss|Janet Hicks|Joe Fowler|Vicki mcilroy|Bob Jones|Jennifer Cooper|Susan Schlacks|Susan Briner
column40:
I am super thankful and giving glory to God for Jason Mildenberger and all his staff at QC Kinetix. When I started my treatments, my quality of life was at a level 2 or lower (on a scale of 1-10). It really seemed like I was heading toward the grave.
In a short time, I have reached our short term goals of walking and driving my car (which I could not do before treatments). You are very fortunate to have Jason as the leader at this location. His professionalism and pleasant demeanor cannot be overstated. Many thanks to QC Kinetix. I'm still here and continuing to improve. Glory to God!|I went through all of the injections in my knees and I am now around 4 months out. I still can't go up or down the stairs without pain. There has been no change. Squatting and getting up out of a chair hurts. And I was told they would reach out to me after 3 months and no one has. No email (even checked junk mail) or call.  Waste of money. I know I had to try but sorry I went this route.|I waited a year to provide this review.  I felt great during and after my treatments, but time is always the ultimate test for fixing injuries.  I had my shoulder treated, I was suffering for almost 3 years of on and off pain, to the point I had to use a lot of pain killers, cbd, ice/heat pads and even physical therapy.......  I was still lifting weights during the treatments, and i really noticed the pain going away during that time.  I waited a year to see how golfing was going to feel, I played our entire season (30 rounds) plus many more on weekends and never had any shoulder pain.  This has worked better than I could have ever imagined.  Full mobility, no loss of motion, no down time, and the biggest, no pain.  This worked well for me.  I highly recommend this treatment.|I have had nothing but a positive experience with this great team of professionals. I had treatment done to both of my knees. I could hardly walk without pain before the treatment. Both knees were bone on bone. I now have pain-free walking and stair climbing, up and down. It's amazing what the treatment has done.  What a turnaround for me.|QC Kinetix is everything advertised and much more. The staff is professional, personable and truly help take the anxiety away. The treatment eliminated the chronic pain I have had in my elbows for decades. I cannot recommend them more or thank them enough.|I had chronic low back pain / hip pain for 5 years from several compressed disc's and damaged tissue. I was ready to see the neurosurgeon, so happy I didn't! I am able to enjoy life again, I am out of pain.|I am 73-years old and was experiencing a lot of joint pain in my knees which had me contemplating knee replacement surgery. I hoped this non-surgical procedure would help my body with its own healing so I began the restorative process in May 2022. To be honest, I was expecting immediate results, but learned I needed to be patient for the healing to progress. By mid-summer, my knee pain was gone and I was walking the dog, climbing stairs, playing on the floor with my grandkids, and finding those activities effortless again. I am incredibly pleased with my results and I found Jason and all his staff to be friendly, supportive, and very professional. This was a definite win for me.|I have been dealing with stiff knee issues for years. My daughter who is a nurse practitioner knew some people that went to QC Kinetix for shoulder issues. She suggested I try it out. I'm so glad I decided to sign up! I am moving better than I have in years. No I'm not perfect but I am able to keep moving from sun up to sundown. Just recently I took my granddaughters to a carnival and walked and walked! Before I started my treatments I couldn't hardly walk to the mailbox! I am still taking treatments. I'm trying not to "baby" my bad knee and feel like I'm getting "there"!! I'm so thankful for Dr Mildenberger and his kind staff. I'm always treated with such kindness and care! I so appreciate all of them !!! They REALLY do care about me !! Thank you!!!!

column3:
At Christopher M Lam, MD, we provide specialized pain management services backed by extensive medical training and expertise. Dr. Lam completed his fellowship in pain management at the University of Kansas Medical Center after earning his medical degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Medicine and completing his residency at Geisinger Health System.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a range of interventional pain management treatments focused on addressing the root causes of pain. Our services include:

  • Steroid injections for nerve pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation (SCS) therapy

  • Diagnostic evaluations and treatment planning

  • Non-narcotic pain management approaches

As both a pain management physician and anesthesiologist, Dr. Lam brings dual expertise to each patient consultation. We take a comprehensive approach to pain management, focusing on interventional procedures that can provide lasting relief. For appointments or more information about our services, please visit our Dr. Christopher Lam - Pain Management Specialist profile or call us at +1 913-588-1227. Our practice is located at 4000 Cambridge St Level G, Suite, BH.G280, Kansas City, KS 66160.
column11: Dr. Christopher Lam completed a fellowship in pain management at the University of Kansas Medical Center. He earned his medical degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill School of Medicine and completed his residency at Geisinger Health System.

column38: Brandy|Monica Derbes|Kelley|Dustin Williams|Jason Bagwell|Sherry Behnke|robin sage|Katie LaMartina
column40:
I took my 25 year old son who has a rare syndrome to Dr Lam after our nuero referred him for steroid injections. The first set help my son. The second ones 8 months between failed. When he had it , the doctor was massaging the back of his neck and I saw the liquid coming out. My son felt a little better for a week or so. So we go back to see him and he tells me that botox is not an option for what is causing my sons pain. He gave two other treatments 1. Something implanted to shock the nerve 2. Finding the nerves that aren't working right and burn them sk they don't work anymore but because my son is developing disabled (6-8 yrs functions) he would have to be awake for that. My son can't get an MRI with sedation because he moves around. So I ask for my child to have tramadol because the other meds (meloxicam and Celebrex) were not working on him and he has an MRI scheduled to find out if it's scar tissue from two previous brain surgeries. This doctor sends me a message on the portal that his clinic is narcotic free and not one patient of his is on any narcotics. He also said my son should probably see a new pain mgmt doctor that our nuero only referred him for injections which is not true. It was even documented in messages in the portal. So if you are in horrible pain and need help. Don't go to Dr. Lam because he will refuse to give any narcotics even tramadol which is a weak narcotic.|Hostile and aggressive. Once I said that I had previously been prescribed an opioid (tramadol),  his demeanor became truly bizarre. I don't know if he didn't review my history before seeing me or did know before and was pretending it was new information when I said it, but both options are incredibly concerning. He made me feel like I was a horrible person for seeking help and trying to understand the source of my pain. He also didn't review my MRI but made a point to tell my boyfriend that he didn't need to because  "the radiologist who reviewed it knew what they were doing". Also, concerning for a doctor to address the patients boyfriend instead his patient. I walked out because no matter how many times I told him I didn't want opioids, he was more dedicated to his perceived reality that I wanted opioids than listening to his patient. I'm glad he and his ego are not part of my medical care team.|I am only putting one star as I can not give an empty rating. This was the worst medical experience I have ever had in my 53 years. My husband was with me to witness it. Dr. Lam spent 5 minutes with us today after I had an MRI on Friday showing degenerative disc disease in my neck that was severe, according to the report. Dr. Lam did not explain the MRI to us but was curious why I had a spinal fusion surgery in my 30s. When I told him I had a disc rupture, he asked if that had caused pain. Do you know anyone who hasn't had pain from a disc rupture or who has an elective spinal fusion surgery?  Dr. Lam avoided eye contact with either my husband or I as I explained that I had been suffering with severe neck pain. As soon as I said that my doctor who had referred me to him for treatment had prescribed me 20 Tramadol to allow me to take one per day to sleep for four hours, he immediately stopped typing, which he had been doing for the entire 5 minutes we were with him. He asked if I wanted surgery. I am not a doctor, we were there to get expertise about what to do about my neck. I simply told him that we wanted a permanent solution to my neck pain. He then asked if I wanted narcotics, and I said that I wanted my pain to simply be managed until I could get whatever procedure I needed. Then, without explaining to us the results of my MRI, Dr. Lam showed my husband a list of sketchy doctors on his phone who "would prescribe opioids." My husband took a picture to document this. Dr. Lam then ended our appointment and said I had been referred to him in error by my doctor and he was canceling the appointment so I didn't have to pay for it. He was abrupt, rude, condescending and highly unprofessional. My husband noticed when we came home and looked up his reviews that other women had experiences similar to me. I don't know if he thought I was some kind of drug seeker, but he could not have been more wrong. The way he treated me and my husband was so unbelievable. I can't believe that he is part of the KU network of physicians. My doctor of 20 years sent me to him for expertise, and he didn't even bother to complete my appointment or look at my records and present me with any treatment options. I would highly recommend seeking your care elsewhere if you want to be treated like a human being.|Extreamly professional and caring Doctor. I can tell that his office is rather busy so our time is limited. I ensured I had everything together for my appointment. Gave my background, revieded the CT and MRI's. Then discussed what I wanted. Pain Relief with the ability to get off of pain meds. In my case a SCS would be the best and sadly last option. He explained everything very well and from there was handed back to a nurse. I have since had another appointment with Dr. Lam which was my trial surgery. I am extreammy please with the proposed solution, Dr. Lam and the entire medical team that I have worked with. Every call, and portal message has been promptly returned.|Dr.Lam helped both me and my wife at different times (nerve entrapment and lower back pain, respectively). Both of these problems required quite different solutions, but they were the correct call.

More than anything Dr.Lam and his staff really wanted to help and (actually) listened to us. In my experience this is quite novel...and most welcome.

For my wife, she had seen so many physicians/specialists who could not help her. I mean like 2+ years of so many. But Dr.Lam was able to correctly diagnose her on the first visit, and treat her on the second.  If we hadn't found him, it's not far fetched to say she might still be dealing with her debilitating side pain.

So yeah 5 out of 5, would recommend|Completely wasted my time. Didn't know what was wrong or how to treat it. Pain management limited to epidural. I'm not going to be bullied into shot's in my back. Nurse that did my vitals had the same complaints as me. If she doesn't trust were she works, why should I!? Filled out information packet. Get to page 6 and it's already been filled out by another patient. The wait was long!|Came in for a consult or possible epidural and a referral to a KU spine surgeon. Instead I was treated like I was looking for pain meds!!! Did not like his attitude or the way he treated me. Incredibly insulting!!  I have been in miserable pain for four years and was just seeking help not drugs!!!|You couldn't pay me to allow this dr to keep doing procedures that never brought me any relief.
When I spoke up and said this isn't helping me, he still wanted to schedule 6 more visits.
I mean he gets paid rather my pain is still the same or not. He didn't care that my pain came from cancer.

column40:
Dr. Ackerman is simply the best in his field! He not only has the knowledge to provide services to his patients they need, but he has the heart. Dr. Ackerman was able to find issues in my mother's knee that over doctors had missed. Thanks to him, we were able to resolve the issue quickly and come up with a plan to keep it from occurring in the future. He was truly an answer to prayers for my mother's health! She now feels so much better all thanks to his determination and compassion.

If you are looking for someone who cares and you want the best treatment possible, Dr. Ackerman is the one you are looking for! Whether it is for yourself or a loved one, he will treat you with the care, respect and expertise that you need to give you hope for the future with whatever pain issue you are experiencing. He cares about you getting the care you need when you need it, while other facilities will just book you out months upon months. Thank you, Dr. Ackerman! Our family truly appreciates you!|Dr. Ackerman is very rude and disrespectful. I, sought out his help for pain management after surgery. Joel, dismissed me and I received a letter from him stating he will no longer see me. I, do have a balance at his office. It can be sent to collections, makes no difference to me. My brother is a Pain Management Specialist and said that was not the way he would treat a patient. If I could give him a zero I would though I understand it makes no difference what I believe.|Dr. Ackerman is very patient and did my spinal cord stimulator implant.  But they didn't inform me that he is not in network with my insurance.  So an expected bill has arrived. Had 2 follow up visits and the lady at the front desk said "no charge" for follow up.  Got additional bill for 2 co pays of $25.00 each. Beware.|Referred to by my orthopedic doctor for pain management. Dr Ackerman is truly a fantastic doctor. I was scheduled for a epidural and was feeling very uneasy. He was very patient and explained everything thing that was going to happen. During the whole procedure he kept talking to be in insure I was doing good. I appreciate his professionalism, care and skill. He by far is a outstanding example of what a doctor is or should be. Kudos to him and his staff.|Our experience ten-years plus experience with Dr. Joel Ackerman and the entire practice at Midwest Pain Management Center Pain Management Associates has always been literally excellent by the front office, clinical staff, and Dr. Ackerman.  Specialists are not becoming harder and harder to find. I am so thankful for this practice and I very highly recommend Dr. Ackerman.  He is empathetic, takes time to listen and gives careful consideration to what patients say and feel. He really cares and is a leader in the pain management field.  I can't fathom anyone being less than extremely satisfied with Dr. Ackerman and this practice.|Dr. Ackerman has been with me the last 5 years treating me for 2 separate injuries! He has been so supportive and helpful on making sure my recovery has gone well with minimal pain. He has never given up on me when times were tough.|Dr. Ackerman is a very professional Pain Specialist while at the same time being a warm caring physician who goes beyond the call to make his patients feel as relaxed and comfortable as possible!
In my particular case the "caine" meds do not have as much effect as they do in others so he covers more area and waits longer before starting the procedures.
I cannot express the relief I feel by him going the extra mile!
I know the "review" is primarily about Dr. Akerman but feel it important to also speak about the Staff and Facility: It (facility) is always super clean and pleasant. The Staff are also great friendly caring folks who also do the extras (warm blanket, extra pillow, etc.) In short, or long in this case I'm grateful beyond expression to be a patient of Dr. Ackerman and Staff at Midwest Pain Management!|Went in for a nerve stimulator for my lower back, trial went great. Some pain but recovered within a few days. Just finished my placement surgery a week ago, pain from the surgery is gone and no sign of my original back pain. GREAT RESULTS. GREAT DOCTOR. I highly recommend Dr. Joel Ackerman.

column3:
At Patrick D Griffith, MD, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout North Kansas City and surrounding areas.

Our practice is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We offer a range of specialized interventional procedures including:

I have been trying since August to get back to Dr Griffith.  I had to cancerl because no transportiaion, dled and he cancelled because of his reason.  "They seheduled me again (six weeks) and then I had to cancel because of virust.  Rescgedued another six weeks.  I am in great pain and Now I cannot get in until the end of November. Griffith.  If you are in   such pain and you cannot wait until the end of November, what amI suspose to do?  I need help bad.|Dr. Griffith and his staff have treated me with the upmost respect and care. Everything was explained to me without anyone making me feel stupid. I had epidural in my neck for bulging disc and was in serious pain. Within in a day I had no pain in my neck at all. I am so grateful!|The staff was great from start to finish and Dr. Griffith is amazing! I had my first visit with him today. He showed great care and is easy to understand as well as talk to. Also, he was able to look at all of my records and tell me things that my other doctor never even mentioned! I look forward to going back and would definitely recommend him to others.|I've suffered from severe neck pain and migraines from an auto accident for along time. Seen so many different doctors most either wanting to do a major surgery or  put me on every med available . I just wanted relief from my horrible neck pain that was effecting my active way of life without being medicated and missing work for PT that never did anything but make it worse plus and the crippling migraines every week. Dr Griffith is absolutely wonderful. He listens, he is knowledgeable and most of all he cares for his patients. Him and his staff are amazing. I'm finally on the path to relief and being able to enjoy life again.|Dr. Patrick Griffith. Did a epidural in my back in which he hit the nerves worsening the damage to my back and then bullied me and wagged his finger in my face. I fired him and if you are smart you won't ever see him!!!!!|Dr. Griffith and his staff are excellent and nothing but the utmost professionals!  I have had approximately 12 epidural injections for recurring back pain.  I have heard that epidural injection are incredibly painful, but DR. Griffith is so good at what he does I actually looked forward to the injections to relieve my constant pain.|Dr. Griffith is amazing.  He did not treat me like a drug seeking addict.    He had me go to a class about living with pain that I found helpfull and started epidurals that were quit effective.
However after 6 mo of seeing Dr Griffith I was informed by a nurse that my medication would now be handled by his nurse practitioner,  Elien Keiser. That I would need to have appointments with her as well as the appointments I have Dr. Griffith but those appointments can not be on the same day.  None of this was told to me by my Dr.
My appointment with the nurse practitioner did not go well.  She was very judgmental and treated me like a drug seeking addict.  She talked down to me, she was rude and she made it quit clear she had an issue with me taking the medication I've been on for 15yrs while caring for children.  I assume this was an issue for her because she has a new baby,  but regardless I dont deserve to be treated like that, no one does.  When I was checking out her nurse noticed I was upset as there were tears streaming down my face.  I told the nurse that I would discuss my issue with the nurse practitioner with my Dr at my next appointment and that I did not appreciate being judge by someone who doesn't know me.   Next thing I know the nurse practitioner came up to me while I was checking out and informed me since I clearly didnt like her and had that I was being fired as a patient and to not come back.|I have been dealing with back pain for the past 18 months.  Dr. Griffith took the time to explain what was going on and what my OPTIONS were.  He did not force anything upon me and made the experience as comfortable as possible.  Great staff!
