column40:
Have been seeing Dr. Clinefelter for over 6 years. He has a wonderful personality and has helped my pain tremendously, considering the fact that my back is a total mess. I'm not pain free,but he has the pain to where it's 80% better than it was. He listens to what I have to say,then gives me a choice as to what I want to do. I can't believe how much better things are pain wise since I've been seeing him. You can't expect things to be instantly better. These things take time. You have to give the injections and treatment time to work.|Edited to add update... I eventually got a diagnosis thru a different team. 4 years of pain until finally getting answers. Clinefelter was WRONG. I didn't have to accept that there was no option & I had to learn to live with pain.

Original review:
Met with him once. Did the consultation in a treatment room instead of office so was charged a lot extra. It automatically coded me as an outpatient at the hospital. All he wanted to do was radio frequency ablation. Once I told him I already did that and it didn't work he was rude & said no one could help me. However, I was referred there for trigger point injections. He did not even exam me but sent me back to my doctor saying neither he nor I could find the points. Completely unethical to give false information back to the referring doctor. You will get bill from hospital $234 for him using their treatment room & he will charge you a separate bill for an additional $375 just to be turned away.|Dr. Clinefelter is rude and very opinionated.  He does not allow the patient to speak; he is interruptive.  It is his way or the highway.  He does not communicate with other doctors.  I would not recommend him to anyone.|Dr clinefelter is a great pain management doctor, very kind and understanding doctor. The first shot I received went well, got a little shaky from the steroid shot, minimal pain. It only helped me for about a week to week and a half. So I was very optimistic going into the office for 2nd shot. I did both with sedation. Got the 2nd shot on a Tuesday afternoon. Going into that night had a pain by shoulder blade on left side that moved up left side of neck and down left arm to hand by Wednesday day. I had taken day off work, iced it, relaxed during day by Wednesday night I was in alot of pain. My mom took me to er, was diagnosed with besides neck, shoulder and arm pain, SVT.  First time diagnosis which could also cause some of left side pain. Here it is Saturday morning and have no explanation on SVT diagnosis and left neck shoulder and arm pain still present. With that said I have no idea if I just had a bad reaction to something from the cervical epidural at c7 t1 or it was just totally unrelated since the first one went well. NOW with all this said Dr clinefelter and i basically had same plan, no more shots, which is unfortunate because after the first one I had such hope to hopefully be painfree for awhile that i haven't had for so long. I stand by my opening statements that Dr clinefelter is a wonderful pain management doctor and would refer all that asked. I do not put any of the blame on hospital blame on him or the procedure that he did. As we don't have explanation for any of it anyways.I just wanted to let him know that if he ever see this. First pain management doctor that explained it, took questions, and listened to patient that I have ever went to. So in closing even though my last experience after appointment didn't go as planned. (Whether it was caused there or not) I would highly recommend this doctor and pain clinic and I understand the deciding not to do 3rd and agree. Just wanted to say I hold nothing against him nor clinic and I do not believe it was caused there just a coincidence that it happened in same timeframe. Thank you for time and service
ENRIQUE|He was terrible. When I saw him all he wanted to do was treat my back pain with very expensive shots. I tried one and it did nothing for me. He wrote me a narcotic script and told me not to come back.|Great doctor! Cares about his patients and how they feel. He wants you to be pain free.|Have you ever had a doctor call you back when you had to cancel an appointment to see if you were OK?  well, he did.  Fantastic personal relationship.  Very professional.|Excellent Dr. He's very quick with procedures and he's very personal. This had been the best relief I've had si ce he's done my ablation.

column3:
Internationally Trained Pain Management Specialist

At Ascentist, Dr. Mauricio Garcia brings world-class expertise in interventional pain management to patients throughout the Kansas City area. We are proud to have a physician trained at the nation's premier pain management program under renowned specialists Doctors Prithvi Raj and Gabor Racz. Dr. Garcia completed his anesthesiology training at the prestigious Texas Heart Institute in Houston and the Clinica Universitaria in Barcelona, Spain, following his medical education at The University Autonomous of Nuevo Leon in Monterrey, Mexico.

Our practice specializes in minimally invasive procedures for back and neck pain, including:

  • Vertebroplasty

  • Kyphoplasty

  • Nucleoplasty

  • Comprehensive pain management solutions

Born in Los Angeles, California, Dr. Garcia offers the unique advantage of being fluent in English, Spanish, and Italian, allowing us to serve a diverse patient population. For exceptional pain management care from a physician with international training and specialized expertise, visit us at Dr. Mauricio Garcia at Ascentist or call +1 913-491-3999. Our office is conveniently located at 4820 College Blvd, Overland Park, KS 66211.
column11: Dr. Garcia received training in interventional pain management at the nation's premier pain management program under the tutelage of renowned pain management specialists Doctors Prithvi Raj and Gabor Racz. Dr. Garcia trained in anesthesiology at the world famous Texas Heart Institute in Houston and at the Clinica Universitaria in Barcelona, Spain. Born in Los Angeles, California, he received his medical degree at The University Autonomous of Nuevo Leon in Monterrey, Mexico. Dr. Garcia has a special interest in minimally invasive procedures for back and neck pain including vertebroplasty, kyphoplasty, and nucleoplasty. Dr. Garcia is fluent in English, Spanish and Italian.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr Garcia for approximately since 2008 and he has forced injections and attempted to make me have surgery for my shoulders and I informed him about my neck having myopathy and then after I had surgery by a world class surgeon he insisted that I recieve injections or he was going to cut my pain meds off . He reduced my meds now I suffer because of it . Others refused surgery and injections and he dropped service to them . I continued because of needing pain meds , I see that ascentist dropped him but I think he needs to talk with a lawyer for unethical practices and violations of Dr's oath for talking against other surgeon because he didn't get a payback|I was referred to Dr. Mauricio Garcia because I have chronic pain. I have severe arthritis and need pain meds for it just to be able to walk thru grocery store and live a fairly normal life. I went to see him and he had a very arrogant attitude toward me. Said he would not prescribe me anything and suggested injections for pain. Here's the reason I feel Dr. Garcia is horrible. I told him in advance that both of my knees have been replaced  and also my right hip is a replacement. This Dr. and his so called female assistant were just downright RUDE!! Never trust this Dr. Nor his staff!!!! They treated me very badly. Did not even touch my joints to evaluate, and suggested injections. I had already told him both knees and my right hip were replaced and injections DO NOT WORK ON REPLACEMENT PARTS! Do not trust this Dr.!!He is judgmental and clueless about pain!!!|My mom came here after being referred. She left extremely upset because of this doctor who treated her with no compassion. She felt like the nurse and the doctor teamed up against her. Instead of listening or even caring about her or her health she felt judged as if she were out looking for drugs rather than looking for solutions to her health problems. Dr Garcia is a trash doctor. Go elsewhere if you wanted to be treated like an actual human being.|Dr Garcia  has been my pain doctor for over 20 years. He has had to draw blood from  my neck without anesthesia when no other veins were available.
Sure we have had disagreements about medication dosages when he has had to make the federal reductions according to their guidelines,
But I trust him hands down to handle any and all of my surgical procedures, they have been many.
I have  had 7 back procedures and quite a few neural blocks over the years among other things and nothing has ever gone wrong as long as I am in Dr Garcia's care.|I see this doctor has 5 stars. I wish I could have met that man. I had received a prescription at the beginning of the month on paper and my son accidentally threw it away. I was reminded of policy that they will not give another one, no matter what. So I saved what little I had and made them last until I could be seen again. I was given an appointment with Dr. Garcia. First thing he does is pointedly look me up and down. I'm overweight and used to this look and unfortunately, knew how this appointment was going to go and Dr Garcia did not disappoint in that respect. He asked me why I was there and I answered that I was there to have my medication refilled. I then got a lecture about how they are not there to just provide me with pain medication because I want it. My jaw hit the floor and I told him I didn't understand what was going on. He I had answered his question wrong. I told him if you wanted to know why I come to the Headache and Pain Center he could have asked that instead of phrasing the question to seem like he was asking me why I was there that day. It went down hill from there. The man berated me and talked down to me until I started crying, at which point he walked out. A nurse then came I was on the phone with my husband telling him what had happened and she heard about the thrown away prescription. I saw her checking something on the computer as if to verify that I had not filled my previous prescription. Then I had to do a drug test. Then he informed me that my MRI of my back was not in their records. This is the second one they have lost now. He also said that my X-ray was from 2015 and he's not sure what my regular hpc doctor was doing. He said I needed a new MRI (not an easy feat) of my back and new X-rays of my neck before he would give me a new script. Actually that's what he meant as he just kept popping in saying something and popping back out. I walked out saying I wasn't sure what had just happened and I was cussing to myself. I went to the front desk and asked to not only file a complaint against Dr Garcia  but my usual doctor who had threatened me twice on my last visit so I would do what he wanted me to. Dr Garcia's nurse came out front, saw what I was doing and went and got him. He came out, accused me of calling him a name and when I said I didn't he looked at his nurse who said 'You were cussing' at which point I told them that cussing to myself did not equate to calling him a name. I also said that I was no longer interested in talking to him and when he wouldn't stop talking to me so I could see about filing the complaint, I raised my voice and said IM NOT TALKING TO YOU. He then told me I was banned from their practice and if I didn't leave he would call the police. So effectively he prevented me from filing a complaint by instigating an argument with me so he could kick me out. No one should be treated this way and I should have kept my cool, but I had been kept waiting an hour and a half just to be berated. I hope anyone else who sees him has a better experience. I just know I'm tired of being treated by these people as a drug seeker when I've done everything they've asked and I don't come in looking like a drug addict like some of their patients. I'm currently looking into filing a complaint with the state medical board because there was no reason for this man to have such animosity towards me when this was the first time he's ever seen me.|I have had 11 spinal phushions and Dr Garcia had to step in and help me out and He saved my life .Thank you for your help Dr.Garcia need to see you here in mo|Doctor Garcia he's very smart&good at what he does.  He's done allot for me and my care I do appreciate everything he has&still doing for me......|Worse doctor n nurses in the field. They should all have their license taken away from them

He also resolves my pain as quickly as possible. I have had multiple procedures with him and all of them have improved my quality of life. He is a great doctor and all around good guy.|My family has used Dr. Scowcroft for over 20 years. We've always received excellent care from this practice. He allows us to advocate for ourselves, and listens patiently.|He did the wrong procedure on me.
My personal experience with Dr. Scowcroft at the KC Pain Clinic was very upsetting. I was referred to Dr. Scowcroft from my orthopedic Doctor for hip issues. The order was for a certain hip steroid injection. Dr. Scowcroft did not follow the orders and injected the steroid into the incorrect part of my hip. My second issue was with Dr. Scowcroft's bedside manner. I was first scheduled to have a consult with him prior to the procedure. The visit lasted no longer than 3 minutes, I felt that he did not listen to any of my concerns, he interrupted me multiple times, and he finished the visit when he left the room while I was mid-sentence. On the day of the injection, I was very nervous and all the nurses and other staff were very kind and comforting. Dr. Scowcroft came in the room, didn't even say hello, did the injection, and walked out of the room. He never even asked for any identification from me. He didn't say a word in that procedure room. As I said before, the nursing and lab techs were all very kind to me. I solely had a problem with Dr. Scowcroft. While I am upset about the lack of bedside manner, that wasn't enough for me to write a bad review. But once I found out that he did the wrong procedure I was furious. I have dealt with my hip problems for over a year now, and as many know it is a slow process getting healthcare, that's simply how it is. But Dr. Scowcroft's mistake has set me back in my recovery. This is medical malpractice and should not go unnoticed.|Dr. Scowcroft has excellent bedside manner. Listens very well, answered all my questions/concerns BEFORE any sort of treatments, plus a dry sense of humor like myself.  I highly recommend Dr. Scowcroft and the KC Pain Center.|My experience was good. Not real sure about the lady at the front desk on the exam side. She seemed a little "snarky" most of the time. On the clinical side, the staff were all great.

column3:
At Prairie Star Functional Health, we specialize in providing advanced solutions for those suffering from debilitating conditions that traditional medicine often struggles to address effectively.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our medical team focuses on treating a wide range of chronic and severe conditions including:

  • Peripheral neuropathy

  • Chronic knee, back, and neck pain

  • Nerve-related disorders

  • Bulging discs and spinal issues

We understand that many of our patients have spent years trying conventional treatments—from pain medications and injections to considering invasive surgical procedures—all without finding lasting relief. This ongoing search for comfort can take a significant toll both physically and emotionally. At Prairie Star Functional Health, we utilize the most advanced, well-researched treatment methods available, creating personalized care plans tailored to each individual's specific condition. Our approach focuses on addressing the root causes of discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. Located in Shawnee, KS, our dedicated team is committed to helping you reclaim your quality of life and find the relief you deserve.
column11:
Functional Health Institute focuses on the treatment of chronic and severe conditions such as peripheral neuropathy, chronic knee, back, and neck pain, and a wide range of other nerve-related problems. We use the most advanced and well-researched treatment methods, all personalized to each individual patient's discomfort.

Many people suffer for years trying a variety of more traditional approaches to treatment including attempting to mask discomfort with drugs or injections to more aggressive surgical options. This search for solutions can take a toll on a person's outlook on life, both physically and emotionally.

WE UNDERSTAND, AND WE CAN HELP RELIEVE YOUR DISCOMFORT!

column40:
I was treated for my bulging disc 6 months ago and my pain is still there.
I paid 5,000 for my treatments which was money I just threw away. I received broken promises and false information. They both told me they could help me, after my treatments my pain still there. I asked should I receive more and Mr Kingsbury stated yes I can receive more with additional cost. I feel they just snowball me knowing I would sign anything to help get relief of my pain. It was all about the money not at caring about my pain. THEY ARE SCAMMERS DO NOT GO TO THIS PRACTICE. I thought I finally found a doctor that can help me with my pain but instead I'm out of $5,000, such a big disappointment. Lying to people to get ahead will catch up with them.|At first I was a little skeptical of going to another pain center. My worries we're put at ease after my third of twenty visit. My knees, feet, and ankles pains were gradually starting to take a turn for the better. The equipment that was utilized was the state of the art.  The staff was excellent in their skill sets. Dr. Kingsbury, Shirley, and Ryan were heaven sent.  Without a doubt I would recommend anyone in pain to give Prairie Star Functional Health Center a try.|I have had positive results with the equipment used on me. I have 2 bulging disc and there decompression machine has worked wonders on me. The Doctor's and staff are excellent to be with. I would really recommend anyone who has any back, neck, shoulder, knees or feet pain to check this place out before going anywhere else.|I had such hope for this "new and advanced" treatment for my peripheral neuropathy. There were red flags when I returned after my initial consultation back in July 2020. I was told it would cost $1,200 for the at home treatment (that almost just as effective as in-clinic), but when i returned to "discuss" moving forward the price was changed to $3,900 due to a "miscommunication". After realizing the mistake was theirs, they dropped it to $2,900. My test results weren't revealed to me and they just wanted to move ahead with payment. In hopes that finally I had found someone to help, I went ahead against my better judgment. Appointments were never consistent, no one ever told me about any progress that was being made, and here I am 8 months later, $3,000+less, and still in the same physical condition as when I first responded to the TV ad. Do not waste your time and money!! Oh, and in this time, I've only seen Dr. Kingsbury in person...TWICE!!|I have suffered from a chronic headache for 18 months due to a ruptured disc in my back and several bulging discs.
After 6 weeks of treatment and decompression I can say that the constant headaches are gone!
With the continued treatment plan I am hoping to avoid back surgery altogether. I was willing to try anything and am so glad I did!!
Dr Kingsbury and the staff have taken time to listen to my concerns and helped me greatly.|i am so happy that i  and my husband attended a seminar with dr. kinsbury. i have been dealing with terrible hip pain due to my bursae andd also burning feet pain due to small nerve neuropothy. since both me and my husband has been receiving treatment i cannot tell you the relief i have experienced. i have no hip pain and my burning feet has sudsided. as for the staff they are great. so personable. dr. kinsbury  is great.|My neck pain was causing issues in my everyday life. I was unable to sleep through the night, and working long hours was a difficult task! I wanted to take road trips or fly on an airplane which was not an option, unless I wanted to be medicated with pain pills the whole ride. After my therapy treatments at Prairie Star Functional Health Center I am able to live my life to it's fullest! Thank you Dr. Robyn, Dr. Kingsbury, and the wonderful staff for giving me my life back! I cannot thank you enough!|They have great personalities and great community service . Ana and Shirley knows everyone by name walking in and out . They are very professional and helpful if needed . They are very concerned about the patients healing process . I would recommend this place of business to anyone. The Dr's are very great as well . They took care of my mother and treated her as if she was their mother . Thumbs up to everyone there .

column40:
Dr. Jones, has been very helpful in helping me figure out a game plan for managing my back pain for quality of life. Helpful in getting insurance to file appropriate things. Very helpful in describing the process and timeline of events. I have had past pain management places just treat me as an ATM. I love the staff at North Kansas City Hospital as well.|I've never been treated so meanly by any doctor. He had me in tears within minutes. Initially I had been referred for shoulder pain. But within the 3 month wait to get into pain management, my rheumatologist recommended some stretches and my shoulder was feeling better. I have chronic back/neck pain from a MVA 5 years earlier. It had gotten much worse over the past year and I wanted to discuss that. He continually cut me off when I was trying to explain. I told him that I had crushed 3 vertebrae in my thoracic region. He asked what they did for my back and I said they weren't able to do anything. He laughed and said it must not have been that bad if they didn't do anything. I told him I was in a body shell for three months. Oh, he says. He just kept saying I was referred for shoulder pain and if that's better then he didn't know what he could do for me. I asked if this was a shoulder pain clinic or a general pain clinic.
I had him in the room maybe 4-5 minutes. When he first came in, a nurse opened the door and said something to him. About 5 minutes into my appointment, while he was being mean to me, a nurse opened the door again. I was in mid sentence and he said I have a procedure and out the door he walked. Mind you... I didn't get back into a room until 50 minutes after my appointment time. He came in an hour after my scheduled appointment time. I picked up my purse and left. This man should not have a license to practice medicine. He was wicked mean and I was nothing but patient and kind.|Since 2013 I have trusted Dr. Dwayne Jones as my pain management professional for my service-connected lower back pain.  He has been excellent at communicating with me and developing my treatment plan. The results I have seen from his treatment have been outstanding.  I liked his efficiency in time management and dedication to treatment. His demeaner led me to relax during the procedure instilling confidence in in his capabilities.  He advocated on my behalf through Veterans Affairs (VA) to approve a procedure which allowed me to receive the most optimal pain management plan available.  These procedures have allowed me to maintain my standard of living. With out his treatment my condition would have impacted my job which requires oversea travel, ability to enjoy social events such as sporting events, and outdoor activities with my family.  Dr. Jones has been able to manage my pain, allowing me to improve my mobility, flexibility, and activity level.  I would recommend and continue to see Dr. Jones, and his team, for any future pain management.|I have been going to Dr. Jones for a good many years.  He has handled pain in my back and both SI Joints.  He is professional and did a wonderful job taking care of the pain I experienced and did it all with no discomfort.  I tell the people in my community that he is excellent and personable.  I highly recommend him.|I was told by Dr. Jones that a back brace that I needed would be covered 100% by insurance. It was ordered back in September and approved by my insurance in September. Yeah they didn't send a bill into insurance until after the first of the year causing me to owe almost $600 for a back brace, I've called Dr. Jones's office. They tried to blame it on the person who ordered the back brace and gave me his phone number and told me that I needed to call him and tell him to correct the air with the insurance company called him several times and never got a callback once. I called North Kansas City Hospital. Patient advocacy department  They gave me two peoples names and phone numbers to call that could help me. I called numerous times never got a callback from either person. Looks like now I'm gonna have to get my attorney involved to keep from getting turned into collections over something that should've been taken care of  by Dr. Jones and his staff continue.
David Taylor|Dr. Jones did a trial Spinal Cord Stimulation on me and it went very smooth. The results were that my back pain was decreased by about 70%. He is going to recommend another surgeon to do the permanent insertion. I would recommend Dr. Jones for this procedure.|I was seen by Dr. Dwayne Jones on 5-4-2022. Never have I ever been treated so badly by Dr. Jones! He called me a liar. That I was seeking drugs. He told me he was going to call my surgeon and tell him I was uncooperative. He while I was crying was laughing.
He was extremely verbally abusive! I left in way more pain than I was when I got there. The staff could hear what was happening. They were very kind and helped me with a wheelchair so I could leave.|Thanks to Father God, Dr. Dwayne E Jones and his wonderful staff I am getting my life back. In precious Jesus name Amen 
I am now 99% pain free. I highly recommend him %.

column40:
Dr. Burfeind is an amazing doctor who sits and listens to your issues and makes the best decisions based on the treatment plan she has set in place. Her nurses are warm and friendly. During the several injections I had, the nurses are quick to hold your hand and settle you down. I will not see another doctor for pain. I've been to another doctor who rushed through everything and had no compassion for your problems. I'm very happy and trust Dr. Burfeind.|When my husband was seeing her, no one notified us that she was moving her practice. It took over 2 months of leaving messages for someone to tell me the office is completely gone from NKC Hospital & they no longer take our insurance. I thought she would have changed from when I was a patient. She was rushed when I was a patient. She threw her hands up when the injections were not helping. No talking about what the next step would be for me.|On behalf of my husband who has been seen and treated by Dr. Burfeind several times over the past 6 months, we are so grateful to this facility and team.  In short, my husband is a mess after an automobile accident where he was not at fault.  The nurses are super friendly and personable.  The care he's received has been very thoughtful and thorough with attention to all of our concerns.  These people work SO hard and have a difficult job of dealing with people who are coming to them for conditions which may or may not have positive results. They have done everything possible to get some pain relief for my husband and have consistently adjusted the plan of care based on his reactions each time they try something.  Some of his treatments worked better than others, but, that is the nature of human body and the science of pain management.  They keep trying their best with their state of the art resources.
I have read some of the reviews posted that are contrary to our experience and hope that those people's viewpoints won't steer anyone away from seeing this doctor or team.  I feel that we get out of the world what we poor into the world and we are sending out positive vibes, thankfulness and gratitude for Dr. Burfeind and the NKCH Pain Management Clinic.|I have been under Dr Burfeind's care multiple times.  She has always been very kind and always ensures I know exactly what she is doing, and what to expect.  She is very good at talking through each process as it is happening.  She has so much compassion for her patients and it is very much appreciated.|Was not taken serious, already made up her mind about my medical condition without any further testing. Her nurse was extremely rude. She canceled my appointment for injections and follow up saying my insurance didn't cover the procedure. She had the wrong insurance. Told me to just take 4000mg of Tylenol a day. No thanks, don't want to be on the liver transplant list. My PCP sent me there to manage my pain and she told me to go back to my PCP. Waste of time and money. Will never go back!!!!!!|I was referred to Dr. Burfiend by my primary care doctor. She started out nice and seemed knowledgeable about my condition, however as time has went on, she has become more and more rude, and so Is the nurse staff she uses! She is always rushing me through my visits, she's quick to dismiss me and my concerns. She acts like you're just another patient not a person. Overall, I have decided to leave her office and find another specialist, because I no longer trust dr.  burfiend, good doctor awful person!!!!!!!|I have seen Dr.Butfeind twice now and felt like both time my issues are not being taken serious. Both times I had advised her of the same issue and what helped and didn't help and she didn't seem to care or want to listen to what medication helped, just wanted to put me on medication that I did not want to be on.  She pretty much walked out of my last appointment before I was done asking questions and did not resolve any of my issues I went in for. I will not be returning|Dr. Burfeind attempted to treat my father for chronic lower back pain. She failed in every way. Mostly by the way she treated him. From the first day she saw him she talked down to him and showed no compassion for his situation. She treated him like a convicted criminal and was more worried about her self than considering his condition. My father was 82 and mentally full of life. All he asked was help with being able to walk and stand without excruciating pain that would put him back down. He knew he would never be pain free. He just wanted to enjoy what time he had left with us. She could have cared less.

column11: Chronic pain can affect every aspect of your life. But you don't have to live in agony. At University Health, our pain specialists will help you find relief. column38: Patty Gabel|Kathy Cockrum|Mary Music|Medusa|Sylvia Raines|Mays Hilmi|Crystal Morales|Tracy Johnson
column40:
I had to have lens replacement and retina repair in my right eye. My wait in the lobby wasn't even 5 minutes. I was taken back to surgery prep where I was made as comfortable as possible. I had to be awake for the surgery due to my heart issues which meant I had to lay flat on my back for 2 1/2 hours but was given several pillows for under my knees to help alleviate my back pain.  During surgery my back started to feel like it was on fire but my doctor was prepared with an IV pain shot. It didn't put me out but helped with my pain. My doctor talked to me throughout the whole surgery to let me know what she was doing. Before I knew it the surgery was done. I was able to go right home since I had no anesthesia. I was given instructions and 2 eye drops.|I sat in the lobby for one hour with No communication from staff. Once I finally got back into the room I sat in there for another 40 minutes. At which time they told me I would have to wait another 6 weeks. For the scheduled injection.
When I inquired about the long wait time I was told we are a very busy clinic.
If I showed up to my appointment 1hour and 40 minutes late they would not have seen.  Clearly, they feel their time is more valuable than mine|University Health Pain Management, 2101 Charlotte Street, 4th Floor, Suite 400 was an elementary business lesson, concerning how one poor employee, can shadow an entire office's professional presentation... Not to mention, garnering (yet, another) negative review, consisting of the cosmic dust, from a single star...

The  (UH Building 2) office unit, appears to be an auxillary " medical services" corporation, which provides an insurance-driven, conveyor belt of appointments, X-rays, trigger point miracles, prescriptions, and other pain relieving goodies, for the afflicted....

Everything was routine: introduction of a new patient, submittals of paperwork, the "does it hurt, here" questions, prescription suggestions, and the availability, of future appointments....

In short, the staff was....o.k.The building, not difficult to find and a "not-too-painful," Pain Management visit..

The front desk was peopled, with the usual cast of characters, who were grappeling, with another dull Wednesday---while planning, for their next cruise...

Ah, but the back desk----circular pen, for the appointment-makers... A sullen young woman, with 'more-than-enough" braids, found my few questions, to be noxious----not to mention, the request for a single page, of paperwork to be copied.... This was due, to the medical transportation contact number, which was printed at the bottom...

The young woman stared, rolled her eyes, made a barely detectable "sheesh," sound, and was (considering her general office position) laughably condescending....

On the way out the door, go the the receptionist's, desk-----preferably, while they are in the phone, ignoring you... This is not wasted time, because behind the two preoccupied women, is a large color-coded, dry erase board, FULL of affirmative plaudits... Talk about the delicious irony, of the positively clueless, modern office personnel....

The board is emblazed with drivel, such as: "Be your own kind of beautiful," and cookie-cutter blatter, concerning goals, character development, being non-judgemental, and other "really-hard" self-improvement....The board's cheery positivity, is the exact polar-opposite, of the back unit's sneering appointment maker....

In spite, of everything, not too bad.... Everything was accomplished, and the staff is a director's hoot....!!! Just prepare yourself, to jump on the medical corporation  treadmill, and take a number.....|I have had 6 spinal fusions. I have lost 100 lbs and eating right. Everything  I need to do. This place does nothing but tell you your pain is here to stay and try to give you shots in your back . column40:
Every since I came to Dr. Misasi he has had a can-do attitude and a smile on his face. I've had plenty of doctors in my time that made me feel I was nothing but a number but when it comes to Dr. Misasi he has always made me feel like he actually gives a damn. There are a lot of doctors out there who do it just for the money but after spending a little time with Dr. Misasi you can tell he has a passion for what he does. So if you're looking for a doctor who cares about your problem and not your money someone who will be honest and straightforward look no further and you have found your doctor|I have a intrathecal pain pump. My pain Dr moved and set me up with this quack. He said from day one he would not do anything except fill pump. He made it very clear  Well he decided I was lying to him and getting pain med from my primary care Dr. I told him I didn't and he called me a liar more than once and dropped me cold turkey. If you have ever been through withdrawals you know what I mean. I'm thinking of getting an attorney for the hell he put me through. He called the other pain clinics, the pharmacy and my primary care Dr. He made sure no one else will see me. Yep. Time to v*attorney|I started out very apprehensive about Dr. Misasi but Dr. Sorrel recommended I see him so I went.  At first I was not happy but just approached him with my doubts and concerns and he was more than informative and took the time with me to explain and talk about what to expect.  The day of the procedure, it was way more intense than an experience with a different doctor and he told me step by step what was going to be done and then several times during procedure ask me if I was doing okay.  Today at follow up he was again very supportive and took the time to talk about what was to come.  I even made him laugh a couple of times.  I am much more comfortable going into the next 2 procedures.   I think it made a difference that I just directed my concerns to him and told him I was uncomfortable so that he know exactly what was going on mentally as well as physically with me.  He is human and not a mind reader .  I appreciate his focus on what he is doing.|This Dr here denied my Referral because I have a nerve stimulator!!
So what do I do for the rest of my pain from a broken back and fibromyalgia??
This Doctor didn't even give me a chance!!
All I wanted was to learn ways to get out of pain, maybe foods to eat and not eat!!
I know there's ways to do this!!
So thanks Doc, I appreciate your help!! Your receptionist didn't even call me to say that you denied my referral!!
Have a great one Doc|

column40:
I had been treated poorly at another orthopedic center, and actually saw this place while driving on the highway. I went to the website and reached what could be done, and every experience has been pleasant. From my first call to set up an apt to my surgery. My case was a bit difficult, we knew surgery would be the end results. When submitted to insurance I was denied for the surgery, so Whitaker met with me and explained how they would go about submitting an appeal. My case was denied all three times by insurance. I was so worried that they would give up, however his Assistant Missy was in constant contact with me. And they were trying every way to think of getting my surgery approved since you could clearly see on the scans I needed help. We decided to start over my case, since I had been seeing other doctors in the process the first time. We were then able to get my surgery approved, and the team walked with me through all of it. I could hear them discussing ways to try and reduce the pain in the mean time. The way everything was explained and taught to me was amazing, I never once felt inadequate like I had at other offices. He took time to explain what my body was doing so I could understand, and he explained how the surgery would go so I would be at ease the whole time. I would highly recommend and encourage people to come see this practice for any needs necessary.|Best practice ever! Staff is caring and made sure they cared not only for my knee, but me. When I went to surgery with PTSD they created that! The OR staff made sure I had the meds and support I needed. They cracked jokes and comforted me when I was being put out. A few weeks post op when I came in for papers and they saw me limping the nurse saw me on the spot, and got the Dr where they did x rays and supported me. Call backs were quick and staff always took time to see how I was doing, and not just for my knee, but now I was doing overall. Would highly recommend. And Dr Bruner has the best surgical skills I've ever seen! Two failed surgeries and with this one im back to normal! And his PA is amazing to! I love everyone here and would go back in a heartbeat and recommend everyone I know. Heck already have as a nurse.|I was told I couldn't get my appointment until I paid a 200$ bill, which is just crazy, I've never been turned down from anywhere because of a bill.|This place is absolutely amazing! They patiently answered everything I asked while reassuring my family and I about the procedure. I honestly couldn't have asked for more. Thank you so much!|I am so happy that I got to experience a Joint & Spine Specialist where nurses and doctors put their patients first! I had carpal tunnel surgery done on my right hand and I am so so thankful that Dr. Kellis Bulleigh did a fantastic and quick surgery, along with being surrounded by the nurses and P.A.-C Bryana Manley communicating with me and being so friendly throughout the whole process! You guys are amazing  Thanks for all of your help and support and smiles and great laughs!|I highly recommend Dr. Camden Whitaker as well as the other Doctors with KS JOINT AND SPINE.  From the ladies at the front desk, medical assistant and Dr. Whitaker himself were all very pleasant, knowledgeable and did not act bothered one bit if I asked a question. At our pain management practice in Galena, KS, Dr. Eugerie A. Hanley specializes in comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a range of advanced interventional procedures including:

  • Spinal steroid injections for back and neck pain

  • Customized medication management plans

column38: Danny Spruce|PAULETTE VANTREASE|Keisha Merritt|Dorothy McCormick|Becky G|Connie Belcher|JK Wright
column40:
Dr. Hanley treated me horribly. She made me wait for 2 months before scheduling me for my spinal injections. This is continuing care and they have been doing these to avoid surgery at this time. After I arrived to what I was told was going to be my injection I have been waiting every minute to get because of the pain I was told by Dr. Hanley that they never received my paperwork from the VA and could not do it. I was extremely upset knowing she was lying to me. I tried to make an appointment 2 months prior but was told the Dr. couldn't even make me an appointment without a current referral. Mine had expired and the VA said they would send a current one. I told them one was on the way and if we could schedule it now so I don't miss any openings. She again said no they had to have the paperwork to ensure they get paid first. I personally seen it was done and they called me to make an appointment. Unfortunately it was for 2 months later and I was already in terrible pain. When I was seen it was not for my injections and nothing had changed with what I needed. She was short with me and told me again she would not do anything without the paperwork from the VA knowing she had it or she wouldn't be seeing me at this time. I told her I was going straight to the VA and see what the problem was. I went to the VA and set down and went over everything with a nurse. As I expected they were sent the paperwork 2 months prior. My nurse tried to call and it went to voicemail. My care provider then called to find out the problem and the office was on a half day and she was filling in. They did gave her look to see if they had the paperwork and she said it was definitely their and had been for months. Why she lied to me I have no idea? They knew I have been in horrible pain and could hardly stand because of the pain. This is not how a "pain management" company should behave. This is keeping me in severe pain every minute of my life. I had been waiting on this anticipating some type of relief every day and she could have cared less. The hospital sent me a review and I explained what happened and the next thing I hear back is they don't want me there anymore. This is horrible way to treat a person that has waited on you for so long and now I have no idea when I will see any relief. I haven't been able to work and had to hire someone to do my daily chores to help my wife around the farm. I will be filing a complaint the the Missouri Board of Healing Arts and contacting legal council to see what I can do. This is not how our medical Dr's should treat patients and especially when in severe pain with them as the only help. This is substandard medical treatment and I will be using all the social media platforms to expose her and what she did to me. I hope she tries to make excuses and lie some more, I recorded the entire visit once I seen how it was going. The recording will be on social media for everyone to hear her lies. She shouldn't be able to practice medicine when she has the power to do this to people. This is the worse medical treatment I have ever receives. Hope she is happy with what she did to me and had a good 1/2 day and long weekend. I am still in terrible pain and it could have been avoided. There will be consequences for her actions on this as I will not let it go until she understands it is not OK to do this. They treat veterans like they are expendable and our feelings don't matter. Horrible person.|When I met Dr. Hanley I was on large does of strong pain medication, muscle relaxers and nerve pain meds. She helped me to realize they were doing more harm than good. I got off all meds and we discussed steroid injections. This heightened my ptsd and anxiety due to past experiences with these procedures. She offered sedation due to this and changed my life. I will forever be grateful for what she has done for me.|Horrible, life changing experience with Dr Hanley. She's very disconnected and doesn't listen to patients. A simple procedure landed us in the hospital for 29 days and she wouldn't even return a phone call to help us navigate and a week later she left her office in Arkansas abruptly with zero follow up. I never write reviews but feel morally obligated to warn others. She's grossly negligent. Horrible physician.|My Husband suffers from Trigeminal Neuralgia, a very painful nerve disorder.  Dr. Hanley has helped him become pain free through treatment and medication.  She understands the condition, and we are grateful to have found her.|Dr Hanley was kind and seemed to care and want to help.
It ended up being a waste of time, money and more pain with a botched injection and emergency blood patch...
Choose a larger city, it will save the agony.
My experience and opinion only.
About 2 years of care, give or take.|I have complete faith in Dr. Hanley! She has been giving me injections for my back for about 2 years. When they quit working she already has a plan!|

I was very impressed with the process of starting my chronic pain management. After my outpatient appointment and that first week post treatment. I feel a bit better. I still have a long way to go to. Also get physical therapy going. But genuinely I feel my pain is a lot easier managed and I don't feel horrible. Always read post care paper they give you it'll let you know what to expect and what to do. As well as any side effects you might need to know. Their team is very sweet.|Melanie NP is one of the best. She is very knowledgeable with my care and  takes time to listen to my complaints. I definitely would recommend Melanie. The staff is awesome, super nice and helpful.|Maddie did a great job of helping. Thorough, asking important questions. Giving me important information. Warm and friendly. I felt completely comfortable in the conversation. Everything went well.|Been with Commonwealth for years and I've been to several of their locations.  The Etown staff is the BEST by miles. I really love this office.  Glad I moved out of Louisville as this will be my specialist till the end. That's no time soon so I'm glad I have a wonderful team looking out for me.|The Nerve stimulator Trial worked great.  Less pain in a long time.
The trial implant should have been left in until permanent implant could be done.
I  am left with severe pain after experiencing some relief.  Waiting, while I know there is relief, I consider it unnecessary torture.|Will sign in , short waiting room time , friendly staff , vitals and checkup , provider was and is always very personal and professional, checkout with scheduling always awesome !!
1 small issue , the small area where you wait to check out is right where a door is if you stand where you can be seen you risk the door opening , if you stand clear , they don't know you are there .... Maybe a mirror or camera so they can see you and not be in the door zone ?? Next time I'll take a photo to show you but I believe if you are familiar with the office you understand.|The staff in the Elizabethtown office are serious about taking care of their patients. When I arrive for my procedure, they quickly get me checked in, called back and prepared. The doctors are all business and are on their "A" game when you are brought into the procedure suite. The nurses that watch over you in recovery are the best and nicest, making sure that you recover well from anesthesia and are escorted to your vehicle kindly.
These people care from the beginning to the end of your procedure and I appreciate it.|Epidural failed. They've got every excuse ready to tell you why. Do you think the doc's gonna talk to you? Or are you shunted to mean people paid to make excuses for him and keep the patients in their place?

They had a staffing problem. Pushed my appointment two weeks to the right. Day of the new appointment, they pushed it another day to the right. There were way more patients in the clinic than I had seen before. Everything was being rushed. Sedation failed. I told them I was wide awake. They stuck me with the needle anyway and probably missed after I nearly jumped off the table.

Should have read the other negative reviews about this place. Every one of them looks like an honest impression. Go somewhere else if you can.

ETA: They dropped me as a patient shortly after this review. I'd give 'em zero stars if that was possible.

This was the best experience I have ever had with a Dr. And their staff.|Update! If anyone read my first review about the way I was treated the first appointment by the office staff who refused to let see the doctor over paperwork .I didn't arrive exactly at 1.30  p.m.  my appointment was at 2.00 p.m. my arrive time was 1.40 however I wasn't allowed to see or talk to the doctor only two of the office staff showed me any compassion..If your new to this practice be there a hour early so you get in to see the doctor. I make another appointment with the Dr. Kevin Andres he is a wonderful he very knowledgeable when it comes to a patient of chronic pain he very easy to talk to a
and understand what person going through. The staff the second time were so different none them were rude or disrespectful it whole different crew working the front desk every one working the time of my second appointment were very friendly and helpful..I filled out my paperwork on line for my second appointment with got there a hour early to ensure I got to see the doctor. Dr.Kevin Andres is exceptional doctor I'm glad I went back to see a very different office that treats their patients with respect and compassion..I highly recommend Dr.Kevin Andres if had a bad experience like I did my first appointment and decided not go back please go back my second time around make such a huge difference than first and Dr.Kevin Andres is a doctor chronic pain patient needs in lives..So the first review I only gave Capitol pain  one star  my second visit I was totally impressed by the staff and both doctor's the nurse practitioner & Dr.Kevin Andres so my one star is turning into a five.. the stars above only reflect my first visit could not change it to a five star which Capitol pain management which this practice earned on my second appointment.|As a patient of capital  pain institute ,I've had everything good to say. I absolutely Love Amy Bowling. I truly feel like I matter to her. She has been the Best Doctor that I have ever had. She has fought for me to have test and get advanced care for my spinal needs. If I die today, I can honestly say, I have never had a more caring and compassionate physician. I couldn't ask for better care. Also, Dr. MIMS is wonderful. He does a wonderful job always explaining everything about your procedure and takes excellent care of me.|I've been going to this clinic for about 10 years.  I love these people.  The staff is great.  The doctors are knowledgeable and works with me on every level to address my pain issues.  Wait time is minimal.  Usually, I'm in and out within 30 minutes.  This clinic is a lifesaver for me.  Love them so much.|I get very little relief from the medication that I'm prescribed. I have two vertebrae that are bone to bone and I'm in doubt that my X-rays have even been looked at. I'm prescribed two five mg norco a day I take one in the morning when I take my morning meds and it dulls the pain very little for a couple hours and if I take another before bedtime I don't get much sleep if I don't take another I hurt most of the day. I feel that my condition should be looked at and something else could be done maybe another pain pill for the day or the strength increased in the meds|They have the nicest staff and my dr Callie  has always been nice to me and she always make sure if I have any questions or any concerns that I let her know she always ask that! to her. You're not just another patient in a long list of that she has that day. She actually cares about us.|Wait time is usually just about 15 minutes. Office staff are helpful and very nice. Nurse is great. Love my doctor. She's amazing!|Very professional, attentive to the needs of the patient and a very caring staff. Dr. Mims explained everything about the procedure
before beginning.He also tried to help get my IV started.They work together as a team.  The nurse with Dr. Mims was very sweet and held my hand throughout the procedure. column40:
Capitol Pain is awesome, I was really impressed! Yesterday 1/28/25 was my first visit, so naturally I was nervous. Pain clinics in general are hard, because you never know what kind of welcome you will get. Some Doctors and staff have no compassion, they just go through the motions,  others treat you like they are doing you a favor by taking time to see you, or they think you don't need to be there, while I can understand that they deal with people day in and day out , some of which aren't there for the right reasons, I think the majority of the folks who go to a pain clinic really need the help.Lord knows I appreciate everything they do for me! I've lived with chronic pain since an automobile accident in 1996. So I was pleasantly surprised yesterday when I got to Capitol Pain, the entire staff was super friendly. I seen Dr Andres , on Ring Rd in E-town Ky. Abigail was the nurse who took my vitals and went over my chart, she was super sweet. Dr Andres was Awesome, I wasn't rushed. He was friendly, patient, compassionate, and he listened to everything I told him. I am so glad that I made the long trip to see them. I live 88 miles away. But my experience made every mile worth it!|I feel all of the NP and Dr are wonderful. I believe they do have my best interest at heart. The nurses and receptionist are great,as well. The only negative would be trying to get hold of a real person in the office. I wish we could call and get a receptionist or nurse,if needed. Without going through other sources. Great job to all!!!|This pain management clinic is amazing, the staff is very friendly,  professional and helpful. Also, the doctors are the same. I had a family emergency and couldn't make it to appointment and they worked with me to reschedule. And I called back for an earlier appointment and they got me the earliest appointment. The appointment was scheduled a week and half from my originally scheduled appointment. I really did appreciate them for their help and understanding.|I had a very good experience here at the Elizabethtown office of Capitol Pain Institute. I usually see the Louisville office but due to my husband's schedule with his heart failure doctor appointment I had to reschedule my regular monthly appointment and I was able to be seen at this office. Everyone was very kind and respectful and was quick and efficient with getting patients to their designated areas. It was not a long wait before I was called back maybe 5 minutes. The person doing the vitals was very nice and done her job very well and was also knowledgeable and asked the appropriate questions that would be expected. I'm very familiar with the doctor as I see her also in the Louisville location. I have always been treated very good at Capitol Pain Institute and have been with them for going on 3 years and plan on it being many more years to come. I would highly recommend this pain management program to anyone needing this kind of medical care not only do they have very knowledgeable medical providers but the entire office personnel are the kindest and most respectful of any pain management program that I have visited. Thank you.|The nurse practitioners are great and the receptionist is just as good. I really like thT the receptionist knows My face and name.. You never had to wait in the waiting room very long. And they're always on time with my medicine.|I was really happy to learn that you all offered this, for several reasons we had a major snow and ice storm in E-Town and we had been without power since 6:00 a.m. Monday morning and didn't get it back until Tuesday at 3:00 p.m. along with that I was also sick so which made it great that I didn't have to reschedule my appointment. I really appreciate the convenience and that we don't miss out on any appointments that way|I have loved my visits at the Elizabethtown office. And love the treatment of respect and friendliness from all employees in the office.
Love the way Dr. Aleatha takes the time to work with me and assist in every way possible to help me get through my worse situations. I feel like God has blessed me with the Capital Pain institute family.|Hi I'm a patient here at Capitol Pain Institute in Elizabethtown. I've been very pleased with the care I've received. Everyone from the receptionist to the nurses to the nurse practioners have treated me with dignity and compassion. The staff takes time to listen to me and address my pain issues.
When I first started coming, I was having difficulty leading a reasonably normal life. Now, I'm able to do many activities I thought were gone forever. I highly recommend this excellent facility to anyone who has unresolved pain issues.

column40: Been a patient for over 2 years great staff and Kelly is awesome. She listens to my concerns and makes suggestions to help. Dr Gardner has been such a great doctor he was so great at not only controlling my pain but helped point me to the right doctors and diagnosis. So glad I came to his office|I love the staff at the Franklin location.  Whenever I walk in I feel like I'm there to see friends. They are all so personable yet professional. The wait time is reasonable and they always take the time to listen to me. They have helped me so much with my back pain. Without them, I probably wouldn't be able to get around as well as I do.  Dr. Unick is great when I have to have injections. He  walks me through the entire process of what he's doing.  I can't say enough good about this clinic and the people that make it so wonderful!|The staff and Kelly are a prime example of a generous caring and professional group of people that represent your company.  They're very knowledgeable about you and ask questions about how you feel. That means a lot. I have always felt comfortable on each Dr visit. Thanks for such an amazing group you have there. God bless always|The people are all super nice I have never had a problem until this last visit on January 29,2025. I was told by the girl at the front desk,Kelly the NPRN and also the assistant that checks you in the room that my prescription would be ready to pick up Saturday 2/1/25. I called to fill them and the prescriptions had not even been sent in. So I am having a really bad weekend dealing with this pain and everything going on with my back|Franklin Ky. office was a good place and friendly place. I really liked going there, but I was notified yesterday that Commonwealth,, Pain & Spine are shutting down this office. This is so an inconvenience for someone that now going to have to drive a whole lot further. When they were Interventional Pain Specialist you could call them and talk to someone at the office. Now every time you try to call and talk to someone at the office you have an appointment at, it is no way or possible to call the office. When you call you get an office In Louisville Ky. The person you may or may not get are some of rudest and someone who really doesn't care about you or your health. I was trying to have a procedure done and they were telling me I had to pay for something my insurance company said they were going to pay for but the office was told by Louisville office to take a copayment of $100 first before I could have it done. I was on the phone with my insurance company and they were trying to get a hold of Commonwealth,, Pain & Spine with me on the phone also to tell them it was covered we was on the phone for over an hour, started calling them at 2:45 my time which is 3:45 Commonwealth,, Pain & Spine time in Louisville Ky. We was on the phone till 5:10 Commonwealth pain & Spine time. They only answer the phone one time around 4 PM there time to say wait a second we will get back to you. We waited till 5:10 then I told the insurance company they close at 5 PM there time they would not answer or even talk to the insurance company. Commonwealth, Pain & Spine in Louisville on a scale from 1-10 would in my opinion would get a 1/2 of 1 for wanting to help someone a 0 for caring about your health and concerns and 1/2 for being knowledgeable about their job and how to help you. And something else happened all the time if the office does call you and you have to call them back on the number they tell you to call it goes straight to the office In Louisville Ky. You tell them the office called and you are calling them back to answer the questions they had, the office in Louisville will not put you on the line with the office that called you and they won't even give them a message. My wife and I have been looking at another office but haven't not found one that our insurance company that another company takes because of being out of network. We have complained at the office about we cannot call them or get a hold of them and all they will say is everyone has the same problem it nothing they can do about it because the office In Louisville thinks they are so special and want all the power they even want let you talk to your own doctor. I have been to a lot of doctors because of health problems I am so glad they don't make life or death decisions because the willingness to just not care about there patience. I even have one that was trying to bring politics in it, I think they was trying to find out who I was supporting. Like I said most of the people in the office are very nice but I have had one nurse practitioner that will not listen to you at all just keep typing on her computer your whole visit and when you try to tell her what the insurance was saying she wants to argue that her notes said you was a no show after trying to tell them that you was going to have to pay she was more like the ones In Louisville Kentucky but it is just one. In my opinion if you can find another company I would strongly recommend another company. But I  will say the actual doctor in the office in Franklin Ky. Are really caring person. And Dr Gardner at the Bowling Green Ky. Is a really good Doctor and care about his patients and really try to help.|I'm so appreciative of this place!! It's conveniently located within 10 minutes of my home, which helps on my bad days. With pain, we don't always want to leave home so this was the reason I started going here. The staff has always been amazing with understanding my situation and I have come to see them as friends. Amanda is hands down the best person in this office. She's very organized and always crosses all her T's and dots her i's. Mrs.McBrayer is supportive and kind. She's offered advice and guidance with possible solutions. I wish all my dr appointments were like this!|The PA that I see is so wonderful and I couldn't ask for a better doctor. She knows exactly what to do for me and is the BEST!!  I love her and wouldn't go anywhere else!!! More than 5 stars!!!|They was very pleasant and took time with me to explain some things i mabe going to do and how it works. They didnt make me feel like they was rushed and explained everything nicely.

column40:
Best pain management I've ever been to. The staff and the doctors are fantastic. They actually care about their patients.|After experiencing mediocre pain management from ANOTHER "Pain Specialist " for 17 years, I find myself getting the BEST care from Dr. T. Beecham at Vitality pain Center. I've also seen three other doctors there and received excellent care.
Not sure what anyone else has gone through but my experience has been EXCELLENT.   Not to say that once or twice appointment dates have been transposed or whatever else. That's clerical. NOT the doctor.
Now, it is a Conglomerate. They have a central office that takes care of setting up appointments and sending messages back and forth to the different offices. If you need to speak to someone in a particular office, you'll have to leave a message at the main number.
All in all, great place for me!|Hands down the best pain management facility I've ever been to. Dr. Beacham listened to my entire medical history and understood my concerns and confusions with managing pain in this country. On my first visit he immediately started managing my pain and created a plan for the future. Best bedside manners I have ever encountered.|Dr. Beecham was very nice and seemed very intelligent.  That is the only good thing I can say about them.  I have never seen a more incompetent practice in my life.  They returned two out of 14 messages,   I went in for a trial and they locked the medicine in a safe and couldn't open the safe so I Had to come back another day, I am in a wheelchair and return trips from Shelbyville are not easy!  I had an appointment they said was a follow up from another appointment where literally I saw the doctor for one minute.  I canceled the appointment, when I tried to renew a prescription they gave me (non-opioid). They refused it since I had not kept the appointment, not telling me at the time that is what it was for.  They referred me to a surgeon for the pain pump, said it would be installed soon just for her to deny me.  When I called them and asked for a solution they took a week for another referral.  This one the wrong office called me and I have never heard back from the referral or Vitality.  I could go on but why, DO NOT ago there if you are not easy money they will cut you loose!|The staff is very warm and inviting. They have always made sure me and mother are well taken care of and that our appointments are scheduled and any questions are answered! The doctors have always discussed treatment options and followed through with the best procedures. They also listen to any concerns you may have and address them.  I would recommend this office if you need help with pain management. I have been going here for a few years.|I absolutely love Dr Beachum! He is so personable as well as on point with whatever is causing ur pain. Samantha was his helper today & she is a special kinda girl. She gets the job done immediately , with a great personality & smile. U can't go wrong at Vitality Pain Center. The first face u see when u check in is Bobbie. She is very good at her job. Love her personality as well, she's fabulous,|I have been dealing with the worst back pain imaginable since mid-April, 2021 and finally got practically 100% relief from Dr. Beechum, whom I adore.  The problem I have with this facility is that I was unable to pay an unexpected $500 bill I received on March 11, 2024.  I had it sitting on my desk to try to begin to make payments as soon as I had "extra" funds to put toward it.  I literally work paycheck-to-paycheck.  I am a single mom with a daughter in college.  On April 22nd, I got a notice from a collection agency that Vitality had turned me over to them for non-payment!  After less than six weeks and not one phone call from them.  NOT ONE.  I would LOVE to be able to continue to see Dr. Beechum because he is wonderful, but I won't be going back due to his accounting department's crappy way of treating long-time patients.  I've been going there for THREE YEARS, and I have paid every bill they ever sent me.  Why they were so quick to screw me this way is beyond belief.  I won't be back.|Office staff is nice but, can not decide if a medical facility, will wear mask sometimes and sometimes not. Lousy Doctor, delayed refilling medication due to delayed urine test results, left me without pain medication for 10 days! Now find out they changed my medication without talking to me first. Not what they promised. Poor excuse for a respectable business. U would Not recommend.

column40:
Today was my very first appointment at this practice. The office staff that I came in contact with appeared to be nice. When I was put in a room I answered the normal medical questions asked by a nurse then after a NP (a lady) came in...she evaluated me and decided what I needed. All sounded OK. However, I am allergic to a certain medication that she wanted me to take. She refused to give me a medication that was better for me and one that wouldn't send me to the emergency room. She is the first NP that recommended that I  take a medication that WILL harm me. I let her know that and it's in my medical history but she refused to change it. She must run the office and not the actual doctor because he never got involved in that part. Yes, he came in and talked with me and he seemed like an ok doctor. No doctor is going to give me a medication that I know I'm allergic to and that will cause me harm. I'm not gonna tell people not to go there because some people get treated differently than others. But this place is DIFFERENTLY not for me. I will not return. There's other places to go and if it wasn't I'm still not gonna take a medication that will cause me to go to the emergency room. I GIVE THIS PLACE A|I am a chronic pain sufferer and have constant burning pain over 80% of my body. I've also had major back surgery, and I have arthritis in my spine. When my pain is not being treated it continues to intensify until I feel like I can't breath and because of this my previous pain doctor had me on an extended release medication as well as a quick release. This did not come about easily, it took about 6 years of trying several combinations of medications to help to wrestle down this pain to get it to a manageable level so that I can work and be a functioning adult. Finally 3 years ago my previous pain management provider found the combination of medication that worked for me and I was able to work full time again. Well my previous provider closed down his practice and I was referred to this clinic. They completely disregarded my previous treatment and said I was on too much medication. They completely took away my extender release medication, they reduced the milligrams and cut the amount of my quick release medication in half. Now, I have NO treatment after like 8pm and through the night when my pain intensifies beyond belief, I've never suffered so much in my life! I'll take labor over this because at least at some point it's over. By the time the morning comes and I can take my medication the pain has intensified to a level that the first dose barely does any good and I've missed so much work. I've blown through all of my sick and vacation time and if nothing changes I will go back to being a non fictional non working adult again. That life sucked so bad and it's all over some pill count that was valued over my quality of life! I gave 2 stars because of hope, I am hopeful that this will change soon and I would love to update this review to a more positive review because I found a provider who cares more... we will see.|This place is amazing. The staff is not only friendly but the doctors really listen are super knowledgeable. They saved my life and that's not hyperbole. Tayza(spelling) was amazing and is a superstar. I can't thank this place enough.|The staff and providers at the clinic are very professional and truly care about their patients. They practice ethical healthcare and provide quality care to their patients. In my opinion, that is an important aspect of medical care that isn't found at many places anymore. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a pain management clinic!|I actually love this place, but today has reminded me of why I stopped injections. Nearly 15 minutes passed my scheduled appointment time and I haven't even been prepared for my procedure.

*Update* My preparation and procedure didn't begin until an hour and a half AFTER my scheduled appointment.|Be prepared to sit way past your appointment time. Don't have other appointments or commitments same day cause you will not make it.|I have been going to see Dr. Lynch for some years ...him and his office has helped me so much.  Friendly office staff, that actually cares ! I get my shots don't by Jason and his little group of helpers and he does such a great job. If looking for pain consider this office.|I have been coming here for about 3 years and the entire staff is absolutely amazing! They treat you like family and know you by your name and make time to actually get to know you . Shannon , Toni, David, and EVERYONE else are just wonderful. I drive here 35 min because I'm so happy with them even though there are several closer office I could visit .

column3:
Specialized Pain Management Without Surgery-First Approach

At Commonwealth Pain & Spine, we believe that exceptional pain management requires more than standard care. Our team of highly skilled physicians rejects the conventional surgery-first model in favor of less invasive, cost-efficient treatment options. With 20 convenient locations throughout Kentucky, southern Indiana, and Illinois, we make quality pain care accessible to those who need it most. Check out our comprehensive services designed to address chronic pain conditions effectively.

Our Approach to Pain Management

What sets us apart is our deep commitment to empathetic care. We understand how exhausting chronic pain can be, which is why our physicians take the time to truly listen and develop personalized treatment plans. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

Located at 99 Wellpark Lane in Campbellsville, KY, our facility is staffed by some of the finest pain management experts in the country. We invite you to experience the Commonwealth difference by calling us at +1 270-572-4348 to schedule your consultation today.

column40: I want to take a moment to share how much I admire the incredible team at Interventional Pain Specialist. They genuinely care about their patients and go above and beyond to make sure everyone feels heard and supported. It's inspiring to see how they tailor each treatment plan with so much thought and compassion, always striving to improve the quality of life for those they serve. If you're looking for a team that truly puts your well-being first, you're in great hands with them.|I highly recommend this practice. I have been with them for 4 years. I have had the best care from this practice. The staff , nurses, and Dr are all very professional, friendly and caring. They do their best to make you have a quality of life. They are not miracle workers,they do their best. Nothing is 100% Guaranteed. Dr vessel is a very good Dr. He and Dr Miller do there best to make my chronic pain better. I am very satisfied with this practice.|The staff and doctors are amazing! It's hard for me to get around these days and the staff is so accommodating. They have even helped me get back out to my vehicle on days when I need the extra help. They get me in and out fairly fast. I dread going to the doctor and I hate the waiting game we all have to play but these guys here get it! If you're in a place in your life where you need to see pain management, this is the place to go!|Commonwealth/IPS are wonderful. Everyone is so kind. Dr Miller has been my doctor but yesterday when I went I found out he was no longer coming to Glasgow. He's been my favorite doctor and I was disappointed. But Dr Vessel did my treatment and he was wonderful as well. I can't say enough about how I am treated at this clinic. They are the best!|I always have a pleasant experience.  I am treated with respect by the staff as well as the doctor.  She always takes time to hear me and answer any questions I may have. If you had more than 5 stars I would give them more.|The staff were so friendly. The doctors assistant was so friendly and patient didn't rush me with questions and allowed me to explain everything. column48: Do u accept cancer patients?
column49:
Mr. Tincher,

In general, we do accept cancer patients for pain treatment.  However, we would need a referral from the patient's cancer doctor, to make sure we would be able to provide the appropriate treatment.  If you have any further questions, feel free to call our Patient Intake department at ext 244. 

Thank you for your question and we hope we can be of help to you or your loved one.
Best,
Heather- Administration

column2: Kentuckiana Pain Specialists: Ajith Nair, M.D.
column3:
At Kentuckiana Pain Specialists, we provide comprehensive pain management services to the Louisville and Elizabethtown, Kentucky communities under the expert guidance of our founder, Ajith Nair, M.D. Our practice stands at the forefront of combating the opioid crisis by offering alternative treatment options that go beyond traditional pain management techniques.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We specialize in creating personalized treatment plans that incorporate integrative, palliative, and holistic approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our services include:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Sports medicine treatments

  • Comprehensive pain management solutions

  • Individualized care plans

Understanding that there is no one-size-fits-all approach to chronic pain management, we work closely with each individual to develop strategies that complement their lifestyle while providing long-term relief and improved quality of life. Visit our official website or call us at +1 502-995-4004 to schedule a consultation at our Elizabethtown office located at 914 N Dixie Hwy, Suite 109.
column11:

To combat the current opioid crisis, Dr. Nair educates patients on treatments that use integrative, palliative, and holistic approaches. These approaches are implemented in personalized treatment plans based on every patient's individual needs.

Kentuckiana Pain Specialists understands that every individual is unique, and there is no one-size-fits-all approach to chronic pain management. Every treatment plan aims to complement the individual while providing long-term results and improved overall quality of life.
