column48: What are trigger point injections?
column49: Trigger point injections are a type of injection therapy used to treat muscle pain and spasms. They involve injecting a local anesthetic and/or corticosteroid medication directly into the trigger point, a tight knot of muscle that can cause pain and discomfort.

column3:
Personalized Pain Management in Owensboro

At Nadar Pain Care, we provide comprehensive pain management services with a focus on personalized care that larger clinics simply cannot match. Our small-scale practice ensures you see the same physician at every visit, creating continuity of care that's essential for effective chronic pain treatment. Unlike large pain clinics owned by private equity firms that prioritize profits, we put our patients first. Our single-physician model allows us to develop tailored treatment plans addressing your specific needs.

Our Comprehensive Pain Services Include:

  • Medication management

  • Injection therapy

  • Radiofrequency ablations

  • Epidural injections

  • Pain pump implementation

  • Spinal cord stimulator placement

  • Kyphoplasty procedures

We understand the frustration of seeing different providers at each visit, which is why we've created a practice where consistent medical care is our standard. Located at 2816 Veach Rd #105 in Owensboro, KY, we invite you to experience the difference personalized pain management can make. Visit Nadar Pain Care or call us at +1 270-684-7179 to schedule your consultation today.
column11:
Small scale but comprehensive pain clinic with personalized care. Covering the spectrum of pain management including medication management, injection therapy, radiofrequency ablations, epidurals, pain pumps, spinal cord stimulators, kyphoplasty and more.
Consistent medical care is often hard to find with large pain clinics with numerous doctors and advanced practice providers. In these situations the patient often sees a new provider every few visits making chronic pain management frustrating. Further, large pain clinics are often owned by private equity and financial groups which put the bottom line and profits above the patient.
Our practice is small scale, and has a single physician who evaluates and treats patients at every visit.

column40:
When I look for a Dr. I look for someone who is passionate about their craft and listens to their patients. I found this with Dr. Hanson. Not only does he constantly seek new ways to improve his care, but he stays up to date on the latest technology. this is refreshing. I also like how easy it is to talk to Dr. Hanson.|I never had a doctor who listened to my concerns as much as Dr. Hansen. He always made sure that I understood the treatments. He never prescribed medication without me knowing everything about it. I have not been able to do much since the office closed because of the back pain I've had all my life. The officials who are still trying to ruin Dr. Hansen don't care about me. They just want to destroy a good doctor's life.|I could not walk and had given up hope before I began treatment by Dr. Hansen. I now have hope and faith. I can now function and am productive as a human being because of the treatment I have received from Dr. Hansen and his staff..I have brought my family to him as long ago as thirty years and now I see him. I am so thankful for him and his Staff.  The place is clean and fresh. The staff is on time and on their toes caring for people like myself.  God Bless and thank you all at the office.|Friendly and professional office staff, great doctor. I consider myself lucky to have found Dr Hansen, he is extremely knowledgeable and skilled. One procedure in particular that really helped me, I had never heard of prior to talking with Dr Hansen. In my research before getting the procedure, it appears to be available quite rarely across practices in general, with few published papers describing outcomes across substantial numbers of patients - but Dr Hansen had already done the procedure about 1,000 times. I can understand some of the other comments, the doctor has been at it for many years and can occasionally be business-like and in a bit of a rush. Still - relative to other practitioners, he has done more to educate me about procedures and about the issues in my back, on the whole. I recommend coming prepared with your questions so that you can make the most of the time you get with him. So, if you are looking for a very experienced doctor who is at the cutting edge of his field, I would consider it well worth it to give Dr Hansen a chance. His practice has helped me immensely, over about a 4yr period.|Dr Hansen is the best Dr for anything, not just my back. I did however have a spinal fusion surgery last year and have been dealing with complications since then. The surgeon referred me to Dr. Hanson to look into the other issues going on, which there is a long list. But from day one I've had the best doctor experience with him and his staff send anyone else for any other reason. He takes his time, really seems To listen, the nurses that perform the procedures listen very well and relay information accurately... I cannot recommend these people enough if you're having problems that other places cannot figure out.  They have went above and beyond to help me with the pain and have not treated me like someone seeking meds like some other doctors have in the past.  They also work with me financially when I had a lapse of insurance that I cannot thank them enough for|EVERY SINGLE TIME I go to an appointment the staff, ALL the staff, are AMAZING!!!!!!!!! I've never met a friendlier group of people.  From the front desk to the people at the exit. The doctors are very understanding too.  I'm horribly afraid of needles and Dr. Hansen is so gentle and does everything he can to put my mind at ease.  I've been to 3 different doctors before IPS and none of them have been able to ease my pain from an auto accident in February of 2018.  I FINALLY am getting relief and have even had a few pain free days.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!|Dr. Hansen and his staff are amazing. I would recommend their office to anyone suffering with back pain. He saved my life. I was in so much pain and could barely walk anymore. I had to use a cane and walker most days and sometimes a wheelchair. Thanks to Hansen and his staff I can walk again. I can have an active role in my kids lives. I can actually live again. I owe them everything and so grateful I found his office. I have been a patient of his for now 20 years and wouldn't trust my back with anyone else!|"This happened in 2023. A few days before my appointment, I was notified that it was canceled because the doctor could no longer prescribe medication. This left me to manage my care on my own, which was challenging and very upsetting.

I managed to find a supportive Pain Management Office, but I remain concerned about how patients were left without assistance and why no one stepped in to ensure continuity of care."

Specialized Pain Relief Solutions in Kentucky

At Bux Pain Management, we offer patient-centered pain management treatments to residents of Lexington, Cynthiana, and Danville, Kentucky. Founded over 20 years ago by Dr. Anjum Bux, a board-certified anesthesiologist, our practice specializes in nonsurgical, minimally invasive approaches to chronic pain. We understand that while oral medications may provide temporary relief, many are addictive and don't address the root cause of pain. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Advanced pain management procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive interventions

  • Alternative solutions to invasive surgery

Our dedicated team includes experienced physicians, physician assistants, and registered nurses who work collaboratively to provide exceptional care. Located at 4071 Tates Creek Centre Dr Suite 105 in Lexington, we're committed to helping you regain control of your life through effective pain management. Learn more about our innovative approaches by visiting our official website or call us at (859) 479-2163 to schedule your consultation.

I went to vitality for a second opinion and thankful I did. They have done more for me in one visit than the last pain center did in 4 months. I'm still trying to pay them off. For nothing. Thank you for easing my pain. I'm so grateful!|I was really impressed with this Vitality Pain Center. Dr. Bosomworth was very courteous and took the time to listen to my concerns. He was very knowledgeable and explained my condition and treatment options in a clear and concise way that I could understand. I left my initial visit thinking, "Why can't all physicians be like him?" I mean, it would sure make the world a much better place.|I have found Dr Bosomworth excellent in his recommendations and in the procedures he's done for me. I personally don't like his bedside manners (or lack there of). Wish he were more humble and not arrogant (but that could be said about too many physicians).

The 1 star is because it is impossible to reach anyone on the phone. Even after leaving 3 voice messages, no one ever returned my call. There also seems to be a rotating door of new staff.

If you don't really care about staff and only about medical care, I would recommend this practice. But if you want/need the full package (which all patients deserve that), then I'd go somewhere else.|I been ok with them for years dealing with Bosomorth, and this horrible new doctor that I didn't ask for named Williams is horrible at his job!!! My medication been in his drop box and takes 2 seconds to send over to pharmacy. Haven't had medications in 3 days... My wife wrote a review also|Dr Bosomworth was very helpful on my first If he was a doctor, he shouldn't be. I was told his name was Dr Randall Oliver. A pathetic excuse for a doctor. He came in the room with accusations and talking to me very disrespectful right off the bat. He accused me of not being at the clinic for 3 months or seeing any doctors at first. Then the nurse in the room confirmed that I was correct and I have been there as early as last month and asked to see a doctor but there was no doctor available. When he saw that I was correct and he was wrong it made him very angry. The first thing I said to the nurse and to him was that the pills were not helping and I don't want them anymore I want another alternative that they can offer. Any advice or anything. He was not listening to me at all and he didn't talk to me, he talked at me. The he denied my pills thinking that would show me. But I had already said I didn't want any. But again he was not listening to me or talking to me. He was talking at me and said I was wrong in using cannabis and kept on and on and then just walked out of the room slamming the door behind him without any medical advice whatsoever and didn't care about my pain level which was a 9 out of 10. I have used cannabis for my pain and to help me sleep and it does work better than the pills did. and he put that down and said that since I do that he's not going to help me at all. But that was not the route to go. And now they will not answer any phone calls or return any phone calls. I will ever darkened their door again. I have actually reported him to an acquaintance of mine who happens to be the director of the Kentucky board of medical licensure, Michael Rodman. He shrugged his head like he knew who the guy was and said he would take care of it. Since the good doctor Randall Oliver at the pain clinic put down cannabis and said that it was illegal and wrong for me or anyone to use, I called my doctor and she referred me to the Kentucky cannabis clinic. I called an old friend of mine which happens to be the lieutenant governor, Jacqueline Coleman. A very sweet and beautiful woman, by the way. And she told me that the governor has already signed the legislature this past May to make medical marijuana legal in Kentucky. And it will be legal on January 1st. She also told me I should put in for my medical marijuana card right now because it takes up to 60 days to get. So I did go to the Kentucky cannabis clinic which was just 3 miles down the road from me. They were very helpful in helping me fill out all the paperwork and got my doctor's recommendation/ reference. The doctor there looked everything over and said it all looks good and I should have no problem getting my card in the next 30 to 60 days. Then he said I would be able to start my cannabis treatment January 2nd 2025. So I'm all set. I don't care what happens to Dr Oliver or vitality pain clinic. I hope they get shut down. Or at least clean up the place. And get good doctors. Right now the only have one good doctor which you're lucky if you get to see him but you will eventually see other doctors. I'm still not done with that doctor Randall Oliver. I'm going to follow through with everything and every means that I can to get that man out of the medical field. In closing I would like to add, cannabis helps me tremendously with no side effects or no harm to my body. The pills that I was given hurt my stomach and my digestive system and has caused me the other problems. Cannabis is natural. Pills are manufactured in a lab that often has many side effects for for many people. I advise anyone who has chronic pain like I do to go to their general practitioner doctor and have them send a referral to the Kentucky cannabis clinic. You should go there. You're treated with respect and not disrespected or talked down to at all.|I have been see Dr. David Bosomworth for over 25 years. He has managed my pain so I was able to enjoy the best quality of life I could with the pain I had. He always takes time to listen to what is bothering me and helps in every way he can. God Bless him and his kindness towards his patients.|Bad place to go. I give them 0 star. I've called 14 times and they our hang up which is highly unprofessional. I came in three days ago and my medication was suppose to be in they had me speak to a doctor over the phone instead of in person. This establishmentis highly unprofessional. My husband is in pain and can't get his medication called in. This is the worst pain management ever.|My son has been suffering with his back and knees for a long time. Dr Williams was so kind and thorough and the staff made sure his meds got approved.thank you for helping my son.after warning them 4 times that our pharmacy closed at 5pm and wasn't open until Monday..Dr bosworth made sure he didn't call his meds in even though my son was in so much pain his b/ p was 186/121.now he suffers until Monday...will find another clinic

I'm 52 & was told 12 years ago I'd be in a Wheel Chair by the time I'm 50, I've  been suffering with Chronic Pain 24/7 for too long. Unfortunately I've had no choice to undergo 7 surgeries for a preventative outcome..
Too make a long story short, I came to KY on November 5th leaving a LTC facility determined to find help!
Capital Pain Institute was extremely Timely, I had a New Patient Appointment almost the following week. It's important to confirm appointment arrival time and complete your Patient Paperwork. The staff was very efficient & accommodating When my appointment was canceled bc I did not know to arrive an hour early.

My biggest issue is that they told me it would be my normal $45 copay, and then charged me $90 without saying anything else.  When I called, the woman who answered the phone said "I'm the one who helped you, and I told you it would be..."  Except she's not the person I dealt with that day, so the phone lady certainly didn't tell me anything.  She put me on hold, came back, and said the other lady told me, too. column40:
Dr. Dubal & David, the PA, are both very thorough & excellent at what they do. Yes, there can often be a long wait time, but this is because Dr. Dubal will work patients in who are having pain & she goes slowly and carefully with her procedures. I'd much rather have to wait for a careful doctor than be rushed in & out of a doctor who speeds through a procedure.|Dr. Dubal is not just a doctor to me. She is a voice in my head guiding me. She dispensed sound advice.  Its been 10 years. Because of her, my life is wonderful. She not only treated my pain, she empowered me and scolded me when needed. Her advice has carried me far through the years like no other. She believed in me. If you are only looking for a doctor to sling narc's and are not ready to move into another direction then she is not for you in my humble opinion. The idea is to put in you a track that allows YOU to be the best you can be while taking minimal amounts of medications... not the other way around. She is slow, precise, and OCD about perfection. Wait times may be long because she loves the people she treats and everyone needs that time. be patient. This is not a regular doctor office. She heals people.

Dr. Dubal. I finally did the (At the time) experimental Ketamine Coma treatment. Its been 10 years of me with a second lease on life. Im sore a few days out of the year but im ME. No medications needed outside of some OTC stuff once in a while. I owe you my life and cant thank you enough for the love and support you and your staff gave me. It was a trying time. Thank you for believing in me until the tests proved I wasnt lying. I love you so much.|The  staff is comprised of COMPLETELY incompetent individuals. Poor wait time. The nurses will not return your calls timely after you've had injection treatments & encounter problems. You will never meet with the physician during office visits if you're  Dr. Dubal's patient. (Even when you request to see her.) You will meet with her assistant "David." He is horrible & has Terrible bedside manner.David is not a physician.He shows little to no concern, is monotone and passive to your medical concerns/questions. He will thumb  through a medical book during your office visit  because he is not knowledgeable. Save yourself the stress and take care of your health. Go to a Dr. who will be involved in your healthcare/ treatment plan and not just show up on the day that you have your injections.... That is exactly what Dr. Dubal does .Don't learn the hard way.Terrible facility.|Oh my heavens. Not sure what Dr you negative folks seen. But Dr Dubal is amazing ,  experienced , caring, total empathy and will do everything in her power too help manage all pain. Which mine is all over. She has went overboard for me. You cannot even compare via another Dr. Unless you are only looking for pills but not a life. Amen.  Thank you Dr Dubal and the staff is a class act.  Mary.|I found my saving grace in Dr. Dubal. She's brilliant, caring, compassionate and listens. From the 1st appointment to present day my quality of life has increased tremendously due to Dr. Dubal & her knowledgable Staff. Thank you all so very much.|I am a disabled veteran and I have been suffering with my right ankle pain for  many years.
I have been accused of drug seeking due to my pain. I have an injury that is nearly 40 years old, 3 surgeries later and a total ankle replacement and still I was debilitated by pain.
Thanks to all of the people who have plagued the system with drug seeking behavior, I fell through the cracks at the VA Hospital.
Finally, I was able to get a referral to APC in Lex Ky.
3 weeks ago I received Kenalog 40 and today my pain and mobility are not as bothersome.
I am here today to be treated again.
I have been seeking pain relief, I have not been seeking narcotics to get high.
I hope to be pain free at some point in my life.|Dr Dubal has been helping me by making the pain bearable enough to live with for about 10 years now
She's one of the most compassionate Drs I've ever been to
As long as she can do these procedures & keep me from back surgery I'll be very greatful|They are great. Without them I would not be able to move.  Never a long wait and very little pain. I highly recommend Dr. GISH.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICES.

Dr Reasor, Kim and staff are caring and life is better with managing  pain under their professional care! I thank God...my Primary Care Doctor referred Dr Reasor to me YEARS ago!!  I'm truly grateful and appreciate Metro Pain for making a difference in so many lives!
Another satisfied patient with a grateful heart!!! THANK-YOU!!!|I became a patient ot Dr Gary Reasor almost 12 years ago, after moving to Louisville.   He and his staff are exceptional.   They are genuinely concerned in their patient's well being and take the time to understand my needs.  I am grateful to have become one of his patients as I am living a less painful life than I was before.
I truly appreciate being able to function and sleep better than I have since the 1980's after my permanent back injury.  Dr Reasor tailors his help
to my specific injury & needs.  He has many different options and staff members who help in assisting patients receive great care to lessen their pain which improves their life.
I believe he is an outstanding physician who cares about his patients and their pain issues.|Metro Pain Associates has truly been a blessing from God himself and I am BEYOND grateful for Gary, Jessica, Kim, and their staff! They have allowed me to get my life back and excel in my career. I would recommend this clinic to anyone who has serious pain that affects quality of life. Dr.Reaser, FNP Jessica, and Kimberly are all very passionate, cool, and professional physicians with integrity. These are very knowledgeable and qualified medical professionals that will take great care of you safely and effectively, no doubt. Their treatment program has allowed me to build back my physical and mental strength. I also would like to mention that their front desk receptionist is a very helpful, kind, and understanding woman. Shoutout to Katy as well, she's awesome. I wouldn't want to be a patient anywhere else, 10/10 experience for me.|I am treated by highly skilled, licensed staff who are respectful and empathetic. Stem cell treatment is available here, as well as various types of spinal implants. Epidural and RF are performed in their on site surgery suite. Sedation is available for surgical procedures|Would give a ZERO but can't. They were extremely difficult from the beginning. I was in pain mgmt in OKLAHOMA and moved back to KY.  My Dr sent the referral over and my pain mgmt place in OK sent my medical records. However, they kept saying they needed a release of care saying I was no longer going to my last pain mgmt office....IN OKLAHOMA. You can't even provide this type of care across state lines. That was squared away finally and it was a 1.5 month wait to get in for my first visit.  I had my appt down for 7/25. On 7/24, they sent me a link to complete my paperwork for my "upcoming appointment". I spent 15 minutes doing so, just to have them call me and say my appt was THAT DAY and I missed it. I explained that I had it as 7/25. She even said she wondered why I did all the paperwork but didn't come in. Why is the paperwork do at the time of appt? Anyway, you could easily see that it was a mistake and not a no show. She didn't care...told me if I were to reschedule there would be a $150 no-show fee and it would have to be paid before I could reschedule.  She had no mercy at all...just kept saying, I am sorry that is the way it is. I am not even a patient yet. Very frustrating. Would not recommend and after seeing these reviews, I can completely see why it is that way....he seems to be all about the dollar. No thanks.|Dr reasor and staff are excellent and exceptional! Because of their treatment and suggestions, i have had more quality of life. And some really good days! They kind, and understanding. I would give them 100 stars if I could. Best pain doctor in Louisville!|Dr .Gary Reasor has been blessing to me. I have worked for 40 plus years and I have endured severe pain in my legs from my back issues. I don't believe without he and his staff I would have been able to continue on with my work due to the pain being so severe. They have not made me pain free but they've got me to where I've been able to function. My quality of life isn't 100% but I do have at least some quality of life. I can't begin to tell you how great he and his staff have been. Thank you so much sir to you and your staff. I remember the first time I met you and I was in tears. You have helped me from the moment I met you. Your team does a fantastic job as well and I certainly can't thank them enough for making my visits as comfortable as they can.|Dr. Reasor really listened to me. Everyone was very knowledgeable and nice. Felt very comfortable & not judged at all.

At Pain Management Centers Of America in Paducah, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive interventional pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our

Specialized Pain Management Services

are delivered by physicians with extensive training and experience in the field of pain medicine. We welcome all patients seeking evaluation and treatment for chronic pain conditions at our conveniently located facility at 67 Lakeview Dr, Paducah, KY.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Multidisciplinary pain management approaches

We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we are committed to providing compassionate care using the latest evidence-based techniques. Our goal is to help patients regain function and improve their daily activities through effective pain management strategies. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at +1 270-554-8373.
column11: Physicians at Pain Management Centers of America are specialists in interventional pain management with extensive training and experience. They welcome all patients for evaluation and/or treatment of chronic pain.

column40:
Aweful. Arrived well before appointment. Signed in, but then sent to the other downstairs office. Signed in again.  41 minutes past appointment time, now empty lot I asked if my Dr is late? THEY NEVER CHECKED ME IN! Nope nope nope. Get your heads outta your @$$ and do you job. Dr left for lunch and still NOONE checked that they hadn't marked me off their signing sheet as completing my checkin?  Very disappointed.|Sent a referral two months ago and I finally called for them to tell me there was nothing they could do for me even though I was a previous patient for 10 years. I haven't been in the last 3 years because of financial difficulties but none of my conditions have changed, they got worse. Okay, no problem I will take my business elsewhere. They didn't even have the decency to call me back. They just left me on hold for nearly two months. Such unprofessionalism.|I recommend not even attempting to use this provider. It's clear they do not care about people living in debilitating pain. For a provider to say there's nothing they can do for you and will not even schedule an appointment to discuss your conditions (after submitting a ton of medical records) shows how extremely unethical Dr Manchikanti is. A professional who is supposed to help people but chooses to not even try is mind boggling to me. Maybe he realizes he's just not a good enough Dr. I am an upstanding human being with a professional career trying my hardest to make it day to day at work while in extreme pain that would cause most people to go on disability yet this Dr doesn't even want to try and help. Hopefully I can find a reputable Dr who does what he's sworn to do. I pray Dr Manchikanti never needs a pain management Dr that treats him with this level of discontent.|I have to take my mother thier. And it's unbelievable to me how little they care about their patients. I don't understand why they still have any patients honestly. She doesn't want shots they make her worse. Dr. Told her that without receiving the shots she can't get her medication? Why would any dr. Want to do a procedure on a patient when the patient tells them they don't help, but in fact makes it worse? It's all a money grab. DONT GO HERE.|refusal of service, my fathers pain medication has been "under review" for almost a week, and nobody will even talk to me about it, saying i "don't understand".|Dr Love has been my doctor since August 2011 before he ever got to PMCOA and has always been wonderful to me but I do NOT have much good to say about the office staff. I live 40 miles away and made a mistake by only scheduling medical transport for an appointment elsewhere because my PMCOA card was in my wallet and I was tired and hurting from having to unexpectedly move. I called the transportation when they didn't show up for my appointment at PMCOA on Monday April 1st and realised my mistake when they said they didn't have me scheduled so I immediately called PMCOA. I was rescheduled for the Thursday 4th and after the call I went to enter it into my calendar and saw that my day was full on the 4th so I called right back, this took about 2-3 minutes. They rescheduled me for the 9th then they called me right back and changed it to the 16th which didn't bother me at all. I called on the 4th for my medication refill I was called back and told that I was outside of the 90 day window and couldn't get a refill until the 16th. After the call I realized it was right at 60 days and then told that I had cancelled twice but I explained the scheduling mistake and that it shouldn't count as a second cancellation and was told to call back the next morning on Friday the 5th and speak to Jessica. I called several times and never received an answer or a call back. Jessica FINALLY called me on the Tuesday 9th telling me that she wasn't even there on Friday the 5th while not sounding very convincing and saying that I was outside of the 60 day rule instead of the 90 and that it did count as a second cancellation and that Dr Love had to be in the building and that with my medication none of the other doctors felt comfortable signing off on it and I told her that get other doctors named on my medication bottles all of the time and she had no reply just silence. I had to say that I shouldn't be told to call her the next morning if she's not going be there two or three times and that she should find out who told me that and to not do that before she stated that she would look into it. So now I'm left to go until the 16th without medication and when I said that I'd end up at the hospital she was SILENT.
There was a time a while back when I called for my refill and leave a message but the pharmacy wasn't hearing from them even though they were requesting my medication refill as well and this went on repeatedly with the requesting and me calling repeatedly without ever getting a reply. It wasn't until nine days after time for my medication that my friend and neighbor,a professor at MSU started making calls on my behalf and without my knowledge after he became totally disgusted at seeing me suffer. I don't know who he called because he wouldn't tell me but I received a call from the pharmacy and they said "We have finally received your prescription,we filled it and it's waiting for you" but I never heard a word from PMCOA about the matter and to this day I don't know why I had to suffer through that situation. I didn't ever mention it for fear of reprisal.
I only left three stars because of the redicunusness and unnecessary suffering but if it stars for Dr Love five stars would not be enough because he has been the kindest, most understanding and helpful pain management physician I've had in my 30 years of constant pain. Dr Love has never been unkind, always understood me, NEVER EVER been rude or walked out on m,hasn't ever performed procedures that were unessesary and or didn't help and hasn't tried to just drug me up out of my mind or prescribe unnecessary medication that messed me up physically and mentally HE'S AWESOME|i'm seen in the hopkinsville office, and have had nothing but positive interactions with everyone.  i've spoken to nurses a couple of times in paducah, but again, only have had positive experiences.  they deal with a lot of people most every day...i'm pretty certain there are some that are unpleasant.  but, nurses and staff can also have off days...we're all human.  anywho, nothing but good things to say!|My husband went here and the doctor did not even see him.  Laxmaiah Manchikanti, MD.  Did not talk with my husband and would not continue his pain management as it was at his other clinic.  Which had closed, so this doctor Sends his assistant in with what they felt was sufficient to give my husband for his pain.  Which turned out to be a medicine that weans people off narcotics, not for pain.

They could have called us before us making the wasted trip for nothing and saved us time and money.

They clearly don't care about people here, its the almighty dollar they care about.

Only one star because thats the only way I could leave a comment.

At Central Kentucky Pain & Spine, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive interventional pain management services to patients throughout Central Kentucky.

Specialized Pain Management Solutions

Our medical team focuses on identifying specific pain generators and performing appropriate invasive interventions tailored to each patient's unique needs. We offer a range of specialized services including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive techniques

Located at 360 Amsden Ave, Suite 305 in Versailles, KY, our modern medical clinic combines advanced technology with compassionate care. We understand how chronic pain affects quality of life, which is why we work diligently to develop effective treatment strategies for our patients. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, contact us at +1 502-570-3767 or visit Central Kentucky Pain Management Services.

column3:
At Commonwealth Pain & Spine, we believe that exceptional pain management requires more than standard care. Our team of highly skilled physicians takes a different approach to treating chronic pain, avoiding the typical surgery-first model in favor of less invasive, cost-efficient solutions. With 20 offices strategically located throughout Kentucky, southern Indiana, and Illinois, we make quality pain management accessible to patients across the region. Check out our comprehensive services to find the relief you deserve.

Our Specialized Approach to Pain Management

We understand how exhausting chronic pain can be, which is why our physicians prioritize empathy in every patient interaction. Our Bardstown location at 935 Chambers Blvd offers the same exceptional care found across all our facilities. What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just their symptoms. Our team includes some of the finest pain management experts in the country who provide:

  • Personalized treatment plans tailored to individual needs

  • Non-surgical interventions when appropriate

  • Advanced pain management techniques

  • Compassionate care from diagnosis through recovery

Call us today at +1 270-506-3300 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.
column11:
At Commonwealth Pain & Spine, run-of-the-mill care simply doesn't cut it for the practice's team of experienced, highly skilled pain management physicians. We have 20 offices conveniently located throughout Kentucky, southern Indiana, and Illinois. Check out our locations here.
Commonwealth Pain & Spine is different from comparable pain management clinics in treating patients. The team avoids the standard surgery-first delivery model in favor of a less invasive, more cost-efficient model. Because each physician recognizes how exhausting chronic pain feels, they make it a point to empathize with the needs of their patients.
The physicians at Commonwealth Pain & Spine are some of the finest experts in the country.

column40:
This is the place. This is where it's happening! Miss Jennifer and the rest of the staff are absolutely wonderful people! They are always friendly in their greetings, helpful with your questions and caring if you have an issue. Miss Erica (PA) is the pride of Bardstown! Well, not really, but she should be! She takes caring to a new level! She always has a snap in her step and wears a big smile. She's happy in her life calling and this is reflected throughout the clinic. You are lucky to be a patient here!|I looked for a good Pain Management and was lucky to find this place. The staff is awesome and treats you as an individual not just a number. I was in pain for 8 yrs at my previous Dr and now my pain is manageable because they listened to me and took the appropriate solutions tailored to my specific needs. I highly recommend Commonwealth Pain and Spine.|I want to thank everyone that helped me yesterday. They are great to work with. Make you feel comfortable, they are helpful and attentive. They have a sense of humor too. 
Dr Reynolds was great, listened and treated me like a person not just another patient. He was familiar with my file, doctors, medications, everything.
They don't rush you through, but don't hold you hostage for an hour just waiting.|My personal experience is they treat me like they would want to be treated, with love, respect, dignity, compassion and like they know me and care. I have been really blessed to have the Bardstown Kentucky team taking care of me. I'm still able to work, I don't have to take narcotics, and they keep my pain in check. I realize as time goes on it will become worse, but for now I feel confident I am going to be ok!|The doctors and nurses at this office are amazing. They are kind patient very understanding and funny. I would highly recommend this place to a family member or friend|The Best pain management facility around. Erica is who I see regularly and she actually cares. You're not just another patient, the effort and communication with her is amazing.|Doctor and his assistant were very pleasant. All of my questions were answered. He was very thorough and very personable. Great bedside manner. I am so very glad that I chose Commonwealth pain and spine!!|Erica, my provider is my refuge and my help. She is so.very compassionate and caring. She is very thorough and helps me with complex medical issues and traveling through, at times, and unfeeling system or if I just need comforting, providing solutions to complex problems. I highly respect her and I would be lost without her care! As a retired healthcare provider myself I complement her professionalism while being able to positively affect my well being!

column2: Owensboro Health Pain Management in Owensboro
column3:
At Owensboro Health Medical Group - Pain Management, we understand that when you're struggling with pain, relief can't come soon enough. Our dedicated team in Owensboro, Kentucky specializes in comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's needs.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a range of advanced pain control treatments at our state-of-the-art facility, including:

  • Personalized pain assessment and management plans

  • Innovative interventional procedures

  • Comprehensive approach to chronic and acute pain

  • Compassionate care from experienced specialists

Our physicians, including Dr. Lee and Dr. Lamar, take the time to listen carefully to your concerns, explain treatment options thoroughly, and develop effective strategies for managing your pain. We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms, ensuring you receive the highest quality care in a supportive environment. Visit our Owensboro Health Pain Management website to learn more about our services or call us at (270) 688-3550. We're conveniently located at 1000 Breckenridge St #205, Owensboro, KY 42303.

column40:
Very nice and helpful staff. I have fought various types of pain for years. All I ever received was a few tests and lots of pills. Dr. Lee is finally someone that seems to understand my problems and offers various ways to deal with it. So thankful to have found a PCP that directed me to Dr. Lee.|I've been a patient of Dr. Lee for several years and through that time he has shown true care and concern for my issues. He's offered solutions and taken time with me explaining all aspects of my care, treatment and procedures.
I wish all my Healthcare professionals were as compassionate as Dr. Lee|Christina Lamar was hands down the rudest most judgmental Dr. i have ever seen. Shows no compassion or concern whatsoever. I would never recommend her to anyone !!|Went there for my first time and had the best experience of my life. Doctor Lee and his staff treated me with so much respect. They truly cared about my health.|I have been seeing Dr. Lamar for years. I feel very trusting with her knowing me and the care I receive from other providers.|Everyone treated me with compassion  and  were polite. Listened well and were quite professional.  Very  knowledgeable and explained everything in terms I could fully understand - this is the way a visit with a physician is expected to be.|I've been going to Dr. Lee for several yrs now and I've never ever had a Dr like him. He's the best out there. He has the best bedside manor and has always treated me kindly. Him and his whole staff are the sweetest people and I always recommend my family members to go and see him. I've had one other pain Dr before Dr Lee and every time I went to see him, I always had to wait 4 hrs or longer to see him, but with Dr Lee I've never had to wait more than 30 min's unless he was behind or doing other procedures. There was one time that I really needed to see him and he was really busy but yet he saw me when he didn't have to and I really appreciate that about him. He's #1 in my book.|Dr. Lee was extremely compassionate and understanding. He listened and was very open to all of my questions and concerns. His answers were very thorough and helped to ease my mind. The first time I met him he walked into the room and knew IN DETAIL everything about my medical history and what I was struggling with. The office staff was also very nice. I am so glad that I found a doctor that will listen and is willing to help.

column40:
I switched to Zhou Pain Mgt this year as recommended by a friend. He listens, asks questions, discusses possible solutions and is a great doctor. Wait time is never much. When I have a hard time getting through on the phone, I can get an email response that day. I love this place!|This is far the most worst clinic ever. I had an appointment at 2 o'clock. I did not get out until almost 5 o'clock when I went in they had just gave a lady a Anastasia shot in her back and she passed out in the last appointment. they did the same and the lady passed out, but it was a different lady each time they always try to talk you into getting shots so they can get paid more . They staff is lazy and rude and disrespectful. They expect you to come in for a pill count after you work 12 hour shifts and they do not have any other way to see your pill count like zoom like other doctors. The farm most worst pain management, doctor I've been to. I discharge myself|Dr. Zhou and his staff are great. I was going to another clinic here in Louisville, and they were not helping at all and only wanted me to participate in treatment that doesn't work for me. I explained everything to Dr. Zhou and he knew how to help. He is a great listener and has helped like no other! Highly recommend!!! Here is a pic of the killer goose outside of his office so beware!|Dr zhou has been my doctor for almost 20 years. When I first went to him he was at the pain institute on Whittington Pkwy now he has his own personal practice. Before he ever treated me I went to tell him my concerns about getting epidurals. He sat down with me and actually listened to what I said unlike a lot of doctors these days who stand in the doorway and rush you to finish talking. I found him to be warm and considerate. I trust doctor zhou and would not trust another doctor for my pain management needs. As a result I have referred several of my family and friends to him and they like him as well. The girls in the office are also warm and considerate and help as much as they can. I would hands down and without reservation sugget Dr zhou to anyone in need of a pain management doctor.|Dr. Zhou has been excellent in all categories regarding my pain management. I have seen other doctors and none of them have provided me with the level of personal care that Dr. Zhou has provided me with. The Staff are always super friendly and attentive to my personal needs as well. I highly recommend Zhou Pain Management if you are seeking a well respected pain management practice!|I met Dr. Zhou when I was in so much pain that I could not even sit down. I was discouraged and on the verge of applying for disability. This doctor has been able to manage multiple injuries and seems to remember everything about my life and what is important for me. The office communicates clearly and they keep it simple. Their technology is impressive because they always greet me on my calls, the email reminder stands out in my inbox and I don't get any annoying/unnecessary communications. The scheduled calls keeps me prepared before my appointment and I am usually seen on time. Dr. Zhou focuses fully on me for my visit, so I never feel rushed. Go here if you need a doctor and team of people who are results-driven!|I have had a great experience at Zhou Pain Management. The girls at the front desk helped me fill out my paperwork when I first went in and was too injured to do so myself. I am getting the help I needed after a truly horrific accident when others treated me like a criminal for asking for help. I am thankful for their assistance and kindness. Some other reviewers seem to leave negative reviews without providing any context and it makes me think they went in with certain demands or expectations. I have a lot of respect for Dr Zhou and appreciate him listening to me vent about my pain when I know he has to hear it all day from others.|Dr. Zhou is very knowledgeable and efficient, which is great when you're in a lot of pain. I believe they prioritize the patients getting procedures, which is awesome when you're in a lot of pain and need a nerve block or a cortisone injection - I'm usually out the door in half an hour. With sedation and things like radio-frequency ablation (which I've had here twice in the last 5 years - on my neck), I can't vouch for how long it takes since.. you know, sedation, but the results have been wonderful.
Staff is very friendly and greets me by name every time, and they make a genuine effort to help me feel comfortable. As a chronic pain patient with cervical stenosis, I hope I don't need to keep seeing any pain doctors at all, but since I'm probably gonna have to, I'm sticking with Dr. Zhou. You all are doing a fantastic job! Thank you so much for everything you do.

At Atlas Pain and Spine, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive interventional pain management solutions to help our patients achieve a better quality of life. Located in Corbin, Kentucky, our state-of-the-art clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions effectively.

Our Specialized Services

We offer a wide range of interventional pain management procedures tailored to each patient's unique needs:

  • Epidural steroid injections for back and leg pain

  • Joint injections for hip and other joint pain

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain relief

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

  • Diagnostic evaluations to identify pain sources

Under the leadership of Dr. Whealton, our team of medical professionals includes nurse practitioners and physician assistants who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. We take the time to listen to our patients, understand their pain concerns, and explain treatment options thoroughly. Our modern facility at 1498 W Cumberland Gap Pkwy is designed for patient comfort, with minimal wait times and efficient procedures.

For those suffering from chronic pain conditions, we invite you to visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 606-280-7875 to schedule a consultation.

column40:
Dr Whealton is so funny, best bed side manners ever(and that means so much)...I love his Dad jokes, thats our thing, we joke and get through the procedures. Always listens to all my concerns and makes sure that I understand what is going on with my back and how it can effect other parts of my body. The rest of his staff are excellent to. I've never had to wait long. Procedures are quick and as painless as can be. I think this Dr is going to continue to help me until I'm out of pain. I would recommend them to anyone!|Dr. Whealton & staff are amazing.
The office manager goes above and beyond to try and make sure patients are able to get the treatment that they deserve or need.
If you're looking for a pain management doctor that cares, I recommend Atlas.|I have had back and leg pain for 45 years. I have never had any help with my back pain from any other doctor other than DR Thomas Whealton at Atlas Pain and Spine. He put shots in my back that alleviated 100% of my back pain. It was absolutely awesome to be able to walk without my powerchair! He is fantastic and has a great attitude. He listens and last but not least, he cares. I positively would recommend Dr Whealton. There are no better pain or back doctors.|My 73 year old mother, who is a retired APRN, has moved down here from Indiana to help me with my son, her Autistic grandson. She was refused tx with medicine she has been taking for years.. she was referred to you guys from her PCP.. she was treated like she was some kind of drug seeker.. she barely takes anything she is prescribed and the most cautious.. she has her masters  in psychiatric nursing and has worked in addiction tx all her life.. shame on you for not treating her appropriately for her pain..I'm going to continue to report this and hopefully something will get resolved so future elderly patients will be listened to.. thank you for your unprofessional, neglagent care.|Dr. Whealton is an excellent doctor. He cares about your overall health just as much as the issues causing your chronic pain. I've seen Natasha many times and she is just as kind and thorough in her evaluations. Dustin is a bit newer but my appointments with him were just as positive. Atlas Pain & Spine is not your typical practice. The practitioners are very qualified and have great bedside manners. Their staff is very kind and accommodating and take care of any issue lightning fast. I recommend them for anyone suffering with chronic pain, especially relating to spinal injuries or conditions. I barely ambled into their office about 15 months ago. Now, I don't even walk with the limp I had grown so accustomed to.|I can't say one bad thing about you all. Every one of you all, has had a positive impact upon my journey here. I come for three different shots. 1) Lower back 2) Hip and 3)Leg...... I am so much better off now than I was. Thank you!!! Highly recommend|Dr.Whealton is a wonderful Doctor that absolutely does everything he can for his patients.  He has done amazing things for my dad and has made it possible for him to begin to have a quality-of-life again and be able to walk without always using a cane. Thank you for all you do for your patients Dr.Whealton.|Dr.Whealton and staff are very profession and courteous. Dr. Whealton is very up to date with  current procedures. Dr. Whealton finds the source to your pain and treats according with the correct treatment. Dr. Whealton takes time to listen to you.

column38: Angela Wilburn|Bill Spicer II|Stephanie Fritts|Reba Thomas|Jessica Dukes|tonya wietholter|Mollie Schwab|KEVIN MOORE
column40:
You're basically a drug test and a prescription monthly. And even though you're taking your medicine correctly, if it doesn't show on their test, they threaten you through the mail with termination, but never bring up the issue in person. I know well and good it was in my system. (There's also another reviewer on here who had the same problem.). Performed their test even when I was on painful periods with heavy bleeding.  Had the correct count every month--God forbid I didn't.   And really, since the prescription says "as needed" system detection should not ever been an issue for their patients. If there was a pharmacy closure (which was often--they wouldn't authorize pick up at another location--often times for 3 days).  No returning calls--getting my first appointment required my doctor having to call them after many failed attempts. Horrible patient care!!!  But it was close to my job, so I continued to endure the obsessive measures. And their little "not detected" termination letter hopefully leads me to a more attentive provider.|ANGIE URHAMMER is the most amazing caring physician on the planet. She genuinely  cares for her patients and goes above and beyond to help keep my pain under control. I work 60 hours a week and would not be able to function if not for her. She keeps me up and running so I can provide for my family and earn a living. She honestly is my hero, my life would be unbearable and I would literally be paralyzed with pain. Her treatment plan has allowed me to return to work after a long downtime. She follows all guidelines and doesn't throw opiates down your throat. Until you have experienced catastrophic injury or debilitating pain, nobody can understand the vital role these particular physicians play.|I never met the doctor. They had called day before because doc had an emergency. Okay, I understand, but before I could open my mouth at all the receptionist took an accusing tone because they had left a voicemail the day prior informing me of a need to reschedule and I hadn't returned the call. I had assumed it was just a reminder message since I got it the day before and didn't check my voicemail. I wasn't even upset until she took that tone with me. Should've known it would be bad because when I signed in at the window she *actively* ignored me. Like purposefully avaided looking in my direction. I guess since they're located caddy-corner to the L&N Building, they think they should have the same attitude as the clerks over there. I won't be back. A receptionist is the face of your practice and if you choose her as a representative, I don't trust your judgment and I don't want you touching my back.|I have read the reviews and as of yet I completely disagree. First, I must say, Dr. Haque not only read my records but knew more about my condition than any previous Dr. I was amazed by his concern and knowledge.

Unfortunately, pain management has changed in the last few years. It used to be that anyone with a minor complaint could be seen and receive pain meds. This clinic cannot control what the FDA has done, the new laws and requirements. They are under great pressure to maintain strict records and must have rules in place to ensure that they will  not be shut down, to say it plain and clear.

So, I have a real problem with my spine and a disease in my spine so I have not been treated badly by anyone and hopefully never will.

People need to realize that they should write their congressman. The American Pain Institute has no control over the rules and regulations that the FDA is continuing to impose.|I was the driver for my mom who was having an injection and being sedated.  The waiting room was full. I was told I had to wait on her in the waiting room or she couldn't have sedation.  I am a nurse also and told them with COVID I did not feel comfortable and would wait in the car.  When she is done text me and I will be right up.  They said no but I could wait in the hallway.  People in the hallway did not have masks on at all so I explained that wouldn't work either. They still refused to text and refused to give her sedation since I did not want to wait and potentially be exposed to COVID.  I have never heard of a policy like this.  Common sense says the less people in the waiting room the less risk.   My mom waited for 90 min past her appt time in that waiting room before taken back.  She states during that time no one came out to sanitize chairs or anything. This was the Carrollton office.|I wouldn't recommend this place they are rude they never answer the phone or return your phone calls only open 2 days a week the doctor talks down to you the lady that does your blood pressure is only there for a paycheck I wouldn't put my dog there just a bad experience an you never meet the doctor|They NEVER answer or return calls! This place must be some kind of scam. Read all reviews and not the BS reviews that their staff is writing! Tired of wasting my time getting in here. Going elsewhere that's more reputable. They've probably been shut down is my guess since we have left messages every day for at least two weeks! If they can't return a call or ever answer their business phone, think about how patient care will be at this joint.|Angie Urhammer Is A Amazing Young Lady . She Has Really Helped Me Out . And Spent More Time With Me Then Other Doctors Has In The Past . She Truly Cares For Her Patients

column48: What is the cancellation policy?
column49: Generally, we ask that you call us at least 24 hours before your appointment if you have to cancel so that we can give someone else who is waiting your appointment slot. We understand that emergencies do happen and in the case 24 hour notice is not possible, we ask that you still call or have someone call us to let us know.

column3:
At UK Interventional Pain Medicine, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from post-operative, chronic, and cancer-related pain syndromes. Our dedicated team of specialists at

The Interventional Pain Clinic

combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help restore quality of life. We offer a wide range of specialized services including:

  • Targeted pain injections for back, neck, and joint pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

As part of the University of Kentucky Healthcare system, our faculty actively participates in anesthesia-related research to advance pain management techniques and improve patient outcomes. We're conveniently located at Kentucky Clinic South, 2400 Greatstone Point a100, Lexington, KY 40504. To schedule a consultation with our pain management physicians, please call us at (859) 323-7246 or visit our UK Interventional Pain Medicine website for more information about our services.

column40:
My daughter was referred here due to her pediatric pain management doctor leaving UK and her being eighteen now. The rude intake lady said they won't accept her as a patient because her referral indicated that she needs medication management and they don't do that. In fact there is no pain management doctor that does medication management at UK, so she will have to find an outside provider (even though all of her medical care is at UK). I asked if they could at least continue the stellate ganglion blocks that she has been getting and was told the doctors there don't do those. I asked what the doctors there do to help people with pain. She said they help people with injections for musculoskeletal pain such as back, neck, and knee pain. I said that's exactly what my daughter has been suffering from for the last year after having covid. She just rudely reiterated that they won't be taking my daughter as a patient. I felt like she took pleasure in denying my daughter care. My daughter is very medically complex and sees many different specialists, all at UK. This is the first time I have been treated rudely and my daughter denied care. I will be making a formal complaint to UK.|I have had several injections in my shoulder, lower back and neck. Dr. Christopher Mallard is very professional and I trust him. Yes, they do train future doctors but that should be expected at University of Kentucky.  No, the shots don't last forever but for 2-3 months I am pain free. It's  better than going under the knife for me.|Dr. Mallard and his staff are world class!
They have a real concern for their patients, and do what is best to manage their pain.|I recently was fitted with a temporary device to determine if I would find relief from my chronic pain.
Dr. Grider and his Staff took very good care of me with the placement, trial, and removal/assessment of my device!
The results were Game Changing!
Unbelievable! Awesome!
I look forward to having my permanent device implanted, and resuming a normal, pain free life!

Update; two weeks ago I had my permanent device installed; this morning I had my sutures removed!
For the first time in 29 months I am totally pain free. Dr. Grider, and the great folks at Good Samaritan Hospital took great care of me, and helped me get my life back! Thank you!|My primary physicians tried for months to refer me to a pain clinic, after 8 months it was either go to a pain clinic for help or have my arm amputated the pain was unbearable. I chose UK Interventional Pain Associates because I have several health issues, my primary physician and specialist are at UK therefore the pain clinic would have access to all my medical records.

I had no issues with the staff or physicians. I was seen timely, treated very well. However now I question everything at this clinic.

I was seen seen the first week of August all went well they added a muscle relaxer in addition to pain medication and sent me on my way with a follow up visit 10.1.18. On Aug. 24 I received a letter dated 8/6/18 discharging me from their clinic for two reasons 1-tested positive for methadone 2-for not improving.....
First) I don't take methadone and don't know anyone who takes methadone. Second) as for not improving...I must disagree, I see immunology, pulmonary specialist at least monthly at UK hosp. Because I see the pain doctors I'm able to keep those appointments, before I would have to reschedule until I was having a deceit day. These specialist have cut down on my inpatient stays in the hospital.
How is it not physician abandonment to mail a dear John letter to a chronically I'll patient. I know they have regulatory hoops to jump thru but don't they have ethics that patient care must come before regulatory issues. Very dishearten & disappointed in the whole process.|I had one appointment at this pain clinic for severe chronic back pain. They prescribed me a pain medicine for once a day at 50 mg, a very small amount which was fine. I month  later I received a letter saying that I tested positive for a drug that I've never heard of and have never taken and never will. I tried to call to clarify the mistake and ask them to do a repeat on the urine analysis and return my to return my calls. They never responded and said that I cannot come back. I do not even want my pain medicine, I just want this clarified that I have never taken an opioid and I have contacted my attorney to file a lawsuit against them.|Update! It's now been six weeks and still no appointment scheduled...

Treatment received is good WHEN YOU CAN GET IT! I had an appointment, and they wouldn't let me schedule my next appointment in office (every 30 days) and told me I'd have to call to make another appointment. So, I called and they don't make appointments over the phone. Told me I would get a call back so I waited and waited and waited (in pain). It's been two weeks since I called to request my next appointment. I called back again today and was told it's still waiting approval. I'm now wondering if they'll even see me or if I need to go back to my primary care doc and find a new provider. Also, receptionist is consistently rude. Doctors have good beside manner, however. I've never experienced another office taking weeks and weeks to sign a piece of paper so they can allow you to make an appointment. If you're in pain, don't expect to be seen promptly or even on schedule.|I went there for pain. Cyst on spine. I have had two shots for pain in last 8 yrs. Went to this clinic to see about getting another shots. The pain starts gradually at the base of my spine. If I let it go without shots the pain gets worse and overtime I can't walk or straighten up. They told me insurance would not cover it. I called back and they said they were working on something else to get it approved. Heard nothing called back left message. Now 4 weeks ago and no call back. Called insurance and according to them the clinic never called or sent in paper work. So now I am in extreme pain and can't walk very far. Would not recommend this place.

Comprehensive Pain Management in Louisville

column40:
Dr. Peters was a good and very caring doctor. If it is only due to staff filling scripts, he should be able to return to his practice. I really miss this doctor he gave great ephirduals. I was a patient for 26yrs.|Dr. Peters was the best Dr hands down I've ever had for my pain issues. I do hope he comes back as I seen he is on a 1 year probation only, so we are rooting for you Doc.|Dr peters was the first doctor that actually listened to me and helped my pain after having a vehicle accident with a semi truck. My pain was real and I felt crippled however that doesn't matter in a world like today because the bills don't stop and I had to continue to work. I am a single mother with no help so I had to keep working. If it wasn't for Dr Peter's I would have had to file for short term disability. Dr Peter's listened to my concerns and took me serious without judgement since I am younger.  He helped me to continue to live my life and do most (not all) of my daily activities by treating my pain. He was always honest with me and I was always honest with him about how I was doing. He is very smart and kind. He gave me a few spinal epidurals which also helped me gain mobility back directly after my accident. Dr Peter's staff was great and always provided in a timely manner. Thank you Dr Peter's for helping me get back on track to normalcy. God speed.|I was in so much sciatica nerve pain and was not only in pain but depressed from having to lay in bed crying as much as I had to breath I could count on the pain.Went to Dr after Dr after Dr tests that that they would put me though and money I spent trying to just feel li ke I was worth more than just trying to do regular things most people take for granted they can do without pain. He examined me thourly and gave me meds to help with some management with pain ..He listened to me and then said I would benefit having a stimulator .I was not up for no surgery's...But I let him do the trial and it worked so well I didn't want to have it taken out, I have been his patient for 6 to 7 years ...I Can't tell anyone about the pain they don't feel my pain because no one knows what they are experiences until they have to deal with it them selves. There is not a Dr in this world that I trust as much as Dr peters was for me. He made my life tolerable from bed ridden and crying to being able to play with my children, grandchildren and great grandchildren again .To take away this man's career that helped over 300 patient's he helped is not exceptable....They see the small screen in front of them but he sees the whole picture..And this is how they treat him for making so many other's life worth living.|I've been going to Dr Peter's for several years. He's the best pain Dr I've ever been to and I experienced some very terrible ones, that didn't care. Dr Peter's always takes all the time I need to help me. I have chronic back pain. And I don't want surgery, I'm afraid of becoming a cripple. So yes I take pain meds, so I can continue to function and work. I don't want to switch drs and I'm really hoping to try to stay with him. He is honest and truly cares about his pts. Whatever they are doing to him is ABSOLUTELY UNFAIR to him and ESPECIALLY HIS PT's. I'm also a nurse and I've seen what surgery can do to people. Dr Peter's knows this. If I even have to change my meds I still want to stay with him. He's just the best, he's truly saved my life. So I can continue to give excellent pt care to those that need it. I don't abuse my meds, far from it. I'm very conservative with them. Dr Peters, is the best DR, I've ever had PERIOD, not just my pain management but he's better than any Dr Ive ever had. It's a shame they put so many regulations on these drs. He's so kind that he called me personally. He really cares about his pts. And this just sucks. He quickly referred me to another dr, so that I don't have to be without my meds, BUT I DONT WANT ANOTHER DR!! He knows me and I trust him. Please reconsider whatever your doing to him to limit his prescribing abilities. These government bureaucrats need to stay off these Dr's backs!! They went to school for several years to be able to practice medicine, and you've put handcuffs on them like they're criminals!! Just because some people are stupid and abuse their meds shouldn't be blamed on the Dr. Every person makes their own choices and it's not the Dr's fault!!! Especially Dr Peter's!!!|Dr. Peters is a highly skilled and compassionate medical professional who has consistently demonstrated genuine concern for the well-being of each of his patients. Over the past decade, he has provided me with exceptional care and attention. Dr. Peters treats his patients as individuals, not just numbers, and his dedication to their well-being is evident in every interaction. The recent events surrounding Dr. Peters are deeply concerning and have had a devastating impact on everyone involved. My thoughts are with Dr. Peters, his family, and his staff during this difficult time. I firmly believe that Dr. Peters is innocent of any wrongdoing and that the DEA's actions are misguided and unjust. By taking away Dr. Peters' livelihood, the DEA is not only causing emotional turmoil for him and his patients but also depriving the community of a valuable medical resource. I am hopeful that the truth will prevail and that Dr. Peters will be able to continue providing the exceptional care that his patients have come to rely on.
#IStandWithDrPeters
#JusticeForDrPeters
#GodBlessDrLawrencePeters
#PeaceBeWithYou
#TheBestDr
#DrLawrencePeters
#ShameOnDEA|Dr Peters is easily, the kindest, most caring, compassionate, empathetic Dr I've ever had in my life. He has always made me feel comfortable, validated my concerns, & given me real solutions, never just a bandage & he's never once been condescending or tried to 'pump me up with pills.' In fact, he continues to seek alternatives to treat conditions that other Dr's find too complicated to treat. He has gotten to the root causes of conditions that specialists couldn't, has found real solutions & I am finally in a place where I actually feel like myself again. I wouldn't be here, truly, if not for him. He has saved my life, realizing I had autoimmune disease because he requires his patients to be seen so often to oversee their progress, monitor any medication they're taking & to ensure their safety. His dieting advice when another Dr put me on a GLP-1, not only helped me lose weight, but because of understanding my GI history so well, has kept all side effects at bay. I am so grateful to him! He found a non-narcotic solution to migraines & seizures that have plagued me for decades. I haven't had 1 since he started me on that medicine & my own neurologist couldn't get them under control!
He understands his patients & takes time with them. He never rushes you. He sits with you, listens, let's you ask questions, speaks softly, with you, never at you. I've never heard a cross, hateful or hurtful word come out of his mouth. I never have felt put off or offended by him. I never get nervous, bothered by or feel like I've had to go out of my way to come to my appointments with him (despite the 45 minute drive when traffic moves well) because he makes you feel so at ease. He asks pertinent questions & remembers personal details about your life, things that most people might otherwise find trivial. I often bring my service dog with me. She's gotten older & now has cancer. He knows how her well-being has affected my life & will affect me in the future. And he truly cares. I always leave my appointments feeling like I have had not just a conversation with one of the brightest people I've ever had the pleasure of knowing, but also an appointment with a Dr who checks up on everything from my chronic pain & the effects of the medication I take, to my ortho/spinal & neuro issues, to fibro & auto-immune disease, & often even a mini-therapy session. I learn more each time I am there because he takes the time to explain things. I've gone in feeling so down & defeated at times from a life that I never dreamed would be my own. 'I did not go to school so that I could be like this,' I often pity myself. But, thank God, this man has given me the ability to get past those emotional hurdles & see that field of hope.
For those of you feeling the need to suddenly give a 1star review, bash & belittle him, his staff & practice (the last one in particular), I emplore you to do your research, (the nightly news does better stories on kitty litter). This man has been targeted for several years & what has happened has nothing to do with money or greed. KY is a big target because of its pill mill reputation. The most disgusting thing here is they've targeted an honest man who isn't a mill, didn't steal, didn't give out meds to his staff or sell cash prescriptions, & who didn't fraud the Medicare/caid system.
I often wonder why he keeps practicing with all the disrespect he receives from patients. I see it in the office & I see it here. But I know its because he cares about his patients. So maybe, before bashing him because 'your mom' can't get 'her' pills, that she's been 'pumped up with,' breathe, think about some of those things, try & imagine what this Dr, his family & staff must be going through, wait for them to help her until he's reinstated (especially since she still has a few days until her next rx is due). Maybe don't bite the hand that feeds? I imagine in the '15 years' that your mom was in his care, you weren't complaining about those meds, especially since you're so upset that her PCP wont give her any now.
Your ignorance is showing.|Lawrence PierceWhat's a wonderful pain doctorI miss him I didn't have to go all over town to get an injectionHe also gave me a 2-month outAnd I was never toldHow's it After my medicine ran out he was on point and making my medicine there on time this doctor is very very messed

Totally unprofessional in all aspects of treatment!|This place is about to be facing abandonment claims after my father whom is a paralyzed man and when chair bound with a steel rod in his back has been treated like trash by the place from the very beginning he was 10 minutes late for his appointment due to his difficulty in finding adequate parking for the handicapped and the lady made him sit there all day until the end of there day in order to to see if dr would see him that should have been a sign for us but just a few months in this man whom has never so much as drank a beer or smoked a cigarette failed a drug screen for meth if it wasn't so sad it would be comical and tried asking for a new test and to speak to the dr considering he is on multiple medicines that will show a false positive it is unacceptable that they discharged him after being in pain meds for nearly 20 years and never failed a drug test or a pill count as they did this time as well and for them to not do a confirmation test is patient abandonment and then further more to not allow the patient to address his concerns with the dr but rather a woman who is simply a receptionist is not acceptable either this lady claims there test can't be wrong because they know as do everything right I'll be contacting an attorney and looking to sue This practice for patient abandonment this is a open and shut case of just that and if they refuse to supply the original sample then more questions and concerns will follow I wil be requesting these today it is so sad that you can't even trust your dr to give you care you need I wil not watch my dad whom has done nothing wrong suffer as he withdrawls from medicine this dr put him on and then abandoned him with no means of finding a new dr this man has never dome drugs other than prescribed medications his entire life looking forward to getting this to the medical board and necessary courts to hold this place accountable|The office staff was wonderful and great. And Dr. Micheal C. Creean seem very concerning to his patients. And wants the best treatment plan you can possibly have. He wanting me to take injections I've had them done before at another clinic didn't work. So I'm willing to give them a try see what they can do. And plus I need to discuss some other issues with my treatment. Cause the injections after while they don't perform like that should.|Dr. Kroner is great.  He has a great sense of humor and explains things fully.  Shiloh is terrific.  She goes over and beyond what most practitioners do.  Very patient, though and considerate. I highly recommend them both.|Though the results are good, they are not sensitive to a person's time. Thirty-five minutes after scheduled appointment, my 88-year-old mother was still not seen. Returned home in pain from sitting so long!|Dana and the staff at the Pain institute are excellent. The different options are discussed with you thoroughly and they help you find the best option for you. Excellent doctors available for epidurals and blocks performed. Excellent care with a truly caring health care professional.|The Pain Institute is a great place to go for your pain issues. He also discovered a huge issue with my neck which we found out I had a collapsed disk and he sent me to the best Neurosurgeon in town, Dr. Doss. Had surgery got it fixed and feeling 100% better now. Would definitely recommend see Dr. Cronen and his staff.|This office is amazing...I had been having migraines for about a month and I went to see Dr. Cronen for them and he helped tremendously with a prescription called Nurtec. Within 20 mins of taking it my migraine was gone. I also do the Biote pellets there for the hormone replacement therapy and with those about every 3 months i haven't had to use the nurtec as often cause they have helped with my stress and headaches, plus they help with joint pain and i am so much more energy then before. There staff are all so nice and helpful, must have all new staffing then from before. I really would recommend The Pain institute!!
