column40:
Dr's and staff very pleasant. They pay attention to your needs and give you advice on how to manage your pain. I would recommend this place.|I had the misfortune of having an appointment with Dr. Rupert at this location. I proceeded to tell him my condition and I was very understanding that, in my particular situation, getting better or back to where I was probably is just not in the cards. After having several doctor visits, physical therapies, and a MRI this was a last ditch effort to seeing if I could ever be 100% again. I proceeded to ask him several questions because my condition is personal to me and can be debilitating at times. He seemed to be in a bit of a rush and proceeded to make fun of my questions and laugh at them with the nurse, saying "let me look at my crystal ball." He then asked if I understood the joke? It was very discouraging to me, as someone just wanting answers for my pain. I can't speak about the clinic itself, but I would not go to this doctor as he was not professional in the least.|I don't do illegal drugs been going there over a year now. All of a sudden I failed a test that they did not notify me of. I got a letter in the mail and if I come on premises they will call the law. Been calling for 2 weeks and no response. I need to know who is top staff there over all of the center. I don't know why they won't call me back with an explanation.  Hanging up on me being snobby. Never have I ever had a problem with them till now. If it was a mistake admit it and give me my appt back this is not fair.|I'm celebrating 10 years of sobriety today.

Most of you know me, but don't know my story...

18 years ago I was in a near fatal car accident. I got put on opioids for the pain, and was addicted within 1 week.
I NEVER bought the opioids off the street, and they were ALL legally doctor prescribed. I was in active opioid addiction for 7.5 years. My pain specialist at that time had me on 10, Lortab 10's a day...

I hit rock bottom, and by Gods grace, I got into a new pain management specialist, Dr. JT Ruxer.

I owe my life to this doctor. Without him, I would be dead by now.

On September 16th, 2014, I decided I was tired of my own shit, and I flushed every single pain pill I had.

I was in withdrawal for 46 days. I did this at home, alone, with my service K9, Minka watching over me.
I'd have to say that these 46 days of withdrawal were the absolute worst, and also the best time in my life.

I learned how incredibly strong I am. I learned to count on my faith in God, and God never failed me.

Today, I am so incredibly proud to say I've made it 10 years sober.

Even though sometimes it's still 1 day at a time, I know that I can do it... 

Please friends, remember, addiction affects everyone, NOT just the addict.|I will never recommend anyone of my friends or family to go to elite pan pain and spine. I know the statistics for African-American and doctors and specially black women that are treated totally different. They'll make you seem like that. Everything is OK and then they'll call you in for pill count which I passed then they'll say oh you had an unsatisfactory urine but you wouldn't tell me that face-to-face. You had to send me a certified letter. I kept telling them that the shots weren't working, we need to try something else but they never listen. They don't take my advice. I found someone else who listens to me. We talk about it. We're gonna try different things and I appreciate that and then what I tell them they don't use against me I like to talk to my doctor and if I can express how I feel because you're gonna cut me off because you think I'm so addictive, but you keep providing me with the medicine  Will never ever recommend anybody to go to elite and spine. Because and one of their PA flunkies is the rudest he walk in don't speak sit down at the computer. Don't ask me anything. I'm sitting there looking at him. He does it make it comfortable for me to talk to him or am I'm supposed to say anything so he goes, you had one little trace of I can't remember what it was but I knew I had been taken TheraFlu and what is the cold medicine NyQuil so he cut me off and was like you have to come every month for a year so I said OK I did the whole year. Urine test were very good , he's rude. I don't know cause I'm black which I'm sure it was cause I don't see too many Black people in there you can talk to Doctor about his PAs. They don't believe you and the patient is always in the wrong.|I have been a patient in pain management care since 2007 and the doctor my general practitioner referred me to was good but Shane Taylor and all the staff at Elite Pain & Spine have introduced me to things that have brought me more relief in a year than my previous provider. I live with pain everyday and some days it is not easily managed but I love how they listen to you and try to alleviate any or all pain. Thank you|I like the Doctors and the rest if the staff. They listen to you and your concerns. And do everything they can, to give you the very best treatment that's right for you. They DON'T  just brush you off like you don't matter. And they don't herd you in and out like cattle to be slaughtered.|I'm not sure if it's his age or the tattoos but the staff is some of the rudest I've ever seen. They act like he doesn't need to be there even though he came limping in the office no difference than everyone else there. I've never had people that are there to HELP be so RUDE.

column40:
Dr muniswamy and his staff are amazing. Very comforting and very  compassionate. Listen to your concerns and do their best to achieve the best results for your pain. I have see them a few times and definitely recommend anyone that's in pain to visit and see for themselves|I so wish I could leave negative stars. No stars minus stars. This facility cares nothing about people whatsoever. They're rude inconsiderate they've cost me my job. Because of their incompetence, an incapability of doing their jobs correctly. I could go on for days about how bad my experience has been with this facility and the Doctor.|Got shots and didn't relieve any of my pain. He just keep saying do you have any questions for me. So next visit I went to the Paris office and seen a Lady PA she was very nice and listened to how my pain had not subsided. She proscribed meloxicam and it relieved my pain but the very next follow up I seen Muniswarmy again and he said you're not getting anymore pills (Which was not a narcotic) I said but it's stopped the pain. Never offered anymore treatment but wanted me to make another appointment and I did and soon canceled it.. what a waste of time and money!!|Working to control pain in people is a difficult job; I  have chronic back pain since I was a teenager. I am being  going to see Dr . Vinod Musigwamy since few months a go and he has done a great  job to control my chronic back pain.|Dr. Mumiswamy has been my doctor I want to say 5 years. He has been giving me injections for neck pain and doing the ablation of nerves in my neck which really works. He even saw how I was walking one time and asked if I had back pain, I didn't at the time.  A year went by and I started having back pain. I think he actually predicted me pain before I experienced it. He did a procedure/surgery which completely took away my back pain. If something does not work for you (It happens) they will try something else that will work. Just let them know. I also had an issue in my arm which none of the doctors could figure out. Daniel listened to me and got me in touch with a doctor who instantly solved my problem and did the surgery. I was in chronic pain crying and they have always taken me seriously. All the nurses are really caring as well. I really don't think they get enough compliments for all they do. Thank you. The front office is awesome as well always getting in touch with the correct people.|I received the most excruciating pain of my entire life from the hands of Dr. Maxpain Muniswamy.
The nurses were incredible and sympathetic but
Muniswamy couldn't have cared less about what he did. I needed a lower back injection to relieve the pain of the arthritis in my back. After the procedure I never saw the guy again! I'm not sure if he is just incompetent or just enjoys administering
tortious pain!   After all, it is a pain center.
If you are in need of back pain injections, proceed at your own risk, or go SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!
His reputation must proceed him because I went to a clinic in Lexington and the nurse asked me where I went before coming here and when I told he she replied "oh yea I've heard of that guy".|I've been seeing Dr Muniswamy for about 5 years. Nerve blocks and then ablation for my lower back. The first ablation lasted 4 years and recently went back to have it done again last week. I'm free of pain once again. He and his staff are all kind and caring people.|TLDR: Incredible office staff, but careless physician.

My experience with Dr. Muniswamy's staff, especially Nikki & Justice, was phenomenal. They were kind, patient & attentive. However, I cannot say the same for Dr. Muniswamy.

I have experienced chronic migraines for most of my life & they seem to be exacerbated by the fact that I clench my jaw and grind my teeth. I had previously been injected with Botox for migraines, as well as in my masseter muscles for TMJ. When I went to Dr. Muniswamy's office, we talked through these things and scheduled an appointment for injections. When I called to confirm it had been approved by insurance, I was told 200 units had been approved. Given that he had told me standard protocol for migraines was between 100-150 units, I assumed that meant the other 50-100 units would go into my jaw, which seems to be one of the main sources of my tension and migraines.

When I arrived for my appointment, Dr. Muniswamy did not explain the procedure, tell me where he was injecting, or give me any idea what to expect. In less than 10 minutes he had injected across my face, head, neck and shoulders without marking any of his injection sites (I have never received botox without it being mapped out for symmetry). He told me he was finished and I asked about my jaw. He told me he wasn't doing my jaw, and I reminded him of our conversation at my last appointment. He eventually said that he remembered that now (did he not read my chart before coming in or take notes about my pain during my last appointment?), but there wasn't anything he could do because 45 of the Botox units have to be wasted and it would be fraud to inject them elsewhere. I expressed my frustration and told him I felt like this was a waste of $1,000 (he seemed shocked that it cost that much), when the tension in my face/jaw is what drove me to the appointment in the first place. He cared very little about my pain or experience and promptly left the room.

Nikki tried to comfort me and worked hard to make things right, and for that I am grateful. However, as a doctor who is treating patients living with chronic pain, I would expect that they would listen to their patient and collaborate on a treatment plan that best fits their needs, rather than utilizing a "one size fits all" treatment. I will not be returning to this office and strongly recommend you seek out a different provider if you are looking for pain management options.

At Restorative Pain Institute, we are led by Dr. Timothy J. Beacham, MD, F.A.S.A., a board-certified specialist in Interventional Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology. With a distinguished career that includes serving as Assistant Professor of Anesthesiology/Pain Medicine at UMMC, Dr. Beacham brings exceptional expertise to our Louisville practice. Our approach to pain management is comprehensive and patient-centered, focusing on helping individuals regain their quality of life through innovative treatments.

Our Specialized Services

We offer a range of advanced pain management solutions including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Non-opioid pain management options

  • Integrative approaches to chronic pain

Dr. Beacham's leadership in organized medicine, along with his contributions to multiple peer-reviewed research articles and book chapters, ensures our patients receive care based on the latest medical advancements. We pride ourselves on taking the time to listen, educate, and develop personalized treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain, not just the symptoms. Visit our Restorative Pain Institute website to learn more about how we can help you on your journey to recovery. column11: Timothy J. Beacham, MD, F.A.S.A. is board certified in Interventional Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology. Dr. Beacham has co-authored multiple peer reviewed research articles and book chapters. Dr. Beacham has co-authored multiple peer reviewed research articles and book chapters. His office is very responsive and professional.|Dr. Beacham as well as Ann and Jenny are phenomenal. I've been at this location when it was a previous doctor who owned it. So I've been here through many changes. And I think Dr. Beacham and his nurse practioners are wonderful! Having seen all 3 of the above listed I can state that they all listen to you, help think outisde the box, and truly care! They are not just there for your pain, but to help find the source and treat it, and not just with pills. Having UC and being able to get a procedure to help with that is life changing. They are in a transition,and just like in any other profession it's hard to find a stable work force. They are working hard to find the right office staff to fit their needs and who will stick around.. Good staff is hard to find everywhere right now. I have and will continue to refer Dr. Beacham to anyone who needs help with pain and don't want the tradional medicines prescribed. Because Dr. Beacham is very good at finding procedures and supplements that can help tremendously too! Thank you Dr. Beacham and staff and may you continue to have a wonderful practice for years to come!|I've been going to pain Management for years and Dr Beacham is the second doctor I've had and I couldn't ask for a better doctor.He has always been caring and compassionate.He will take time to sit and talk to you and explain everything to you and answer any questions you have. I have followed him around Louisville and even to Frankfort when he was at that office and I live an hour away from each location . you couldn't ask for a better doctor.|I'd give him no stars because HIS STAFF are non educated, non critical thinking.  Having file w medicaid fraud waste n abuse.  THEY VIOLATED MY RIGHTS N STAFF PRACTICING MEDICINE WITHOUT LICENSE.   REFUSEDto fax order to Ky Bureau of  TRANSPORTATION. .....As required to set up transportation for people w cars in their name.... ...I WAS A NURSE , ASST MANAGER CHARGE NURSE N HOUSE SUPervisor....RUN from this office. When u got incompetent staff it's too easy for corruption and extreme cost saving measures take place at detriment to  patient bcuz not one will question anything done.  Bunch of sheep w no brains  on phone..they may seem nice but I have no faith they cud save a person or do CPR correctl. They got big ego for ppl doing wrong n violating pts rights .  U are not allowed practice medicine just bcuz u work for a md. ....it was ordered because it needed be done n u just cancel it cuz u dont want fax something so i can set up Transportation?   A disabled nurse w a TERMINAL NEUROLIGICAL CONDITION??? Never at ANY PAIN MANAGEMENT, for 20 yrs... NORTON DOWNTOWN, U of l , as cancer survivor have Ihad an issue only here......  i been denied treatment because the staff are ignorant.|It is so nice to have a doctors office that returns calls. The staff is very nice, and I've had zero hiccups. Dr. Beachem implanted my pain pump in April 2022, and everything went well. My last pain management office was an absolute nightmare, so I am grateful to be under his care now. We commute 2 hours, and are happy to do it in order to have good care.
Mary Rogers|Dr Beacham is very attentive, listens well and is very informative of treatment options.
His staff was also very friendly and professional. Dr Beacham is soft spoken, and comforting like a teddy bear.|I was bent over like Handi-man and couldn't fly. Dr TB got be together over time and I've been following him ever since. He always listen to the Patient and figure out exactly where the problem is. column2: CSAR, PLLC, Dr. Oliver C. James, MD
column3:
At CSAR, PLLC, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Oliver C. James, MD. As a leading

Pain Management Specialist in Lexington

, Dr. James combines his expertise as both an anesthesiologist and pain physician to deliver personalized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that living with pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we offer a range of advanced interventional procedures and treatment options tailored to each individual's needs.

Our services include:

  • Epidural steroid injections for back and neck pain

  • Pain pump implantation and management

  • Treatment for spinal stenosis

  • Comprehensive chronic pain management

  • Personalized medication management plans

Located at 120 Prosperous Place, Suite 102 in Lexington, KY, our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure effective pain relief solutions. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered approach, taking the time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that address the root cause of your pain. column38: Larry Milburn|Robin Atnip|Patricia Brannock|Connie Hall|Angie Barger|Tina Adams|Alice Young|Mary Noe
column40:
Probably one of the worst experiences I've ever dealt with when they keep coming and asking the same questions over and over again. They put a pain pump in my best friend. And then the pain pump does not work and she keeps calling them. She goes to the ER and they say the pump is not working and they keep doing the same stuff over and over again until she's in so much pain, so she can't even hardly move. This place is ridiculous. They don't follow through. They don't call when they said they're gonna call. I would stay away from this company.  Commonwealth pain clinic is so much better. They have real compassion this place has not.|I don't write a lot of these, but I saw there were some negative comments, so to set the record straight, I have been dealing with chronic pain for 8 years. I spent 6 of them being either undertreated, not treated at all, gaslit, or straight up ignored. I was almost to the point of wanting to die, not because of depression, but because my legs were on fire constantly, I could barely walk, and no one would help. If that was going to be the rest of my life, then it wasn't bearable, nor worth it.

Dr. James was the first doctor to actually listen to me, treat me with respect, and treat the issues. I'm finally to the point where I don't have to be afraid to give an honest assessment of the efficacy of my medication out of fear that they will just decide I'm lying and stop treating me at all. He's very straightforward about treatment options, limitations, and the reasoning behind them, which I appreciate. I don't know where I'd be without this practice, so I would take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.|He performed epidurals in my lower back
It was painful but it did help my back.
Going tomorrow for some neck injections for my spinal stenosis|I really like Dr James and most of his staff. I was there today for my appointment and was very disappointed in the employee that checked me out. She was very rude and acted like she was miserable! I've been a patient for 4+ years and never had this happen before. Maybe she was having a bad day, but if she treats all the patients like she treated me, she needs to find a new job.|This was the best experience I have had in a long time seeing a doctor. The staff was amazing and polite with yes ma'am and no ma'am. Clean office, with pleasant music playing. My wait time was short and I was very nervous. I have had medical chronic pain issues for 2 years with surgeries and no one really listening to me. I met Dr James after my orthopedic and urologist suggested him. He was amazing and listened to everything I said, even joked and laughed with me because I told him how nervous I was. We came up with a plan until I can get a knee replacement in the future, due to my age they want to wait and he is working with both my receding doctors to keep me pain free and healthy. I have had 2 years of horrible visits with other doctors who want nothing more than to take you off meds that work and try other meds or endless injections. I would recommend this group to anyone and nobody was rude or rushed me, I think some reviews are just people not getting a certain way they wanted because you couldn't have asked for a better staff and a more understanding doctor.|There well over a year, seen the actual Dr the first visit ONLY. They called out if the blue while all my grands were here for spring break. I had NO way to get there with 4 kids. Never have they called before, that was the first time. It was completely out of my control. Today I get a letter saying they were discharging me. No warning no real reason and they booted me. They wonder why so many turn to the street for relief, THIS is why. Ive never abused ANY medication..EVER! I've never sold, or given away ANY of my medicatiom and take it exactly as prescribed. I do NO other recreational drugs. They are destroying my quality of life and im absolutely positive they do not care! If I put myself out if this misery i live with 24/7 they would not bat an eye! Shameful practice! Im disabled and can not drive far at all. Me getting there meant waiting for a ride. Thats not possible when everyone is at work and I have 4 small children.|I've been going to this clinic for over 5 years for terminal lupus and other problems. I came home from being at families for Thanksgiving and received a letter in the mail telling me they let me go from the clinic because I missed a meds count. I'm absolutely in shock cause I was never informed that I had an appointment to do a med count, let alone missed it. I've always done everything they've asked of me, never missed appointment, always passed drug test. When I called them to find out what was going on, no one wanted to discuss it, it was just to bad. I know I'll end up in the hospital trying to deal with being taken off meds that quick and it will send my lupus in overdrive! I really don't know where to go from here! Very disappointing!!|I like Dr. James but majority of the staff is rude, mean and unsympathetic. To Edit: had an appointment at 9:30 11/14/23 this morning for an epidural. It's 11 a.m. and no signs of anyone, not even to check on me. 2 hard chairs, my back is hurting. I overheard one of the nurses offer someone a recliner. Excuse me? I'm hurting too! I guess I'm not important enough. I think I need to talk to whoever is in charge. Not very nice. Definitely not happy.

column3:
Advanced Pain Solutions Beyond Traditional Methods

At Wellward, we take a comprehensive approach to pain management that goes beyond conventional treatments. We start with traditional methods but elevate care through our innovative use of live x-ray and ultrasound technologies, allowing us to precisely identify pain sources down to the specific nerve. Our expertise lies in understanding not just what hurts, but why your body hasn't been able to heal itself naturally. We specialize in cutting-edge techniques like Prolotherapy that concentrate your own repair cells at injury sites, maximizing your body's natural healing responses. Our services include:

  • Precision-guided pain interventions

  • Ketamine infusion therapy for depression and anxiety

  • Specialized treatment for addiction and mental health concerns

  • Comprehensive orthopedic care

Located in Lexington, our state-of-the-art wellness center combines medical expertise with advanced technology to address the root causes of your pain. Call us at +1 859-275-4878 to discover how our regenerative approach can help you reclaim your quality of life at our 101 N Eagle Creek Dr location.
column11: At Wellward, we start with traditional treatment methods but then take it to the next level by incorporating our innovative approach using live x-ray and ultrasound technologies. This allows us to not only identify what's causing the pain, it gives us the precision to know that we are targeting exactly what hurts, down to the very nerve. Once found, we then identify why your body failed to fix the problem. Cutting edge techniques such as Prolotherapy and others can concentrate your own repair cells at the site of injury and maximize your body's natural healing responses.Ketamine infusion therapy for depression. Ketamine prescription for anxiety. Ketamine therapy center for addiction. Ketamine for mental health concerns relating to addiction

column40:
Great treatment, the staff that is in charge of scheduling, and billing not so good. They've tried to double charge me for services, still trying to. I've gave proof of payment through statements from the card I used to their bill collection service representative. She told me to disregard, but Wellward  continues to send me the same bills. I have been trying to get a response from their bill collection agency since May, but no luck. Very frustrating.|Overall I can't say I was helped after all. They did a swab for genetic defects but I never got results. They do injections with anesthesia which is as painful as you'd guess! I even tried working in the lab for a bit and saw the machinations in the back. The nicest term I have is disorganized. We were just not a good match.|Everyone there is so kind. . They are intelligent and know exactly how to deal with each patient's needs. I was in so much pain when I first came. I am getting better with each visit. Would recommend Wellward to anyone.|I moved from Louisville to Lexington august 2022. I have been a patient of this facility since. The first 5 months where positive! Testing mostly to target my specific pain points. I suffer from rheumatoid arthritis, so there are a lot of pain points in my body. Triggerpoint injections, epidural, injections, nerve block, injections, and acupuncture in my spine and shoulders! My doctors truly cared as they listened to me during all this process of diagnosis. Everything was going great until 2023 January 1 when they changed my doctor and I have seen a different doctor every visit since. I have only had one bad experience where one of the staff complained about my language and I was reprimanded by the office manager, as if I were a child disrupting class in grade school! It was very demeaning. However, after I had complained about this episode, I was given a call at my home from the office manager that had reprimanded me. We actually had a very good conversation where I was able to express my feelings. I feel like the office manager understood me and the other patients a little better after this conversation as I understand them a little better. These are young doctors with new innovative techniques to manage pain. I have nothing negative to say about their process!
I feel like the front staff needs to be a little more diligent. I have been waiting for three weeks for them to call me to set appointments that the doctor had ordered.
All in all, these people are way better than the Louisville clinics by far! The doctors do listen and seem to genuinely care about me as an individual and not just a dollar $ sign! Thank you for that!
The Big Question:" would I recommend these people to someone with chronic pain?"
Absolutely 100% yes! I have been to several pain management facilities in my past! Let's just say these people run circles around everyone else I have experienced!|On my first appointment I was actually impressed with my interactions with the nurse practitioner that I saw and the doctor that she called in to get his input. On my second appointment they had me see a different doctor and that Doctor who was a psychiatrist was in my opinion an absolute quack, an embarrassment to the profession. The second doctor appeared more interested in arranging for me to have treatments that were astronomically expensive and that even though I had tried those treatments before and they did not work, it appeared irrelevant to the psychiatrist that we would be doing the same procedure I had already had without any benefits. The first visit was great but the second visit made me feel like they were just looking for creative ways to charge my insurance astronomical fees.
I was specifically looking for ketamine infusions and I had more than a dozen medical professionals, psychiatrists giving me a diagnosis that qualified me for the ketamine infusions but wellward seems to be making things more complicated than they needed to be.|As someone who has battled chronic pain for over 25 years and only 45 years old, finding a solution to pain was a nightmare I couldn't wake up from. On top of that I had an accident where I was told it was mandatory to have a lumbar fusion.  I also had bulging discs in my neck and back, a torn meniscus in my left knee and a torn MCL in my right knee...... I know pain.
For those like myself who are weary of the prospect of surgery, Wellward offers a light at the end of the tunnel that you've been praying for. After exhausting everything from Massage, cupping, chiropractor, dry needling, acupuncture, burning nerves, injections, Ice, heat, electricity, and of course patches, creams and anything else you can think of, I had given up on life.
What truly distinguishes Wellward is the doctors. Dr. Danesh and Dr. James are not just MD's. They are like what CSI is to solving crime but they solve your pain problems. I have never had doctors explain to me how anatomy of your whole body and how pain works, giving you multiple options to solve the problem.  They don't just throw pain pills at you or cut you open. In desperation I put my trust in Wellward and got PRP injections in my back and knee. The relief brought tears to my eyes, since it was the first time since my surgery that I felt normal again.  I promise if you find yourself weary of the relentless cycle of pain and apprehensive about undergoing surgery, run to Wellward TODAY!.|Great medical service andcommunication is very good. Highly recommend to anyone.|I can't say enough positive things about this facility! The ladies up front always get my appointment scheduled so fast, and are always so welcoming, kind and attentive! Dr. Escaloni and Dr. Ethridge are AMAZING, they are so knowledgeable and caring and truly do make you feel as tho you are their only patient! They have given me back hope where I had lost it. I am beyond grateful for everyone at this practice! If you have pain, or know of someone struggling with pain I can't recommend Wellward enough!

column40: Dr. Saint-Preux was amazing to work with. She actually went over my results and validated that my pain was real & started a treatment plan. I have been fighting for 8+ years with chronic neck pain only to be brushed off or just sent to therapy with no help & no answers. Before I left my initial consultation appointment I had a procedure scheduled the next week to start my steps to relief.|I saw Dr. Newcom for my back pain.  I had injured my back years ago and had two bulging discs.  My back has since deteriorated and I have pain all the time.  When I talked to him he asked questions going down a list.  He cut me off nearly every question.  Just interrupted me and kept asking questions.  I found that was very rude.  I asked him "WHAT'S WRONG WITH MY BACK"?  He looked at me and said "I DON'T KNOW?!".  During his questions  HE ASKED ME IF I COULD WALK"!!!!  I obviously got myself to his office.  I have no wheelchair or walker and he has seen me walk.  What kind of condescending question was that?!  He did a spinal procedure on my back even though HE DOESN'T KNOW WHAT'S WRONG WITH MY BACK!  That's simply  unacceptable to say and do that to a patient.  I asked him for something for my pain.  The answer "No"!  He gives me the impression that he thinks I'm a 60 year old drug seeking grandmother.  Period.  I will never spend $400.00 on a visit only to be treated that way.  Beside manner for him is a zero!|This pain clinic doesn't care about the patient I went in servere pain hoping I would get some help Dustin Walker nurse practitioner doesn't care he didn't care about my pain he didn't offer to give me anything for my pain  he just typed on his computer ask me few questions I said can you help my pain he never said and when they checked me out the secretary said if you need us call that's what I was there for I would not recommend Dustin Walker to no one he doesn't care|That guy is a JOKE as far as pain management. He expects lidocaine cream to fix 30+ years of roofing, car wrecks, obesity on my joints n knees... HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND.|Dr was very attentive to my needs made some lifestyle suggestions very nice lady dr Lamar, very nice to deal with.|Great experience every time I visit.|He is terrible I seen him 2 times and he did nothing but talk and charged my insurance all that money I am suffering from an accident that almost killed me...|

column40:
Wendy and Dr. Vergis has let me run out of medicine 8x over the past year and a half. The latest incompetence of that office was sending me for an MRI when I can't have an MRI. This dr and office just replaced the battery on my simulator. He should have known that I couldn't have this MRI done. No1 told me about the appointment but luckily I got an email 2hrs before I was due to show. The MRI technician said I cannot believe they made this appointment for you knowing that it could cause serious internal Burns in your body and/or try to pull the stimulator leads from your body. When I've been actively voicing my opinion about running out of medicine and it costing me my job to where I made $30 an hour. It started a problem obviously because no one wants to be critiqued and accused of ruining someone's life. Then their latest ignorance was sending me to this MRI appointment to where I could have been seriously seriously injured. The staff at Norton's pain management do not care about their patients, when you voice a complaint, their staff actually laughs at you with the office manager (Ruth) as you're walking out the door. Good luck trying to get and hold of the director for Norton's because they're about as incompetent as the rest of them. What employer is going to believe that a establishment like Norton's would let people run out of their medicine? Instead the employer is going to look at you like you're abusing your medicine. I have Casper reports, drug screens and everything that is on my side. I have done nothing wrong besides voice my opinion and stand up for myself and to try and hold people accountable for their actions.  THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE BUT I WILL DO MY BEST TO MAKE SURE THEY CAN NOT DO THIS TO ANYONE ELSE. I got dismissed from their practice and had to request a letter, which I received today after trying to call in my medicine to hear from the lady on the phone that I am no longer being seen by Norton's pain management. They don't even care enough to let me know that I've been dismissed by certified letter that is how things are supposed to work as I've heard. I've never gotten kicked out of a pain management place because I do everything by the book|Had a VERY poor experience trying to get a patient scheduled in this office. Spoke with the office manager RUTH who was very rude and aggressive! I spoke very calm and polite with her but she was very argumentative and then hung up me when I tried to get her last name to report this issue. I am beside myself at the idea that someone in your office would be so rude and inconsiderate! I see all the bad reviews for this location and it starts with management. If this is who they have as an office manager then it makes sense why they have so many issues! They probably need a fresh start or re-training at this location. Very unprofessional and just unacceptable to treat people that way.|After waiting in line and in the nasty packed waiting room behind someone arguing over who is responsible for paying for their pain medication with the front desk person for over 35 minutes...then sitting in the run down and dirty exam rooms...my appointment went equally as poor.

I should have just walked out then.

But I was there hoping to see my former pain management doctor after being told they could treat my Arachnoiditis...but instead the appointment was with a NP not the doctor who had treated me for several years prior.
He was my doctor until I refused anymore spinal injections at that time because they were making my pain worse after receiving the dozens that were pushed on me to receive any pain medication from him at all. I told him I didn't want anymore shots because they weren't helping so he said no shots no more meds and that is when I left then. After leaving there I was diagnosed with Arachnoiditis by another doctor in another state. I received 4.5 years of proper care there but my doctor retired leaving me in a tough spot without a pain doctor at all.
But here they quickly reminded exactly why I left this place in the first place. ABSOLUTELY NO HELP or HOPE at all with my Arachnoiditis DX and work related pain but offered to give me more epidurals, a spinal cord stimulator, or a pain pump. All of which I cannot have due to my autoimmune pain disorders...I explained that fully before making the appointment to see if they could even treat me in the first place if they bothered to look it up in their medical journals. I waited 2+ months for this appointment and was also told due to my concurrent psych issues no one would help me at all by the unprofessional Nurse Practitioner. Wonder if they realize if my pain was under control that my depression may not be as big of an issue as it currently is.  As a professional you never say that to a patient especially a severely depressed chronic pain patient.  I didn't ask for pain medication but was treated as a drug seeker wanting to off myself anyway.
I was hoping to try ketamine and or low dose naltrexone for my severe pain and relieve some of my depression at the same time but couldn't even ask before I was given a drug screen which I passed.
No such hope at this place. It is either 60 to 80k for a pump or a stimulator plus maintenance refills or endless $2300+ epidural injections which my body would be further damaged by and or reject the implants or NOTHING.

Go elsewhere these people aren't here to help unless you are willing to put your health at greater risk and possibly end up with what they will say is an untreatable condition that these harmful excessive epidural injections do cause. I am proof.


Update and response to owner:
You already have my current phone number and contact information in my medical file.  I am willing to discuss whatever you want to about my experience and review of your business.|I'm not sure if they are having a staffing issue at this location or if it's something else, but I've had more issues in the last few months than I've ever had with any doctors office before. Mixed up or missing paperwork, appointments that were scheduled weeks in advance only to find out it was rescheduled when I show up, little to no communication at all, and when I give them my info to call me back at their convenience I end up not hearing from them for weeks until I eventually have to call back. I hope they get these issues resolved because this is location is the most convenient for me due to work|When I first started several years ago they were great.  The other day I had to see the nurse practitioner and she was horrible I am having trouble getting my pain medication refilled for the first time.  This is going to force me to go to the er just for some relief.  She was rude and did not listen I am going to talk to my Dr about changing The only one in the front who knows what she is doing is Pam and she is wonderful|Dr Vinayakan and the staff upstairs are incredible. They seem to care and listen and I'd give a 5 even though I've not had any relief. The actual clinic in suite 185 is a very different story. If I could I'd give a negative 5. One of the receptionists was very kind the other jumped all over me for paperwork I was never given or sent. The nurse lacks anything that even remotely resembles empathy or compassion and god forbid you are upset that you've been dealing with the ever increasing pain with no relief in sight.  A patient isn't even allowed to use the restroom. I now have a better understanding as to why people seek help from the streets|Dr. Verghis and Wendy are the best. Thank You both!|My 1st issue:  I give this rating bc of Communication issues with Dr. V's assistant.  I am having a serious situation and have tried to talk with Dr. V directly.  I've only been able to talk to his assistant and what I'm telling her about my situation does not seem to be being shared with him.  I've called 3 days in a row; what is relayed back to me doesn't match up to what I told her.  My last call waa on Friday.  Never heard back from Dr V or from her.  I'm going through a long holiday weekend in serious pain and nothing to do about it.

My 2nd issue is the Progress Notes from my visit 2 weeks ago. I printed off a cooy from My Chart.  There are many very serious errors on these Notes.  I don't know who to talk with to get the corrections made so my appointment information is correct and my history is correct. I think I need to go back and see what the previous appointment Progress Notes look like.

I hope to hear from someone soon so these issues are addressed and corrected.  I'm so frustrated!

column40: Dr West rook is a great Dr and she cares I hope nothing is wrong and I'm praying for youMrs Westbrook! Hurry back we need you!|I have gone to ms. Westbrooke awhile. She does not have a sweet bedside manner. If your looking for that lord knows you won't find it. She gives you harsh reality with a finger tip of sauce. But,she gets the job done. I requested to be a patient at Metro Pain Clinic I was having some issues with my current Pain Management clinic and a friend had told me Dr Reasor was good to work with. I had everything faxed that Metro requested. The had told me to self discharge myself from my current pain management clinic before I could become a patient of theirs. After my previous clinic faxed all info to them, Metro faxes a denial to schedule me letter to them. They did not call or email me as for the reason. Not I have to hope my previous clinic will take me. Metro was very disrespectful and unprofessional!!|Dr. Reasor is a phenomenal physician. He always takes his time and so does Jessica, his NP. They answer all your questions and you never feel rushed. I have had numerous injections in my back and hips and will continue to do so with Metro Pain Associates. Thank you for being so professional and kind.|DR Reasor is an excellent physician but his staff is not up to par.  They lost my MRI disk even though I wrote who it needed to go to and who it needed to be returned to.  The staff are also very rude and insensitive to the pain people are in.  Also Since Dr. Reasor is a one man show, getting an appointment in a timely manner is next to impossible so you ended up setting around in pain for months.

1/13/2021 This is an update to my post last February.  There have been some changes at Metro Pain for the better.  Dr Reasor is still a one man show but is an excellent doctor.  His staff have worked to get me in when I needed treatment and Dr Reasor has helped me with additional treatment for injuries I experienced from a motorcycle accident.  His anesthesiologist is outstanding and the scheduler has been extremely helpful in getting my appointments.  Metro Pain is the best in Louisville in my opinion.|Dr. Reasor is AMAZING! He's very funny, excellent bedside manner, listens to every word you say and takes it in account. He's has been treating me with SPG blocks every month for 2 yrs now. I'm so glad God put thus doctor in my path. His team that works with him in the procedure room are amazing as well. They make you feel relaxed and at ease bc I'm a nervous nelly. His NP is also AMAZING! She listens,  dosen't rush and I know she's there for me. A great place with great people. Front desk, Dana is great! All around you could say I love this place and the help I've got from Dr. Reasor.
Bethanie Gitlewski|Dr Reasor has excellent bedside manner.  I have been a Nurse for 25 years and I can't say enough good things about this office and the staff. Everyone is professional.. they don't over book appointments... the wait time is shor .  They are prompt to return calls.  They listen to your concerns and they are very much concerned with helping you feel better.  The nurse practitioners are very knowledgeable and friendly. I never feel rushed or not cared for when I'm there. Always welcoming... concerned and friendly and Dr Reasor has an awesome sense of humor.  I reccomend them 100 percen .  They have helped my pain with fibromyalgia and I'm ever so grateful.. thank you Metro pain|My husband and I were referred to pain management by our family physician. We were very anxious and hesitant because of the horror stories we had been told about it. Dr. Reasor came highly recommended and our physician set us up with him.

Dr. Reasor is a wonderful, caring, and compassionate physician. He eased both of minds about pain management. He discussed a plan of treatment for both of us at great length. He is extremely thorough and we left feeling like we had been listened to, taken seriously, not judged, and happy with the treatment we received from him.

If you have to go to pain management, I would absolutely recommend Dr. Reasor and his staff. It may take a couple of months to get an appointment, but he is well worth the wait.|I'm currently with a pain management doctor who is "okay", not great not horrible. Prescribes opioids, persistently wants to "sell" you a SCS (spinal cord stimulator) or a Intrathecal Drug Pump. Pretty much like the typical pain management doctor I guess, I am looking for a higher quality, more professional doctor than who I'm currently with. The previous comments are about my CURRENT pain management doctor, I'm not disclosing his name for fear of retaliation. Again the previous is NOT about Dr Reasor.

Dr Gary Reasor initially took about 9 MONTHS to be seen,  after requiring me to send my medical files to him for review to see if I would be approved as a patient.  I did think this was horrible, pain management is a little different than other specialities, people are in pain and suffering and if your primary care doctor is not prescribing opioids you are going to suffer a long time before becoming a patient.  I was though very impressed with Dr reasor, his personality, professionalism, and researching during my time waiting to be seen found he does come quite recommended.|Unbelievable how awesome Dr. Reasor is!!! He truly cares about what you are going through, how you got there & where to go from here to fix it and get you back to the quality of life that you deserve! Praise GOD for doctors like Dr. Reasor, along with his staff. They're unremarkable as well!!!!!!!

Specialized Pain Relief Solutions in Kentucky

At Bux Pain Management, we provide patient-centered pain management treatments to residents of Lexington, Cynthiana, and Danville, Kentucky. Founded over 20 years ago by Dr. Anjum Bux, a board-certified anesthesiologist, our practice specializes in nonsurgical, minimally invasive approaches to chronic pain. We understand that chronic pain significantly impacts quality of life, and while oral medications may offer temporary relief, they often come with risks of addiction and diminishing effectiveness. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Alternative solutions to invasive surgery

Our dedicated team at Bux Pain Management is committed to helping you find lasting relief from chronic pain through innovative, effective treatments. Located at 1210 KY-36 East in Cynthiana, we welcome patients seeking compassionate care and advanced pain management solutions. Call us today at (859) 479-3786 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain.
column11: WELCOME TO BUX PAIN MANAGEMENT Bux Pain Management offers patient-centered pain management treatments to those living in Lexington, Cynthiana, and Danville, Kentucky. Anjum Bux, MD, launched Bux Pain Management more than 20 years ago. The practice focuses on the nonsurgical, minimally invasive treatment of chronic pain. As a board-certified anesthesiologist, Dr. Bux understands the effect that chronic pain can have on a patient's life. While oral medications can provide short-term pain relief, many are addictive, and their effects temporary. Many patients feel that their only solution to pain is invasive surgery.

Of course it's not his fault it's my insurance.  I  am definitely calling my insurance provider to see why they are denying what he suggests all the time. Wish me luck.
I will say I suggest having this Dr as your pain specialist.|Well, Dr. Klickovich's review of himself speaks volumes. Not everyone who leaves a bad review misuses their medication. For the record, I have passed every drug test I have ever been given.

Dr. Klickovich will not call medication in on time. If you upset him, he screams at you and calls you names. He did not act in a timely fashion to insert a stimulator. The only saving grace is that he has a very nice staff.

Dr. Klickovich has a warm, personable bedside manner, until he doesn't. So be prepared.|Recently, Northern Kentucky has had three practices which have closed regarding inappropriate prescribing of opioids.   While we have tried to accommodate patients who have been displaced by these practices, some patients are inappropriate for opioid management or have a history of abuse, misuse, aberrancy with medications, or physician shopping.  If patients are not able to follow state and federal laws, the practice will not and cannot support such behavior and patients will be discharged.  Patients who have chronic pain and functional limitation are welcomed to the practice for consultation and treatment.  Our goal is to treat patients as we would wish our family to be treated.  Unfortunately, some individuals who are opioid seeking will misrepresent the truth in reviews when they are unable to take accountability for their own poor decision making and misdeeds.   In those cases, we consider a negative review to be a sign that we are fulfilling our responsibility to fight the opioid epidemic.|This is the worst place ever. I had to make 3 appointments just to see the doctor and still wouldnt fill my medication.  My other facility closed and had to find someone. But They couldn't even call me to discontinue services with me, they FED X it and had to sign for it all because i told them WE ARE ALL NOT ADDICTS and hung up, that was verbal abuse. SMH That was their reason.. SAD ... The staff is horrible . They do not need to be in practice. I'd give them a -10 stars if I could. I hate offices that treat people like they are an addict  and not a patient who is truly in PAIN.

column40: First time here and Dr Zachary Klinger was amazing! Made me feel really comfortable and describing everything diminished my anxiety as had never had a spinal shot like this. I didn't get sedation (my choice) I was a little worried of the pain but it was not near as painful as I expected! It helped he talked to me as he was doing the procedure so I knew what was happening and it took my mind off what was going on! 24 hours on I feel 100% better and no pain ! No reaction from needle puncture. It left the tiniest bruise that has almost faded in 24 hrs. Will definitely go back and recommend too.|Everyone was very helpful and friendly in a place where patients may have some fear. They were thorough and Dr. Zack Klinger explained every step of my procedure as it progressed, making me very comfortable. I will go back to him when my neurologist orders another treatment. And I feel great.|Went in for knee injections and walked out feeling like a million bucks! Got my knee drained in addition to the procedure o went in for. I thought I was in for some pain but Doc knows his stuff and is an absolute G at what he does, highly recommend!|I'm a 65-year-old male that was referred by Baptist East Hospital to go to Commonwealth pain management, after hours release from the hospital after two days I was treated for back spasms so severe I could barely walk, on January 8 I went into Dr. cleaner's office, hoping to get some relief for my back pain, I assume that they was going to give me an epidural, but they said my insurance wouldn't cover it. They had to wait to hear back from the insurance company. I was in so much pain I asked if he could do anything help me relieve the pain. He gave me some numb shots in my back five injections, hoping that it would work I went home and the next day I was worse than I was when I went there on call in the office and asking for some pain medicine until they had my insurance approved. My epidural I was told I can only get muscle relaxers , after pleading with Dr. Klinger that I couldn't stand the pain I have indigestion and I've been eating Advil like crazy. Still refuse to give me anything for pain I'm a 65-year-old male that takes good care of myself I don't do illegal drugs nor do I smoke, but the arrogance of this  doctor to God decided that he didn't wanna do anything for my pain, I have never been treated so badly in my life and at the time of making this review, I'm still trying to seek help from my back pain. I'm currently flat on my back and excruciating pain waiting for my primary care doctor to call me with another referral to go somewhere where they have some compassion , I hate making post but I feel when you put your trust in a doctor to help you that's what they should do. And I'm sure there's many more people like me that just don't post worse experience in my life so sorry my waste of my time going there and not getting any relief , it's unbelievable to me that they can call a pain management|The aides, nurses and doctors are all very nice. column40: I have been calling since last Thursday (29th) for my medicine refill. Today is September 4th. I've been calling the Hopkinsville Office, Madisonville Office. No Response. Today ,the September 4th I called Paducah Pain management. They even called all the numbers they have. They couldn't reach anyone. So when are the offices OPEN??|I'm so disappointed of late with no one calling you back and not calling your medication in at all. Causes me to be aggravated because I have to keep calling waiting for 30 minutes and then having no one call you back. I like my doctor but I hate their service. Who in a Drs office stays on the phone that long or never calls you back. My medication keeps me from pulling my hair out so I can live somewhat of a normal life but they just don't care at all. That's the conclusion I make out of it|The Doctors there seem nice. Always in a hurry to get you in and out though. I've knocked down stars because the phone calls leave something to be desired. I've called now a handful of times, it's always over an hr wait time. I've left 2 voicemails, to which they have yet to return my call. This last call was over two hours waiting, just get forced to leave a voicemail because it was their closing time. I'll edit if they ever call back.|Worst pain management ever, I went here for years and have gotten into full blown arguments with the staff, if you can get past the office workers the Drs and , especially, the nurse practitioners are good at what they do. It's the shear laziness of the office staff that will cause u to hate this place. They set your appointments out a little over two months away but the office ladies don't bother themselves with calling or sending a reminder out when that apt is coming up and than if you miss the appointment they act like you are a criminal, than another example of shear laziness is when i contracted COVID, they asked for proof so I emailed it and than they left a voice mail saying "if it was u that sent the at home COVID test you need to get one from a Dr office, if not disregard this voicemail" I sent one from a Dr so I disregarded, a few days later Tracy (what they consider a manager I guess) calls with a snide attitude " Mrs. Brown" "we sent you a voicemail and you still haven't sent us a DR note" ....I had sent one from jenny Stuart for that matter and when I told her this she said "oh, well we didn't receive it" no apologies nothing, so I verify the email address even though I have sent stuff to it before and i resend it. Fast forward about a week later I get a letter in the mail kicking me out for missing appointments (even though I never got reminders and always made it within a week or so ) and for not doing pill count (because they never received the Dr note). Now why would they not call me and tell me they didn't get the notification knowing I resent it? These people also treated me like I wasn't in much pain even tho I have over 6 things physically wrong documented and known for causing dehibolitating pain and they have me in loratab 7.5s! The worst part is now that they have done this it looks like I got in trouble in pain management and I am struggling to find a new one and I just got diagnosed with severe canal stenosis after I had been saying for years something is wrong with my back and they throw freaking lidocaine cream at me. If you in anyway can go to the one in Madisonville do yourself a favor and do so to avoid the mess that they call pain management.|Took over 3 weeks for  Dr. Manjikanti to say "there is nothing I can do fir you." These pain mgmt docs act like they are god...they're just foreign docs wanting to make bank off of US customers, and have zero compassion.|You can either provide Lisa volburns new pain management with her records or we can just sue you guys!! You kicked her out OVER A NEGATIVE REVIEW THATS 100% HONEST.. looking into the laws, I see that's a form of medical malpractice , and I will be talking to an attorney about this issue and negligence on your end preventing her to get the medical attention she needs.  Try me!! I'm sick of you guys there, it's always something with y'all and it STOPS TODAY.. if you don't care about ppl, then I'll hit you in your pockets and affect you that way.  2aiy and see guys!!!|I've posted for my mom's experience with the Dr Chann.visit. I pray they God I never see her so upset and drive  hour ten min. And be treated like dirt. She had a dr.vist with Chann. Did u listen to her Pain ?? Did u ask her pain level, did you look at her ankle and foot.??  I will be with her the dec. 3 .10 am appointment.  She's not a win insurance number. She's human. I can see what people sometimes self medicate. Ur not doing ur job..... point blank.. it's human being.. not insurance number. So ur paid and yell next... My mother is so upset and shaking crying. Cause she can't get a Dr. To listen and really care about ....pain management... Pain management..  definition of it?? To help manage pain... Listen to ur patient ..and help them like ur supposed to for God sake..|I just visited this clinic less than a week ago.  This is my experience but each person has to make their own decision.   I was sent a grey.booklet that I was to fill out and bring with me to my first appointment.. I had difficulty in answering some of the questions so I called the office.   I explained this to Tracy.   She informed me if I didn't fill it out completely the doctor would NOT see me. (BIG RED FLAG)  When I arrived I handed it to the receptionist.   Tracy looked it over and marked some sections and had the receptionist to bring it out to me to let me know I didn't answer the questions. I told the receptionist I did answer them and removed the yellow sticker to show her but Tracy was not satisfied with how they were done and she brought it back out to me.   Things went down hill quickly.   I snatched the booklet out of her hand.   I didn't mean to do that but I was extremely frustrated by then.   I had already told her numerous times that I did answer the questions but there were a few I simply couldn't answer.   I felt as if she was pressuring me and badgering me to answer the questions despite the fact that I had repeatedly told her I couldn't.   She proceeded to tell me I didn't the doctor would NOT see me.   I saw this as a threat do this or else.   I proceeded to tell her what I thought.   I mentioned the rating and the bad reviews and that she was one of the reasons.   One review complained of staff being rude and she definitely was.   Instead of yelling and arguing with her I should have simply gotten up and walked out.   A patient's treatment should be based on the facts, on an exam and tests if necessary.   It should NEVER be based on guessing which is exactly what she wanted me to do.   If this process of facts, exam and tests are not followed the patient is at risk of not getting the best care as possible and the outcome may not be as good as it could have been.   No patient should ever feel pressured or threatened when seeing a provider.   This type of treatment of a patient is unethical.

column40:
Dr. Dicky Collis seems nice at first.  Prescribed me pills that I said give me headaches but still prescribed.  Also they have generic drug screening.  He said my meds weren't in system and they were.  I can't recommed this place.|The Dr. I had at the time was a huge disappointment but I don't think he is there now. Very clean. I remember a couple of very kind and attractive nurses that I felt really comfortable around and had the since that they really cared about the patients there. Sometimes the waits were  long other times It went Very fast.  I was there about five years before I had to cut back on all the meds for my own good.  I left a star out for the horrible Dr.|My Dr is Dr. Verghis. He is probably the best one in this office. Although they do run a little behind, it's not bad. He listens and is very understanding and knowledgeable. He doesn't push procedures on you at all. The only downfall of the office is when you have to call in a script. They are either really good about it or terrible. No in between. Sometimes your voicemail seems to get lost I guess. But as Dr.  Verghis goes....he's amazing. Most of the staff is very friendly too. They treat my wife and I like family.|I've been getting Caudal Epidurals from Pain Management for about 7 years. I get them every 4-5 months, So far, I guess I've had about 20. I have NEVER had an issue or bad experience. The Dr's and staff are excellent. Very kind and very professional. James Q. Bilyeu|I have been a patient of Dr. Gudibanda for many years and it has helped tremendously! I am a fan. I am not a "pill" person, I go for the procedures which is a better course of therapy. The pills are addictive, and hard on your organs. My advice is to stay off the pills.
Dr. G is very good with the injections, I get them in my SI Joints. They use an X-ray and there is slight sedation. IT WORKS. It does not hurt. It is stressful, cuz needles are involved, but it's not bad.
I have been to many PM Clinics and this is the best. Yes, there is a wait...like all the other places. Yes, the clinic will drug test you if you take opioids but since I do not, I am not required to do that testing. Other clinics insisted and tried to charge me for tests I do not need, it is a cash maker for them...a real racket.
If you are in pain mgt, you are at the last stop...where they send you when there is no where else to go....
I have been so so so lucky to have these physicians and the staff helping me. I have had some bumps in the road with rescheduling too much...I had to realize how important this is in my life and quality of life I have...but it hard to get off work sometimes or get rides after procedures for me....
I also do my PT there at the hospital when needed, they have a professional staff and a large area which I prefer over cramped little places in strip malls.
It os so easy to judge these types of clinics, but they have certain policies for a reason. They deal with loonies on heavy meds who are addicted. It's not easy to care for as many patients as they see a day....
This is the BEST place in Louisville for Pain Mgt, hands down. I owe them so much.|certain staff members are very rude and unprofessional. I started out having Dr.Verghis because of insurance change on my part I had to start seeing Dr.Gudabanda he's very hateful i miss Dr.verghis he is more understanding.Some of the nurse's that work up there act like it's a bother that they have to do something for a patient. It has gotten to the point I am looking for somewhere else to go because I cannot be talked to like that anymore|I have had a great experience with all the staff, nurses and Doctors at Norton Pain management. I only receive injections in my back and do not require any narcotics. They are wonderful people.|I had a spinal fusion in 1998 which was a failed laminectomy. I was able to continue to work 10 more years with the experience and steady hand of Dr Ricky Collis.  He worked miracles with my back.  This type of specialist may not move as fast as you would like, but would really want him to. I cannot say  enough good things about Dr Ricky not to be confused with the others in the practice.  I owe him an awful lot. He kept me mobile for years.

column40:
Everyone is always nice and friendly. The doctors are very helpful|I had been with Commonwealth pain for almost 8 years. Dr Walls managed my pain medication.  I ask him personally,  if he did abdominal injections and he said "no". His lady assistant said they didn't do them and don't recommend them. I found a Dr in Louisville that did the injections and Dr Walls continued my pain meds. I came in for my appointment and he had his assistant tell me that I am no longer being managed by their group. I responded with the above comments and he said that he would never have said that. The man has the personality of a dead chicken and told her that I stepped on his toes.  So unprofessional to let personal feelings control a patients care. Beware!!!|Everyone there is very friendly and they seem like they wanna help you in any way that they can They have helped me in a lot of ways|Everyone in the office was very professional,
Knowledgeable and friendly.  Dr. Walls explained everything to me in detail, making me feel comfortable. I will be having my procedure done soon.
Thank you Commonwealth Pain and Spine.|I had my first apt today after being with another pain management for the last 7 yrs. The staff was pleasant and helpful. However the Dr. was impolite, couldn't have been more unconcerned, and truthfully acted like a toddler that was pouting and I somehow was taking up his time. I know that many of these pain doctors do deal with patients that are "drug seeking" or possibly addicted to many of the pain meds that they prescribe.  But for many of us that have chronic conditions, it is sad that we are made to feel like criminals if god forbid we have to go to an emergency room, and are treated shabbily by doctors or other healthcare professionals because we need pain meds to help us get through a day. I have to deal with that "stigma" whenever I have to see a new doctor. One would think that doctors that deal with patients daily would have some idea what many patients have to deal with regarding constant pain. I am fortunate that if I have to I can get by without medication and my pain at this point isn't intolerable.  So that being said, I will not be returning to to Dr Walls.  His obvious disdain for those of us seeking treatment do not need his condescending attitude or his flippant dismissal. I'm just too old to put up with being made to feel as though I was a bother to him.|I always get a reminder of my appointment. The staff are very friendly and helpful with any of my needs. The doctors give all information of me to me. I rarely have a question, unless I want another procedure. Thank you for helping me|My pain was never validated. Was told over and over to go to the ER. No imaging was ever done to determine the cause of my pain. I now see another Dr at a different facility and and MRI was done immediately. Found 2 bulging discs and sciatica.so glad I went with a second opinion. I am now being treated for my pain and feel that I am being heard. Wish my experience could have been different with commonwealth pain.|First visit for me and I was a little apprehension ,after reading the reviews about Dr.Michael Walls ... Let me tell it straight.We should never judge a book by its cover or discriminate against anyone...He is a good Doctor.That being said his staff were very friendly  and Dr Walls listened, an answered all my questions  and set up a plan to help me with severe sciatic nerve pain, tho I'm a very new patient,
I felt very comfortable with Commonwealth Pain and Spine.. I will say if your looking for a Chatty Cathy he is not one of those Doctors.He's a straight to the point kinda of Doctor,
I would definitely recommend anyone seeking treatment for severe pain to check out Commonwealth pain and Spine!
Don't always take what someone else says is the absolute truth including me!! Please check them out for yourselves..
Everyone has an opinion and this is just mine!

column40:
Outstanding! I could not be happier with my experience here! I have been going here for a while for multiple issues like hips, knee, lower back and neck. They have helped me so much with my pain and getting injured areas healthy again. Every single person there is just amazing, kind and genuinely care! To be pain free now is just amazing!|After two sessions, I'm left feeling let down. I went in with high expectations, but it quickly became clear that their focus was more on securing payments and pushing memberships than delivering the service I'd paid for. The staff's attention to detail was lacking, to put it mildly. The person operating the spinal decompression table seemed clueless--barely aware of what they were doing and with next to no experience. Even after I pointed out that the machine was misaligned, nothing changed. Then there's the fact that my 20-minute session started four minutes late and ended two minutes early, yet I was still charged the full rate. The office staff couldn't have cared less when I brought it up--no empathy, no effort to make it right. So, after that second session, I walked out, mentally firing them on the spot.|Everyone that I spoke with from the first phone call to the face-to-face visit, they all are so professional and nice. I'm hoping that they are going to be able to help with my problems they are the type of doctors in nurses that you want to help you. Thank you again looking forward to becoming a patient there. Thanks, ... Update... Then they called back days later and said they don't take my UNHC Medicare which they said they did from the day because I wanted to be sure so they scheduled my appointment. I was afraid it was going to be a waste of time and it was!!|Literally the biggest scammers of all time they should be ashamed of themselves double billing an insurance company for a tins unit charging $450 and then adding another $495 for a cheap attachment that you can clearly go online and see it's a $29.95 tins unit and a $60attachment!! Sickening to pretend they care for patients when really they want to keep you at least the whole hour and charge for spinal adjustments when I have never been adjusted in that office because I've had 3 neck surgeries so they are scamming insurance companies and there customers because you are not a patient to them!!! My insurance company is being notified of all of these false charges as well! And the proof is in the photos attached if you don't believe me you can see with your own eyes! Literally called medical fraud!!!! Oh and yes my bad my name was incorrect so I fixed it so now look me up and tell me I'm wrong!|I like their holistic approach. We will see what the future holds.

column40:
If I could leave 0 stars I would. I have chronic pain due to muscular dystrophy. I went to Dr. love for pain medication treatment and of course he insisted on doing the steroid injections which we now know are NOT FDA approved to treat pain! When he was doing the injection they hurt so bad I was coming off the table. I told him it was hurting, I was in tears and couldn't help but let out a cry. He told me if I didn't shut up he would kick me out and end my services. He said he couldn't have other patients hear me. I tried my best to just bare it and take the pain however it got to be to much again and without even realizing it, I yelled out again. He kicked me out and would no longer see me as a patient. I left and have since been bed ridden due to pain and not having a doctor to treat my pain.|I've been a chronic pain patient for very close to 30 years and experiences with other "physicians" that were honestly horrific but NEVER with Dr Love and that's why he's been my pain management physician for longer than any of the other ones at close to 12 1/2 yrs. He makes me feel comfortable and respected instead of a dollar sign or cattle to be hearded through in order to obtain the dollar signs and does it without arrogance. He doesn't prescribe me medicine that turns out to worthless or harmful to me and my situation neither physically nor mentally as have other "physician". I am truly grateful for Dr Riley Love|Dr.Love took care of my husband for many years. He was an extremely patient doctor who always made time for us. He even made time just to talk to my husband as his pain increased. Dr Love made sure my husband had options of what medications to use during a certain time so that when he was in a little pain, he could use a less potent drug but when his pain increased he had the option of using a stronger drug. He seemed to know that my husband would never abuse the drugs, so he allowed him to choose the drug that matched his pain level. It was a relief to my husband when Dr Love gave him choices of what medications to use on his own.
My husband passed away a couple of months ago, but Dr. Love was a life saver to him when we knew he was at the end of his life.
Thank you so much Dr. Love and his staff,  for all of the time and understanding you gave to us during a very difficult time in our family. Dr. Love is an extraordinary physician who goes above and beyond even when I know he was extremely busy. Thank you, Dr. Love and staff, for all of the care you gave to my family.|Excellent care and treatment from the entire staff.  Nurses explain  everything so that it is understood.  Dr. Love is the BEST!!  I have been with him for 6 years and the treatments he gives work very well and keep me active without having to take any medicine for pain|All the rooms are clean and sterile. The staff are very friendly caring and efficient. They are concerned with every patient.
Dr Love is great and is concerned with his patients welfare. He takes time with his patients and listens to their complaints.
I would not want to go anywhere else. I get shots in my back and neck because of nerve damage and pain. The shots have helped me considerably.|Dr Love has wonderful bedside manners. However he prescribed me meds that my insurance doesn't cover & has been asked to prescribe something my insurance will cover & my pharmacy still hasn't gotten anything. I've left message after message w no returns. I'm hurting badly & need something to help. I can't wait til my 1 appt for injections n Feb. So the only thing bad I can say is they r not very timely n handling my situation. Other than that it was a great experience!|I have been a patient of Dr. Love for about 15 years and I have never had a complaint until now.  Ever since he moved over to Pain Management in Lone Oak it has been down hill. I never get to see him,  I can never talk to a real person,  and. they never return my calls.
I am treated like an addict and I have been without my meds for days at a time each month. I really like Dr Love but I am so sick of putting up with the staff at his new location. I am looking for a new neuro surgeon.  I can't take it anymore.|Dr. love has been so caring and taking the time to try different procedures. I have been going to him for over 11 years!

column40: Dr. Grainger finally gave me a couple of possibilities to hopefully fix my back issues after years of excruciating pain and worsening mobility issues. He gave me some information to research and look over to make an informative decision and I'm beyond excited for the immediate future. The thought of being able to walk, stand or lay down without being in pain makes me hopeful.|My very first visit with Dr. Grainger seemed like he was a genuine and compassionate doctor. After that first visit things went south very quickly. He went thru my history of medicines that I had been on but didn't seem to care about my true medical problems. Dr Grainger had seen that I had been prescribed pain medicine for quite some time and he assumed that I only took the medicine to keep from having withdrawals, so I was completely cut off my needed medication after many many years being prescribed it. He just left me high and dry, no help to get thru the withdrawals from being cut off, no referral, no compassion! I guess it's typical these days for doctors to assume we're all just looking to get high and abuse pain pills. I'm so sick of the stigma from the doctors. I don't want to get high, I only want a little better quality of life without pain. I told my precious doctor that my medicine was no longer helping me for 2 years and he totally ignored me. We do build a tolerance for these pills and they do stop helping us. I could go on and on but I feel like this doctor didn't want to waste his time on me so I'm not wasting my time on him.|He is a very good doctor. He takes his time he's very concerned and as long as you need, he gives you that time he's very caring and compassion. I've been seeing him for about three years now and if it wasn't for him, I probably would not be able to do my every day activities, he keeps me walking. Thank you Dr. Granger.|We need more doctors like Dr. Grainger.  He really took his time to explain everything and to listen to my issues and concerns.|Cares about what's going on with you and listens. I am glad I finally found a Doctor that cares!|Excellent doctor that truly cares!
