column40:
I would give them zero if I could. I don't know if I've ever been treated so badly. My doctor treated me like a criminal. I'm 67 years old and I've never been convicted of any crime.  I've never been arrested for being violent. I would recommend another clinic.|The doctors and staff have always been kind and courteous, my appointments times are within a reasonable wait time. My questions and concerns about my treatments are always answered. And I feel as a patient that I matter..|This is a terrible clinic to go to. I went there for several years and in the beginning they tried to do some procedures to ease my pain but they didn't really help. Then they just quit trying. I have quit going because they changed my Dr 3 different times and the last time the Dr they had me seeing said instead of giving me the option of taking the pain medication when I needed it she insisted I take it all the time. I tried to do as she said and was struggling with controlling my bodily functions. When I told them I wasn't coming back they informed me that my last 4 or 5 drug screens were dirty which was impossible. I am now going to a different clinic and this new Dr says I have arthritis in my lower back and knee so he I'd planning a procedure to try to get me some relief. And he is listening to me that I DON'T  want an excessive amount of pain meds. I do NOT recommend this place at all!|My visits have always been professional. The office ladies are very nice and the nurses assistant are very kind especially Rodney ,who makes my day always cheerful and kind. And my PA mrs.Shockley is  absolutely so helpful and a carrying  physician assistant, and always willing too help me. I am blessed too have a place that all the departments are great here.|I have been a patient at this clinic since 2012;  If they say something I do not understand regarding procedures etc. , I ask questions because that's what they want you to do.   As for waiting times, there have been maybe 2-3 times that I have had an extended wait, but its very rare given the number of people that they see. I live 2 hours away and have no problem traveling to see them because Im not usually there over an hour unless I am having a procedure and they are a little behind.  If I take anything new over the counter I always ask a pharmacist how drug screens will read, and always take packaging so they can see for themselves.  Unfortunately the drug laws are super strict, and it's sad because so many things can cause a false positive.. today most all pain doctors will refuse to see you if you have a dirty test, not just here.  This center has provided me with with more help than I have ever had anywhere else, and I appreciate them all very much!  I have to say though that the only dr. That I did not like was dr. Hummel, and I only saw her once maybe twice butI told them I would not see her again due to her rude treatment.|if I could have given no stars for this office I would have.

I was referred to this office in the Fall of 2017.  I have been on disability due to a car accident since 2009 and had left my prior pain mgmt office due to the way staff treated the patients. I had read the few reviews of this place and it scared me to death but I tried to stay positive that I would be treated professionally.

The amount of paperwork I had to fill out prior to even getting an appointment was beyond ridiculous, they did not make it easy as their forms could not be completed using a smartphone but only a computer, thus I had to use the library to do the forms.

I finally was given an appointment with Dr. Laura Hummel. I waited close to 4 hours in the waiting room. When I was finally called back I was told my RN friend that drove me could not come back with me. I have never heard of a policy like this and my first question is what are they trying to hide? Well it turns out a lot. I was would be refused an exam if my friend went back with me so I had no choice but to go back alone.

They brought me to a room that wasnt even big enough to be an exam room. There was no overheard lights, just a desk lamp and a candle, quite unusual for a practice that treats physical ailments. Next thing I notice was a pretty desk sign that said "the pain medication you prescribe to a patient rarely gets dispensed to that patient". I was appalled and knew this was going to be bad.

Dr. Hummel finally came in and I knew immediately that this appointment was a big mistake. She immediately questioned my medications and said I was lying, that my previous doctor would never prescribe those. Funny I had all my bottles with me that stated exactly who wrote the meds, but she didn't bother to look at that. Next she asked why I was there. I told her that I wanted a 2nd opinion, I was tired of being treated poorly and that when I had wanted to get a 2nd opinion the office discharged me. Again she accused me of lying, that she knew of no office that would fire me for wanting a 2nd opinion.

She half heartedly looked at me when I stood and had me walk on my tip toes, that was the extent of the physical exam. She proceeded to tell me that I had 1 leg longer than the other and that was my only problem, nothing Tylenol and warm baths wouldn't fixed. I questioned her than why have I been on disability for so long and why have I gone thru every treatment possible with no results? Who  in their right mind that was faking it would ever subject their body to the intense pain these procedures produce? Not me for sure. I mentioned that I had a lift in my right shoe as I have a shortened Achilles tendon from how I walk due to my hip. She said that's impossible, that's the leg that is longer. I showed it to her and she told me my podiatrist was wrong and I did not have a shortened tendon. She never once even touched my body to examine me and just got ruder by the minute until she came out and accused me of being a pill seeker and then kicked me out of her office.

I have never had anyone in the medical profession ever treat me the way Dr. Hummel did. She actually had me wondering was it all in my head. Thank goodness I came to my senses and did get referred to a different pain management office in Louisville. Funny they immediately diagnosed me with SI chronic pain, which is what my doctors in Michigan had all diagnosed as well. I am now going on my third SI injection this coming week. But oh I forgot, I'm just faking it.

Stay clear of this horrible office, unless you want to be treated like nothing more than a liar and drug addict.|I've been going to pain management for over 10 years.  I've only had 3 in that time period this being the last. They are the worst to all they want to do it stick you with a needle and charge you and your insurance a fortune. I'm a retired coal miner that's busted all up and they've ruined my credit over something I didn't even know I owed. 5 years old and they still hounding me.|The doctor was rude and had a serious lack of empathy. My experience was a nightmare. The building was so trashy like I was in a dope house and the atmosphere was tense and cold. They will not give you time to speak or explain and he seemed to have his mind made up that I was drug shopping or something before he even spoke to me. Said the pain was all in my head and that my surgeon, (a man who Mayo clinic and Cleveland clinic were highly impressed with when I showed them the work he had done on my back if that tells you anything.) pretty much said he was a quack and that the surgery I was getting was because I wanted it not because it was necessary--which is also ridiculous. Also, he can't read a CT scan properly. Caused me to cry and just gave me this smug look the entire time, completely heartless. Stay away from this doctor--and Lexington all together if you have a orthopedic issue in my honest opinion. Go to Louisville if you want serious help. I've yet to find an orthopedic doctor that has any sense in Lexington.

I took the referral to Berg's office PERSONALLY lady at the front said I can't be scheduled yet it's been a year since I had been there I would need insurance looked at an etc I'll get a call from someone the next day, next day came I didn't receive a call so I called and called them all day left voicemails like I had been doing since I first started reaching out to this office a YEAR AGO like I said it's hard to get through so i finally got someone on the phone she said,  Oh let me see what she did with your referral! I am now doing a 4hr commute to indy trying to get out of pain the new dr never mentioned arthritis to me when BPM only ever talked about it|If I could give this practice zero stars I would in a heartbeat. Don't come here. They are awful and do not care in the slightest about their patients and try to cover the mistakes they make along the way. Stay away. Ridiculous amount of gaslighting. I would rather eat nails than ever return here. Pathetic excuses for providers.|I have NEVER had a bad experience with Dr. Daryl Barnett's office. Dr. Barnett is kind and courteous. He goes out of his way to be helpful and to ensure professionalism in the office. I see Jacque APRN for most of my visits. She takes her time to get to know me as a patient AND as a person. I cannot possibly recommend this caring office ANYMORE than I do! It is marvelous!|Dr Barnett is a great Dr.  Very down to earth; explains conditions and options in a way that can be understood by a non medical person.  He makes you feel comfortable and at easy.  He has always been concerned about me as a whole patient.  I can say the same for Brigid Buckman and Jacqueline Dennis.   Dr and NP's are caring and not judgmental. I am a long time patient and would highly recommend this office if you are dealing with pain.|Dr. Bauer is outstanding doctor she is very caring and will go out of her way to make sure you are taking care of. She is very caring. I have been to another pain management and never had someone to care about me like Dr. Bauer she is awesome!!!|Dr Barnet was great, compassionate and accepted my truth about my pain. I was switched to Brigid who was very judgemental, scolded me for taking too much Tylenol instead of Hydrocodone, go figure! When I was asked my pain level for which it was a 10 that day, I have arthritis and it was raining that day, they said they had to send me to the ER. So I lowered it to a 5 because I just got out of the hospital for a pulmonary embolism & DVT that I had been telling her that I have been feeling faint putting on socks and in the shower. Plus the ER will not do anything for you when you're seeing a pain management Dr. I am very honest with ALL my Dr's, sometimes too honest, but I refuse to allow some jaded APRN to treat me as if I am not worthy of help when my regular MD referred me to them. After speaking to someone after I was told I could not return who goes to the same office about this experience, they also did not like Brigid and was switched to another APRN, they were not told they could not come back. I was told if I can't see everyone in the practice that I would need to find another practice. I found water therapy for which is working great for me, after I found it pain management sent in the referral. I am having tremendous mobility issues for which land therapy would not of worked out for me at this time. Why wouldn't pain management recommend this for me or pay attention to my medical issues when it comes to the pulmonary embolism and DVT??

Usually when I hear stories like this about pain management offices, they eventually get shut down for illegal practices... I will stay with my water therapy because it's working. Most likely I will not subject myself to another pain management Dr to be treated this way. I am not a drug addict, I have passed all drug tests I have been given, I haven't even smoked Marijuana in life. I was just trying to seek management of my pain. Two good things came from this experience, me finding water therapy on my own and getting prescribed a non-narcotic medicine to help with the nerve pain. I highly recommend not going to this pain management center, but if you do, I hope you're not vocal about your treatment and only tell them what they want to hear because then they will tell you that you need to see their shrink if you say tell the truth about anything...|Dr Barnett is a very good and caring person. Aprn Brigid Buckman and Jacqueline Dennis are also very good and caring and non judgemental. I have been a long time patient and have recommended. I did have a couple problems with staff but they have long since been replaced. Never a problem with the Dr.|Referred here by my doctor.  Saw the nurse practitioner not the doctor and was charged a large amount of money to have someone spend only a few minutes with me and just recommend shots.  They also had me provide a urine sample without letting me what the test was for or that insurance would not cover the test.  The front desk staff was also not friendly.  I attempted to dispute the charges but was just told "that is what Baptist Health charges".  Baptist Health is overcharging for services.  I paid less to see an actual orthopedic surgeon across the river.  Avoid Baptist Health if you can and especially avoid this pain management office.

column38: Belinda Whited|Christi|Lake Lover!|Amy Adair|Roy Hawkins|Heather Zetterberg|Shelby Verdine|Tami Deming
column40: My poor mother has been in severe pain for weeks, was referred here by Dr. DeWeese for hip injections over 2 weeks ago. I call daily and cannot reach a person. All you can do is leave messages. My horses get 1000 times better healthcare than my mother is receiving. It took 8 days for the Mercy Orthopedic Group just to send her referral over. I still have heard nothing from Mercy Pain Management. Extremely poor management or lack there of.|I've been a patient for 3 weeks and it's been a horrible experience so far. I'm no street junkie and in pain everyday due to multiple back conditions. I work a physical job and just want the edge of my pain to be taken off until I'm able to have surgery. Still no meds (mind you it's just tramadol er not anything super strong like Roxy) and I cannot get them to even return my calls. It's absolutely unprofessional and irritating! I'm about to just be done with this place too! I waited 4months for the appt and for what?! Ughhh|I should have known not to go here. Should have trusted the reviews. I'm a disabled veteran. The VA gave me a referral to go here. I have been waiting for a few months to get in. When I arrived I completed my registration. Was at my appointment on time. Someone comes out to let me know that they can't see me because of 4 documents that weren't filled out. She stated that she could tell I filled them out online but they can't see them. The paperwork would have taken about 5 minutes to complete. Instead they rescheduled me another appointment over 2 months away. I won't be back.|Do not go here for your chronic pain, especially migraine. After suffering for 7 years, I brought my teenage daughter here for Botox. She has had a daily migraine since she was 12. It felt like a factory line, first of all. We saw Cheryl Vinson, APRN, who I quickly realized had no idea what she was doing. Instead of injecting botox where my daughter's pain was, she injected it how she wanted to. We were also seeing headache clinics in Lexington and Chicago so we weren't always able to make the appointments in Paducah but always rescheduled. For that courtesy, my daughter was just dropped as a patient, even though Cheryl has also rescheduled on us twice. I would highly recommend seeing Dr Trimble at Horizons Headache Clinic in Lexington if you or your loved ones have a chronic issue with migraine. Avoid Paducah Pain and Cheryl if you possibly can.|After being on pain management for three years through my orthopedic doctor for severe arthritis and spondylitis, the state insisted that I go through a pain management clinic. We tried to get appointments at several near to where we live.  Mercy Health Pain Management of Paducah was the only one that would work with me in getting an appointment in a reasonable amount of time.  Everyone I talked to prior to the appointment day was very kind and compassionate to my condition.  By the time of my appointment I had been off of pain medicine for six weeks and was dealing with pain that radiated through my lower back, bursitis in my heels and elbows, pain in both knees (the right one especially needs to be replaced, but I am only 49 years old and would rather wait), and arthritis pain in my hands, hips, and shoulders. We had a Walt Disney World vacation booked since January, when I was still on pain management through my orthopedic doctor and we were counting on that to help me get through all the walking that has to be done.  The office staff was very kind and the nurses were wonderful.  Cheryl Vinson, the APRN, is FANTASTIC!  She listened to my symptoms and pain explanations, she examined me to help figure out where the pain was coming from, and formulated a plan to not only treat the pain but to also relieve the symptoms.  I have had an extremely difficult time trying to sleep the past six weeks and have often ended the night with only two or three hours of sleep.  My wonderful wife has had to listen to my complaints and watch helplessly as I struggled to get through the day and to sleep at night.  Ms Vinson was so helpful that my wife burst into tears of gratefulness at the end of the appointment because she knew we had come to the right place and was getting the help that I needed!  I could not be happier being under Cheryl Vinson's care!  They are not going to arbitrarily throw pain medication at you, they are trying to be responsible to their patients and, thus, they need to certifiably diagnose and understand your condition before they offer any medications.  I am content with that.  It helps protect me and helps to protect them as well.  I would give them more stars if I could!  My experience with them has been wonderful so far!|If I could give zero stars I would. I seen Millicent G Kadner, APRN, she was very rude and has zero passion or sympathy for anyone who lives with chronic pain. I waited 6 months for an appointment, drove an hour and waited for almost 2 hours for them to tell me they couldn't help me. I asked why they didn't tell me this over the phone when I made the appointment, she claims she didn't even know why I was there. Then afterwards she puts in my web portal patient notes that I was told before the appointment that they told me that they couldn't treat me when they scheduled me but that was a lie or else I wouldn't have wasted my gas time and energy going up there. I even explained I was willing to try non narcotic options but she said the best she could do was ibuprofen when I know theirs more options than that. I wouldn't recommend a dog to see them for pain. Don't waste any efforts going there, seek treatment somewhere else|Very confused clinic. Would not treat me until Paducah PM would release my pain contract they would not release me. At Norton Healthcare, we're proud to have Dr. Anilkumar N Vinayakan as part of our pain management team. With extensive credentials including his medical degree from India and completion of both anesthesiology residency and pain management fellowship at The State University of New York, Dr. Vinayakan brings exceptional expertise to our practice. He is board certified in anesthesiology and pain management, demonstrating his commitment to the highest standards of patient care.

Specialized Expertise & Academic Background

Prior to joining our team, Dr. Vinayakan served as program director of the Pain Medicine Fellowship program at the University of Louisville for three years and held an academic position with the university's Department of Anesthesiology for over five years. We offer comprehensive pain management solutions with a focus on:

  • Implantable therapy treatments

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Spinal infusion pumps

  • Lumbar epidural injections

Our approach combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. For more information or to schedule an appointment, please visit our Dr. Anilkumar N Vinayakan at Norton Healthcare page or call us at +1 502-629-5455. We're conveniently located at 315 E Broadway Suite 415, Louisville, KY 40202.
column11: Dr. Vinayakan received his medical degree in India and completed an anesthesiology residency and pain management fellowship at The State University of New York. He is board certified in anesthesiology and pain management. Prior to joining Norton Healthcare, Dr. Vinayakan spent three years as program director of the Pain Medicine Fellowship program at the University of Louisville. He also served in an academic role with the university's Department of Anesthesiology for more than five years. He has special expertise in implantable therapy, including spinal cord stimulation and spinal infusion pumps.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Louisiana

At LA Pain Doctor, our team of interventional pain management specialists - Dr. Firas Hijazi, Dr. George Kum-Nji, Dr. Satvik Munshi, and Dr. Pham - has been dedicated to providing exceptional care throughout Louisiana since 2004. We specialize in diagnosing and treating a wide range of acute and chronic pain conditions at our locations in Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, Luling, and Hammond. Our comprehensive approach addresses:

  • Joint and Limb Pain: Hip, knee, leg, arm, shoulder pain

  • Spinal Conditions: Back pain, neck pain, sciatica, herniated discs, degenerative disc disease

  • Other Conditions: Headaches, muscle pain, and various musculoskeletal disorders including arthritis

We develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs, focusing on improving quality of life and restoring function. Our Hammond office at 42276 Veterans Ave. features a welcoming environment where patients receive attentive care from our experienced team. Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website or calling us at +1 504-229-4866 to schedule a consultation.
column11:
The goal of interventional pain management specialists Firas Hijazi, MD, George Kum-Nji, MD, Satvik Munshi, MD, and Dr. Pham, MD at LA Pain Doctor is to provide high-quality pain management services to men and women living in and around Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, and Luling, Louisiana.
LA Pain Doctor has served patients throughout Louisiana since 2004. The team regularly works with individuals to diagnose and treat all types of acute and chronic pain, including hip pain, knee pain, leg pain, arm pain, muscle pain, shoulder pain, and headaches.
The team also specializes in treating musculoskeletal disorders, such as arthritis, back pain, degenerative disc disease, herniated discs, neck pain, and sciatica.

I've been coming to the Hammond office for awhile now, the front desk clerk Rebeca is very helpful and polite, makes you feel like family, she's awesome and calls your name the minute you walk in the door, that something you don't get at all doctors office, I couldn't have picked a better pain management clinic... Kudos to her|I sought treatment at this office for a serious work-related injury. I visited multiple times due to a specific referral. However, despite sending detailed and updated documentation several times to the medical providers, they failed to review the information, resulting in the denial of the referred procedure. I made numerous attempts to explain the referral, but was not well received. Notably, when the evaluation summary of that visit was requested, a particular employee, Riley Ann, displayed hostility and juvenile conduct by shouting, stomping away, and using abrasively toned language. Management failed to take any action to address or rectify this behavior, further contributing to an unprofessional environment.|I was getting good care until doctor hajaji was not there and they put some other guy to see me who had a attitude as soon as he walked in the door of the room that I was in. One of the nurses kept telling me. I was lying about my medicine at the pharmacy. And I told her to take herself there and figure it out herself. If she thought I wasn't telling the truth because I had no reason to lie. Come to find out when we were leaving. The nurses up front confirmed that the lady that was calling me a liar was the liar herself.. but whoever the guy was who came into the room that worked with Doctor hajaji Is very unprofessional and we're trying to tell me i was having things going on. That wasn't happening, and when I tried to explain to him what was going on. He wouldn't listen and told me. He was the doctor and he didn't want to hear what I had to say about where I was hurting. My husband and a friend came with me to this appointment because after a month. I'm still in severe pain that has not been taken care of. The rudeness of this Doctor left me crying as I left from my appointment. The rude Doctor also made a comment to me as I was leaving. "You won't be getting any care and you'll never find out What's going on with you!" And he made it happen for me to be removed from getting good treatment by his partner.
I was scheduled for an epidural to help my pain. Now I am fighting to find a new Pain management because of a Rude idiot that was trying to convince me that things were going on, That wasn't when I was trying to tell him what was going on. He told me I wasn't a doctor. It's my body and I have x-rays to prove that. I have other things going on. But he was so stupid he didn't even want to look at it or understand what he was looking at. So was the assistant that was taken the notes.. doctor hajjay is very good, but the rest of the people here are very ugly.
I would have given them 5 stars if they actually took me out of pain but they didn't. But I'm stupid because I don't have A phd. behind my name and me, trying to tell them what is going on was pointless.  I was crying because my husband came to ask him. Why were they putting the horse before the cart? And putting me in more pain instead of finding the actual problems. That is when the guy got offended and made the ugly comment that "You would never find out what's going on and I wouldn't be getting any treatment." I brought my husband and my friend because maybe they would believe how much pain I was in if they heard it from somebody else since they didn't want to listen to me and what I had to say about my own body. All they want is for you to show up for stupid appointments every week. So that way, they can run through medicaid. Instead of taking care of everything at one time.
They have refused to send my medical records to my new pain management now for 2 weeks. When you call them, they are very rude to you on the phone. And the lady lied instead. She had a call medical record when all your records are handled in house at the office. I had called one of their other locations to find out that information. They are refusing for me to have medical treatment. By withholding my medical records from my new Doctor..
And for the record for the guy who saw me, that wasn't the normal doctor. he would not have been called outside of his name if, he did not threaten me that I would not get the help that I needed or find out what's wrong with me. So before you act like a victim you best think about what your doctor's words were to the patient. He might have a PhD behind his name. But everybody is different and for his lack of knowledge when looking at an X-ray and reading the report. And act like he don't know what's going on. Maybe he shouldn't be a doctor.|Excellent care. I had suffered for over a decade. Pain stole my quality of life. Dr. Hijazi diagnosed the main source of my debilitating back pain. Through his treatment plan I have range of motion I haven't had since I was in my twenties! I am moving, dancing have been given my life back. Highly recommend LA Pain for professional, caring pain management!|The care that Billy gets at LA Pain is exceptional. Doc is a great doctor and caring and everyone on his staff is exceptional.|As always, Dr. Munshi and his staff went out of their way to make me feel listened to. He answered all of my questions, and he is never condescending as some doctors can be. He explained things in a way that I could understand. I appreciate that everyday as sometimes it's a rarity. His compassion never ceases to amaze me. I highly recommend him and his office.|The staff and Dr. Hijazi is always professional.  I wouldn't want to be any place else.|Great doctor, and staff. column2: Louisiana Pain Institute : Cathy Zhang, MD
column3:
At Louisiana Pain Institute, Dr. Cathy Zhang and our dedicated team believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. We practice a multimodal approach to pain management that addresses both body and mind to significantly improve your quality of life.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a complete spectrum of pain solutions including:

  • Non-invasive and advanced surgical interventional techniques

  • Personalized medication management

  • Alternative medicine therapies

  • Customized physical therapy programs

  • Pain psychology support

Dr. Zhang brings a balanced perspective to pain management—the same approach she would use for her own family. Working hand-in-hand with each patient, we take time to understand your unique health needs and develop strategies that not only treat current pain but also prevent further complications. Located in Covington, we're proud to serve the people of Louisiana with compassionate, comprehensive care. Because at Louisiana Pain Institute, you are not just a patient, you are family.
column11: Dr. Cathy Zhang believes in multimodal care, meaning her approach focuses on both body and mind to improve your quality of life. She uses a variety of techniques, including both noninvasive and advanced surgical interventional techniques, medication management, alternative medicine therapies, physical therapy programs, and pain psychology. Dr. Zhang's balanced perspective is one that she would use for her friends and family and wants to bring that same approach home to the people of Louisiana. Dr. Zhang will work with you hand in hand to better understand your health needs and discover ways to not only treat, but also prevent further disease processes. Because at the Louisiana Pain Institute, you are not just a patient, you are family.

Moving from one state to another,  I was fearful that I wouldn't find proper care for my many back problems.  I am blessed to have found this Pain Management Clinic. Dr. Crosby understood the issues and stepped into action promptly.
Thank you so so much.|Dr. Crosby is the best!!!  He is always professional, knowledgeable, not only with pain management, but your health overall.  He genuinely cares about his patients!  He takes his time and does not run you thru like cattle or another dollar.  You are in the best care with Dr. Crosby!|Dr. Crosby and his staff are all very nice and professional.  Dr. Crosby is friendly and makes his patients feel comfortable in his presence.

There are two drawbacks to seeing him.  First, his office is extremely hot and the staff say it's the fault of the door being opened and shut so often.  I've been in similar offices where there was no heat issue when the door was open and shut often.  I think this is something their landlord needs to look into.  Second, the wait after check-in has always been EXTREMELY long.  I have sometimes sat waiting (in very uncomfortable chairs, btw) for 1-1/2 hours to be seen.  When you bring this information to the staff, there are various reasons as to why the wait is so long, but will often say you're next in line and magically I am.  I have gotten to where I wait 20 minutes after my assigned appointment and go to the nurses' station.  I hate complaining, but I'm already in pain, as are most of the rest of the folks sitting in the waiting room.  I wish that were the end of it,  but once the nurse put me in a room, I have waited back there for anywhere from 15 to 20 minutes again.  Summary, LOVE Dr. Crosby and his staff, HATE the wait times in his office.

5 stars for not only the practice/staff in general but also for Avala Hospital too! Thank you for being such an excellent provider to the area & to the patients!! When I say that Dr. Chad saved my life, those are not words just lightly spoken. He saved me physically but also mentally.

Dr. Domangue performed a procedure for me today. He and his staff were excellent. They were cheerful and kind. The process was efficient from beginning to end. I was in and out!!|Today was my first visit with Dr Domangue and I'm very impressed!! Comfortable, clean and modern atmosphere. The nurse (forgot name, sorry) took down all of my information with a smile. Then Dr Domangue came in and addressed all of my problems and concerns. He is extremely diligent and intelligent. I can't wait for my treatment to start!
I will highly recommend 
Thank you Dr Domangue|Dr. Domangue is a great physician and works with me to help ease my pain. He has helped my husband and myself for many years with injections. After my neck surgery and my husbands back surgery, he has been awesome. His staff are great, especially Miranda and Kristen!  Kristen is wonderful, very knowledgeable, and makes us both feel very comfortable. We both look forward to her professionalism at each appointment. We will both continue to see this physician and his wonderful office assistants!|My wait time is on schedule. I love how my appointment flows smoothly and nice and quiet in waiting room. Comfortable chairs. And nurses and doctors are very explanatory  on Andy questions I ask. As well as they are greeting !  Thank you AVALA Pain management  employees for your hard work and dedication to make my visit go as quickly and prompt as possible.  Have a blessed day.|Dr. Chad Domangue is the Most Efficient and Knowledgeable Man i have Ever encountered, He is attentive and doesn't Rush....Avala Pain is the Best thing that I have Ever done. He has Dropped his Patients with No prior Contact or Conversation Nor any Notification or Referral before Doing So... Bad Business!!!! He was still a Phenomenal Doctor!|Dr. Chad was a very important part of chronic pain patients getting help that was so badly needed. For reasons he states he is no longer doing chronic pain management.  This has left many patients in a hard place. More and more doctors are leaving patients without care due to FDA restraints. None of the doctors care to fight for their patients. They pack it in and change what they do. This leaves patients nowhere to turn. Yes, we got referrals to other doctors to turn to but how long before they fold up also. The FDA feels that this will help keep prescriptio n medicines off the street. They evidently haven't done their homework. All this has done is put patients in need of help looking for medication out in the streets buying from the people they are trying to put out of business making things worse not better. I wish Dr. Domangue and other pain management doctors would fight for their patients as hard as they do for their money.|Usually have great experience with Dr. Chad and Miranda. This last week has been a nightmare of an experience with the office staff. From the ones that DONT answer the phones to those that work on prior authorizations. I have called a week working to get a PA completed. Received ONE call back a couple days ago was told by a very nice lady she told me I could call her back at ext 105. One morning I actually lucked out and a call was answered. To be told she wouldn't ring ext 105 without me going through the entire story again. While speaking to the girl at Ext 105 she did tell me the PA was approved said she looked at it again the next day when I finally did get her call back. She said she saw it yesterday and looked again to make sure and yes approved. Wrong answer again. Wasn't approved. We are now in the appeal stage because the insurance didn't receive enough information to approve.  Called again today to see if the insurance had called them and to followup. Again no answer ALL DAY left a message asking PLEASE PLEASE for a call back well now 4:40pm again no call back again. Very disappointing!!|Dr. Chad is seriously, the BEST & COOLEST guy ever!! To top it off, his staff is just as awesome! I have been so nervous for years to talk about what has personally worked best for me to treat my pain & to not feel like I'm being judged considering I'm in my 20s, but when I saw Dr. Chad for the first time this week-- I knew he would be the doctor to finally help me & make me feel comfortable enough to talk about my pain & what works for me. This is the start of a new beginning for me-- to finally enjoy life & not sit in bed or on the couch all day, almost everyday--in a dark place mentally because of my pain constantly getting in the way anytime I try to do anything fun & get out the house. I am so glad I chose Dr. Chad, and excited to have him along side of me for the rest of my life to be my doctor to treat my pain. I cannot even put into words how happy I am to finally find something that works & helps manage my chronic pain. I have laid in bed so many sleepless nights due to pain, and me worrying/crying silently because I have missed so much of my kids life due to my pain and never being able to get out and enjoy life with them. But after years of just dealing with it & almost giving up... I FINALLY I am getting the treatment I need & that works for me! It's like a huge load off my shoulders. So thank you Dr. Chad.

column3:
At LA Pain Doctor, we've been dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions throughout Louisiana since 2004. Our interventional pain management specialists, Dr. Satvik Munshi, Dr. Firas Hijazi, and our expert team serve patients in Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, New Orleans, and surrounding communities with personalized care and advanced treatment options.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We specialize in diagnosing and treating a wide range of acute and chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Back pain, neck pain, and sciatica

  • Joint pain (hip, knee, shoulder)

  • Arm and leg pain

  • Muscle pain and headaches

  • Musculoskeletal disorders

Our expertise extends to treating complex conditions such as arthritis, degenerative disc disease, and herniated discs. With our patient-centered approach, we develop customized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at (504) 229-4866. Located at 3220 S I-10 Service Rd W in Metairie, we're committed to helping you regain comfort and improve your quality of life through effective pain control strategies.
column11:
The goal of interventional pain management specialists Satvik Munshi, MD, Firas Hijazi, MD, and the team at LA Pain Doctor is to provide high-quality pain management services to men and women living in and around Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, and New Orleans, Louisiana.

LA Pain Doctor has served patients throughout Louisiana since 2004. The team regularly works with individuals to diagnose and treat all types of acute and chronic pain, including hip pain, knee pain, leg pain, arm pain, muscle pain, shoulder pain, and headaches.

The team also specializes in treating musculoskeletal disorders, such as arthritis, back pain, degenerative disc disease, herniated discs, neck pain, and sciatica.

column40:
I've suffered from chronic pain since 1984 after getting injured while in the Air Force.  I went through multiple doctors, physical therapy and opioids as part of my treatment.

That is until I found Dr. Firas Hijazi.  He was the first one who actually listened to me and informed me of non narcotic alternatives.   I now live with less pain overall but more importantly am not constantly living in a fog because of taking opioids as the means of control.

I still have pain, as the injections wear off and the nerves grow back.  But in the months between procedures I have more of a life.  Able to drive without the fear of being a hazard to others or getting a dui.

I highly recommend Dr. Firas Hijazi.
I also recommend trying the injections and RFA as an alternative treatment option.

Thank you to the Staff as well.
I've been to all the offices and Alliance Surgery Center and consistently received professional, yet friendly service.

I am going on around 10 years of treatment with Dr. Firas Hijazi.

I also have lower spinal issues not shown in picture/diagram.|Friendly,knowledgeable, caring staff offering on time appointments with easy scheduling. Love Dr Hizaji and his staff. Highly recommend.|This is literally one of those places that's only interested in making money and they will treat you like cattle and they will force you to take injections because that's where they make their money even if they don't help and they don't care if they're dangerous or painful. And also notice that they will not even let you take a family member with you because they're so scared of getting sued because of how terrible they treat their patients I've actually seen them hide reviews so you've been warned if they mistreat you immediately see a lawyer|The staff is always helpful and polite. The doctors are very helpful and have various options for treatment!|Dr. Homra has been amazing! I recently had my first procedure in his Metairie office and the experience was very pleasant. He took his time and explained everything he was doing step by step throughout the entire process. My pain has gotten significantly better since I've started treatment with him.
His entire staff is so caring and polite. The young lady at the front desk is so kind as well as the lady in the procedure room. They definitely know their stuff!|I love Dr Hijazi and his staff!! My number one fan to keep me pushing and different remihdeies to help thank You Doc. Sheree Morgan Glass|The staff is great, very pleasant and seem eager to help.  I was a little confused on the direction the medication was going but was cleared up on my second visit.  The only real problem is the parking - they need more for sure.|I am very satisfied with my visit to LA PAIN DOCTOR, Because Dr. Hijazi listens to me not just as a patient but as a human being. I was in a lot of pain , blood pressure  and anxiety was at an all time high but thanks to fast thinking and action , I'm pain free most of the day. Thank you

Specialized Pain Management Since 1994

At Louisiana Pain Care, our board-certified, fellowship-trained pain management physicians have been serving patients throughout Northeast Louisiana and South Arkansas for over three decades. We've dedicated our entire practice to the relief of pain, ensuring you receive care from specialists who are truly experts in their field. We partner with patients and their referring physicians to develop comprehensive treatment plans for all types of acute and chronic pain conditions. Our approach focuses on relieving pain, controlling medication intake, and restoring quality of life so our patients can return to their daily activities. Our specialized services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Physical therapy coordination

Located at 210 Layton Ave in Monroe, we're committed to providing compassionate, effective care in a professional environment. Visit Louisiana Pain Care or call us at (318) 616-6877 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain.

column40:
I've been seeing an orthopedic doctor for over a year; during this time I've had constant and worsening back pain. I was finally sent for an MRI 3 months ago. I have arthritis and spinal stenosis in L4 and L5.  I'm 40 years old, I have a job that requires me to be in my car 8 hours a day and sitting causes the worst pain and I'm too young to feel this bad physically!! I feel like no one has been listening. My orthopedic doctor took months to accomplish anything then sends me here to get meds when I've specifically said that's not what I want.

On my first visit with Dr. Gordon I was talked to with respect about numerous options that could help me. I felt like he was hearing me not just trying to get to the next patient. Within 4 hours I had a call back for an appointment to receive nerve blockers. My orthopedic doctor would take months then say it was the insurance company. Dr. Gordon assured me that this process would be quick so I could receive more lasting relief not just pain medication. Also the staff were personable and efficient! I'm so grateful I found Louisiana Pain Care and I look forward to getting my life back!|What's worse than zero stars because I have to give one to review yet I'd give them whatever the worst shape is and only highlight one of them.

Worst possible place to take yourself or a loved one who has chronic pain. Literally pushed me to constantly get injections then after a hundred not working and one their beach houses paid off. I was told through imaging that it's not bad and I'm making a bigger deal about it that I should. Went literally weeks later to a neurologist and he literally told me that last guy is a complete idiot and I had a piece of disc that fractured off my L4-L3 bulge pulled out of my spinal cord and the rest of that one shaved down.
They were completely aware of my family history of back issue and I literally have the same name as my father. So giving me naproxen after I come piss in cups and do countless expensive and painful injections, then completely missing that is absolutely unacceptable. I'm so glad I finally got in with the other guy but I still need 4 more done and they obviously missed those as well.  Literally sell your soul to whatever evil bad guy you believe before going here. I've lost years of my life, money, and my mental health because these people didn't help me the way they should have.|I've been seeing Dr. Forte for months now and he and his staff have been wonderful to me.  I've also had two procedures at the surgery center and everyone there has been so nice, caring and helpful.  I'm so thankful to have found these people to help me at such a tough time in my life.  Blessings to them all.|La pain care and staff are truly awesome people. They go above and beyond to make sure that you are well taken care of. I would like to recognize Dr. Henry Gordon and Teresa Kennon for their hospitality and kindness shown each visit.|I've been seeing Dr John Ledbetter and his staff for almost 3 years. He and his staff are exceptional and they truly listen and care about their patients. My lower back is kept in check by the care I receive from these people. I wouldn't know what to do without them. More people that's getting quality service from them like I do should leave a 5 star review. They deserve that!!|I was seen there for a few months maybe a little longer.  Each time I had a co-pay of $30. I had a couple of no shows due to my not having the $30.  I was on a pain medication that allowed me to function.  Earlier this year I decided to try a friend's alternate pain management method.  It didn't work so today I went back to them to resume my medication regimen. I didn't always take my pain meds because I didn't always need them.  If I had extra at the end of the month I flushed them. I took a drug screen for a company while on them and they didn't show up. So apparently they didn't show up at LA pain care urine test either. So I saw a fast talking NP today that reviewed my history and asked me what I wanted. I simply said to have my pain care handled by LA pain care. She left to go talk to the Doctor and next thing I know a nurse is handing me a discharge sheet with recommendations on it that we're never discussed with me.  Apparently I'm supposed to live with the worsening neuropathy pain the rest of my life.  I really feel like I was just dismissed as a pill seeker and nothing was seriously discussed with me by the Doctor. Very unhappy, frustrated, and hurt by my treatment today.|I've been coming since the first of the year, I see a lot of reviews that are absolutely BS. I can only speak of Dr Forte, He is by far the best of the best, not a doubt in my mind , he is definitely on top of what I'm going through, I feel pretty sure all the bad reviews I've read, I'm pretty sure y'all are the problem, It truly has nothing to do with this clinic nor any Doctor, or nurse practitioner, cause the are all very passionate and caring as anyone could ever be.|These doctors are wonderful and very humane. Went there for 17 years, had to move cross country and the doctors are not humane here. They make you scream during procedures. Dr.Ledbetter and Dr.Gordon never made me scream during procedures and they have the best NP in Donna Courson. I miss them and have daily pain since I moved away.

column2: Louisiana Pain Care - John Ledbetter, MD
column3:
At Louisiana Pain Care, we are dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain and regain their quality of life. Dr. John Ledbetter, the founding member of what was originally St. Francis Pain Management Center, brings exceptional credentials to our practice. He received his medical degree from Southwestern Medical School in Dallas, Texas, and completed his residency in anesthesiology at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio, along with specialized fellowships in both pediatric anesthesia and pain management.

Specialized Pain Management Services

As a diplomate of both the American Board of Anesthesiology (in anesthesiology and pain management) and the American Board of Pain Medicine, Dr. Ledbetter offers comprehensive pain management solutions including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach focuses on both pain relief and functional improvement. Located at 210 Layton Ave in Monroe, LA, our facility provides a comfortable environment where patients receive personalized care from our experienced team. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, visit our physician profile page or call us at (318) 616-6877.
column11: Dr. John Ledbetter received his medical degree from Southwestern Medical School in Dallas, Texas. He completed his residency in anesthesiology at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio (UTHSC-SA) as well as fellowships in pediatric anesthesia and pain management at UTHSC-SA. Dr. Ledbetter was the founding member of the St. Francis Pain Management Center (now Louisiana Pain Care). He is a diplomate of the American Board of Anesthesiology in both anesthesiology and pain management and is a diplomate of the American Board of Pain Medicine. He has dedicated his life and his practice to helping people overcome pain and the resulting loss of function.

The NP's and physicians are very nice, but also thorough and knowledgeable. I have no complaints.|I have been a patient of Dr. Ledbetter's since he was at the P & S Surgery Center ( 40 plus years ago). And he has become more than a doctor, I call him a great  friend  He has the greatest staff and has always helped me with my pain. And he never wants you to be in pain.  I have to say he has a great nurse also. Thanks Mrs.Jeannie for always making me comfortable. I have had quite a few unfortunate accidents and Dr. Ledbetter has worked past his hours to help me, along with the great staff.|I started out with Dr Ledbetter at LA Pain  Care in Monroe LA. It was ok just crowded  not as friendly or caring. Because of so many patients there was .longer waits in the room. Almost a year ago I moved to the Ruston location and Dr Gordon.. it was great, less patients  same receptionist and treoge nurse and when put in a room only about 15 to 20 min wait max. We got to see Dr more often and he acted like he cared about patient so it was easy to talk to him. Then he left and we were getting Monroe Dr's a couple days a week when they  can do it. I pray yall get a Dr for Ruston soon that's nice.|I had a plane crash two years ago and I've got cardiologist urologist pain care and several more doctors. Dr Ledbetter is the best doctor 10 to one over anyone. Not only is he the best doctor but a great friend that will go out of his way to help. I have recommended over 12 patients that went to the pain care and are still current patients. I wouldn't go anywhere else in the world even if they were free.|Im extremely pleased with  level of care and the compassionate nurse practitioners that I see at the pain care.
All of the staff are so thougful and help me to get in the office and out in a timely manner.
The office staff is also very pleasing and help me in anyway or anytime I need to change appointments or times , they are very understanding.
Next the nurses that do triage are just the very best around. When they call for me they ALWAYS ASK me how I'm feeling or what is going on.  They always ask if anything has changed and if so how long. They are the best !
Last, i couldn't not help but mention the best ,most professional lab lady that does the urine screen. She makes sure that I understand  her question and explains the test process. She is the best.
Unless you live in chronic pain you can't possibly understand how important it is for these people to be kind and compassionate.
Im very pleased with Louisiana Pain care and can't imagine my level of activity without them.
They are a 10/ 10 in my book and that's the absolute best! Thank you for what you do.|I always have a nice visit with the nurses and physicians. They listen ti my concerns and offer details on how to help with my pain issues. Whether it's therapy, shots or medicine. They help me to decide what's works best for me in trying to relieving my pain issues.|I live an hour and a half away from the clinic, but I don't mind the drive. Dr. Ledbetter is awesome. Comprehensive Pain Management in Shreveport Since 2005

At Flex Institute, we've been helping thousands of people manage their pain and reclaim normal lives since 2005. Our dedicated team believes in a hands-on comprehensive approach that combines compassion, honesty, and teamwork to address each patient's unique needs. We create customized treatment plans that consider your lifestyle, social and familial support structure, and personal expectations. Our multimodal approach includes:

  • Medication management tailored to your specific condition

  • Physical therapy programs designed for rehabilitation

  • Specialized injections administered by experienced physicians

What sets us apart is our ability to coordinate all aspects of your care under one roof at our Shreveport location. Our physicians work collaboratively to ensure you receive the most effective treatment for your pain management journey. Visit Flex Institute or call us at (318) 629-5505 to schedule your consultation at our 1534 Elizabeth Ave #201 location and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11: Since 2005, Pain Care Consultants has helped thousands of people manage their pain and get back to living a normal life. Our team believes in a hands-on comprehensive approach to care that includes compassion, honesty and teamwork. By utilizing a multimodal approach to care, the physicians at Pain Care Consultants create customized treatment plans that consider their patient's lifestyle, their social and familial support structure and their expectations and concerns. These plans may include medication management, physical therapy, and injections and can all be coordinated under one roof.

column3:
Personalized Neuroscience Care in Covington

The first thing you'll notice when you enter Segura Neuroscience & Pain Center is the personal feel of our office. We are a neuroscience pain center, not a pain clinic, and this distinction matters in how we approach patient care. Unlike management providers with a factory-like atmosphere, our style of care is designed to give personalized attention to every patient. We do not churn people in-and-out like cattle. Our dedicated team provides comprehensive pain management services including:

  • Advanced neuroscience-based pain evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions

  • Interventional procedures for pain relief

  • Ongoing pain management support

Located at 141 Lakeview Circle in Covington, LA, we serve patients throughout the North Shore area. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Visit Segura Neuroscience & Pain Center or call us at +1 985-231-6751 to schedule your consultation and experience the difference our personalized approach makes.

column40:
I was a patient for a couple of years and never had a problem. Then after a procedure, at the hospital before leaving, I spoke to his nurse there to see if since this would cause more pain than normal and it was almost time for me to refill my meds if he could write for a couple extra pills. The nurse said yes to just call the office.  The office staff was extremely rude and refused to give him the message. So I reported it to the joke of an office manager. That procedure was treatment for one of multiple injuries. My other injuries I'm seeing a neurosurgeon and will be having surgery in the near future, so I wrote a letter saying that at that point in time, I was no longer in need of treatment. I even got a letter that says to go back if needed. Well, my neurosurgeon said I should go back here to pain management until surgery. I called today to try and make an appointment only to have the office manager tell me that I had an issue with some staff, so it was in my best interest to go elsewhere. When I asked if that was her "polite " way of saying I'm not welcome, she hung up on me. Stear far, far away from here, if you are in need of help due to pain. They will treat you like trash and not care or help you. If you do become a patient, don't disagree with the staff. If so, you will end up in my shoes. Treated like trash and unsure of what to do|My first visit was with Dr. Robertson in November of 2023 and things went well. I have Ankylosing Spondylitis and was having severe lower back pain. We scheduled an injection and everything was great. Each visit thereafter has been with his medical assistant.

My most recent visit was on 10/16/2024, again I saw his MA. It was determined we would schedule another injection. I was told clearance from my primary care was needed as I would need to be off one of my medications. Two weeks passed, there wasn't any follow up so I called the office. I was told they had a change in personnel and the way scheduling was being done. I was told to f/u in a week. Upon me following up I was told my doctor had not returned the necessary form and it had been sent twice. I found that odd because my doctor and her staff are very quick to respond to requests. Typically a response is received within 2-3 business days. When speaking with my primary care on or around 11/13 she confirmed the document had been completed and returned to your office and provided me with a copy.

As of today's date, 12/06/2024, Lisa from your office still has not followed up with me. Therefore, a call has been placed to pay the small balance, under $8, and to obtain information on obtaining my records to move to a different doctor stating I was not happy with your office. I was not asked what my issue was, the person simply cold transferred me to someone whose voice mail picked up. I called back and received the rudest person ever. I was explaining to her that I'm unhappy with your office because it's been almost 2 months since my visit and still no follow up from anyone regarding the scheduling of my injection. The person stated perhaps they were waiting on clearance from my doctor. I informed the document had been sent since last month and that I have a copy. She asked if I brought a copy to them to which I stated I did not as it isn't my job to do so. This person stated, "look I'm not going to argue with you. I'll take your payment". Before she could say anything more, I advised no, you will not take my payment because I'm not going to pay it!

What I thought was my solution to Ochsner turned out to be a nightmare!|As a 23 year old with a debilitating chronic illness, Dr. Segura was my FOURTH pain management doctor as I had been turned away by 3 previous ones who refused to give me anything for my pain, even after seeing that I am hospitalized constantly for this issue. I rely on pain mediations to be able to function daily. Dr. Segura listened to me and took me very seriously. He is such a kind man and I am so lucky to have found him. He speaks to you like you're an old friend. I highly recommend seeing him for pain management.|Amazing team and Dr. Segura is amazing. A doctor who CARES about his patients and not just making money off of my pain. I thank God for Dr. Segura|I've been seeing Dr Segura since January of this year, I was with clinic in Metairie for over 6 years and for some reason they decided to discharge me. I guess they figured that they made almost 1/4 million dollars from me. I'm glad that I was able to find a dr on the Northshore and Dr Segura and his staff care about each patient. He's asked me a few times about having the radio frequency ablation but I don't like the idea of having sharp items near my spine because my issues are at C5-C6 so if anything was to go wrong I wouldn't be able to feed myself. I also like that they give 2 month appointments so I don't have to come to Covington every month, but sometimes when they do the e-scripts it might be dated for the weekend and my pharmacy isn't open on weekends. Which I wish the pharmacy was open at least 1/2 a day on Saturday, that way I wouldn't be out of medicine the whole weekend.|Went to Dr. Segura in the West Bank office when he was just starting out.  He was seemed to really care about my well-being and I really liked him.  Something happened in that office because he was the only pain doctor and the others were orthopedics.  He told me he was moving to the North shore.  I followed him to his new office and things took a turn for the worse.  His NP called me at work and said I had until 4pm to bring my prescriptions in.  I left work at noon and drove an hour to his office.  There were no patients waiting but the NP made me wait 2 hours to count my pills.  When I complained about the wait to her she got an attitude with me and said I could go somewhere else if I didn't like it.  Two weeks later I got a letter from them stating that I had Cocaine in my last drug test and was discharged immediately.  What a coincidence?  I wrote to Dr. Segura explaining what happened but never heard from him again.|Hands down Dr Robertson is the best. Dr. Robertson sat down and listen to what I was dealing with and then gives me his straight to the point advice. When I came to Dr. Robertson I was all the way messed up I had a back surgery that went wrong I was down and out and thinking I wasn't ever going to get better because another Doctor had butchered me up but Dr. Robertson and his amazing nurses assured me that they were going to do everything they could to help get me better are. Dr. Robertson nurses listen and they do everything they can to help you out in a timely manner. So I can honestly say that Dr. Robertson is the best doctor in this great state and his nurses make him a better doctor. And that's hard to find a doctor that listens and actually cares about you getting better and a doctor that has great nurses that back them up and picks up the slack for their doctor.|Doctors seem like they're good, but other staff is bad at following up and scheduling, never got my procedures done thanks to them. Will get procedure elsewhere

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Shreveport & Bossier City

At Willis Knighton Spine & Pain Specialists, we are passionate about providing state-of-the-art treatment options for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, and other chronic pain syndromes. Our approach is simple yet effective—we diagnose and treat your pain in the most straightforward and minimally invasive way possible. We pride ourselves on delivering the same level of care we would want for our own family members. In fact, many of our patients will hear us say, "If you were my mom or dad, I would recommend..."

Our specialized services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

Our team of expert physicians—Drs. Noles, Hirsch, Munjampalli, Germany, and Abney—adheres to the highest quality standards of patient care. We invite you to visit our website for more information or call us at (318) 212-7960 to schedule an appointment at either our Bossier City or Shreveport location at 1811 E Bert Kouns Industrial Loop, Suite 300.

column40:
Dr Jolly and his staff are a very professional group. I've had a few different procedures to address my knees and hips. I now have great control over my pain issues. The follow up after the procedures is outstanding and through. After years of powerlifting competition, the various injuries start to catch up with you. Life is so much better with the pain level at an acceptable level.|Dr. Jolly is a great doctor who really tries his best to help you with your pain that you are dealing with. I've been seeing him for a few years and he tried to help me with different options with my back issues.He hasn't given up and we both finally found the right option to cure my pain that I was having.He is a very personable doctor and I would recommend him to anyone that has any type of problems with their back,neck,or any kind of nerve pain.|Dr. Jolly and his staff are top notch!  Super responsive and Dr. Jolly is an amazing practitioner.  Will definitely recommend to anyone struggling with chronic pain.|The new staff here are very rude.  Need the old staff back because they resolved problems quickly, were nice & handled professionally. Some problems I have experienced
1) An error of theirs, like wrong Dr. Code on prescription so pharmacy cannot fill, took an entire week to correct & that is the pharmacy calling everyday & myself as well. All that needed to be done is send in a new script, same meds with correct code.
2) They scheduled me on wrong day & called the day before to set up another appt & was without meds for at least 1 1/2 weeks to a month at times.
3) To change a script that is same medication, because on back order, ex. need 1-10mg instead of 2-5mg dosage which of course = 10mg, is going to take 1 1/2 weeks, because have to be seen. Let the doctor hear this & I bet he will change that script in a heart beat, without needing to see me.
4) One time, staff in back, told another patient & I to sit in waiting room for paper scripts, for the receptionist to ask an hour later, can she help us. We tell her, we are waiting on prescriptions & then she goes in back & they tell her, the prescriptions were sent to pharmacy. Now why they never come, to tell us, once they changed the plan to send them to pharmacy.
4) Doctor is good, takes care of pain, with meds & injections, just he is only in bi-weekly & new staff say, have to wait until next week when he comes in office. That is not true, because old staff never did tell me that & had any issue resolved within 2 days.  Most of time the same day.
So for these reasons I do not recommend unless they start piecing the puzzle pieces together to get better resolutions for patients beside making them wait so long, plus they need to change their attitudes. Too many doctors out there to deal with the attitudes and wait times.|Dr Jolly is so personable and compassionate. Highly skilled physician. Great care great nurses!|I am always impressed when I visit Dr. Jolly's office. They are very kind, and they listen.|It's real great I like it does a good job|My review would've had a higher rating but I don't know Dr. Jolly that well. I had an appointment with him years ago. I received injections in both knees. He was great and seemed very caring. I really liked him but I couldn't go back because my insurance was no longer accepted. I was told I could only see Dr. Kaufman. I discovered he has horrible bedside manners!! I cried when I left his office and suffered lots of pain over the years because I didn't want to go back to him. Finally, I was sent to Dr. Davis and he's much better! He has given me injections in my knees, hips and I had a Radiofrequency Ablation in my back. Unfortunately, it only relieved my pain for a month. Still hopeful that he will keep trying to find other ways to ease my pain and improve my quality of life!

column2: Louisiana Pain Specialists - Metairie Pain Management Clinic
column3:
At Louisiana Pain Specialists, we believe in a balanced approach to pain management, combining appropriate medications with clinically proven interventional treatments. Our Metairie clinic specializes in providing safe, minimally invasive solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Expert Pain Management Services

Our team is led by Dr. Suneil "Neil" Jolly, who trained extensively across the country to develop advanced skills in:

  • Neuromodulation and surgical techniques

  • Innovative spinal cord interventions

  • Peripheral nerve interventions and ablation

  • Ultrasound-guided and fluoroscopically-guided procedures

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs. Our comprehensive approach focuses on improving your quality of life while minimizing reliance on medication alone.

Located at 3434 Houma Blvd #301 in Metairie, LA, our clinic is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. Learn more about our comprehensive pain management services or call us at (504) 754-2334 to schedule your consultation today.
column11: The Louisiana Pain Specialists believe in a balanced approach of appropriate medications and utilizing treatments that are substantiated with results. We offer safe, minimally invasive, clinically proven interventional treatments for patients suffering with chronic pain that are highly effective. Dr. Suneil (Neil) Jolly trained across the country earning advanced skills in neuromodulation/surgical techniques, innovative spinal cord and peripheral nerve interventions/ablation, and both ultrasound-guided and fluoroscopically-guided procedures. Find out more about all of the chronic pain treatments available from the our team.

column38: Dawn Manix|Cortland Walsh|ladycplum|Diamonds R' Forever|Easy Fixed1|Renee|Barbara Winslow|Ritchie Stanley
column40: This is why I fired Dr. Davis. I originally decided to go to pain management to try to hold off as long as possible on having to get my 2nd knee replacement due to work constraints and length of healing time off of work. As well as having left upper arm pain that wakes me up nightly along with various other conditions. The 1st visit went fine. I met Dr. Davis explained the situation. I was prescribed the lowest dose of meds 2 daily. That was fine with me. Unfortunately a couple weeks later I took a bad fall. My next visit after the fall was with the NP and I asked her "do you think I need an mri?" She said "no I don't think so". She goes to confer with the real doctor and comes back in with yes you need a cervical mri (upper spine) when the majority of my pain was now severe left buttock pain since the fall and still left knee pain. I got a knee injection was given the same low dose of meds 2 a day and was sent on my way. So I did the mri and upper X-rays. The mri showed herniations and disc bulges in my diagnostic portal. I advised in their portal that I wanted to see the DR for the results visit. Upon arrival I AGAIN am met with the NP. So she of her own admission says they messed up and should've ordered a full mri. Which means another lower mri co-pay ($90) and lower X-rays and states she wants to check my tailbone. I have heard many people discussing fracturing or breaking their tailbone and the severe pain and it can take up to over a year to fully heal. Ok. But...my tailbone does not hurt. Feel free to cover your bases after you've already dropped the ball. So I can't sleep at night due to the left arm pain worsening since the fall and now can't work at my desk all day without severe left buttock pain. She again leaves me on the lowest dose of meds 2 a day. I now still have to choose what parts of the 24 hrs in a day I want to endure the most pain and take Tylenol the rest of the time. Dr. Davis would have known that IF I actually got to see HIM. Maybe he did know and chose not to care. I pay for private health insurance every month out of my own pocket to see a DR. I am not a "drug seeker" but turned to pain management out of desperation to have some type of quality of life. However I never dreamed as a 55 year old woman with osteoarthritis, a prosthetic disc in my neck, neuropathy, fibromyalgia and a host of other various ailments that a Dr. would just let his patient stay in constant pain like this daily and not even actually SEE HIS patient. I get it's more $ for him to have a NP see patients while he sees his chosen patients and does procedures and after all it is all about $ in this world. But it should also be about ETHICS and OATHS taken by doctors to treat their patients properly and not allow them to be in this type of constant pain daily. I will never understand how a Dr. can sleep at night practicing in that manner.|Miss Lauren was very thoughtful and thorough during my office visit.  She treated me  in a very professional manner and listened carefully to all of my questions and concerns.  She was truly FIRST CLASS because overall she treated me as a human being, not a number.  VERY SATISFIED!!  Thank you Lauren.  Sincerely,. CORTLAND WILLIAM KING WALSH|Terrible experience. Doctor Bryant didn't introduce herself, didn't ask my name, didn't ask how my pain was, did a cursory exam, dictated when I could get my medication filled (I had already been out for a few days, which means I am going through a rather painful withdrawal right now), and sent me on my way. I had seen Dr. Jolly for another condition about a decade ago and he was a joy to work with. I don't know what's happened, but they now seem more interested in "moving the meat" than taking time to get to know their new patients. I made a big mistake switching PM physicians. I would suggest people try LA Pain Doctors, at least they take the time out to do full exams and treat you like a human.|I had the Best experience at this office they offer complementary snacks,water,tea soda.The staff is wonderful. The doctor is Great .. looking forward to my follow up! appointment... the wait time is great they give updates while you wait. Sooo you're never Just sitting and Waiting. They offer Uber rides to and from your appointment.  This place is A1 all around.|This review for The team that works at the clinic Specifically for Jennifer. You the best you amazing you awesome and friendly and your kindness for helping others to schedule their appointments to their needs. That's something you don't see often|I was impressed with Dr. Eric Sterne.  He was very kind.  He had a very good bedside manner.  He explained in detail what my conditions are and what is causing my back and hip pain.  He explained to me in detail the treatment plan that he suggests for me.  He told me that he hopes that the treatment he suggested for me helps relieve the inflammation that is causing my pain.|Has everything i would expect in a doctor. Takes interest in my general life, overall health and shows compassion. Has completed all my procedures with skilled success. I am thankful for Dr. Sterne, my doctor.|Dr. Jolly looks at each person with consideration for individual needs. He and his team try their best to meet those needs with real solutions. I have had a spinal cord stimulator for 5 years and I have had consistent quality results  . Thank you Dr Jolly and your team !
