column40:
I've always had a great experience when I've visited the Headache and Pain Center!  The office staff is friendly and accommodating and greet me with respect and a smile.  The level of care that I have received from the doctors and medical team has kept me as pain free as possible and from having surgery and   I recommend them whenever I can.  The Ponders are running a top-notched facility!|Gotta say, I am very pleased with Dr. Ponder and his staff.  My NP Paige is great!  She has listened to my every need and has relayed the info perfectly to Dr. Ponder and staff to make what needs to be done, happen.  Love, love everyone there, very friendly atmosphere.  Thank you!|If I could score this place and 99% of the staff a zero I would. I had to be there an hour before my appointment to fill out paperwork that could, and should have been available online. Add to that fun much of it was repetitive. Then I was called back over 2 hours late! I was the only person in the waiting room. My input on treatment for issues I have had for years was ignored. When I refused to consider the injections they wanted to start immediately they were appalled and unhappy. Never mind I have had a number of specialists I have seen for years tell me to not do them.

Then I'm told the NP wanted labs. When I asked what and why that upset them more. I'm a retired nurse, I take no order without questioning it. Almost a month later and I still have no clue on the results. Imaging was supposed to be ordered and I had to call back a week later to see if it was sent anywhere. The nurse actually acted like I was clueless and it was my fault the hospital didn't have the paperwork. Of course they wouldn't give me the orders to hand carry for some reason. Needless to say my association with this clinic is one and done.|Wonderful staff! Mimi and Dr Ponder are the best! I'm living pain free thanks to them. I recommend them highly!|I had my first appointment here today. Everyone, and I mean everyone, was so kind (I am not any easy person right now) and attentive. The most outstanding thing - everyone listened to me and took time to reassure me and answer my questions. I have never been to a Neurologist before. Won't know until after tests how to resolve my tremors (onset with rear-end auto accident), but I feel that Dr. Friedman and everyone will find the answers and help me get my life back. I can't express how thankful I feel to have benn referred to them.|Hands down the best doctor, PA, nurses & staff members I have ever encountered. The location is not close to me but I still choose to drive 1.5 hours each way because Dr. Ponder & his staff actually listen to the patient before they start seeking a solution. They understand that every injury & every patient is different. Excellent work guys, keep it up!|I felt very comfortable having my procedure at the Headache and Pain Center. Everyone was very friendly and proficient. I'm a health care professional and going through the process I felt like this facility was top notch. I have already referred a friend who is experiencing similar problems with their sciatic nerve.|I've been a patient of the headache and Pain Clinic since Dec 2008.  I have always found the clinic staff to be polite, friendly & patient. The professional staff have been skilled, caring & knowledgeable.  Their care has allowed me to remain a part of my family's life as I lived w chronic pain.  I will always be grateful for their care of me over the years.  As I leave Houma to live in another state, one of my great losses will be this clinic.

column2: Louisiana Pain Care - James Hardy Gordon, MD
column3:
At Louisiana Pain Care, we're dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of

Dr. Hardy Gordon

. As a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain medicine specialist, Dr. Gordon brings exceptional credentials to our practice, having earned his medical degree from the Medical College of Georgia and completed his residency at the Medical University of South Carolina where he served as chief resident. His specialized fellowship training in pain management at the University of Alabama-Birmingham further enhances our ability to deliver advanced care. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Personalized pain management treatment plans

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

  • Multidisciplinary approach to chronic pain

Our main goal is helping patients return to the activities they love and enjoy. When not treating patients at our Louisiana Pain Care facility at 210 Layton Ave in Monroe, Dr. Gordon enjoys hunting in Louisiana's beautiful outdoors and cheering for SEC football as a previous University of Georgia team member. For exceptional pain management care, contact us at (318) 616-6877.
column11: Dr. Hardy Gordon is a board-certified anesthesiologist and board certified in pain medicine. After receiving his medical degree from the Medical College of Georgia, Dr. Gordon completed his residency training in anesthesiology and perioperative medicine at the Medical University of South Carolina, where he served as chief resident. He then pursued fellowship training in pain management at the University of Alabama-Birmingham. Dr. Gordon has made numerous presentations in the field of pain management. His main goal is to have his patients return to the activities that they love and enjoy. In his spare time, Dr. Gordon enjoys hunting in the wonderful Louisiana outdoors and SEC football (he is a previous member of the University of Georgia ...

column38: Michael Fox|Sonya5377|Tattle tale Designs|John Ferguson|Rob Fox|Barbara White|Hershel Johnson|Candy Keen
column40:
Over the past year and a half, I have been a frequent visitor to Louisiana pain care. They are helping me as I try to move past a fall that I took at the coast several years ago. They have been very attentive to my needs. Their kindness and their empathy are always on display. Their practice is able to provide me with help and consolation in their area of expertise which other doctors just don't fully understand. My visits to the clinic for procedures have just been as pleasant as such things can be. The chief word that I would think of that is true of the clinic is hospitality.. Now I imagine that. The chief impression I have of a hospital unit as hospitality. Well done my friends. I have great gratitude for you.|The doctors at Louisiana Pain Care are very good, from the facility to the service of each provider that I dealt with - Dr Forte was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in identifying my health problems and explaining the issues so that I could understand the issues,  as well as ensuring I had the information needed for additional referrals.  In addition, they immediately followed up within hours of my appointment to make sure I had no questions and to make sure I understood the importance of completing follow-ups with the appropriate referrals. Extremely satisfied with every aspect of this facility.
-J.E. Worsham|The doctors, nurses and NP are all wonderful. They listen to me and help me manage with my personal goals to keep me moving forward. They help me manage my pain so I am able to keep working through it. Oh and the sweet office ladies. I can't leave them out. These ladies always have a smile on their face and are so sweet and helpful. Wishing you all a Merry Christmas!!|I have been a patient of Dr. Gordons for the past three years and have always received excellent care. His staff has always treated me with kindness and respect. I will be forever grateful for his professionalism and his excellent care.|I have only seen Dr. Gordon once very briefly. Each subsequent appointment has been with a PA. The structure of the Pain Clinic is such that you must visit once per month (paying your deductible each time) so that they can simply prescribe more meds. In addition to the random drug testing (which in my opinion is only a means to keep authorities from raiding or at a minimum auditing the facility), there is little help offered beyond more services that bring in more money (such as steroid shots by the clinic next door, also owned by the doctors). When I expressed a desire to seek a second opinion from a surgeon, I wasn't discouraged, but it was presented as a last resort with a lot of downside and not much promise of relief. Not sure I would recommend them for someone interested in getting to solutions at the source of the issue rather than simply masking it with pain killers.|Always professional.friendlyand definitely address why you're here and how they can help. Appointments are very close with little waiting. I strongly recommend clinic  and Dr Gordan is trusted to treat my medical issues. Staff is great. Always smiling.|Dr. Gordon has been helping and advising me with my age and work related problems for many years. He has not failed to help me. He helped my wife while she was still living. Just be honest with him and he will help. I have heard good reports about the other doctors at La. Pain Care also.|I have been a patient at Louisiana Pain Care for about 10 years. I have always been treated with the utmost respect and dignity. My appointments have always been right on schedule and handled quickly and efficiently.   I will continue using this facility as long as I need to. Thank you Dr. Gordon and staff for your continued service. Candy Keen

column48: Do I need a physician referral or can I come in directly?
column49: Requesting an appointment using the contact form on our website is considered a self-referral. In order to have an initial consultation, we will need the notes from your last three doctor s visits, any radiology, MRI, or X-Ray that references the source of your pain, and a cover page with your name, contact information, and proof of insurance.

column2: Louisiana Pain Care - Vincent R. Forte, MD
column3:
At Louisiana Pain Care, we are dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain and reclaim their lives. Led by

Dr. Vincent R. Forte

, our practice combines advanced pain management techniques with compassionate care. Dr. Forte received his medical degree from Louisiana State University at New Orleans, completed his anesthesiology residency at the University of Alabama Hospital in Birmingham, and furthered his expertise with a fellowship in pain management at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio. Board certified by both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine, Dr. Forte brings exceptional qualifications to our Monroe clinic.

Our comprehensive pain management services include:

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Diagnostic evaluations

Located at 210 Layton Ave in Monroe, LA, we welcome patients from all walks of life seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Visit Louisiana Pain Care or call us at (318) 616-6877 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11: Dr. Vincent Forte received his medical degree from Louisiana State University at New Orleans. He completed his residency in anesthesiology at the University of Alabama Hospital in Birmingham and completed a fellowship in pain management at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio. Dr. Forte is board certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology as well as the American Board of Pain Medicine. Dr. Forte currently devotes his professional time to helping people from all walks of life overcome their pain and return to their lives.

At River Cities Interventional Pain Specialists, we are committed to offering advanced and compassionate care for patients experiencing chronic pain in Shreveport, Louisiana. Our approach focuses on accurately diagnosing and treating the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. With our team of expert physicians, we deliver personalized treatment plans using minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures designed to help patients return to their daily activities as quickly as possible.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide specialized treatment for a wide range of painful conditions, including:

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neck and back pain

  • Sciatica and nerve pain

  • Chronic headaches and migraines

  • Carpal tunnel syndrome

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Located at 8731 Park Plaza Dr in Shreveport, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure optimal outcomes for our patients. We invite you to visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 318-797-5848 to schedule an appointment with one of our exceptional physicians today.

column40:
For you active duty military guys getting referrals here. 10/10 recommend, tricare had my referrals sent over on a Friday, seen the following Monday for initial evaluation and received the epidural injection Tuesday. No nonsense straight forward doctor. Procedure was fast with minimal pain. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Make sure your provider sends over all your MRI/X RAY'S and other supporting docs with the referral. Experience may vary they worked with me very fast after I explained my time line for my child's surgery and a school I have coming up. I was referred here from Fort Johnson. Good luck!|I have been with Dr. Brewer for years. I did my best to comply with the Rules and Regulations, for the most part I have complied. Beginning about 6 months ago I started being treated as a hostile patient. First, they said my urine test came back positive for fentanyl; which I do not have access to. I had medical procedure s done that may have used that. I couldn't give a urine sample at the snap of a finger so I was made to sit there for four hours drinking water nonstop where I ended up going to the dr. Because I about drowned myself due to having gastric bypass my stomach couldn't hold that. They swabbed my mouth, low and behold it came back fine.

This is the icing on the cake. My daddy is in Hospice and I was with my family. I get a call. We need you to come in for a pill count. I explained my situation. We don't care, you need to be here by 5pm or your prescriptions and appointments will be cancelled. Needless to say, I did not leave my Daddy's side. You do what need to do and my Attorney can handle the rest with the harassment charges along with the charges with what my body may endure by shutting me down immediately. I am a heart patient and this is not good. But Melissa and Carrie Anne, y'all have a blessed day because I'm still with my family and daddy.

I don't need to speak with you Dr. Brewer. Your office lacks empathy. For my daddy to be with Hospice about to pass and Melissa and Carrie Anne demand me to be there or get kicked out enough.  Again, my attorney will handle their harassment. I hope this happens to them in the near future. Have a great day!|Dr Brewer and his staff went above and beyond today during the week of February 15, 2021 ice storm.  They worked all day getting medicine called in and succeeded in getting my husbands called in despite pharmacy closures and electricity outages.  The answering service, Dr Brewer and especially Ms. Nicole, were patient and compassionate, even though I had to call 3 times due to not being able to find an open pharmacy that had his medication.

I'm grateful.  Thank you guys so much for what y'all do|Ive had a great experience with Dr. Brewer & His Staff of PA & Nurses.
I've been treat with respect & some with pain that needed to be controlled & after 5 back surgeries later, Dr
Brewer is doing this well. Working with me in the process of managing the pain. Which by the way get a little out of control sometimes. But Dr. Brewer is always on top of it!
Would highly recommend Dr. Brewer & His Staff of professional!!|Very unprofessional! Waited 2 hours before doctor came in! Then he asked if something was wrong, I asked why my appointment was 2 hours prior and he is just now coming in? Then I stated that if I'm 15 mins late you charge a no show. He decided to reschedule! Mind you I was not loud or rude to this man! He is not above any of us and my time is just as valuable as his.
In response to owner comment, the nurse took 5 mins|Fantastic first visit! Staff was very professional,  yet friendly.

Dr. Brewer offered several options  to go to for medications. I found him very caring towards me, the patient.

I will definitely be going back to Dr Brewer. Thank you, Dr Brewer, for giving me some hope in managing my pain in the future.|Dr. Brewer is the most arrogant, uncompassionate man I ever met. From the 1st visit to the last he not once garnered my trust. Therefore anything asked by him weren't answered. If he had spoken to me compassionately I would have answered. I was even asked no less than 3 times by him and his nurse why I used a wheelchair!! Excuse me Brewer for getting in my condition by incompetent surgeons. I also was made to wait in exam room for an hour and a half with no apology or explanation.|I've been his patient (pain management for MS related issues) for over 4 years, and when he divided his practice and opened a new location, I transferred as well. He is thorough and with all injection procedures, I have had as good or better outcomes than I have had with any other doctor. I read the only 1 Star review and see how he might be misinterpreted, as he does work hard to get to the heart of the issues promptly and demonstrates his concern for patients, not through words necessarily, but with the treatment he offers.

At Advanced Pain Institute, we understand that 1 out of 5 Americans currently suffer from chronic pain, and we're committed to changing those statistics.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our team of compassionate professionals provides thorough consultations, education, and ongoing care designed to alleviate pain and improve quality of life. We believe pain affects not just the body, but also the mind and soul, which is why our approach is holistic and patient-centered.

  • Personalized treatment plans tailored to your specific condition

  • Compassionate care from skilled pain management physicians

  • Advanced interventional procedures to address chronic pain

  • Ongoing support throughout your pain management journey

Located in Hammond, LA, we are well-prepared to provide prime care for all our patients with skill, professionalism, and empathy. Our main goal is to bring relief to those who feel their condition is debilitating and lowering their quality of life. Visit www.painexperts.com or call us at +1 985-345-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain.
column11:
1 out of 5 Americans are currently suffering from chronic pain. We believe that at Advanced Pain Institute, we can change those numbers. Our team of compassionate professionals and supporting staff can alleviate pain, providing thorough, caring consultation, education and ongoing care.

Our main goal is to bring relief to those who feel their condition is debilitating and lowering their quality of life. We are committed and well-prepared to provide and continue to give prime care for all our patients.

Skill, professionalism and empathy are what define us. We are experts in pain, it affects the mind, body and soul. With us you can trust that your overall well-being is our goal. You will feel pain relief and overall life improvement.

WHEN I RETURNED, I saw this " sour puss looking doctor " Dr. Eckersh " who spent LESS than Five ( 5 ) minutes in the room & sent me for a 2nd opinion for surgery BUT DIDN'T EVEN WRITE ME a Script for Pain Meds !!!  it Seems that when DR. STEVE LEE LEFT, HE TOOK MOST OF THEIR PATIENTS WITH HIM.  IN MY PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL OPINION, GO ELSEWHERE. ie, Liberty Intervention ( Dr. Steve Lee ) OR BROC in Baton Rouge. " I really was impressed with BROC.
I Remain: James D. Hodges
NMTCB/RT retired|I've seen Dr Lee since 2018 he is the absolute best! He listens & goes above and beyond to help you with any problems you're having. I have complete trust in his procedures & recommendations. Also Courtney Coyle is also one of my favorites! Friendly & efficient you couldn't ask for better doctors at Advanced Pain! Thank y'all!|I've had a pain dr for 10 years he chose Dr Lee for his patients, he has no patience with you if you don't want what he offers he gives you no chance to think about it. He's like a used car salesman trying to sale you a me car and if you don't except he makes you feel even worse by his words.|I love the people here. From the front desk (especially Rachelle/such a beautiful soul) to the checkout ladies, & all of the PA's and Dr. Lee for sure! Wait time is hardly a wait, they get you back pretty fast.  I've been to both clinics; Hammond and in Covington.  Honestly both places are great.  I do prefer Hammond as it is closer to me. They get to know you by name, which is so sweet of them. I think they all must love working with Dr. Lee because how else can they be so kind and professional to Everyone!   Dr. Lee is both kind, professional, and he truly listens to you & your concerns. He is by far a shining star in pain management as well as in the medical field. I hope they know how thankful I am that he is on my team of doctors who manage my health & wellbeing.|I've been receiving treatment from Advanced Pain Institute for 5 years for chronic knee pain. Dr. Steve Lee has been my physician from the beginning. Excellent doctor. Willing to work with you and your condition and other illnesses. I have chronic leukemia and Dr. Lee always keeps up with my progress. Very knowledgeable and keeps up with the latest techniques and technology. Gabby, his nurse, is excellent in returning phone calls and answering questions. Goes the extra mile for you in handling insurance problems. Office staff very polite and courteous. Will work on scheduling appointments quickly if need be.|I've sat in the waiting room for over an hour trying to see Dr. Lee. Dr. Lee is arrogant and extremely rude. He doesn't seem to care about his patients. When I tried to tell him that the pain stimulator doesn't work he said he didn't like my attitude. I felt as if he wasn't concerned he got his money and I was no longer a concern.|I've been traveling from Denham springs to Hammond for a year now for trament from Dr Ken Earhart and his staff from the day I walked in I was treated like a person and not just a  patient everyone in this esblishment are very helpful and considerate of people's feelings and well-being and as far as Doctor Earhart words truly cannot express the gratitude that I have his bedside Manner and consideration to explain how everything is going is very helpful he has made my life so much easier and I will ever be grateful thank you so much dr. Earhart in short if you're in pain and discomfort Advanced Pain Institute is a place to go I highly recommend them to anyone and everyone God bless have a good day|The moment you walk in the door at API you are greeted by one of the sweetest front desk coordinators I have ever met along with the other young lady that works with her. Both are super nice!  Rochelle makes you feel safe and lets you know that things will be great. I had an appointment with Dr. Lee so I can set up something with Ashely Bratton, FNP specializes in migraine pain to set up an appointment for Botox to help with this. The whole process, from the Medical Assistant, Dr. Lee, the Nurse, on to checking out was great. Dr. Lee listened to what I had to say, what I have done in the past, and what we could do to stop the pain. I have been having migraine pain since I was young and I am now in my mid 40s, so to have someone not want to push medication is what I wanted and needed. I was recommended to get a neurologist on board just to make sure all my ground are covered. I highly recommend Dr. Elkersh and his group at Advance Pain Institute. Three clinics so it is easy to get seen. So grateful I found this group.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions Since 2004

At LA Pain Doctor, our team of interventional pain management specialists—Dr. Firas Hijazi, Dr. George Kum-Nji, Dr. Satvik Munshi, and Dr. Pham—is dedicated to providing high-quality care for residents throughout Louisiana. We've proudly served the communities of Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, and Luling since 2004, offering personalized treatment plans for both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our expertise encompasses a wide range of pain management services, including:

  • Joint Pain Treatment - Hip, knee, and shoulder pain relief

  • Musculoskeletal Disorders - Specialized care for arthritis and muscle pain

  • Spinal Conditions - Treatment for back pain, degenerative disc disease, herniated discs, neck pain, and sciatica

  • Headache Management - Effective solutions for various types of headaches

Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment approaches, we work closely with each patient to develop customized pain management strategies that improve quality of life. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 504-229-4866 to schedule an appointment at our Harvey location at 3820 Lapalco Blvd.
column11:
The goal of interventional pain management specialists Firas Hijazi, MD, George Kum-Nji, MD, Satvik Munshi, MD, and Dr. Pham, MD at LA Pain Doctor is to provide high-quality pain management services to men and women living in and around Metairie, LaPlace, Harvey, and Luling, Louisiana.
LA Pain Doctor has served patients throughout Louisiana since 2004. The team regularly works with individuals to diagnose and treat all types of acute and chronic pain, including hip pain, knee pain, leg pain, arm pain, muscle pain, shoulder pain, and headaches.
The team also specializes in treating musculoskeletal disorders, such as arthritis, back pain, degenerative disc disease, herniated discs, neck pain, and sciatica.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in New Orleans

At Louisiana Pain Specialists, we are dedicated to providing interventional pain management services to adults 20 and older throughout the greater New Orleans area. Under the expert care of Dr. Erik A. Davis and our specialized team, we offer a balanced approach to pain relief in a welcoming, comfortable environment. Our practice combines medications, conservative treatments, and clinically proven interventional solutions to address chronic pain conditions. We proudly serve patients at multiple convenient locations in Kenner, Metairie, Laplace, Baton Rouge, Marrero, and New Orleans.

Our comprehensive services include treatment for:

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Post-herpetic neuralgia

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Burning pain and neuropathy

  • Headaches and facial discomfort

We believe in educating our patients and practicing pain medicine responsibly. Visit Louisiana Pain Specialists to learn more about how we can help you manage your pain and improve your quality of life.
column11: About The Practice Louisiana Pain Specialists is an interventional pain management practice with locations in Kenner, Metairie, Laplace, Baton Rouge, Marrero, and New Orleans, Louisiana. The expert physicians offer pain relief for people 20 and older in a welcoming and comfortable environment. Louisiana Pain Specialists uses a balanced approach of medications, conservative treatments, and safe and clinically proven interventional solutions for people who struggle with ongoing pain. The exceptional team treats failed back surgery syndrome, post-herpetic neuralgia, back pain, neck pain, burning pain, headaches, and facial discomfort. Louisiana Pain Specialists educates their patients and practices pain medicine in a responsible manner.

column40:
Dr E is the most compassionate knowledgeable doctor I have ever met. Hands done the best doctor I've ever been to.  His office staff are caring and dedicated. He truly cares about his patients.|I've been a patient at this clinic for around 6 months, and I can say with confidence that Dr. E and his staff are by far and away the best pain management team in the state of Louisiana. I've been to more than my fair share of doctors from many disciplines, and pain management is easily the most difficult one in which to find quality doctors. The staff at Accurate Clinic is beyond reproach. They treat their patients with compassion, and express a true desire to make their patient's lives better. From the receptionists to the support staff, the nurses, the PA, all the way to the doctor, they are the best team around and it's not even close.

I can't begin to express the gratitude and respect I have for Dr. E himself. He actually spends time with his patients to ensure they are on the best possible treatment plan possible. He coordinates care with my rather extensive team of doctors. He truly listens to his patients and and isn't dismissive of their thoughts, ideas, questions, etc. He's basically exactly how every doctor should be, but unfortunately very few actually are.

There simply aren't enough stars to demonstrate how exemplary this office and it's staff are, and the gratitude I have for their absolute desire to improve the quality of life of their patients.|Ms.Amanda is absolutely EXCELLENT! She goes over and beyond to make sure that you are taken care of! She is very compassionate, caring, outgoing, and truly makes you feel special as a person not just a patient! She is very encouraging and overall more than a 5 star rating!!

Dr.Ehlenberger is a TOP NOTCH physician! He is very kind and thorough! He makes sure he educates you on so many medical topics that it almost feels like a class room! If it wouldn't be for him accepting me as a patient I don't know where I'd be today. It's truly worth the drive!|My husband and I are very pleased with this clinic.  Dr. Ehlenberger is very informative and takes the time to explain things in a way that a person can understand them.  He and his staff are very courteous and kind.  We are being treated for pain and have been helped greatly.  I would definitely recommend this clinic to my friends or anyone who is in need of medical attention.  They have a very informative website which lets you know all the services they provide be it from Massage Therapy, General Practice to Urgent Care needs and much more.|Dr E has been my primary care MD for many years. He takes a lot of time to get to know his patients and utilizes many modern cutting edge principles to promote health and wellness. He is always working on new ways to better his practice and it shows. I would highly recommend this clinic for simple health maintenance and more complex lifestyle coaching.|Doctor Ehlenberger takes his time with his patients and shows compassionate concern.  He goes above and beyond to explain medication and treatment options.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.
A well deserved five star rating.|Waited 5 hours and 30 minutes to finally get ready to see dr EllenBurger. They took my clean urine and claimed there was as a problem with it. I explained that I had to pick up my sick 5 month old child and asked if I can reschedule due to the long wait. They refused me (but told me if I can wait again and use the restroom again that I can see the doctor) I had to leave to get my child so they still charged me 75 dollars for a visit I never had. I can't wait to get my results in for my clean urine that they so called had a problem with. I also waited two months to finally get into this doctor and it has been hell to say the least. If you can get in with Dr. Anseman at my old clinic I would do so any day before accessing this office. The front desk along with the wait time here is unreal. Only a fool would wait that long every month just to get a refill on their pain medication. God bless.!|Dr. E is thorough, incredibly studied, and very empathetic.  My experience as his patient has been superior.  My case has been very complex and far from easy to treat, but Dr. E has showed extreme patience and diligence in helping me find solutions to remedy my pain.  "One size does NOT fit all," and Dr. Ehlenberger tailors his treatment plans specifically to me.  I have been battling chronic pain since 2003 and to date, I haven't received better care by a physician and his staff than I am receiving right now under Dr. E's management.  He takes a comprehensive approach and looks at your entire biological picture to help the patient understand his/her condition and how I can work with him to improve my condition.  Dr. E is constantly educating himself with new research, and incorporating that knowledge into his practice.  If you are having any issues with pain/pain management, I would look no further.  Make an appointment with Dr. E, he is the best in south Louisiana.

column2: Faust Interventional Pain: Barry Faust Jr, MD
column3:
At Faust Interventional Pain, we provide specialized pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Barry Faust Jr, MD. As a double board-certified physician in both Pain Management and Anesthesiology, Dr. Faust founded our practice in 2020 with a commitment to delivering comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Our Specialized Services

We offer a range of minimally-invasive, high-quality treatments including:

  • Image-guided procedures for spine pain

  • Advanced interventions for nerve pain

  • Targeted therapies for musculoskeletal conditions

  • Customized pain management protocols

Our approach combines cutting-edge technology with compassionate care to address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Located in Metairie, LA, our modern facility at 4500 Clearview Pkwy STE 200 is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment tools. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, taking time to listen and develop individualized treatment plans. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, visit Faust Interventional Pain or call us at +1 504-350-8700.
column11: Dr. Faust is double board-certified in Pain Management and Anesthesiology. In 2020, Dr. Faust founded Faust Interventional Pain where he provides high quality, minimally-invasive treatments of pain, including image-guided procedures for spine pain, nerve pain, and musculoskeletal pain.
column38: Kim Sands|teriw989|Linny Ro Ro|Michele R|Sylvia Langlinais|Sharon Ryan|J McLean|Wanda McKinney
column40:
Dr. Faust is highly intelligent, well trained and most knowledgeable about techniques and modalities in his field. I had a telemed consult with him on radio frequency ablation for the facet joints in the cervical spine and he was truly able to make me feel much less anxious about the procedure I am facing. I would highly highly recommend him as he is also a very nice person, so anyone would be in very good hands, with him.|Dr Faust is everything a successful doctor should be; a great listener, he cares about his patients and has tremendous talent. This is a rare combination today. Eight months ago I could hardly walk into his office. Today I am feeling better than I ever thought possible. I wouldn't trust my care with any doctor but Dr. Faust.|I've been with Dr Faust since early 2016, when he first started at his former office, before seeing him, I had given up on having any sort of normal life without pain, or even less pain, as I have had horrible experiences in the past. I can confidently say, he is very proactive and truly listens when I tell him about my extreme back pain and how it's affecting my quality of life, instead of being reactive, which is what other pain doctors have done since my injury. Mine is a complicated case due to a spinal fusion with a lot of hardware in my lumbar spine, but he finds ways around it when doing my procedures and has given me back a semi normal quality of life, that I never thought I was going to have again. His office staff are just as wonderful and caring as he is, you will not find a more caring, compassionate, and competent pain management doctor in the southeast Louisiana region. I highly recommend anyone that is need of pain intervention to go see Dr Faust.|I saw Dr Faust recently for a back pain episode, I was very impressed with the approach he took during my appointment. Dr Faust was very attentive and gave me suggestions to treat my pain at home. He made me feel very comfortable and I will only see Dr Faust for any future pain management.|I would definitely recommend Dr. Faust for pain management.  He is thorough in his exam and listens to what you have to say about your pain issues and will discuss options available for your circumstances.  My recent treatment has proven to be very effective.

His staff is wonderfully helpful.|Everyone is so nice at his office.  He is very thorough with everything.  Has a great bed side manner.  You don't feel rushed or just another number.  He takes his time and listens to everything you have to say.|Dr. Faust is the best interventional pain doctor I've been to. The reason my back was so vulnerable was due to my job as a dentist - having to sit for a prolonged period of time - and my poor posture during work. Dr. Faust's recommended procedures, allowed me to live and work "pain free".
Thank you for everything, sincerely..|The staff is friendly, caring, and supportive  Dr.Faust is all of those things, also, but most importantly, he is extremely skilled. His manner of interacting with you as a patient serves to ease so many concerns.

column2: The Spine Diagnostic & Pain Treatment Center - Sean Graham, MD
column3:
At The Spine Diagnostic & Pain Treatment Center, we provide compassionate pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Sean Graham, MD. Our approach to pain medicine combines medical expertise with genuine empathy—values Dr. Graham learned from both his medical mentors and his father's ministry work.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a holistic approach to patient care that addresses the physical, emotional, and functional aspects of chronic pain. Our services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Medication management

  • Patient education and support

Located in Gonzales, Louisiana, our team takes the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns, ensuring we understand your unique pain experience before recommending treatment options. We believe in creating partnerships with our patients on their journey toward improved quality of life. Learn more about our approach to pain management by visiting our official website or call us at (225) 535-3870 to schedule a consultation.
column11: Just as my mentors in medical school and residency have taught me about medicine, I have learned much about healing from my father. As a child I was always asked if I was going to become a preacher like him. My reply was always no. However, after watching him and learning more about the practice of medicine, I began to realize that I actually did want to follow in his footsteps. Pain Medicine, like ministry, provides a significant and critical component to a holistic approach of patient care and affords patients the steps necessary to truly being able to recover. Everything that I learned from my father about empathy and caring for other people has contributed to who I am as a person and a physician today; just as everything that I learn...

I thought he was the best doctor I had ever met. That is before I met Dr. John Crosby. I have now been in treatment for 20-years for my horrible arthritic disease. Simply put, Dr. John Crosby is by far the best pain management doctor on this planet. Time and time again Dr. Crosby has stepped up to help this veteran. If any of you out there are veterans you know how horrible the VA claim process is... Yet, Dr. Crosby has never denied me the very best care he could offer and as much help as he could provide me in my 7.5 year battle with the VA. At every turn he has been there for me as I'm sure he is for ALL his patients. Dr. Crosby has changed my life for the better. I have no idea how I can return the favor. But I do know how I can help others. And that's by getting the word out about a doctor above all the rest. Oh, and Dr. Crosby is just as good of a man as he is a Doctor. My life has been and will always be PAIN infused. At least, I have the very best doctor I could have ever imagined. Thank you Dr. Crosby for being you and for making my life a little easier. Trust this veteran and do yourself a solid, switch pain management doctor's immediately in favor of Dr. John Crosby. Why not go to the best? I know I did...|I always receive a special care from his team! My meds are reviewed and pain addressed . There's no in and out rush jobs here. I love Dr Crosby staff and my nurse practitioner|Dr Crosby is without a doubt a well educated physician, his experience is definitely documented in a clear and precise manner.
He listens to his patient's concerns and addresses them in a caring way.
I found Dr Crosby to be a gentle man with extremely great knowledge in his field of medicine.
I look forward to the epidural he is going to  administer to my upper back to treat a four year long acute pain from shingles,!|Dr. Crosby and his team are wonderful. He really cares about his patients. I had a really bad surgical experience recently, and I told Dr. Crosby and Casey, his PA everything that I've been going through. They took the time to listen to me, address all of my concerns, and took over the complete management of my post surgical care. I have improved and am getting better day by day because of their care, and I really appreciate them. I've been a patient of his for a couple of years now, and from my very first visit i knew i had found the right doctor for me, and I was pleased because he spent an hour with me talking to me, did a complete exam, and we came up with a plan of care that included physical therapy, medication, an MRI, and what worked for me. I'm a registered nurse and I had two serious injuries to my neck and my lower back years before at work, and I have a couple of other very painful chronic conditions, and Dr. Crosby didn't treat me like I was a drug seeker or like I didn't have the well documented conditions that I have. Instead he took the time to get to know me, really listen to me, and included me in my plan of care. I had been to several other doctors who just dismissed me and treated me like I was crazy, and wanted to just give me drugs which is not what I wanted or needed, and did me no good at all. Dr. Crosby and his team have never treated me that way which I really appreciate. They always take the time to make sure that I'm doing OK, and that my current treatment is working well for me. With this recent issue, I had severe pain and suffering including multiple infections caused by the hospital staff, and my surgeon did nothing about it. Dr. Crosby took over my post surgical pain management care after I explained everything to him, and I'm so thankful for that because when you don't have proper pain management after a major surgery, and i had two mismanaged surgeries at the same time, you can't heal properly which he and his team understands. I can't say enough how thankful I am for them. Without their help and the intervention of my primary care physician I would not be in a good place. I'm healing comfortably now and my pain is under control thanks to them. I give them 10 stars, and I highly recommend Dr. Crosby to everyone!|I wish I had more time to chat with him very knowledgeable man my last visit my wife learned a lot! About inflammation!!!
He told her to look up the Whole30 diet!
She's not big or anything it's just a better way of eating!
That diet is good for anyone very healthy!
Thank you Dr. Crosby for some good advice

At Spine and Pain Specialists, we are passionate about using state of the art treatment options for our patients with back pain, neck pain, or other chronic pain syndromes. Since breaking my neck twice and 13 neck and back surgeries, I have struggled to find a caring and COMPASSIONATE pain doctor. Dr. Hirsch helped me to accept that I will always live have pain and meds might not always take care of it. He put my mind at ease that he would help me along this pain journey. Thank you, Dr Hirsch and thank you staff for taking good care of me.

Dee Smith|The staff at the Spine and Pain management in Bossier are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable . Dr Hirsch is very professional and explained the treatment I'm getting . The clinic is clean and the atmosphere is very calming . .|I was having pain in my right leg for sometime, I had to stop work on December 24th,  2024. Meeting with Dr. Noles..he suggested I get a nerve block..well..on my 70th birthday I had the shots..Epidural Root Nerve Block...they gave me Valium to relax,
I asked for Jello shots..Valium doesn't relax me much..hahaha. I went in with a pain level of 6 and limping...Dr. Noles administered the shots..and Hallelujah...I walked out pain free and no limping..I pray that it will last a long time...I returned to work on February 1st.
The staff was very friendly and polite..
Dr. Noles was the blessing I needed and I thank him for restoring my hope!|The actual appointment has been great Dr Kerr gave me two referrals I've had to wait 3 weeks and I have not got any phone call from physical therapy referral pain management doctor for injections I've had to call the office to get help to get the referrals confirmed. The lady at the office went above and beyond and called herself over to the pain management doctor to get it scheduled and taken care of she was absolutely wonderful|Emily was so helpful at my follow up visit. She's thorough in her explanations & also in offering  care that can help alleviate my pain. The wait time is always minimal to see her!|The people there are so nice . Everyone from the person checking you in to the person taking you to your procedure. I feel that they care for and respect you . They ask how you are doing right then and they don't rush you . Dr. Noles is a caring man . He's always asking how I'm am and he says that he is very sorry about my situation but he is very kind and very caring.|I love Dr. Steurmann. He listens to his patients and tries to choose the best injection options for his patients, and keeps at it to find a solution that works. He is also very personable and one of my favorite docs.  Every nurse I encountered, whether in office or at the injection procedure area, was very kind.|I was seen and my MRI disc reviewed. I left with not much hope. My neck and back will no doubt torture me the rest of my life and not much left to even operate on. Severe critical cervical and spinal stenosis. The rest of my life will not be chasing doctors who can help you because I haven't found one and won't waste my time. In my case I left with what I came with. Untreated chronic pain. Inhumane is my opinion . Sorry for those like me.

column3:
New Orleans East's Premier Pain Management Clinic

At Louisiana Pain Specialists, we believe in a balanced approach to chronic pain management, combining appropriate medications with clinically proven interventional treatments. Located at 5620 Read Blvd in New Orleans East, our team specializes in safe, minimally invasive procedures that deliver effective results for patients suffering from persistent pain conditions. Under the leadership of Dr. Suneil "Neil" Jolly, who trained extensively across the country, we offer advanced expertise in neuromodulation techniques, innovative spinal cord interventions, peripheral nerve treatments, and both ultrasound-guided and fluoroscopically-guided procedures. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Specialized pain control therapies

  • Advanced anesthesiology services

  • Chiropractic care options

  • Medical evaluations and treatment plans

  • Interventional pain procedures

We take pride in our patient-centered approach, dedicating time to thoroughly explain treatment options and develop personalized care plans. Discover our full range of chronic pain treatments or call us at (504) 754-2334 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

column3:
At WK Spine & Pain Specialists, Dr. David Hirsch brings exceptional expertise to pain management in Bossier City. After earning his medical degree from LSU Health Sciences Center in Shreveport in 2011 and completing his anesthesiology residency at Tulane Medical Center, Dr. Hirsch developed a passion for comprehensive pain management. We believe in a multimodal approach that combines both interventional and non-interventional treatments to address each patient's unique needs.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide specialized care for numerous conditions including:

  • Low back pain and neck pain

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Neuropathies and sciatica

  • Spinal stenosis

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Phantom limb pain

Our primary goal is helping patients regain significant quality of life through personalized treatment plans. Located at 2449 Hospital Dr Suite 300, Bossier City, LA 71111, we welcome new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. For appointments or more information, call us at (318) 212-7960 or visit our official provider directory.
column11: Dr. Hirsch earned his medical degree from LSU Health Sciences Center in Shreveport in 2011 and his residency in anesthesiology at Tulane Medical Center. During his residency, Dr. Hirsch was exposed to chronic pain in many different settings, which helped foster his interest in pain management. Dr. Hirsch believes in a multimodal approach to pain management, specifically interventional and non-interventional treatment modalities. He provides care for conditions such as low back pain, neck pain, headaches, neuropathies, spinal stenosis, sciatica, chronic regional pain syndrome, and phantom limb pain among many others. He believes it is vital to so his patients regain a significant quality of life. He enjoys golf, spending time with his wife

At The NeuroMedical Center, Dr. Jake Trahan III brings dual board certification in anesthesiology and interventional pain medicine to patients across South Louisiana. Our approach combines conventional therapies with cutting-edge interventions, including:

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

  • Ultrasound-guided interventions

  • Non-surgical pain relief treatments

Dr. Trahan's expertise focuses on improving quality of life by addressing the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Visit us at The NeuroMedical Center on the 2nd Floor at 10101 Park Rowe Ave, Baton Rouge, LA, or call us at (225) 769-2200 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Dr. Jake Trahan, III, a dual board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain medicine physician, specializes in minimally invasive spine procedures and ultrasound-guided interventions. Joining The NeuroMedical Center, he brings advanced expertise to deliver high-quality care for patients across South Louisiana."

column40:
Very impressed by Dr Trahan, the staff and the facility.  Friendly and informative from the moment I stepped into the office.  He was very thorough and I never felt rushed out of the office.  All of my questions were answered before I could even ask!  I also am appreciative of the explanation of my issues and what options are available to me as far as care goes.  And not just immediate plan, but a long term plan.
Was also very happy with the process of my procedure.  Quick and easy! I loved the next day follow-up as well.
Highly recommend!|My husband was referred by 2 doctors to see Dr. Jake Trahan and the doctor will not take him on as a new patient.  Why?  They won't give us an explanation.  My husband has suffered from Peripheral Neuropathy for 22 years and it has progressively gotten worse.  All the doctors that have seen him over the years said there was nothing they could do for him, so he was given opioids to take.  Our doctor that was managing my husband's pain all these years retired in Dec. 2023 and we were left with a list of doctors to call.  Either the doctors are not taking new patients, or they don't prescribe pain medicines.  We were not told that Dr. Trahan is not taking new patients.  We were told that he would NOT see my husband as a patient. This is a PAIN MANAGEMENT FACILITY.  Please explain to me how this doctor can so easily turn us away without even letting us have an appointment??  I watch my husband writhe in pain everyday, to the point he just wishes he was dead.  It's a shame that a person in this much pain cannot get an appointment at a PAIN MANAGEMENT FACILITY.  The medical system has failed us terribly.|Dr. Trahan has helped change my life. When I met him, he was confident and had a plan. He showed compassion and empathy for my condition. I have been pain free for over 2 months.|I have only been seeing Dr. Jake Trahan for a month and he has already figured out and eliminated the terrible pain I have had in my leg for almost four years. column40:
Earlier Review:  Dr. Patel has stole the last 10-12 years of my mother's life from us.  Years of not being able to function because she's too high on pain pills. Years of me having to answer my children's questions of "what's wrong with maw maw?" Years of watching her slowly fade away and and not be able to stay awake through a whole conversation.  Years of watching her endanger herself.  Years of watching her count pills to make sure she has just enough left to pass that drug screen. It's an addiction and Dr. Patel graciously hands out pills like candy to patients to keep them coming back.

Update:  My mother passed away the morning of Christmas Eve 2023.  She had been on Hospice since early November.  Note to others who may be addicted to the high amounts of pain meds this doctor prescribes to you.....  you will be in tremendous pain in your last days here on earth.  Our Hospice organization was astonished at the amount of morphine and fentanyl patches they were having to administer to her to help alleviate some of the pain.  December 23rd, we were having to roll her to clean her.  At that point she was mostly sleeping and barely speaking.  She would scream out in pain.

This was the case as well through her various surgeries.  Ankle surgery, hip surgery, open heart surgery, partial lung removal.  She suffered in pain because unfortunately there is only so much pain medication they can give you before it affects your blood pressure and other various medical conditions.  Therefore, she suffered.  She would cry out to me in pain wanting me to do something for her and there was nothing I could do. She would continuously ask the nurses to please give her more pain medication, but they couldn't.

I write this review in hopes that maybe someone will see it and get the help that they need.  What may keep you numb right now may hurt you more in the long run.|This place is terrible doctors especially on down no respect no compassion and no resolve to pain issues and they get disrespectful when you try to get help to resolve the pain I've been suffering even more with my issues and I've been with him for 5 + yrs|My wife and I have been going there for the last 5 years. We have nothing bad to say about him. The staff is very pleasant|I have been seeing Dr. Patel for years and never had a problem. He is very thorough and explains everything. I never have a problem getting an appointment to  see him. The staff is very nice and helpful. I would like to thank his mom and dad for him and and wife taking care of me. I would recommend him and his staff to anyone with pain issues.|I love the clinic and I've been a patient for several years. Dr Patel along with his met every need I have to help with my pain.  He's very nice and always pleasant to see during visits or anytime I need procedures.|My biggest issue that I have concerns a complete lack of communication from the staff and the patients. If you have to call for any reason, you will never get someone to answer. And to make matters worse, their voice mail does work. So, your call will never be answered or returned. A very disfuctional system over there.|Wife is a patient she gets herded in and out. Staff and doctors make you feel like a drug dealer. When you need to contact any you get sent to voicemail that is full or not even set up.|Dr. Kelly Boussert with Anne are the best Physician and Physician Assistant I ever had for a long time. They take the time to know your case and you not just a number to the. If there is something they see would help me they bring to my attention. If I need help they are there for me. I would recommend them to anybody that needs a good caring doctor. I hope I don't ever have to start with a new physician like I had to before. It is hard to find a caring physician.

column11:
WellSmart Health Pain Therapy of Opelousas is a community based Pain Therapy practice created to assist area providers in the medical management of their patients with severe pain who require long term pain therapy.

We strive to improve the quality of functional daily life for your patients through the optimization of medications as well as the utilization of ancillary therapeutic services including Physical and Occupational Therapy and Chiropractic care where appropriate.

We accept patients in referral from providers who have determined that their patients are in need of a next level of care for the management of their painful conditions. We do not accept self-referrals.

column38: Shannon Hebert|Lacey Mayeux|Scott Guillory|Rodney Moran|Lonnie Dupuis|sheila mouton|Ndn Beauty|Tammy Bonnette
column40:
Great physicians and staff!  My husband injured his back over a weekend.  Dr. Martin and his PA were amazing, he went from barely able to walk on a Sunday to back to work on Wednesday.  Can't say enough about the treatment he received.|I see Dr. Martin for low back and elbow pain. I tried my best describing the pain in my elbow but didn't think I was making much sense. When I tell you this man injected my elbow RIGHT ON THE MONEY. I went back a month later for my other elbow injection. I now have zero pain in both elbows!!! All 5 doctors are a God send to the Lafayette area. They are so incredibly sweet and very willing to help make their pain patients as comfortable as possible.|I did not end up in need of such services by choice.  My Lafayette-based Marine Corps unit was deployed on a combat mission overseas where I was wounded by enemy fire, leaving me permanently injured, and dependent on medical treatment, hardware, and/or medication to manage the effects of such injuries.

As anyone who has experienced severe long-term pain will tell you, if not properly managed, it will take over every aspect of your daily life.  What was simple before is demanding, and what was straightforward before is now complicated.  To blunt the mental and physical effects of the pain, I devote time daily to stay strong and limber, to eat right and not put extra weight on the injured limbs and joints, to maintain a rest and sleep schedule, to maintain a support group for when the pain is overbearing.  Anything I can do to rely less on medical treatment is a daily priority for me, but some treatment is still required, and is necessary to maintaining a demanding full-time professional career and social schedule.

Recently, I had a refill due at APC Pharmacy.  My home is a couple of hours North of Lafayette.  Upon arrival, the lead pharmacist notified me that the medication would no longer be filled by APC Pharmacy, "because I also have a home and pay a portion of my taxes in Texas."  Although she was prepared to deny the refill, she did not have the written prescriptions required to fill the medications elsewhere.  Should a patient call the nurse's station and request a written prescription, the first thing you're told is to expect up to a 10-day wait, so after doing everything I could to advance my cause, I returned home without the prescriptions.

From the time the refill was due, to the time it was filled elsewhere, nine days passed.  For a person experiencing severe physical pain, whether acute or chronic, neuropathic or nociceptive, one day without treatment is the longest day of their life.  I believe anyone has the right to deny business, whether their reason is right or wrong, but to not consider the patient's basic needs (written scripts) upon denial, leading to consecutive days without treatment, is not caring for the patient's health.  It's careless, it's not healthcare, and it's not professional.

In my case, one careless 'healthcare professional' was responsible for a week of physical agony, a week of unscheduled "vacation" days with my Engineering Firm, a week of zero sleep, a week with little to eat, a week of no exercise, two round-trips to Lafayette, and a daily reliving of the injuries that required me to depend on healthcare treatment in the first place.  Each day was long, and it's not something I plan to experience again.  I leave this review not to convince future patients to not choose, or to choose to be treated here.  In fairness, the majority of the administration, techs, nurses, and doctors in the office and pharmacy are 5-star individuals.  But I leave this review here regardless, because something like this should never occur, yet it occured to me here, and therefore, it could occur to anyone else that chooses to be treated here, and especially anyone else that chooses to fill their prescriptions at the attached pharmacy here, and if I were considering treatment here, I would want to know about such instances, so I could make an informed decision.|I can't  be more displeased at this time. I had an appointment with them but during the Christmas holidays I forgot to call. I made it there to my appointment drove all the way from Alexandria to Lafayette for nothing. They know I got 2 bulging disk in my back just did  epidural injections on my back prior to all this and let me leave there with no script.  I talked to Christine told her I was coming days before that she didn't bother to tell not to come if I didn't call within  a 10 day supply time.

To add insult to injury they gave me another appointment only to call cancel that one and told me they can't see me til sometime in February and I can't get mrds from another doctor cause it would void my contract.  To me that is malpractice.  I am in pain and very upset with them and the VA for allowing this to happen to me a War Time vet.|According to my wife's doctor she needs pain management because of the new legislation passed for prescribing pain meds . She just had emergency neck surgery due to spinal cord damage , went to see dr Rabalais ... the doc was fine however the staff is about useless. They lost her paperwork so now we ha e to make another trip on Monday and they didn't give the correct info to the pharmacy so she has to go all weekend with no pain medicine. Typical Louisiana health care , mediocre at best . No wonder Louisiana is leading the way with drug addiction . Will be looking for other options for her pain management|Been going here for 2 years, was seeing Dr Taylor but he retired, will be seeing Dr Rabalais but until then seeing Nurse Practitioner Angela Morrison, love her, so nice, polite and thourough, no complaints so far. Hope Dr Rabalais is just as good as the rest|Grossly unprofessional behavior due to their lack of customer service and communication skills. Lack of itemize description on billing invoices, very unethical.|Dr. Martin has always been more than kind and helpful, while being sympathetic to my needs. His personaliity is unmatched to any other physician I have encountered.

After seeing every specialist there is, one doctor done exploratory surgery and found that her colon is sticking to all her organs and had to be burned or cut apart. column48: Do I need a physician referral or can I come in directly?
column49: Requesting an appointment using the contact form on our website is considered a self-referral. In order to have an initial consultation, we will need the notes from your last three doctor s visits, any radiology, MRI, or X-Ray that references the source of your pain, and a cover page with your name, contact information, and proof of insurance.

column3:
At NRMC Pain Management Institute, we specialize in providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain who haven't found relief through traditional methods. Our outpatient facility in Natchitoches is led by Dr. Rand Metoyer, who is board certified in both Anesthesia and Pain Management, ensuring the highest level of specialized care.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We are dedicated to helping patients regain control of their lives through our specialized approach to pain management. Our team is trained to evaluate, diagnose, and treat pain stemming from various causes, including:

  • Injury-related chronic pain

  • Disease-related pain (cancer, arthritis)

  • Nerve damage and neuropathy

  • Diabetic pain complications

  • Pain of unknown origins

Expert Pain Management in Covington, LA

At our practice, Dr. Richard C. Robertson, Jr. brings exceptional credentials as a double board-certified specialist in anesthesiology and interventional pain management. As a native of Jackson, Mississippi, and a graduate of the University of Mississippi with both a Bachelor of Arts in Biology and medical degree, Dr. Robertson delivers comprehensive pain management solutions at our Covington location. We offer a range of specialized interventional treatments designed to address chronic pain conditions through our patient-centered approach. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

column11:

column40:
At first, I was skeptical of the entire procedure after many fails with other facilities in Mississippi since 2005.
I've got a Spinal Stenosis diagnosis about 2 months ago but have been suffering with my back since 2005.
The staff here at Dr Billiodeaux's, made you feel welcome and important  from the very beginning. Dr Seth himself was very thorough , in depth and knowledgeable.  I received my first injection yesterday and all I can say is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.
It was fast. I hurt a couple hours afterwards but the medicine fi ally hit where it needed and I've FINALLY  had the best nights sleep I've had since 2005. In my personal opinion,  Dr Seth and staff are the BEST in the business anywhere!
Thank you for giving me back some quality of life you guys. I'm looking forward to my next appointment and HIGHLY  recommend you all to any and everyone suffering from their ailments whom want relief and life back.
Simply amazing!|The staff are all friendly and warm, made me feel comfortable right away. I have 3 disc's in my L's that are all sitting low and are on my nerves.  My second appointment I went in for my injection. It was so fast, I was home within a half hour. The NP is amazing, Dr. Billideaux is very good at what he does. I am grateful for them all. I am pain free and have a follow-up appointment already scheduled. Absolutely 5 out of 5 stars!|I have been seeing Dr. Billiodeaux for years on and off. I have never had any issues getting in to appointments, getting answers to questions. He is by far one of the top doctors I've had the privilege of being worked on by. Kudos to his staff for what they do. I get a lot of people get agitated they don't see him directly even going through VA but his staff is amazing and he does stay informed. Everyone needs to keep in mind he's very sought after for work and to be seen by him. I gotta say he's has an amazing bed side manner and always is there if requested to talk to. I recommend him to all my friends and fellow VA patients for work. Good job Doc keep it up and to his stuff you all are killing it keep up the amazing work also.|My visits was to have injections in my back/neck with Dr. Billodeaux. The front desk associates were wonderful at all times. The last two injections was absolutely horrific for me. Both times of the injection as Dr. was administering them It felt like electric bolts going through my arms and head as my arm came off table. So scary the Dr. said whoa and i told him that scared me. Long story short Dr. and his assistant both times was cold with no emotion. I had to get off table no help with my arms feeling so painful. Never will I ever recommend him nor his assistant. The Nurse Practitioner was so caring and thoughtful.
0 rating for my experience.|I am a veteran finally got a community care appointment after 3 window visits. Brought MRI results with me 2 buldging disc 3 pinched nerves excruciating pain and they set me an appointment for August 28th  32 days later
The VA send us to private doctors to be seen expeditiously in this they failed. Dr Billideau did not see me on my initial visit all reviews that say he did is a lie and fake. You won't see him until time of procedure|As nurses, both my wife and I have worked with many physicians. My wife recently had a MRI performed and the results showed several disk that was causing her severe pain in her neck and and shoulders. We researched the various pain management physicians in the Lafayette and surrounding area that could suggest the best treatment without going directly to surgery. We found Dr. Seth Billiodeaux at MEMORIAL MEDICAL GROUP INTERVENTIONAL SPINE AND NEUROSURGERY in Lake Charles.  My wife set up an appointment and he treated her with the Steroid Injections. The pain started subsiding within a few hours of the injection. By the afternoon of the same day, her mobility improved greatly and the pain was now very manageable. The next morning she was pain free. She seen Dr. Billiodeaux twice for the same issue. The first injection kept her out of pain for close to 5 weeks. Of course each patient will experience different results. However, 5 weeks pain free is quite extraordinary and she is very pleased.  What we like about Dr. Billiodeaux was his thoroughness, positive attitude and sincerity in caring for her. We drove from Lafayette to Lake Charles. In view of the results, the drive was well worth it.  His staff was simply great. We highly recommend him for pain management based on the positive results. If you are experiencing back or neck pain, I truly believe a visit with Dr. Billiodeaux will be well worth your time. Thank you Dr. Billiodeaux, seeing my wife free from pain not only made her life better but mine as well. You are simply one of the best and we can not thank you enough.|Dr Leger sent an urgent request for Michael hales for upadural and a shot in his neck where the pinched nerve is. Lady put me on hold and said they did not receive it. Dr sent it to you again yesterday. Lady this morning said mame we have a lot of referrals and it will take awhile. Call back in a couple days!!!  Husband in excruciating pain so now we are in the ear here at memorial emergency .

My husband did get to see Dr Keller. He was awesome. He explained everything in detail and answered all questions.

As I said earlier, your staff at the window do not appear to have any empathy for the major pain my husband is in.

Filled out paperwork, paid the co pay and when finished my husband brought back the paperwork to the desk. I asked him where was the receipt for payment, and he had left it with the paper he turned in. When asked for the receipt, she stated she had shredded it!!!  Shred a receipt   She did print another one, but I've never heard of anyone shredding a receipt.

I was extremely tired as I had been bringing my mom to her dr appointments and my husband all week and was exhausted. So while waiting I put my head on my hand staring into space,
I just happened to have my head facing the reception window,  they looked at one another, opened the window and they both said , do you need something , not real nice like I was staring at them.

To me they are young yuppie young ladies and we were treated as if we did not matter. Again the have no empathy for excruciating pain as they probably have not had pain like that.

Just to be clear, not the doctors in any way. The window staff could be more attentive to patients pain.

Talked with the nurse with Dr Leger and they sent the request on Monday and Tuesday and again Wednesday. I wonder what happened to the first two.

Anyway, I am very thankful that you are taking care of my husband. Right now all he can do is lay in bed so it does not hurt. Still waiting for appt for mri as he has an appointment to see you again on Tuesday. I'm sure they will call Monday.

Thank you again for caring for my husband and understanding the pain.

We saw dr  Keller last Thursday. He was to order an mri and made an appointment for Tuesday which is tomorrow. I called the mri and they have no records on my husband and she said when she did get it it would take two weeks.

My husband is almost out of pain medicine. We cut them into fourths to make it last. He cannot go without pain medication for two more weeks. The only relief is lying down.

If you can't do anything we are going back to emergency and someone is going to help my husband.

Called your office again and they are waiting on the insurance to approve the shots. The mri will come later. Thank you Jesus.

Thank you
Michael and Kathleen Hales.|Dr. Billiodeaux takes time to talk to his patients, consider options, and provide excellent care.

I visited Dr. Billiodeaux after top Houston doctors were not able to provide solutions, or demonstrate genuine concern for me, my pain, or my health.

Dr. Billiodeaux showed real interest, kindness, and patience with my many questions, and his techniques were painless and effective.

Dr. Billiodeaux understands the nuances of pain and the unique complexity of each patient, is forward thinking, analytical and optimistic.

I heartily recommend him and his excellent Team at Memorial Hospital in Lake Charles.

column11: As an Emergency Medicine physician for greater than 10 years, I have experienced the difficulty of treating patients in chronic pain and seen the hardships these patients endure. The lack of effective treatment that many had access to was disheartening and drove my interest into Pain Management. After completing an Interventional Pain fellowship at UMMC, it is my hope to establish a practice that supplies empathy and compassion to those in chronic pain. It is my belief that the field of Pain Management is in its infancy. However, rapidly expanding technical knowledge is making new treatments available to patients today.

column38: Donna Farmer|Brent Alexander|Lourdes Tucker V.|Joy Alexander|Emmanuel Russo|Brian Knight|Craig Lamarsh|Maria Lauriano
column40:
I was referred to Dr. Grieshaber by my rheumatologist NP for back pain. He's polite, knowledgeable, very nice & friendly. He listens to you & you don't feel rushed like you do at some other Drs offices. His office staff is nice & polite. I would highly recommend Dr. Grieshaber to anyone. I would give him 10/10.|Dr Grieshaber helped my mom with severe back pain and hip pain. He spent time with her at both office appointments and made her feel at ease. I would highly recommend him for pain management.|Been having this extreme pain for almost 5 years, the Meds for pain weren't helping, to a point that I became allergic to any Pain medication. The sciatic nerve have been pinching me all this time to both of my hips, running down through the back of my legs to a point that was so unbearable even to stand, felt like it was paralyzing me. Then my Rheumatoid Doctors Perdue & NP Burgess's recommended that I see a Pain Management doctor; well that's how I ended up at Dr. Dominick Grieshaber.
He's polite, knowledgeable, pays attention to detail, well mannered, cares for his patients, and his Staff those nice Sweet ladies are great also.
Dr Dominick explained to me what was best for me to relieve the pain, first I had an MRI and that showed what he suspected, he explained the xray to me and told me the solution, which of course I agreed. Now I feel like a new person, I can go dance  now. What a difference it made, I'll be seeing him again if anything arises, but for the moment I am enjoying my freedom of pain relieved. And Thank You|Epidural steroid shot Took 99% of pain in hip and back away. Dr. Grieshaber explained my pain and prognosis very well. I am so grateful|Domenick Grieshaber gives top-flight pain management care, no question about it.  You'll have his full attention, throughout, and reach your goals faster. Dr. McMyne is a very caring and concerned physician.  He listens to you about your issues and comes up with a resolution. His staff is also very polite and caring.  I would recommend him to anyone that's having chronic pain.|I have been going to Dr McMyne for at least 10 years with neck and back problems. He truly gave my life back, extending my ability to work by many years. Before specializing in pain management, his specialty was physical medicine and rehab.  His focus is getting you to the highest level of function possible, given your particular problems. He sent me to neurosurgery when it was appropriate. I am retired now, but his focus is still on me gaining maximum function.  Having the fellows there has been great. Two heads are always better than one and sometimes they come up with an idea we had not thought of previously.  Fellows are doctors who have finished their residency and can start working but they want a super specialty in pain management. I have referred many to this clinic.|The front desk personnel were very friendly and professional. At Ochsner Health, Dr. John Vu brings exceptional expertise to pain medicine with dual board certifications in anesthesiology and pain management. Dr. Vu completed his medical degree at Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center in New Orleans, followed by his anesthesiology residency at Ochsner and a specialized fellowship in pain medicine at Emory University in Atlanta. We offer a range of advanced pain management solutions including:

  • SI joint therapies

Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring each patient receives individualized attention. Located at 105 Medical Center Dr, Slidell, LA 70461, we welcome new patients seeking relief from chronic pain. Contact us at (985) 639-3777 to schedule your consultation with Dr. Vu.
column11: John Vu, MD, is a pain medicine doctor with Ochsner Health. He earned his medical degree from Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center in New Orleans. At Thibodaux Regional Pain Clinic, we are specifically-trained specialists dedicated to diagnosing, preventing, and treating both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our expert team, led by Dr. Keith Duplantis and Dr. Luis Hernandez, provides personalized care for patients suffering from a wide range of pain-related issues. We understand how debilitating pain can be, which is why we offer comprehensive treatment options to help you regain control of your life. Our services include management of:

  • Neck and Shoulder Pain

  • Knee and Elbow Pain

  • Herniated Discs and Pinched Nerves

  • Arthritis and Cancer-related Pain

  • Headaches and Migraines

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

  • Damaged Nerves and Post-surgical Pain
