Seen him the appointment time is to long.|Dr Jahi walked in and didn't introduce himself to me and yelled at me and immediately told me we are not in the business for passing drugs...I looked him and said I came here for help, I am dealing with a back injury that has setup arthritis. He didn't even care.He didn't try to listen to what was wrong with me.His attitude was very rude toward me.I am dealing with back pain, alone with knee pain, feet feels like I am walking on blisters. I have been fighting this injury since 2007.I have a family a husband with 2 amputee legs...8 grandkids that loves mamalinda 's house and don't want to leave.I never though I would be going to a doctor office and being treated like a dog. I am a very nice person I treat people the way I wants to be treated. I have been a very hard worker in life...it's sad to see that when you need help nobody is willing to listen...My Oncologist was treating me for 4 years..I received radiation and them Chemotherapy. Now I am cancer free when I took my last chemo treatment I became weak in my legs and became bed bond for almost 2 weeks. I couldn't walk or even turn myself over. I couldn't even pick up my TV remote..I continue to get this weakness in my legs and sometimes no feeling in my legs to my feet...but no one even care enough to sit down and try to help to figure out what's wrong...I have always been there to help anyone that needed me but now no one is here for me. I though a doctor suppose to care about their patient have sympathy for their patients. Nobody care for Linda...Once someone reads this they will remember she was only reaching out for help...I never thought I would be dealing with this...it's hard to not be able to walk and hurting and nobody cares enough to run tests to see what really going on...I took my meds 2 in the am and around 3pm no later than 4pm that pain would hit...my lower back to my buttocks down my right leg to my knee hurts...if I can describe the pain like that I must be telling the truth..I have no reason to lie...no one has to help me..just be sure to tell my family and especially my grandkids i love them...I hate to do what I am going to do..but I am tied of running from doctor to doctor asking for help and they are looking at me like I am a junkie....I am just a person who injury herself and need help managing my pain...life has been good to me..But I have to more fight left in me...Suicide is my best option...nobody gives a Damm anyway...I am just a name on a piece of paper...they don't realize I was a mother..wife..grandmother...Thanks for not giving a Damm about me...Linda Keller...|Dr. Jiha was very friendly and professional.  He recommended options that my last doctor never mentioned.
I'm very glad I was able to see Dr. Jiha. I felt that my visit was very productive.

At our pain management practice, Dr. John G. Noles brings over two decades of specialized experience to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Dr. Noles earned his medical degree in 1999 at LSU Health Science Center and completed his residency in Anesthesiology at Parkland Memorial Hospital in Dallas, which was the largest anesthesia residency program in the United States at that time. We take pride in offering individualized care, understanding that each patient responds differently to pain therapies and medication techniques.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We provide comprehensive pain management solutions including:

  • State-of-the-art procedures for unusual and difficult painful conditions

Dr. Kramm is the best pain management doctor that I have ever seen. He listens to me. I have seen him for years. He has always been helpful in trying different things to help reduce my pain. He also has the best staff.|Dr. Kramm has truly been a life saver to me. After having suffered immeasurably for many years from an infected & inflamed opened wound that would never completely heal, Dr. Kramm introduced me to a very simple injection that could help the inflamed nerves to calm down to allow healing to take place. In less than 2 weeks, my wound was completely closed up and my wound care specialist was shocked and asked for his name. 3 weeks prior, bone was visible!

Dr. Kramm truly cares to get to the cause of the problem. His kind and calm bedside manner puts one at ease. He is humble and tells you the truth. He is compassionate, understanding, and Tricia, Stephanie, Catherine, and Kelsey always go over and above to make sure that anything I need is handled. There's no comparison out there. Kramm's the best.|Amazing everything.
he admits to at one point being a young whippersnapper who thought he knew everything and then realized if he wants to help his patients, he's got to listen to us! And he does. If you have pain and no one can seem to figure it out, it could be a soft tissue problem that Western medicine doesn't necessarily think is an issue. Until it turns into an issue. Normally people have to wait for surgery. He does such a vast variety of injections So that the body can heal itself!? Yes, it's true. And we have a lot of work to do on me L O L, but he is not the least bit intimidated by a very very complex situation: congenital issues, along with several injuries that went untreated for many years. Injuries on top of injuries. He's funny and explains things well. Is naturally curious about anything that would help us to alleviate chronic pain. He works well with other doctors and even ask me questions about what to do because it is, as he says, my body.|Dr. Kramm is very kind and understanding. He's the best doctor I've ever seen! And because of my illness, I've seen a lot! If he isn't sure of something, he takes the time to research it. I allowed my husband to go in at several of my visits and he said the same thing! He's the best doctor we've ever seen!|Dr Kramm himself is very good but not his staff. I have been a patient for around 10 years. Unfortunately lost insurance.  Trying to transfer to a doctor on Medicaid for now but won't help. Not even a call back to say no. This after giving me expensive new medicine. I can't afford both a 200+ appointment and over 300 for medicine due to new rules.|I agree with the other reviewer who wrote that Dr. Kramm is the best doctor in the state. I have to add a slight caveat that he is in my top three, but I would find it very hard to rank those three any further than that. He is an exceptional physician who treats me for pain from rheumatoid arthritis and shingles-related nerve damage. I never have to wait more than five minutes in his quiet, peaceful waiting room. His staff is calm and efficient. They must not ever over-book, because Dr. Kramm always spends as much time with me as I need. He explains everything in detail at the level of a patient's ability to understand. He also has a sense of humor and obviously loves people. I hope he will continue to be my doctor for a long, long time!|I have been going to Dr. Kramm for about six months now.  I can barely put into words what this doctor means to me and just how good he is!
I am a very sick female with a lot of problems.   Dr. Kramm has ALWAYS taken his time with me and he actually listens to me.  What doctor does that these days?  He takes care of your problem and for once in many years I can live a quality life.

This is the best doctor in the whole world if you ask me!   There is not another like him!!  If you have issues with pain, this is your doctor.   I would like to keep him to myself, however,  that wouldn't be fair to Dr. Kramm.

The wait time is never over 15 minutes.   There is absolutely nothing about this doctor that I say that's negative.   He'said the BEST!

Triple Board-Certified Pain Management Specialist in Covington, Louisiana

At our practice, we provide comprehensive interventional pain management and headache medicine services with 18 years of specialized experience. Dr. Conn brings her background in Chemical Engineering from Louisiana State University and extensive medical training to deliver exceptional care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We are proud to be triple board certified in:

  • Neurology by American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology

  • Pain Management by American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology

  • Headache Medicine by United Council of Neurological Subspecialties

Our approach focuses on minimizing opioid use while employing a variety of proven therapies including nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, and advanced pain management techniques. We take the time to listen to each patient's concerns and develop personalized treatment plans that address their specific needs. Located at 187 Greenbriar Blvd UNIT A in Covington, we serve patients throughout Louisiana with compassionate, evidence-based care. Visit our website or call us at +1 985-345-7246 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

Neurology by American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology

Headache Medicine by United Council of Neurological Subspecialties

column40:
Dr. Patel has stole the last 10-12 years of my mother's life from us.  Years of not being able to function because she's too high on pain pills. Years of me having to answer my children's questions of "what's wrong with maw maw?" Years of watching her slowly fade away and and not be able to stay awake through a whole conversation.  Years of watching her endanger herself.  Years of watching her count pills to make sure she has just enough left to pass that drug screen. It's an addiction and Dr. Patel graciously hands out pills like candy to patients to keep them coming back.

Update:  My mother passed away the morning of Christmas Eve 2023.  She had been on Hospice since early November.  Note to others who may be addicted to the high amounts of pain meds this doctor prescribes to you.....  you will be in tremendous pain in your last days here on earth.  Our Hospice organization was astonished at the amount of morphine and fentanyl patches they were having to administer to her to help alleviate some of the pain.  December 23rd, we were having to roll her to clean her.  At that point she was mostly sleeping and barely speaking.  She would scream out in pain.

This was the case as well through her various surgeries.  Ankle surgery, hip surgery, open heart surgery, partial lung removal.  She suffered in pain because unfortunately there is only so much pain medication they can give you before it affects your blood pressure and other various medical conditions.  Therefore, she suffered.  She would cry out to me in pain wanting me to do something for her and there was nothing I could do. She would continuously ask the nurses to please give her more pain medication, but they couldn't.

I write this review in hopes that maybe someone will see it and get the help that they need.  What may keep you numb right now may hurt you more in the long run.|Great doctor and staff, I would definitely recommend to anyone, this doctor listen to your problems and make sure he solves it to the best of his knowledge, you will be satisfied|Dr patel he is a Great Doctor and his wife is a Great Doctor too they both treat you Great  and you can always ask them about anything and they will Let you know about it or on your next Doctors appointment they will have the answer for you|Never returns insurance company's calls for prior authorization of meds. Blue Cross has been trying for over a month so I can get my meds.  No one returns their calls, nor mine.|I've been a patient 4+ years now and I'm very pleased with the level of care I recieve from CPM and the staff are very professional and sympathetic towards others. There's been a lot of changes in Pain Management over the past 5 years and I'm really blessed to be with a Dr that works through them with the patients (ME) and to find the most cost efficient methods.|After seeing dr Patel for the last 15 or more years, I was basically left to fend for myself. Dr Patel apparently did this to all the patients at the same time. I found a great doctor in Hammond and Noel's better than ever!|This outfit is poorly run. Because they would not approve prescriptions for Express Scripts they discharged and blocked my wife. Now she is blocked from seeing other pain management doctors. No other doctors will see her and the pain continues. Apparently there is no recourse|Great doctor and Staff, little hard to get through on the phone, but Super Nice People.

column3:
At Dr. Steve C Lee's practice, we provide cutting-edge interventional pain management services where we treat our patients like family. As

Board-Certified Pain Management Specialists

, we combine advanced techniques with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. Our comprehensive approach includes:

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

  • Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) for back, neck, and knee pain

  • SI joint fusion with less invasive techniques

  • Personalized medication management

  • Medical cannabis evaluations and recommendations

We pride ourselves on taking the time to listen to each patient's unique concerns and developing customized treatment plans that address their specific needs. Our dedicated team, led by Dr. Lee and including our compassionate PA-C Courtney Coyle, works diligently to improve quality of life through effective pain management strategies. Visit us at our Metairie location or learn more about our services online. Contact us today at (504) 270-1930 to schedule your consultation at our office located at 3901 Houma Blvd #113, Metairie, LA 70006.

column40:
I have been a patient of Dr. Steve Lee for 14 years now & I can only say that he is the BEST Dr. that I have had in my 67 years old life ! He is always attentive to my many aches & pains & when I have needed surgery & other procedures he has always explained in detail all the benefits & risks involved. I truly appreciate his kindness, caring & compassion & am so glad that he is my doctor! ( also kudos to his wonderful staff especially Courtney !)|My doctor retired and I got stuck with a money grubbing pill pushing excuse for a competent pain management doctor. If all you want are drugs then he's your guy.....nothing wrong with that. If you want responsible,long term care, don't waste your time.|Dr. Lee is THE BEST pain management doctor!! If you want to see a very talented, compassionate, intelligent doctor who really cares about his patient's well being and will do everything within his power to make your life pain free, this is the doctor for you. Dr. Lee is very caring, understanding, knowledgeable,
and very compassionate. I have had different treatment options with Dr. Lee and I'm happy with all the outcomes. I've had injections and radiofrequency ablation (RFA) in my back, neck, and KNEES and had great outcomes each time.  I am so happy I found a WONDERFUL and CARING doctor!! Thanks, Dr. Lee, for helping me!!
His PA-C,  Courtney Coyle, is compassionate, helpful and super sweet. She truly hears what you say when you talk to her. The office staff is very helpful and pleasant to interact with.|If you are in need of someone who cares, & is up to date on all new procedures & medications Dr. Lee is your guy.  He will even make sure you get the things he feels you need to live your life to the  fullest.Even if it means him getting on the phone! Also his staff are amazing. They buzz around so busy all the time, but never too busy to ask about grandbabies, etc... lol! They are sweeter than ice tea on a hot day! Y'all  see!|He is amazing when everyone else gave up on me he said he would be there for me in anyway he could and so far he has I would follow him wherever he is and  Courtney his nurse practioner is just the sweetest and they do listen and try to figure out the best plan for you|Dr. Lee has been a big help in managing my pain. From performing a much less invasive SI joint fusion to helping me to get off opoids and replacing them with medical cannabis. Getting off the opioids is the best thing that has happened in my pain journey. Medical cannabis has helped me so much more, without the side effects of the opioids.|Dr. Steve C. Lee, is truly a patient-attentive, caring young doctor in the field of pain control. He takes the time needed, understanding that each individual patients life & situation is not always as routine as the regimen prescribed, and works with each person on that basis. Advanced Pain Institute has wonderful staff,
are extremely flexible, and for those who have a true medical need, I'd highly recommend them.|Dr. Lee was highly recommend for pain, but I got a lot more. His staff is first rate from when I enter to walking out the door. I lived with chronicle pain for some time after many Surgeries. After treatment I don't even take Advil. Dr. Lee's the beast!!!

column40:
I can't believe anyone would post a negative review about this office. Dr. Royster and all of his staff are excellent professionals that address your needs on an individual basis, and you are treated with the utmost respect, compassion and dignity.  It is so refreshing to have not only Dr. Royster there to listen to my concerns and address my issues, but also each and everyone of his staff and nurses.  They will all go out of there way and bend over backwards to help you with any of your concerns.  They are extremely prompt, courteous and they really DO treat their patients as part of their extended family.  I would always recommend these fine folks to anyone that I encounter.  Keep up the great work you guys, it is DEEPLY appreciated and so are each and everyone of you.|Dr. Royster and Dr. Simpson are amazing!
The entire staff team is just as great! From the moment you walk in you'll so welcomed, so at ease and well taken care of; before and after procedures.
Best pain specialist in Louisiana.|I became a patient here in November of 2022 and I was given injections in my neck. As a result I lost my mobility in my right arm. I've tried contacting Dr. Simpson for 4 consecutive months and I was denied access of speaking to him. I went to another state and sought further treatment. Upon my return I went inside the office to sign a medical release form and I was also denied that by the Racist nurses there. At this point I'm having to seek legal advice to obtain my medical records to see if this was a attempt to end my life. I'm advising All African Americans to stay away from this medical facility it's not a African American friendly facility. Dr. Royster staff isn't any better. The entire office is filled with a bunch of unprofessional, rude Racist who don't have the courage to tell African Americans they're not welcome there.|Today, I was Annoyed that I'd waited over an hour and watched 5 people go to the back that came in after me. I verbally expressed my frustration, I heard Several staff members laughing and  talking about me once the door to my room was closed. A nurse/ aid talked to me like she was my elderly grandmother when I said I was Annoyed then had a condescending attitude with me when I answered her back. Completely unprofessional, you can't get mad when a patient is rightfully frustrated and call you out for it. I  won't be back.|COVID restrictions have put medical offices personnel in new and every changing roles.  However, I found the frontend staff friendly and helpful.  The backend clinical staff were kind, and knowledgeable.  Dr. Royster was exactly the type of physician I like working with ~ fully engaged in a conversation, listens and responds.  I would highly recommend Dr. Royster.  Dr. Royster responded to my pain issues with positive outcomes ~ am I cured no ~ but I am not taking medication either.  On going treatment for an on going pain is the plan until another plan requires development.  Thank you IPN!!|Dr. Eric Royster is amazing! I've been with him for several years, and I'm so thankful to have him as my Pain Management SPECIALIST!! He respectfully treats me as an individual with my own special pain issues and does that with  empathy and dignity!! I highly recommend Dr. Royster as a TRUE Pain Management SPECIALIST!!|I am submitting this review based on the quality of service received from staff.  I contacted the clinic as I suffer from migraines and other regular  headaches. I was excited to make an appointment with Dr. Friedman after reading his bio. I was told by a very unfriendly staff member answering the phone that I had to send my medical records prior to making an appointment. (Something I have never had to do for any other clinic). None the less, I requested my records to be be sent from my former doctor's office and a couple weeks later sent an email to the office of Integrated Pain and Neuroscience to ask if they had received my records so I could call and make an appointment. I sent this email three times and never received a response. It is 2019 and it is common practice to use email as a communication tool during our busy days. To be ignored by the staff of a pain clinic is utterly disrespectful and unprofessional. Unfortunately I will never find out if Dr. Friedman is a wonderful doctor as I must now start a new search due to the lack of empathy and professionalism of this clinic's staff.|I can't say enough about how great this place is.  The doctors are very personable, actually listen, take their time with each patient, and have/use a wide variety of tools/techniques at their disposal to help their patients out. I really can't say enough about the wonderful job these doctors do. Wish there was a 6th star I could give them. Very highly recommended. Call and ask to see Dr Royster or Kim today. You'll be happy you did.

I suppose he's about as good as anyone if you have the time to wait. From your appointment time until he sees you plan an hour and you a half to two hours waiting in those hard little chairs, I usually bring a book..|Dr. Aust is undeniably the most compassionate pain management doctor I have encountered. He is extremely educated on a vast variety of conditions.
After 10 years of having a debilitating pain issue starting in my early 30s that led to a much lower and very difficult quality of life, Dr. Aust took the time to get my pain, which was a general 5-8 daily, under better control, around a 4-6 per day until we could do the surgery that took my pain down to a 0-2 ALL THE TIME. Dr. Aust gave me back my quality of life from the horrible condition of the bladder called IC. He and his growing staff are exceptional.
His Nurse Practitioner, Nicole, is also compassionate and extremely capable for continuing care.
My best doctor hands down.|Dr.Aust was highly recommended by a top neurosurgeon at Southern Brain and Spine when I explained to them that I would prefer not to do major invasive surgery with the fusion. Dr AUST really knows what he's doing. I've been going to him for several years now and he gets results. Namely pain relief, Without fusion surgery. I would highly recommend him to anyone suffering from miserable, debilitating back pain. His whole staff and team are professionals. They're fast efficient knowledgeable and friendly. Bottom line they get the job done.|Personally, Dr. Aust is an excellent pain management doctor. I would recommend him highly I mean really highly anyone who needs help for Painmanagement.|Dr Aust has done medial blocks and rhizotomies on my shoulders and lower back from injuries I received from a car wreck years ago and I refused surgery then. All the non invasive procedures have been a total success.  He even corrected the 1 rhizotomy that another doctor done, in Dr Aust absence...my mistake for allowing the other Dr to do and dismissed his mistake in the procedure.  Dr Aust fixed the other Dr's mistake.  I am so thankful for everything Dr Aust has and still is doing for me.  He is so committed and compassionate with his patients. I will never see anyone else. He has saved me from the horrible surgeries that other Dr's have said I needed. My best decision ever when I found Dr Aust.  If you have the opportunity to see him, you will be glad you did. I have several friends I suggested him to and they too are happy with the outcome of seeing Dr Aust too.|I truly was looking forward to working with Dr. Aust--he came highly recommended by some top political affiliates/close friends who have utilized his services--it's unfortunate that I called on Septmeber 11-expressed the major concern with current, persistent Sciatica--I was told I could not schedule an Appt due to "New Patient Coordinator" being Out-Of-Office; I was told the next day, would receive a call; never did--until Friday (September 15)--of course, the pain was persistently heavy, which is what prompted my call as semi-emergency attention was needed; it seems for  whatever reason, someone dropped the ball on properly following up with a potential new client who owns several thriving businesses and would have gladly paid over and beyond the cost of rendered services--when the person did finally reach out, the energy seemed apathetic and certainly unapologetic. It's unfortunate you have to jump thru so many hoops, which prevented a potentially great patient-Doctor relationship from being formed and a path to alleviating persistent Sciatica.|Dr. Aust is not only on of the kindest people in the world, he is an amazing doctor. I have suffered with lots of back pain from a car wreck 5 years ago, and Dr. Aust  has not only alleviated so much of the hurt, but he has constantly been concerned and checks up on me to make sure I am doing well. He is NOT the standard " Let's do surgery" doctor. In fact , his methodologies are designed around not having to rely on pain medication and surgeries. I highly recommend Dr. Aust! Just to top it off, his manners and consideration are unparalleled. If you are suffering, see Dr. Aust now!|5 stars is below what I would rate a professional who gave me back my ability to bend, twist, and turn...

Unscrupulous doctors like this is the reason why the opiod epidimic is out of control. My visits consist of a urine sample to staff and usually a wait for up to 30 minutes to answer routine questions about your medication which takes at the most 2 minutes from a office staff. Then a couple of hours later the doctor would call and the entire call would last from 8 to 10 seconds and in that time he gives you your next office visit. On my last visit instead of waiting my up to 30 minutes I waited for 2 and 1/2 hours for the staff to come get me and ask me questions I was irritated and told the staff that sitting for 2 1/2 hours is not good for my back. They called in medicine. I assumed everything was okay but 33 days later when I had not received my call to come in I left a message for the office and then at that time was told I was released from the clinic without any notice. The doctor is well aware of my medical condition and this is illegal for him not to give me proper notification to seek another doctor. This was done out of spite from his incompetent staff! I did get my medication! Doctor is in it only for money! He is rich!|Love doc munjumpali and his staff. They are very kind and helpful. I seen this doctor dismiss an elderly woman in her early 80's because she missed an appointment the day before because of transportation issues with Medical transportation which she took from Mansfield, Louisiana. I also seen the same with other patients for no reason|Great doctor & staff!! They never make me feel judge for being there. Would recommend to anyone! I literally drive 2 hours to see Dr M!|Stay away is all I can say. I have never witness anything in a doctors office like what I witnessed at this place. Doesn't care one way or the other about treating people..3 hours past my appointment  finally  see this man. Look elsewhere if you need health care.|Dr. Munjampalli's office usually runs very well.  You usually have to leave a message and be called back to talk to them,  but they usually phone back pretty quickly. PA's are also usually done pretty quickly as well.  I do use the word usually because like everywhere else, sometimes things fall through the cracks. The staff is always absolutely amazing!! As for Dr. Munjampalli, I like him very much.  I had a false positive drug screen,  which he only asked me about after the !4th! false positive test. Most doctors would have booted me after the first one without even exploring the reason for it. I explained I have had this issue before because of one of the other medications I take that cause a false positive result.  He took me at my word and gave me an oral test the next time. He does everything he can to make sure I can stay a patient and get the treatment I need. My only very small issue is I needed a tiny increase in my medication and it then became about smoking.  Asking me if I just planned on being on these medications for the rest of my life and if I didn't help myself he wasn't going to continually up my medication. Again small issue,  his reasoning was medically spot on. Which he actually took the time to explain. Overall, I recommend him highly. No place is ever perfect,  but here they do try very hard to be just that, perfect.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We specialize in treating a wide range of conditions including:

  • Joint pain

Ended up with 2 compression fractures at T11, and L1. Also blowed several disc out in my Lumbar spine. I had a double discectomy to cut the bulges off of the disc that blew out. After that, I have lived in very bad pain, and have been declared fully disabled. My latest MRI shows degenerative disc disease, and  alot of arthritis from the breaks, along with calcium growth on my vertebrae from the fractures.
Im from Natchez, Ms, and was previously seeing Dr Vance, at Comprehensive pain management of Madison. He was a great doctor, and had me on a great regimen of RF ablations, sacroiliac injections, and medication. I was actually able to have a decent quality of life again, playing with my kids, and such. Then, he adopted a no nicotine policy. Like an idoit, I'm a smoker, and just couldn't drop the cigarettes, so he had to let me go. I gave this place 5 stars, because so far, they have been very helpful trying to get me in to see a doctor. I will update this review after a few visits, but I also have heard very good things about this place such as, MOST of the doctors genuinely care about you and your pain. I need a doctor that cares, and will help me. I'm praying that this is the place, and they dont judge me by my arm tattoos, country boy exterior and such. Alot of places are quick to judge. Hopefully we will soon see, as I'm supposed to call them Monday 9/7/20, to set up an appointment. I must do something, because my quality of life has went down over the past couple of months, not having a pain management doctor. I'm looking forward to seeing what they can do to help me.|They switched my appointment because my regular PA couldn't be there. Then they forgot to switch me back. I sat waiting for 2 hours. You MIGHT get a call back at the end of the NEXT day.  Front desk etiquette is horrible and unprofessional.  The only good thing about this office were my visits with Dr. Braswell, whom I will miss.  He has great bedside manner and he's very caring and compassionate.  He listens to my concerns with patience and understanding.   Dr. Jiha is the WORSE 'medical professional' I have ever encountered.  That is why I am changing locations to receive my medical treatment.|By far the worst experience I have had with Ochsner. I was initially seen in the emergency room at Our Lady Of the Lake with dangerous elevated blood pressure and no sensation throughout my entire left leg. I was "patched " up until I could see my primary physician, which is in network with Ochsner. I was referred to Dr.Das about two to three ago for the earlier appointment available. I was not notified for an earlier appointment of no sort. I called to inform nurse that I was caught in traffic and was 7 minutes away from the office and was pretty much given an ultimatum to be checked in within 5 mins or I would have to be rescheduled. This was so upsetting considering the fact I left work two hours early and live the next state over. I have never experienced such negligence especially when a patient is experiencing some of the things I have. I am very disappointed in the care.

They were super nice and were well informed on the whole process. Love love love Mrs. Felicia !!|Easy in, easy out.  All the staff was very friendly, making the appointment painless.  Ms. Felicia Smith, the Nurse Practitioner, was most knowledgeable and informative in delivering the necessary information.|I can say, without a doubt, that my experience with Pause Pain & Wellness in Hattiesburg, MS, has been nothing short of transformative. From the moment I walked into the clinic, I felt welcomed, supported, and understood--a stark contrast to the often intimidating or overwhelming experiences that can come with medical treatments. The level of care, professionalism, and compassion at this clinic is truly unparalleled.

One of the standout elements of my experience was the incredible staff, particularly Felicia Smith. Felicia has an extraordinary ability to make you feel at ease. She is not only incredibly knowledgeable about the medical cannabis process but also takes the time to genuinely listen to your concerns and needs. It's clear that she is passionate about helping her patients live better, more pain-free lives. She explained everything in a way that was easy to understand and never rushed through any part of the consultation. In fact, I left feeling empowered and confident about the next steps in my wellness journey.

The entire team at Pause Pain & Wellness embodies a holistic, patient-centered approach that I find so refreshing. It's rare to find a healthcare facility where the staff is not only invested in your physical health but in your overall well-being. Everyone I encountered, from the receptionists to the medical professionals, treated me with respect, kindness, and professionalism. The clinic itself is bright, inviting, and designed to make you feel at home. The calm, soothing atmosphere makes it clear that the team is committed to creating a healing environment for their patients.

As someone who had been struggling with chronic pain and the side effects of traditional medications for years, I was initially apprehensive about exploring medical cannabis. However, the staff at Pause Pain & Wellness made the process seamless. They took the time to educate me on how cannabis could be a viable option for pain management, walking me through the various strains, dosage options, and potential effects. I felt fully supported in my decision to pursue this path, and it has absolutely changed my life. The results have been incredible, and I now experience relief from pain in a way I never thought possible.

Felicia Smith, in particular, deserves special recognition. Her guidance and compassion were invaluable during the entire process. She answered all of my questions (and trust me, I had plenty!) and ensured that I was comfortable and well-informed every step of the way. It's clear that she truly cares about the people she serves, and her dedication to her patients is evident in every interaction. I felt like I was not just another patient on a list, but a person whose health and happiness truly mattered to her.

Beyond the medical side of things, I also want to mention how easy and stress-free the entire process is at Pause Pain & Wellness. The staff takes care of all the paperwork, assists with the application for a medical marijuana card, and walks you through the legalities and regulations in Mississippi. column38: Thrifty Clancy|Mary Callison|Frank Fearon|Tom Terrific|Dayna Lynch|Joanne Bagley|gretchen ziemer|crystal fogleman
column40:
They are searching out ways to lessen or end my pain. They have explained to me each thing every step of the way. I did ask Dr Mahmoud to give me warning before an injection and he's been very careful to do so, again, explaining to me each step he was taking.
When a person gets here, most likely they have really bad pain and that will not necessarily go away immediately.  I can be patient and wait for the proper procedure to help.
Yes, it's frustrating that I have to wait for the insurance company to approve of upcoming procedures and I have to wait my turn for each procedure, stretching out the time before the pain procedure can be done. But, that is not the fault of Dr Mahmoud and his excellent staff. It has to do with insurance companies and many people leaving medical positions during Covid and nor yet being replaced. It also has to do with Maine's large elderly population who have many pain issues.
NL Interventional Pain Management are doing superb work.|As a medical doctor, a trained physician, I listen carefully to my providers. When something isn't clear I speak up right away. As can happen, bone on bone hip arthritis pain came on suddenly for me 2 years ago during chemotherapy. After much PT and imaging I was referred to pain intervention with hopes for some temporary abatement of pain. Surgery was the most desired treatment as it would provide a long term solution. So my first and only visit with a pain management clinical provider seemed good with referral for steroid injection and orthopedic surgery, however, my spouse and I are now being gaslighted.
No one said a steroid injection would delay by 3 months minimum the much needed and desired hip replacement surgery the severity of which was known by all. Nor was it said that this would also introduce an increased risk of infection even still at 3 months out.
The orthopedic surgeon I saw two days after the injection was livid that these people hadn't yet gotten it straightened out. The patient needs to be informed that they need to see ortho first in severe cases as surgery could have already been done and recovery well on its way in just a couple weeks. Orthopedists can also provide steroid injection. Now I wait 3 months in pain with chronic inflammation and debilitating quality of life.
After many attempts to talk with someone at pain intervention, someone other than the MA, I was sent a letter stating that basically, yes they did tell me about the 3 month delay because the box on the computer report is checked off and that's that.
As an aside, the same physicians clinical note for this visit presents in detail the severity of lumbar scoliosis seen on MRI while her physical exam said my spine was completely normal without deformity at all ! In clinical practice I have used electronic medical records software. Clicking enough boxes ensures full insurance reimbursement. It doesn't matter if it's congruent or correct.
I'm a 3 year survivor of an aggressive breast cancer. Managing inflammation is key. The pain management providers took no consideration of that or my adamant desire for surgery as soon as possible. They didn't listen to me or my spouse who is a 20 year Navy vet and retired Recreational Therapist with a four year college degree. She's really upset feeling that they're essentially calling her a liar. The delay for surgery was absolutely not discussed. Seriously broken trust.
There's a known and ongoing problem with the Northern Light Pain Intervention system/protocol and the pain intervention folks are taking it personally. They're refusing to speak with me and hear what I offer as a solution. They are behaving like unprofessional, rural hospital administrators who care less about patients and most about keeping their mill of steroid injections running at top speed. Technical skills are great. They got the needle in the joint but there's little relief for this severity of eroding bone on bone arthritis. Their skills, even caring to help patients get real pain relief, these are atrocious. Beware of what they're not telling you or what may be documented that never happened.|The worst place to send a patient. I saw Dr. Mahmood, he made promises, said if the shot didn't work the first time he would do it again in a few weeks. They were rude, he and his nurse sent me out with my leg numb from hip to toes. No wheelchair, no escort nothing. Then instead of a follow up appointment I get a letter discharging me. He was full of himself and the needle went too deep causing no pain relief but made me a fall risk, then they discharge me! I would NEVER recommend this incompetent office to anyone!!|Horrible service and care. Picked up 86-year-old father, who was in pain, and drove 2.5 hours to get there.  Told that computers were down, so can't be seen because no way to view image and medical records.  Told recepionist that I had copies of image on disc, and copy of medical records.  Receptionist told Dr. Ammar Mahmoud that, then he said he had no way of documneting visit with computers down.  Informed receptionist that documentation could be done via writing it on paper, then transposing to comuter when they came up.  This is a Medicare Continuity of Operations (COOP) requirement.  Was told Dr. Mahmoud was not willing to do that.  Then asked to stay for a bit, to see if the computers came back up, because father was in pain.  Receptionist said no, Dr Mahnoud had already cancelled all of his appointments and gone  for the day.  Had 2.5 hour drive to get father (still in pain) home.  I do NOT recommend this place.  They seem to do only the bare minimum and seem to have no regard for patient well-being.|Iam extremely upset with this place. I have scoliosis, arthritis, and 2 blown joints in my spine. I've dealt with is for 2 years and it took them 2 years to actually schedule me and my primary was not impressed. I have to call a couple times and wait weeks before anyone will call me back. They tried yelling me I called the wrong place but confirmed I did not.
Another time they tried telling me that someone did call me but I did not recall voicemail. But they insisted I was the one who was wrong.
They tell me I can only get injections every 3 months but it's always 4 and they make me come in for a new visit each time. I'm in pain, it effects my work, how me life, and family life... I get in young but my back and pain don't care. They should|The people who work here are my heroes. My autoimmune diseases leave me in horrific pain, but these guys always help me. It's nice to have an option for pain relief that isn't a narcotic. Dr Mahmoud is excellent at what he does and has a great bedside manner. PA Alan is also fantastic and thorough. The nurses are the best and help keep my anxiety from getting out of control. The lady who does the scheduling and gets the approvals from the insurance companies,  Peggy I think,  is a miracle worker! She gets approval quickly and is always able to get me in for an injection in a reasonable time frame.|Pain...I am one of the lucky people who lives with joint & nerve pain. Anyone who feels it, feels it, but there is help to manage it. Dr. Mahmoud & the remarkable team at Northern Light's Interventional Pain Management Clinic are fully focused on reducing & managing pain without opiates. Every single person, the scheduler, the CMA's, the PA, the nurses & Dr. Mahmoud are friendly professionals who remember me, are thoughtful and prompt. This clinic & the staff make it so I can manage chronic pain in healthful ways. If you are feeling painful, I recommend checking them out!!|Pain management has Diagnose me and has helped me through what I need to get through. And I would send my family and friends to them with no problem. My doctor is absolutely amazing.

He cares and wants to make sure that you are feeling better and doing better ! His work as a doctor is the highest standards for anyone i know! He is so personal , He makes you feel as he is part of your own family ! For me , I feel like he was a fellow collages friend ! I gave him 5 stars for his knowledge and love for the care and compassion !! Northern lights need more doctors and staff that are just as caring! *****|I just met dr M for the first time with my daughter. He was the most gentle, compassionate doctor I've ever met, both with her and with me.  She has developmental delays and he carefully explained what he would do so she understood. No doc has ever taken the time or had the understanding to do that before.

column2: Portland Pain Solutions: Frederick C. Littlejohn, M.D.
column3:
At Portland Pain Solutions, we believe no one should live with pain. Our medical practice is dedicated to providing highly personalized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer expert procedural care focusing on:

  • Spine conditions and sciatica treatment

  • Musculoskeletal pain management

  • Neurological pain conditions

  • Epidural injections and interventional procedures

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy

  • Low-dose naltrexone treatment options

Dr. Littlejohn combines compassionate care with medical expertise to develop individualized treatment plans aimed at restoring your quality of life as quickly as possible. We pride ourselves on taking the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns, conducting thorough examinations, and explaining treatment options clearly. Located in Portland, Maine, we welcome new patients and often accommodate urgent cases within 48 hours. Contact us today to discuss how we can help you return to a pain-free life at Portland Pain Solutions or call us at +1 207-835-8116. Our office is conveniently located at 1945 Congress St BLDG C STE 103, Portland, ME 04102.
column11: At Portland Pain Solutions we believe no one should live with pain. We provide highly personalized care and aim to restore quality of life as quickly as possible. Our specialty focus is expert procedural care of painful spine, musculoskeletal, and neurological conditions. Give us a call or send an email, we'd be happy to discuss ways our services might benefit you.

column38: M Frazier|Nick|Corey McEntyre|Julia Lucas|CAPTMAHI|Mary Fuller|Michael Bedecs|Squid Pogany
column40:
Dr Littlejohn is very compassionate, knowledgeable, and has a great bedside manner. I am a Long COVID patient who has been suffering with a multitude of issues and symptoms for almost 3 years. It has been a very life changing and debilitating experience, but Dr Littlejohn has been able to help ease some of my symptoms and is in the process of helping me even more! I feel very comfortable, safe, and confident in his treatment plans/ideas and recommendations. I have seen many specialists since having COVID and I highly recommend giving Dr Littlejohn a try.|Dr. Littlejohn is a lifesaver.  He was able to get me in within 48 hours when nobody else I called could see me for over a month.  I was in so much sciatica pain I would have gone to the ER if I couldn't see someone.

I hadn't had any injections for my spine issue before but he was able to clearly explain the process and put me at ease.

The epidural injection really helped ease my pain until I can consult with a surgeon.  He clearly cares a lot for his patients.  I'm very grateful for Dr Littlejohn and his quality care and willingness to get me in quickly.|Dr Littlejohn and his team have been supportive and always tried to provide the best care for my chronic pain. While I may end up working with a neurosurgeon to finally resolve the issue, they made every effort to help me with my sciatic nerve pain. I think if I had sought them out sooner, the injections may have been more effective - I waited for months. Don't be scared of the injections - great doc who will put you at ease and work hard to keep you amused if you struggle with needles. Compassionate, smart, and a great sense of humor.|Dr Littlejohn is great, his bedside manner is considerate and he truly listens. He clearly explained the treatment options for my generalized pain and with his guidance I elected to try low dose naltrexone. I was truly amazed with the effectiveness of the treatment and am excited to be able to get back to doing the things I had not been able to for the last 3 years.|I'm not certain what to make of this guy.However a big red flag for me is it seems many of his treatments aren't covered by insurance.There's a reason insurance companies refuse to pay for particular treatments.Most commonly it's because it's been proven to not work.  Most importantly, he doesn't advertise what he does.He has a blank web page.Not even the literature in his office describes any specific types of treatments.I found this to be very suspicious. All these things combined, lead me to believe the guy is basically preying on the desperate. I'm 65 and have never heard of any doctor anywhere, requiring that you provide a credit card for him to keep on file.Despite the fact I'm well insured. Give me one instance where you would need to charge my card if I wasn't there. Just one. I dare you. It's a scam.And there was absolutely nothing informing me  of your "policy"  or I wouldn't have driven 75 miles. I have a policy as well. It's to not let medical charlatans bully me. How's your policy working out for you? I got an appointment with you in a few days. And the place was completely empty. Two more giant red flags. As far as I'm concerned you're a criminal in a lab coat.|I was suffering with severe back pain and was unable to see my usual physician for weeks.  Dr. Littlejohn saw me immediately and recognized the cause of my pain, he performed an injection and made numerous treatment options. I have recommended friends see Dr Littlejohn and each has been pleased with his treatment plans  as well as his interpersonal interactions. He and his office staff are definitely patient centered which is a refreshing experience in todays health care environment.|I was recently in back pain following a surgical procedure. I am also a physician who has treated and understands pain. Its however different when one is a patient! My experience with Dr. Littlejohn was simply superior, beginning with his warm and caring office staff to his treatment of my condition. Dr. Littlejohn was very professional, reassuring and competent in his explanation of what my medical issue was along with an extremely caring bedside manner. The treatment was nearly painless and the relief was almost instantaneous and as Dr. Littlejohn predicted, continued to get even better over the next 6 hours. I strongly recommend Dr Littlejohn for anyone experiencing acute or chronic pain.
Michael Bedecs DO|Dr Littlejohn is an amazing doctor, kind, well informed, caring and emotionally able to connect with his patients. He made it possible for me to walk again by repairing two collapsed vertebrae in my spine. I am very grateful for his care and recommend him without any doubts. His follow up to my questions has been amazing. He returns your calls promptly and answers your questions .
He also has a clinical manager named Stacey who is awesome in making you feel welcome to the office and in assisting  Dr Littlejohn during the procedure. Finally, if you have to be on hold, the music playing in the background is worth listening to.

At Maine Comprehensive Pain Management, Dr. Terence Gray and our dedicated team believe that patient empowerment is the cornerstone of effective pain treatment. We take pride in our individualized approach to pain management, helping patients throughout Greater Portland and Maine regain control of their lives.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

Our practice offers prompt diagnoses and effective treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs. We provide a range of specialized services including:

  • Advanced pain management procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Physiotherapy options

Dr. Gray's Harvard training and extensive experience enable us to address complex pain conditions with precision and compassion. Our goal is to improve not just your pain levels, but your overall quality of life. Located in Scarborough, our modern facility at 400 Enterprise Drive offers a comfortable environment where patients receive the highest standard of care. Connect with us at Maine Comprehensive Pain Management or call +1 207-289-6726 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your active lifestyle.

column11: Terence Gray, DO believes that when patients take an active role in managing their pain, they regain control of their lives, often leading to significantly improved health and overall quality of life. column38: Deb Piawlock|Sarah Mackenzie|Wilbur Eugley|Barbara Dickison|Eric Hallee|Christine Rollins|daryn plante|Amanda Mcclendon
column40:
I very much dislike this Dr. I have fibronyalgia and there isn't really any treatment for this. I mentioned this to Dr Gray and he said there isn't any money in it!! I'm applauded he even mentioned money! He's not there to help you he just wants the money! I refuse to pay 125$ for a no show appointment.  He injected my back with something and it didn't do nothing.  I do not recommend him! ((|The absolute worst Dr.  If I could, he would get zero stars.  He doesn't care at all about any options you present.  In fact I am pretty sure he sees it as a challenge and then makes fun of you for having the nerve.  When we discussed why an injection from a procedure he did had helped to manage the pain, I was excited that there was something that could finally help that wasn't a gabapentin (which he kept increasing the dose saying "it's helping you more than you realize").  It was not helping at all.  He quickly shut that down stating that injection is "no longer allowed".   He literally lied about the injection and said there was nothing more he could do, that gabapentin was the best thing to help manage the extreme pain (and at the time I literally couldn't walk a block).  I said that med was not helping and not a long term solution, that whatever was causing the pain needed to be fixed.  I asked about surgery.  He said that wasn't an option.  Maybe so, but then he was laughing at me and then implied I was trying to get opioid meds and he won't do that.

Fast forward a few years (Dr Hall just down the road who gave me my life back), I found out later from a guy I was dating, he gets the exact injections from Gray that Gray said are no longer allowed.  The exact same injections I get through my current Dr.  So he plays God and gets to mess with your life, while you suffer.  He doesn't care and has such an ego, he laughs at you if you don't agree with him.  After all, he is the "Harvard trained expert."  Well from now on I consider that to be the biggest joke of all, as anyone who says that is more ego than expert!
If you are lucky enough to get relief from your pain by whatever he does, that's awesome!  If not, run!  Don't waste months and months of pain and suffering.  Dr Hall is infinitely better!  He listens and he cares, and he doesn't insult you by implying you are a drug seeker when you are trying to fix the problem that is causing the pain.

News flash Gray,  I am back to having a full life despite your insistence that gabapentin was the solution.  I don't even take Tylenol.  Thanks for the insult and memory loss.  That little gem of a side effect was not discussed.  You failed in your oath to do no harm, you let your ego dictate and as a result cause years of needless suffering.|I went to see Dr. Gray after I was told by other medical people that there was nothing they could do to stop my chronic debilitating leg pain. I was  unable to walk without sharp pains randomly firing down my legs. This was keeping me from living my life. I am a big car show fan but the pain was stopping me from walking the show area. Dr. Gray was able to trigger my pain on command reinforcing the fact that he knew what the issue was. He did some tests and confirmed he could remove the worst of my pain. When he did the final injections, I discovered he had done as he promised. The worst pain was gone and all that remained was what I could easily deal with. I started going back to car shows and going on long walks. I owe him so much. He changed my life in such a positive way. He is a straight shooter and I always appreciate that about him. You know where you stand. I recommend Dr. Gray with the highest of praise. I was in pain that was ruling my life. With his help I am living my life. Thank's Doctor Gray!|If you are looking for someone to alleviate your back or neck pain- or perhaps anything else you may have- make an appointment with Dr. Gray-- its a great practice that is thriving on honesty and results.  I recently moved here and i can assure you if i was still in Rhode Island i would have probably been scheduled for 2 major shoulder surgeries by now- Dr. Gray recommends you to another very ethical surgeon - who will only operate if you need it! What a concept!!  Unfortunately so many places have become meat markets- where you dont even meet the doctor = just a PA- then they schedule you for surgery.  Dr. Gray sends you to the right place- fortunately for me I did not need surgery - then followed up with 2 injections that have fixed my pain.  Wonderful practice with great staff - do not hesitate to call - you will be taken care of .|If I could leave 10 stars I would.  DR. GRAY is an amazing person who truly cares about his patients and talks straight to you.  Very thankful to now have him as my pain management doctor.  His staff are equally amazing.|I had Dr. Gray at Mercy Pain clinic and will see if he can get except me back. He is the best, up front, clearly explains everything he's doing. Makes you feel like you are his only patient during my visits and procedures. Bed side manner is the greatest.|I went 3 months with siatic nerve pain, I went multiple other doctors and not one could help me.. after one procedure with doctor Gray I was back to 98% with no limitations. Dr Gray was even able to get me into to see a doctor to treat my basil cell cancer in record time. He was also able to diagnose my sleep apnea on my first visit. I can not say enough about the care I've received at Dr Gray office. lol end with this.... just go see doctor Gray once...that's all it will take for you to be on your way to a better quality of life.|Dr Gray is the most compassionate doctor I've encountered. I've felt like he really listens to me and does everything he can to help with my pain. Throughout my procedures (which can be scary), he's very comforting and reassuring. He's been a godsend to me with my chronic back pain.

Our comprehensive approach to pain management combines innovative technology with compassionate care. We're committed to helping you regain your quality of life through effective pain management solutions.

column38: Bern Jones|Crystal Wright|Jared McLaughlin|Dave Dobson|Darla Arreguin|Rebecca Williams|John Locke|M M
column40:
I'm literally at a loss for words (rare for me) regarding how incredible this group is. From the front desk, to triage groups to the nurses and physicians are all A+++. I have lived with extreme chronic pain since I was around 15 years old and have had so many surgeries I've lost count. Dr's Tivnan & Wise are doing everything and anything to help me avoid more surgery. I can not thank them enough for the relief I receive. For the people who complain about the pain after (of course it's going to be uncomfortable) but the rewards most times are so worth it. The doctors always listen to me and I trust their decisions on the appropriate direction to take. There is no other place I would ever consider going and refer so many friends here. Thank you to the entire office for making me feel like the only person who you treat in a busy environment. You truly are all caring and compassionate individuals and I'm forever grateful.|They are fast, friendly, and the shots are for the most part effective. The doctors don't say that the shots will do more than they do.|These guys have made a HUGE difference in my life!  I'm only 44, but I came down with a chronic pain issue.  It is a very outside the box type of muscular condition.  I have seen literally 18 doctors over the last 4 years, and pretty much all of them tried to convince me that their thing would cure me.  They were happy to collect the money even though they NEVER delivered results.

Just before going to Northeast Pain Management I went to Northern Light and unfortunately had a horrible experience in their clinic as well.   They treated trigger point injections as if it were major surgery.  Put me in a damn gown with a hair net and the like and put me in a room with like 20 other people separated by sheets.  And they would only inject me with preset amount and wouldn't go over their predetermined limit, so basically half my body was left untreated.  And when I was still in pain later, and I called there was zero responsiveness.  They left me in pain, and when I complained, they tried to send me to a Boston clinic.  Really?  You want me to drive to Boston while in life altering pain?!

Annnyway, the point of this review was not to talk trash about Northern Light or the other doctors I have had trouble with.  The point is that these guys are an oasis in a desert.  The doctor I see most often is Dr. Tivnan, and he is fantastic.  Super personable.  Treats you like a human being.  Really listens.  Treats you on the spot.  Gets all the areas.  And I always walk away feeling better and with a substantial reduction in my pain.  I really feel like it's been a collaboration.  I mean, I'm no doctor, but I've  tried like 20 whatever treatments, so that's probably important info right?  You'd be surprised how many doctors never even want to take in that information and just want to condescend to you and put you in your place.

The culture here is different.  Like I said, Dr. Tivnan is just plain awesome.  But I have seen other doctors as well.  Sorry I'm forgetting names!  But they were good as well.  It's the culture there.  You feel it when you walk in the door.  And honestly from the administrators at the front desk, to the nurses that prep you for the exams, to the doctors that do the consultations, to the doctors that do the actual procedures you always feel respected and cared about.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  They have made all the difference in my life.

Thank you Dr. Tivnan!  And thank you Northeast Pain Management!|Went for my first appointment after driving 2 hrs to get there...they hit me with $2000 deposit. I have a job in health care and insurance. My understanding is here in maine you need to tell people what the bill is going to be. I paid my copay never recieved a bill. Went back for follow up they still insist on getting deposit. I had enough...this sounds like not healthcare.|Every staff member, nurse, and doctors I've met here have been friendly, positive, professional and most importantly, caring. My pain management plan through them has allowed me to STOP needing my cane! They have the most up to date equipment, and most certainly the knowledge & expertise
allowing extensive success! I would rate them 10 stars if I could! Many thanks!!!|Horrible. They gave me injections that caused me excruciating pain for days after. I called to tell him and he said to deal with if for ten day's. When I called to say I didn't think we clicked and asked for a different provider and explained what happened, the receptionist said if I didn't like it, I didn't have to go there. That was helpful, because I am actually stuck with them. So, all around bad tratment. The burning and pain are so intense I can't deal with it anymore. His bedside manor is awful. Treats you like garbage with the first appointment. Absolutely nothing positive came from that appointment. I left in more pain than I had when I went in. Now I have no idea what to do.|After suffering a back injury, and having my care mishandled by Maine Nuero, I was referred to Northeast Pain Management.
I have been to these doctors numerous times, and I found them to be professional, engaging, and truly helpful.
I would suggest this fantastic group of doctors to anyone seeking pain relief through injections. No doubt that these miracle workers can help.|Saw Dr Tivnan as a new patient.  Worst Dr experience I have ever had in my life.
Defensive when I asked questions, barely examined me, asked no questions about the history of my pain and then misdiagnosed me as later images and seeing a different Dr confirmed.

I refused a follow-up.  Run don't walk away from any appointment with this doctor!

column38: RLD|Mimi A|Sarah West|joshua burnham|Michele Gonsalves|Frank Fearon|Pbnew1|Sabrina Elizabeth Szoldan
column40:
I don't like giving bad reviews but I do when they're warranted. I was hopeful that I would finally get relief from my back issues here. I did not. I saw someone named Ryan at the outset. I don't know who he is, what credentials he has or doesn't have, if he's a NP or something else. That would have been helpful to know. However, he was incredibly dismissive, and guess what? He was wrong. He told me what I needed, and it was incorrect. I had the procedure, it didn't work, and they told me they can't do anything for me.
Wrong answer. First, Ryan was dismissive and abrupt. It was clear he didn't want to be there. He ended the office visit after a few minutes. What I didn't know was there was no anesthesia for my procedure and it hurt like hell! (Some other places do have anesthesia, I checked).
I saw an orthopedist today because my family doctor had given me the referral to Mercy Pain Center. The orthopedist took one look at my x-ray and told me immediately what the problem was and what was causing my pain. He told me that the Pain Center gave me the wrong procedure and that I should have had something else. He's referring me somewhere else so I can finally get the relief I've been looking for. And they have anesthesia!
I had high expectations for this place. I was incredibly disappointed. Why I was given the wrong procedure I'll never know. I'm not happy, and I'm not recommending this place to anyone.|I was referred by Spectrum Orthaepedics. Initial consult in October was not pleasant.  I was in a car accident last year and had a neck injury.  I was hoping to get a procedure that would give me relief from the constant pain.  The woman I saw was abrasive and somewhat dismissive of my condition.  I had an MRI and other scans that clearly showed inflammation.  She made several comments to me that I felt were not appropriate.  She did tell me that the procedure could be done by the end of the year.  I should expect a phone call within a few weeks to schedule.  Five weeks passed and no call.  I called them yesterday and got the run around.  Told me the authorization takes time.  I asked when it was submitted.  They wouldn't tell me.  Now the procedure can't be done until January.  At the time of the visit, I stated that I met my deductible for the year and was hoping this could be completed before January.  I was told that it could.  I immediately called my insurance company after my call with them.  They stated that the authorization was submitted yesterday, not five weeks ago.  They lied. They only submitted it after I had called to inquire about the delay in contacting me.  I called back to cancel the procedure.  I will be going elsewhere.   What an absolutely horrible experience.

Update: 12/9.
In response to your reply to this post, I did call the office four days ago and spoke to your office manager.  She had nothing to offer other than an appointment for January.  New year, out of pocket expense.  This practice is lacking in many areas.  They failed miserably in the follow up regarding the initial consultation and the PA was not someone I would want to work with again.  The fact that they lied to me about the authorization speaks volumes.  Why not just tell me the truth?   I would never recommend this practice to anyone.|Dr. Ryan Trosper and his team are the best. Honestly, I've been dealing with neuropathy pain for 15 years and I'm only 31 years old. I came in and his team was so pleasant. I didn't have high hopes for coming in since I had been to what felt like a ton of doctors but he listened, he felt like he cared, and he actually set me up with something that finally, FINALLY, gave me relief. Also, all of the ladies at the front and back desks are always so nice. I actually really like coming to this office, they truly are the VIPs!|Nice place and was easy to find for me . Nobody was rude staff and doctor were nice but they couldn't do much for me except offer trigger point injections. And ask me why I'm a thin small framed guy . I've always been slim in a healthy way . Then the doctor said I was lucky I got pain managment from my doctor . Seems like my primary doctor did better pain management then what mercy offered.if I did the trigger point injections it be every month pretty much . And there's twenty symptoms to what they wanted to inject me with so I called my doctor and explained why I didn't want to go thru that she agreed with me . Mercy tries to be nice but in the end they really couldn't do anything for me . Except wanting to inject me with dexamethasone side effects are as bad as anabolic steriods.|As a new patient my first encounter with the NP made me feel as tho I was "faking".  She was dismissive of my previous pain Drs treatment.Very negative of the treatment I'd been given which btw was fantastic and worked!  Only reason I went to NL was because I returned to East Coast. Also NP informed me the center does not offer any anesthesia for my type of treatment.  The NP made me feel less than important and a  "whimp".  Within 10 min of my appt I gathered my things and left. Not how I'm used to being treated!|All of the staff and especially the nurses were so caring and kind and friendly. Dr. Karl Hinrichs was the best. I am getting better thanks to this office! I HIGHLY recommend this practice and Dr. Hinrichs!!|When an appointment is scheduled, it would be helpful to list which suite, and the name of the office the appointment is at. The Directory on the main floor doesn't list doctor's names. As a result, I was a few minutes late, because I had to ask if I had the right office a couple times. When I finally found the place. I had to wait in line again, and discovered my appointment was cancelled. I was told their policy cancels if you're even 10 minutes late.  The signage in this building is terrible! It would be helpful to have proper notification as to where the Suite is, especially for new patients. I only had the doctor's name, not the name of the practice, or the suite. 195 Fore River is a large building to try to locate a doctor.  Had I known he was at the Pain Center, that would have made tracking down the appointment easier.

This is the biggest complaint about this facility...lack of proper signage (list doctor's names on the Main Directory).|I have always had very positive experiences at the pain clinic at Northern Lights. Every staff member I have encountered including those who pick up the phone,  the front desk, the MA, and Christina Lee have been kind and compassionate. I have a lot of poorly controlled pain that has caused me a great deal of anxiety, extreme difficulty sleeping, and difficulty doing nearly everything. I am always very anxious about going to the doctor's but the staff here are calming and make me feel safe and comfortable discussing my medical issues. Thank you :)

column3:

column40:
I saw a Dr here in late 2023. I don't remember his name unfortunately, and it's been changed in my chart to Dr. Martinez. The first Dr. I saw barley even looked at me when speaking to me. told me I was too fat, and "just need to lose weight." the entire appointment I felt he was dismissive and belittling. I requested a different dr for my next visit. This dr told me I HAD to do a treatment I didn't agree with before he would even consider an MRI for the injury I was there for. I tried said treatment and it made it worse. So, I told him that and asked him to order the MRI and if insurance denied the claim I'd handle it. that was in February. now in June, I have NO ANSWERS AND NO ONE WILL GET BACK TO ME.
also, when I asked to change drs, the woman at the front desk said, "well, are you sure, he's really nice! he must just be having an off day. no really, he's really nice, give it one more chance." I told her I didn't care how bad a day he's having, it's NO excuse to be dismissive and disrespectful to patients. if I could give this place negative stars I would. don't go there.|I haven't felt this good in years! Thank you Dr Martinez and your team for your guidance and attention to detail that you gave in a very troubling time for me. I highly recommend Dr Martinez he is very knowledgeable and obviously cares about his patients. Thank you so much for putting me on the right track.
Ted Weber Jr|I went to see Dr. Perkowski for a second opinion for chronic back pain, and I appreciated his knowledge and experience. A previous physician injected a steriod shot in my spine, when there was never any need to do so. I felt very hesitant to see the previous physician, so I was referred to Dr. Perkowski, and he relayed to me that my spine was in fact healthy and that there was no need for that shot.   As much as his expertise shows, his attitude showed just as much. He was oddly frustrated with me when explaining that my spine my healthy  like I was at fault for being told the first time there was an issue with my spine, like I had no business to be in his office. I went to him to get a second opinion which I was very happy to know that my spine is in fact healthy, but he spoke to me like I was a waste of his time and effort. Even when I explained a couple of concerning symptoms to him, he made the face equivalent to rolling his eyes and just completely dismissed me. I'm not sure if he was having a bad day, but I surely didn't feel cared for by him. I felt hurt after this visit; however, I will take his care plan seriously and follow it, though I will be asking to be seen by someone else.|After my mom saw this doctor she was traumatized. Each time she would go she seemed apprehensive to go back. After her last visit I'm very concerned as to what went on. I have no idea what he did to her because whenever I ask she just cries and says he's not a nice Doctor. Almost as if she's afraid of him. She refuses to go back. I've never seen my mom so shaken up about anything. Very concerning that this man cares for many patients who are dealing with chronic pain and vulnerable.|Kind and understanding staff.  Dr Guernelli and Kristen Schroeder provide excellent care without judgement.  They are up to date on new treatments and practices to alleviate pain.  I would reccomend this practice to anyone who experiences chronic pain.|I have found Dr Perkowski to be very helpful in reducing my pain and improving my quality of life. In addition, unlike many other offices, people actually answer the phone. They are quick to resolve any issue or answer any questions. She has shown a pattern for being vindictive and neglectful towards my care, and it is unacceptable for this kind of discrimination.|Dr. Ten performed numerous procedures on my husband for his intense back pain. The procedures were unnecessarily done in an operating room, preparing for a final treatment that was to finally take the pain down. Abomination.|crazy lady who refused to use a mask during the height of the pandemic, and when I visited her for horrible chronic pain told me to go to church (again, during the height of the pandemic!) -- she should have her license revoked. EDIT:  I just saw her in the local hospital for anesthesia and she tried to tell me things about my own medical history based on her 10-second "exam" of looking at me.
