column38: patsfan1280|Cattrina landry|John Henry Ruminski|John Skeen|E Z|Denise Scales|Amy Irvine|Debra Guyette
column40:
Runs pain center at Mercy Hospital but doesn't believe anyone needs pain meds. I've had chronic pain since 1997 and in 2011 I wanted to try and manage my pain without meds. After eight months it was clear that it wasn't  working, that medication was needed, and eventhough Dr. Hull had promised that he would put me back on medication if unsuccessful, he refused. Eventually his nurse practitioner (my main provider) insisted that I get medication again because my situation was so bad.  Also, I kept hearing from them how great their pain center was, how they were setting up a program to include PT, OT, psychology, exercise, etc...did not see it in the 1.5 years I was a patient. All I got was one visit a month where I would talk to the practitioner and they gave me referrals for injections that I knew would not work.  I don't recommend to anyone.|I saw Dr Hull back in January of 2016 I had then been thru 5 surgeries on my  Back which were unsuccessful  I was in so much pain ,I sat down after he reviewed my MRI.  He told me that I see you should be under care for your pain and be on pain meds BUT I'm not doing that instead I'm recommending you come off everything. I asked about a back stimulator, and asked about my fusions and if they are fused .He told me nothing will help now.  I have never seen such a rude and uncaring Dr in my life. Since that time I went to Boston as the pain was overwhelming.The first Dr I saw looked at my MRI and told me you have several surgical problems that need to be taken care of.My other fusions never fused.The bolts in my back were entirely loose .I had bone spurs ,and some Disk left in there . I had a 9 hour surgery in Boston.This Dr told me ,all of the work he had to do. This was the same MRI I had taken  to Dr Hull . It's not just the Extreme rudeness, Its the fact he cannot read an MRI or he read it and did not care . He is not fit to be a pain Dr. When Boston read his report on me, They agreed.|My name is John and I have seen Dr. Hull for the past five years. This Dr is the most compassionate Dr I know. When I read a few reviews above I was shocked for those statements are pure false..... This Dr. goes above and beyond to care for you. Believe me when I say you are not just a number with him. He cares about your overall health and not just your pain. If you are having other complications he will guide you in the right direction.... I just had to say something for this man really cares for you. Lastly I think he has a photographic memory for he knows stuff about me that we talked about months or years earlier. You want an excellent Dr go see him.....

Sincerely,

John H. R|Dr. Stephen Hull is among the very few exemplary doctors I've ever had, and as a PTSD chronic pain patient, I've had many many doctors over the past thirty years. Dr. Hull is a treasure. His knowledge of medicine, the broad range of drugs and their appropriate applications, and the physiology of pain and how we experience it, is encyclopedic. His program at the pain clinic at Mercy Hospital, provides specific and practical tools for understanding pain, and for managing it, to the purpose of participating in life more fully. I'd been trying to get rid of my pain for years, trying literally dozens of treatment modalities with no success. In the year and a half that I've been part of Dr. Hull's program, (classes
twice a week and support/discussion group once a week), my life has expanded exponentially. I still have some pain, but Dr. Hull has enabled me to have a rich and rewarding life anyhow.

In the course of this journey, Dr. Hull has demonstrated over and over, his respect for his patients and for our struggles. He is open about his own efforts to manage pain, and is in effect part of his own program. He sets a good example for the rest of us. His personal and professional integrity, as I have witnessed these last eighteen months, are beyond reproach. I have been shocked to read the disparaging remarks some people have posted about him. I hope they find relief somewhere, but I think Dr. Hull is
not the appropriate target for their disappointment. I am deeply grateful for what he has given me, and continues to give.
John Skeen, Portland, ME.|Don't waste your time! Worst Dr ever.  I made it clear I do not want opioids. I do however want to try meds for nerve pain (my ortho has said I am having nerve pain). He continues to promise, but always has some excuse for not giving them. His nurse made it quite clear he won't give me the meds unless I join his support group. This is blackmail and totally unprofessional.|I call him Dr. Hell.
I will start by letting you know that finding a doctor to treat my condition was not easy. I had been bounced around by one doctor to another to get help. Keep in mind I didn't ask for this help. I have been to an osteopathic surgeon (7 yrs or more with him, I felt as tho I could trust him and he began prescribing me pain meds for my back and neck  and I liked him as a Dr. and When he found out that I had a herniated disc in my neck He sent me to a neurological surgeon and she took over the prescription.
I didn't understand why I had such pain in my back! I thought it was my oversized breasts so I scheduled a reduction and it didn't help! I went to the tummy tuck and that Didn't help! All the while
I'm getting these surgeries done I'm asking myself," why aren't they doing an MRI of my spine to figure out what's going on instead of letting me get these  very invasive  surgeries done?"
Neither surgery helped.
I called my neurosurgeon,  because I had to get a refill of my Vicodin and as I'm talking to her nurse she started grilling me on where I have been getting my medication.. I'm thinking she has my chart in front of her before opening her mouth! To be judged like that or talk to you in such an accusatory tone didn't sit well with me so I had it out with the nurse. My snarky reply," I had a refill"! Did you perhaps notice that while looking at my chart? Nope! So when I go to the office of this Dr. at Maine neuro and we discussed what took place between her nurse and myself  she apologized for the reaction and behavior of her nurse but that's it!  I got squeezed out and the nurse got to keep her position .
This doctor that I have been with and trusted for 3 years is now kicking me to the curb but in a way that won't be noticeable so I can't report her and is setting me up to be with DR.HELL!
The moment I walked into this office I wasn't treated as a chronic pain patient, I was treated as an addict. We have meeting & he decides to put me on methadone & Vicodin! Talk about someone being very sick... Each medication he would put me on made me sicker and sicker because I am very sensitive  to a lot of medications not just opiates but SSRIs as well!
So on our first visit common protocol is to take a urine test and I think nothing of it because I am not into Coke or heroin or anything illicit!  I leave this office with my prescription and go home. I going to see him about a week later and he asked me some questions and then asked me where I got the Percocet from. Now keep in mind that I am no doctor nor am I a medical assistant or a pharmaceutical representative. Also,  I won't remember the one Percocet I took two weeks after I took it because to me I'm not doing anything sneaky or wrong. I didn't know that it was any different than the Vicodin and I had asked someone if I could have one of theirs because I didn't have any for the appointment that day and it was late in the day. So I'm not going to abscess about one little pill that I took that I thought had no bearing on my urine test whatsoever! So when he asked me where I got it I honestly couldn't remember. Dr. hell told me to "go home and think of another LIE  and EXCUSE better than the one I just gave him! I WASNT lying and that's what piissed me off!
He's obviously dealt with some massive pill heads in the past but I'm not one!
I go home called my mom in NH and I told her what happened and we put our heads together and we realized that I took one of her pills and that's what showed up in my urine!
He excepted that but didn't believe me so at This point it was incredibly difficult  to call and ask for a refill. He would say things like call me in a couple of days and I'll let you know how I feel and maybe I'll fill it maybe I'm I won't!  Maybe I'll tell you one thing and then I'll tell you another. I was a nervous wreck every time I had to deal with him. I was honest with him and I wasn't going to lie just to make the truth sound plausible. It's like the cops making you admit to doing a crime that you Didn't do. He crude & rude.|With fibromyalgia he pushed me to exercise through the pain, causing more long term pain. He's ignorant about long term fibromyalgia|Dr Hull  and the staff at Mercy are the best I have ever seen.Very positive and helpful.Awesome!

column40:
Had shoulder pain for a few years a friend told me about his experience and I made an appointment. Met with Brigham Mckenny   he had a cancellation that day and said he though he could help me with my pain. I was in the office 3 hours they drew blood and worked their magic injected 5 shots into my shoulder some discomfort . took advil when I got home. Told me to not lift weights for a couple days. the next day I had a lot of relief.and it got better daily.Very happy with the out come.
.|I received regenerative therapy for my knee and it's the best treatment so far to alleviate the night pains from arthritis. I did this treatment instead of the recommended partial knee replacement. I was going to have to cancel all my planned hikes for the summer. Thanks to  QC Kinetix regenerative therapy, not only was I able to continue to hike 4000' Mountain Peaks all summer and fall, I had NO Night Knee pain after a hike. Game Changer!! I couldn't be happier. Thanks for getting me back to doing what I love to do.|I went to QC Kinetix about a year ago now. I had been told by my doctors that I needed 2 knee replacements. My right knee had already had one arthroscopic surgery a few years before. I didn't want the knee replacements at all. I bit the $$ bullet and decided to try QC Kinetix after my sister-in-law said it was working wonders for her. I am so glad I did. I feel like I have a quality of life back again. I can walk around with out all that pain. One knee is like its old self. The worst knee can still bother me a bit on cold rainy days but nothing in comparison to how they were before. Being able to walk normally again, I can move more, losing some weight too so that is a great bonus from moving more! I recommend this to anyone who might want to opt out from joint replacements. Worth every penny! Insurance providers are nuts for not covering this.|Great staff!  Everyone is very professional, knowledgeable and take the time to explain the procedure.  Went to QC Kinetix because Dr. Herzog had been my doctor for a few years before he closed his private practice.   I am a believer in stem cell rejuvenation.  Dr. Herzog's great reputation as a doctor and surgeon made me feel comfortable with the procedure.  The doctor makes the all the difference.  My pain (hip & sacrum) was noticeably less after the first treatment.  By the end of the treatments my discomfort was gone.  Five months later I feel even better.  It does take time for the stem cells to do their job.  Thank you Dr. John Herzog!!!|I injured my left shoulder in college playing football. It was a partial separation, and as I had earned a starting position as a freshman I didn't tell anyone as I didn't want to loose my starting position . It is now 48 years after that injury. I have suffered through pain and an inability in sleep on my left side for years.
I went to QC Kinetix in hopes they might be the answer to my chronic pain . The initial visit, that was a free evaluation was eye opening . Dr. Herzog , as well as one of his assistants informed me that they turn away more than half the potential clients if they felt there would be no benefit to the procedure. I appreciated their honesty, as it reminded me of the way I run my business , A-BEST Window.
Upon the initial scan, Dr. Herzog saw quite a substantial amount of arthritis. He indicated that their procedures made me a good candidate. My injections were scheduled and let me tell you the results!
Even though it's only been a little over a month after the 5th injection I am pain free in my left shoulder snd can sleep on both sides for the first time in decades. The other positive thing is that Dr. Herzog said there will be continued benefits through the rejuvenative treatments for months to come .
I would highly recommend going to see if QC Kinetixs would be the answer for you if you are experiencing arthritic pain and you felt the only option was surgery . What have you got to loose? The initial consultation is free! The answer to "what have you got to loose" is the pain you've been suffering with for years . Jim Soule  Woolwich, Maine|I suffered with lateral knee pain and after x-rays and an MRI my doctors could not see why I was in so much pain. I do have mild arthritis but they told me it should not be causing that much pain and that I was too young for knee replacements. I heard the ad for QC Kinetix and thought I'd give it a try. I had results with the first plasma injections! I just finish the process and couldn't be happier. I walk better, can get up and down from the floor, go up and down stairs faster and put pressure on my knees to get up and down. I would definitely recommend making an appointment for a free consultation!|Brought my mom here after trying a few other clinics in and out of state to treat her hip, back and shoulder pain. From the get-go the staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home. Dr. Herzog, Leigh the attending nurse and the rest of the staff are really friendly, kind and knowledgeable. They presented us with different treatment options to treat her pain. She underwent Plasma/PRP and Laser treatment for two sessions, and a week after our second visit my mother was able to walk without using her cane, go up and down a flight of stairs, stand for longer periods of time and even dance with me and my sisters for Christmas. My mom is very satisfied with the results so far. Thanks QC Kinetix!|I am no longer is constant discomfort. I just finished my 5th shot ( last of the series), so I've not completed my healing phase. Dr H & staff were the best. Skip the knife, take the spike.. Much better option.

I am so happy with the results of my stem cell regeneration to both hips.  Now, I can walk without pain and climb stairs. I tell everyone who will listen.|I was so skeptical about regenerative medicine but after several years of extremely painful arthritis in my thumb joints I decided to try it. I'm a believer now! Since having treatment I have the use of my hands back. I've had no pain since the treatment. Best of all I can pick up my grandchildren!

But just had the final injection and am beyond happy with the outcome. Basically 0 pain like I don't even remember what it felt like anymore. Increasing mobility and strength with the help of YouTube and some rubber bands. column40:
I know this is a crazy review. I've done a few for Dr. K.
Sincerely they're 2 of the best!! They're a great team & Thanks for all you do.

Miss Kim is funny & entertaining. Whenever waiting we chat chat chit chat away!!
Dr. K. Is my main man!! I've known Dr. K for a 1000 years.
I recall seeing him after 500 years & he said "so what happened to you!?"
I know he meant it like "wow you look incredible, what happened?" are you taking the new mega results vita vita vitamins?"
I said "yes!!" The Jetsons sent me home with packets. Rosie packed my bag, I put on my new improved jet pack!" See ya!!
Cars speed of sound, much more efficient than the older models, Honda TST!
Snow loves to see me & I LOVE Snow!! I need to dress in downtown Jerry brown. Egghhh! She loves the FedEx men!
They are in model Lightning Super Extreme Box Truck!! SEBT's!!
Crazy but true!!|From start, Kim and Dr. Anthony have been a tremendous support system and a consistent reminder that there are good people in the world and you never have to go through whatever your struggle may be alone.  Highly recommend you leaving whatever doctor you're at and signing up with them|I've known Dr. K. for many years. He's respectful, kind, understanding & knows what his patients contend with! He's an awesome Doctor!
His Assistant Miss Kim is phenomenal. I love to chat with Miss Kim. It's like a fun therapy session before I see Dr. K. She listens & allows me to jabber away. She's a Great lady. They're the A-TEAM!
Dr. K. Listens to many patients & has the patience of a Saint! Snow is the mascot! She ensures everyone gets love & she deserves loads of love plus high end treats:) She's simply marvelous! They work late hours & do the best for their patients. In turn I  do my best to show them the respect & appreciation they greatly deserve!|I've been with Dr. Kozma for many years He is compassionate, non-judgemental and fair. As a patient, he has given me great advice in both medical and personal issues. Dr. Kozma is a straight shooter, yet listens and treats me as an individual.  He is wonderful to talk to, and I look forward to my monthly visits with him.
Kim, his assistant, greets you with a warm smile and is very friendly.

I would highly recommend Dr. Kozma to anyone. Get the Best professional advice and don't do this alone  !  The best thing I could  have ever done. TRUE PROFESSIONALS|Dr. Kozma is a caring doctor who went above and beyond to help me as I was transferring from out of state and time was of the essence. He takes his time with patients and genuinely makes sure things are going well with you. Kim in the office was also very helpful to me. I am grateful for this office.|All of my many experiences with Dr. Kozma and his staff have been positive.  He's everything you want in a Doctor.  Friendly, intelligent, compassionate and he truly cares about his work and the affect it has on his patients.  I can't imagine that there is a better option out there, anywhere. Great job Dr. Kozma and Kim!|Having survived Cancer twice, 4 major surgeries, and hospitalized 3 times, for major depression. I think I've had enough experience with doctors, to know a good one when I see one. Dr Kozma is a wonderful Doctor. He listens with a careful ear, doesnt judge, and is eager to find solutions, to almost any problem.  I couldn't recommend him any higher, than I would. They don't come any finer, and I feel grateful, to have him in my life!! He is the best!!|My experience with Dr. Kozma is nothing less then exceptional. I have been with him for the better part of a decade now, and have seen myself grow as a patient, as well as seen him grow as a doctor. He has been there for me since the beginning, guiding me and being the ear I need through my ups and downs. If you are looking for a doctor that can really understand and relate with you, look no further. He is truly an outstanding doctor.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Portsmouth, NH

At American Pain Institute, our specialized physicians are dedicated to treating chronic, intractable pain conditions at our Portsmouth, New Hampshire clinic. We provide expert care for a wide range of pain disorders including Headaches, Fibromyalgia, Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy, Trigeminal Neuralgia, and Pudendal Neuralgia, as well as pain resulting from Cancer, Nerve Damage, Herniated Discs, and Arthritic Joints. We develop customized treatment plans for each patient that may include:

  • Injection Procedures

  • Radiofrequency Neurolysis

  • Kyphoplasty

  • Platelet Rich Plasma Injections

  • Hydrodiscectomy

  • Medication management

  • Implantable devices (Spinal Cord Stimulators, Intrathecal Pumps, Occipital Neurostimulators)

We're conveniently located at 14 Manchester Square, Suite 290 in Portsmouth, NH, where our compassionate team is committed to helping you regain function and improve your quality of life. Our approach combines advanced medical techniques with personalized care to address the root causes of your pain. Visit American Pain Institute or call us today at 603-766-8500 to schedule your appointment and take the first step toward effective pain relief.
column11: Our Physicians at our Portsmouth, New Hampshire clinic specialize in the treatment of chronic, intractable pain including Headaches, Fibromyalgia, Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy, Trigeminal Neuralgia, Pudendal Neuralgia as well as pain from Cancer, Nerve Damage, Herniated Discs, and Arthritic Joints. American Pain Institute is conveniently located at 14 Manchester Square, Suite 290 Portsmouth, NH. Our approach involves a customized treatment plan including Injection Procedures, Radiofrequency Neurolysis, Kyphoplasty, Platelet Rich Plasma Injections, Hydrodiscectomy, medications, and implantable devices such as Spinal Cord Stimulators, Intrathecal Pumps, and Occipital Neurostimulators. Call us today to make your appointment at 603-766-8500.
column38: Candi Cousins|Matthew|Kevin Kelley|Barbara Conachey|Heidi Rycek|Thomas Leavitt|Bonnie Bowerman|DENNY L CURTIS
column40:
I have seen doctors for years hoping for help with arthritis, trigger point pain in shoulder area , and neck and lumbar spine extending to thighs..Dr. Greenspan is the first doctor that has totally helped me!  I am so happy. I have felt better with each steroid injection. I have complete trust in his care.       The staff is just wonderful too. They are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable every time I visit. Its so nice to still have a doc that listens. Thanks to all!|I was referred to Dr. Greenspan by my primary care doctor. Thank god! Dr. Greenspan is a very thorough professional. He listened to my issues and my needs. LISTENED! I have had 3 pain management doctors since 2004. Ranging from 'OK" to purely unethical...

Dr. Greenspan is amazing. He did not stigmatize me. He did not judge me. In this day of mismanagement of pain patients, he gave me the care that was appropriate for me.

Dr. Greenspan is going after the causes of my pain, not just masking it. He wants me to be pain free, not just throw pills at me, keeping me and my insurance paying into his pockets. As such he has referred me to outside specialists to fully determine the causes of my pain. With those test results in hand, we are in the process of figuring out the way to best alleviate my symptoms.

If you are trying to just get high, abuse some pain prescription, or just want an easy way out of your issue, this is NOT the place to be.

This practice is professional and follows not just legal or medical guidelines, but is ethical in their treatment.

The nurses and office staff are discreet, caring, and knowledgeable.

For best results, come here!|I have been going to Dr Greenspan who is upfront about getting relief from the excruciating pain I was suffering from.  The first three Epidurals did very little for me but the first one of the second round did the trick and I have been completely pain free for 6 weeks. I have to mention the ladies at the front desk are wonderful and caring. Dr. Greenspan is very gentle and I feel like I have my life back being able to do the everyday things.  Thanks Doc|Personally, I find Dr. Greenspan to be caring and truly interested in I you have to say. As a doctor, he is very competent, knowledgeable and he takes the time to determine what procedure will work best for YOU, as an individual, with your unique medical issues. He is also very patient and takes the time to make sure you absolutely understand what the course of treatment will be by putting all medical jargon into layman's terms. Dr. Greenspan has helped me deal with my spine issues, as well as how best to give me relief.  In addition, the staff is class A, from the receptionist to the medical assistants. I am so happy to have found him and am certain my quality of life will improve because of him.|I have been going to Dr.Greenspan since 2014. He is one of the most caring compassionate doctors that I have ever met and very thorough he actually does his job and tackles the pain problems you have at hand he has done so much for me over these years I couldn't ask for a better doctor. not to mention a few years back I broke my foot and I was having trouble getting the medicine that I needed it was late at night on his day off he answered the phone and he took care of everything for me not a lot of doctors do that kind of thing. So if you need help with your pain management and you're open to all options American pain Institute is the place to go. I now see the physician assistant Kevin which is just as good as Dr. Greenspan I wouldn't change my doctors for the World. Also everyone in the office is very helpful for professional and very nice. Thanks So Much for helping me in life with my care. You guys are the best!|I have been a patient of Dr. Lehns for a close to a year. I am very grateful for his help. I can now play with my dog and have also stopped smoking marijuana. My quality of life is increased 10 fold. I have also gained a healthy amount of weight as my food now tastes better since stopping marijuana. I am so glad to have found him. I also appreciate his wonderful staff. They are very efficient and take care of me well.|Dr. Greenspan has literally changed my life.  He and his entire staff are always so happy and such a pleasure to be around.  His knowledge and expertise is far greater than any other Doctor I have seen prior to him, and the fact that he makes it a point that you understand how much he truly cares about YOU makes my overall experience with him beyond perfect!!|My experience has been next to amazing. The initial walk in was enlightening, everything you would not expect from a doctors office.  My first thought was, 'this can't be a doctors office, I must be in the wrong place.

It is what you would expect from an art gallery, not a doctors office. The waiting room has the most comfortable chairs with  impeccable decor and the lighting through out the entire facility.

If you are like me and have the dreadful experience of a drab dark and unkempt Dr office for years, then I strongly advise to give them a visit. I can promise, you will never go back to the drab. The pain institute puts most hospitals to shame with their advanced technology.

The staff is knowledgeable, respectful, I'm not some number waiting in line at the deli counter for my lunch meats. The patient rooms are soothing and inviting, not dirty and gloomy. Bathrooms are impeccably clean with warm colors and lighting, the same you would find in a 5 start hotel.

Each room is numbered by white led glass wall sconces. Recovery room, Yes! They have a recovery room..the chairs you relax in during recovery, is something you may find at a brookstone.

Dr Greenspan is the model for all doctors, knowledgeable, personable, innovative, and most importantly, he treats you like a person, not a paycheck as most have come accustom to. It has been close to one year since my first visit, and since then, my quality of life from the chronic pain and illness has improved by 80%. Everyone has different situations, some more difficult than others.

I was at the breaking point with my pain and quality of my life was at an all time low. Doctor after Doctor, hospitals that claim to be pain management but treated me like a washed up nobody, they made me feel guilty because I was in pain and needed help, almost as if I was faking it just to get medication.

Dr Greenspan made me feel comfortable, I did not feel like a nobody seeking medications, I felt assured, someone finally! Understands me, Finally there is hope and it's not all in my head.

Moving forward..Dr Greenspan found the problem to my chronic pain and conditions. I followed his advice and treatments, had surgery the same day, and today I am able to live a better quality of life with less pain.

I have a little ways to go still, but I know it will only get better. I am forever thankful to Dr Greenspan and American pain Institute and all the great staff. Had I continued on that road I was on with assumptions and getting shifted around with Doctors and hospitals telling me, "It's all in your head", I would not be in the happy place I am today.

Thanks,
Mr. Curtis

column40:
First visit there to see Dr. Ngo. My pain and discomfort level had dropped considerably since I made the appointment. Yet he was understanding with my following thru with my appointment regardless.Professional, personal, attentive and reassuring. He acknowledged  I was heading in the healing direction and to keep moving forward with my self-care, and to check back with the office in a month. Wonderful office staff also.|I absolutely love everyone at Pain Specialty Group, especially Dr. Gno. He tries to find ways of longer lasting relief for my pain, instead of just throwing pills at me like previous doctors at different places. He has an excellent group of staff all like minded. They put the patient first. I trust everyone there.|Dr Ngo and the entire staff are a great professional team. Looking forward to my upcoming appointments with them. They are all understanding and listen to the concerns I had. I would highly recommend them to anyone who's in pain and need help!!!|The dr spent extremely little time with me and did not listen in the most elemental ways. There seemed to be an assumption that I would be seeking narcotics, which I was not. The dr had not reviewed records that I sent ahead of time and despite my telling him repeatedly that I had sent them already, told the front desk person to order my records. The whole experience was dehumanizing and just strange and unhelpful and rushed. I moved from another state where pain management was handled much more professionally and respectfully.|Dr. Ngo and Josh, his PA, are wonderful. They are incredibly knowledgeable, very thorough, and genuinely empathetic to my husband's medical conditions. We would highly recommend this practice.|My appointment was timely and convenient.  The staff is helpful and pleasant and Dr. Ngo was prompt, addressed all of my concerns, explained his plan of action for me and entertained any and all questions.  It was good, not to feel rushed.
During my procedure Dr. Ngo and staff were extremely attentive, checking constantly about pain level which was minimal.  Truly a compassionate individual.|Dr. Ngo is without a doubt the best pain specialist I have EVER seen. I've been going to different specialists all over New England for over 15 years. No one even comes close. From the ambience of walking into a clean, tranquil waiting room with pleasant music playing, to being greeted with a smile by each and every employee I have interacted with. Unlike many places that take a one size fits all approach, Dr. Ngo and his expert team of Doctors and PAs create a bespoke approach for each and everyone of their patients. They take the time to see how you are doing every single visit. You aren't rushed at all unlike what I have experienced at many other practices. They have gotten me as close to pain free as I have been in over 15 years through a variety of treatments. Don't hesitate to give them a try. Other people I have talked to who see them drive several hours for one visit, just like me. That's because they are the BEST!!! Dr. Ngo is a phenomenal Doctor and an intelligent, kind, generous individual. The same goes for Bobby his Office Manager, Dr. Robertson, Josh, and the rest of the staff at Pain Speciality Group.

Thank you all for helping me to be able to enjoy spending time with the people I love and keep doing the things I find fulfilling. I wouldn't be able to do it without each one of you!|Dr. Ngo and his medical staff are highly professional, proactive, patient-centric, and flexible. From my experience, they put the best interests of their patients first!

column38: Acdoja420|den arm|Patrick Corbin|Carina Lindstrom|holly lemar|Matt Taylor|Danny Greene|Maggie Muffins
column40:
So this was probably my 3rd appointment at the Mount Airy location (previously went to the Rockville location.) While every one I've ever dealt with in their practices have been kind and helpful, they even go above and beyond my prior experiences with the practice. Everyone from the front office staff, to the people checking you in taking blood pressure etc, and of course the Nurse practitioner or Dr are kind, helpful, and also efficient. I had a couple new things this visit, met another staff member and forgive me I can't remember her name (it started with an M.) She met with me first to go over a couple things. First was a new App they have you down load and help you get set up there. This is to check in daily with them, just a few easy questions, but then also will have the ability to ask questions or make requests through the app so if you need anything you can just add it while doing your daily check in and they'll get back or follow up with what is needed. I love this as you don't have to call and it sounds like it will streamline getting assistance from them without having to sit on hold or call multiple times as it is with some Dr's offices I visit. So they are proactively making their practice even more efficient and patient friendly. She also had me do a new test which involved blood pressure cuffs on your 4 limbs and an oxygen meter. The Staff member was kind and considerate, making me feel comfortable and not rushed at all and not even worried if I wasn't able to do everything necessary due to pain and mobility issues. So aside from the usual easy, friendly, and quick in and out appointment, they continue to add new technology to make the patients lives a little easier. I've been going to pain management on and off for 20 years with the latest practice change due to insurance not covering my old Dr, and I can honestly say while I had no problems with past practices, the people at PASS Maryland and the ststem they have set up really has been the best overall experience from any pain management clinic I've been to. Thank you for helping keep my quality of life at an acceptable level especially during these cold months which are by far the worst for me.|Expert and professional staff.  I have been working with this office for over 6 years and I have always been treated in a professional and caring manner.

This practice is  modern and very much up to date on the latest developments and treatments.

They also have developed new technique's, new treatment's, and devices which have been adopted throughout the medical community.

I would always highly recommend this office to anyone that requires treatment for their own health needs.|The receptionist presents a very warm and welcoming atmosphere. Waiting times are minimal. Nurses are exceptionally friendly they explain everything they will be doing to prepare you to see your doctor. Once Dr. J walks in the room he also presents a very calming atmosphere he explained all the recent results of my previous weeks testing such as nerve and balance testing results he answered all my questions regarding the test results and offered up information on where I could get help with improving the test results. This company is top notch when it comes to critical spine care and explains all the latest procedures that would help you in your pain management journey. Thanks to everyone there involved with my care. I really appreciate each and everyone of you. Thank you all.|If you are looking for a place where professionalism and expertise are valuable to address your pain problems , this is the place to go. Chrissy very clearly communicated to me the details of my issues and the treatments  that I need . I have surgeries coming but while waiting, I am getting better sleep following the physical therapy they recommend along with the right medications. I know what they are doing is right. In my previous doctors, they just keep injecting me with steroids until they are not working anymore. Thank you Pain and Spine Specialists of MD! Highly recommended!|I'm treated with dignity and respect. The appointment is fast and efficient. Everyone that works there is very kind and caring. I'm very grateful for the people at pain and spine specialist. My appointments are always comforting. I've always been a little anxious going to doctors appointments but not here. Again I'm very grateful to everyone one at pain and spine specialist.|Great experience for me as a new patient best doctors office I've been to in the past 3 years. I have been going through my spine issues. As soon as you walk in information about what I was going through was available in the waiting room . Staff very welcoming and efficient at their jobs. Doctor was clear about what my options are and allowed me to tell him what's going on and answer my questions with clarity HIGHLY RECOMMEND|Definitely one of the best practices I've ever been to. I would recommend this place to anyone. Especially people that are over 65 and have been cut off because of Medicare or Medicare. It took me a long time to find a doctor who would accept me and treat me with my pain medication.|This office saved my life!!!
I've had CRPS for 8 years. Even with countless medications, treatments, specialist and doctors it was still very poorly managed. My daily pain was a 10+ moving was hard life seemed impossible. Although I had reached the end of the scope of practice of many doctors before I still carried hope there was a doctor out there who would listen. Then I found pain and spine specialist and it changed my life forever. My very first appointment I felt heard. For the first time in 8 years there was genuine empathy, and honesty about my condition. Everyone in this office makes me feel comfortable and cared for. Every Doctor and P.A. I've seen has listened to my probelms and worked with me to come up with a solution. My daily pain level is down to a 6, I can get around much better and even play with my kids.
Thank you pain and spine for literally giving me back my quality of life.

Outstanding customer care and professional service by Dr. Anna Irwin and her medical staff at Clearway Pain Solutions during my initial visit on 24 Jan 2025. I was greeted with a warm welcome during each stage, from Tiffany (check-in), Reggie (medical asst), and by Dr. Irwin. Tiffany was very professional and explained everything that was required at check-in for the initial visit. Their sign in process using the office tablet worked great  and is the way to go I must say. After completing check-in, Reggie led me to the exam room where she was very efficient in taking my vital signs and preparing additional paperwork that was needed. Finally, the care that I received from Dr. Irwin was outstanding. She explained my symptoms by using a visual aid which greatly helped me to understand my current condition, and the treatment plan going forward. I'm highly confident that I'll be back (no pun intended) to enjoying my active lifestyle again by following Dr. Irwin's recommend treatment plan. I highly recommend Dr. Irwin and her staff at Clearway Pain Solutions. Definitely 5 Stars!|My first visit- A very kind and cheerful front office staff. column40:
I decided to share this review because the staff here is truly amazing! They deserve recognition for the incredible work they do to help their patients.
Initially, I was hesitant to share this review because I didn't want anything to change the smooth and efficient experience I've had. Unlike many other pain management clinics, where you might wait up to an hour to be seen, my provider, Jay, ensures that appointments run on time. Jay is a true professional with a caring and positive attitude--something that's rare in this field. The level of consideration and respect for patients here is exceptional, especially compared to other places where long wait times are the norm. It's refreshing and much appreciated! Hopefully, this review will not bring in too many patients at once; however, I'm sure they will be able to keep up with patient demand , so I'm not too worried about it.
I want to add one more thought about pain management clinics. I've been to four different pain management clinics in the past 15 years. Throughout those years, I've had many operations, and you often need your pain medication adjusted for the procedures you're undergoing. The problem I encountered at three of the previous clinics was a lack of communication between staff and doctors. This led to errors in providing the proper dosage or adjusting prescriptions appropriately based on my procedures.
Elkridge Pain & Spine Center is awesome! I had been putting off my back operation because I was afraid of the pain level and not receiving proper medication from previous clinics. After seeing a review about Elkridge Pain & Spine Center, I decided to give them a try--and now I'm writing my own review because they deserve to be recognized!|Great people very caring and understanding I am well treated and they take the time to ask a lot of questions. I have been to several pain management places and this is by far the best . I highly recommend them and can not thank them enough for the quality of the treatment . it has been a pleasure working with them and a great experience. I look forward to a long|Dr. B is very competent and kind to his patients. Jay, the nurse practitioner was very helpful and the staff at the front desk are very responsive and polite. Thank you to all!|I the Elkridge office !
I  Dr. Jay is kind, friendly, and understanding, he shows genuine care and compassion, listens to all my concerns, and makes me feel comfortable during my  treatment; he has a positive and reassuring approach when dealing with me. He has a great  bedside manner .
I do hate the turnover with the front office staff!!! I have had appointments at all the locations since 2016 .
I'm a RMA myself and I think a MA/Nurse, Receptionist should know their patient. (Establish a rapport)
I do Miss Tru 
I do miss Ebony!|everyone at this  facility is so knowledgeable and so nice to you.
You never feel like you are an addict coming to get drugs, you always feel like a patient or part of the family. I highly recommend coming to them for your medicine management they are very thorough and they allow you the space to decide when you want to change your treatment goals. Jehangir Madan, PA is my MD and I find him to be extremely patient, knowledgeable and kind.  He never looks down on me as a person using my medication for recreation and he offers a lot of helpful ideas and solutions for my pain.
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!|Really good first appointment. Everyone was pleasant and professional. The women at the front desk were pleasant and efficient. Overall, I was very pleased with my experience there.|Dr. Madan is the best doctor I've had in a long time. Any issues that I'm having he helps me find all the options and will help with referrals for anything I need. He also helps with solutions to your pain with not only medication and physical therapy but with many different procedures as well.|Everyone are very respectful and friendly. The offices are always clean. Jay is my PA and he is really concerned about his patients. At the end of our appt  "he says is there anything else you want to talk about?"so that made me want to talk about my 2 brothers that passed away 8 days apart in Buffalo, NY,  and I'm having to stay a month at a time and then l drive back to Baltimore for my Pain Mgmt appt and then drive back to Buffalo, he allows you to get emotional. That to me is being concerned. I  would give him a 10, since we talk about numbers of pain always. I use to go to Glen Burnie  office but it closed down, so I have to go to the Elkridge office, but it's not a problem. I'm giving photos of myself with my brothers trying to be happy about their life. The other picture is my father holding me as he was building  our home that I  grew  up in. I'm getting emotional just telling my story. I  respect him working with me.
Thank you.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions Since 1998

Founded in 1998, we at Pain Management Specialists provide specialized pain treatment at our Rockville and Frederick, Maryland locations. Our board-certified physicians, Dr. Stuart Hough and Dr. Ramani Peruvemba, are dedicated to addressing pain caused by spinal conditions, nerve injury, surgery, and cancer. We take time to understand the intricacies of each pain condition and design personalized treatment plans that may include:

PAIN MANAGEMENT SPECIALISTS

column40:
Dr. Peruvemba shows great empathy towards his patients, has great bed side manner and is a very competant doctor. I  have returned to him for continued treatment and would recommend him to everyone I know. If there were more doctors like him our health care system would be in great shape.|This appointment specifically refers to a cervical epidural injection. The check-in and preparation went smoothly. I previously have had lumbar epidurals but a cervical epidural was new and I didn't know what to expect. I was also in some pain so, as a result I think, my BP was 30 points higher than normal. As the procedure began (with a local anesthetic), Dr. Hough said I would feel a pin-prick (it was barely noticeable)and then a sting (it was very mild and also barely noticeable). As the steroid was injected, Dr. Hough said I would feel an increase in pressure (I did but it wasn't uncomfortable) and then some pain in my left arm (I did, of short duration and not intense). Overall, I would rate the procedure as fairly quick and painless. Now for the hard part: waiting to see if the cervical epidural works as well for me as the lumbar epidurals had.|Dr. Peruvemba (Dr. P) is concerned, conscientious doctor willing to spend the time necessary to address all my questions and concerns. The support staff (Evan) has always been very easy to deal with.|Dr.Hough is very professional and knowledgeable. He explained the reason behind my pain and recommended the best care to solve it.|Staff was informative, kind and efficient.  Dr Hough was direct and amazingly gifted at placing a needle in a tight space with incredible accuracy..and performed it painlessly.  Thanks for the pain relief.  I highly recommend.
G Grover, MD|I'm very grateful for the care I have received with Dr. Hough and the pain relief. From the time I walk in the door until I leave I am given outstanding care|Dr. Hough did a great job. I am recommending him to family and friends now!

I felt especially helped by ASHLEY, who spoke with me multiple times on the phone, but everyone in the office was very kind! I am grateful to be recovering, with good pain relief, but will always recommend Global Pain Management and their team to anyone suffering from a pain issue. The front desk staff were very polite and friendly as well.

However, I received the bill today for my visits earlier in the year, and it seems the only way to pay is with a credit card, where I have to either mail back the bill with my credit card information written on it, which presents a huge risk if the mail gets lost for whatever reason, or I have to come in to the office in order to pay. They're not able to take my card number over the phone for some reason and now that the Columbia office is temporarily closed with no definite date for reopening, I have to go all the way to Pasadena office during my work day, which is very inconvenient. Correction: you are able to mail in a check, which is a little better but still very manual.|I absolutely recommend Global Pain Mgmt to all my family and friends. I have been a patient of Dr O for more than 10 years and couldn't imagine going anywhere else for my back. The entire office is friendly, professional and goes above and beyond to meet your needs.|I have never been to a pain management clinic before and did not know what to expect. The treatments really helped my issues, and I would highly recommend this facility if you need to address a pain problem.|I have been coming here for 3 years. My doctor left, and they replaced him with a nurse practitioner named Nia Valentine. I don't like her attitude; she seems very fake and acts like she knows everything. When I told her I didn't have any current X-rays, she got loud and insisted that I did, saying I had them last year. After she found out that I never got them done, she looked foolish. It's a shame how African American women treat each other. I had high hopes for her because she was African American, but she has the worst personality. Now, I have to find another location to go to; this place is going downhill.

column2: The Pain Treatment Center of Greater Washington, Justin Wasserman, M.D.
column3:
At The Pain Treatment Center of Greater Washington, led by Justin Wasserman, M.D., we specialize in treating the most complex chronic pain conditions and opioid addiction cases.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We excel in managing challenging conditions including:

  • Fibromyalgia and complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

  • Low back pain and "failed back syndrome"

  • Pelvic pain, vulvodynia, and interstitial cystitis

  • Migraines and severe headaches

  • Depression, anxiety, and insomnia associated with chronic pain

As internationally recognized experts in medication management for complex chronic pain, we frequently receive referrals from other pain management physicians who trust us with their most challenging cases. Our approach is comprehensive—we don't just treat the pain, but also address the psychological components that often accompany chronic pain conditions. Located in Bethesda, MD, we're committed to helping patients who have exhausted other treatment options find relief and improved quality of life. Visit washingtonpainclinic.com or call us at 301-263-8000 to schedule a consultation at our Wisconsin Avenue location.
column11: The Pain Treatment Center of Greater Washington specializes in the treatment of intractable chronic pain as well as opioid addiction. I manage the most complex cases of fibromyalgia, low back pain/"failed back syndrome", CRPS, pelvic pain, vulvodynia, interstitial cystitis, migraines and other types of severe headaches. I am an internationally known expert in medication management of the most complex chronic pain cases. Most of my patients have failed treatments from multiple other pain doctors. In fact, my largest referral sources are other pain management doctors who send their most difficult patients to me. I also am an expert in managing the depression, anxiety, and insomnia which commonly occur in patients with severe chronic pain.
column38: Brenna Frey|RD Steinle|Jon Belinkie|Abby Payton|Thomas Caldwell|Patrice Drake|Ellen Salkeld|Nancy Lee
column40:
If you feel that your doctor is not listening to you about your pain and you are frustrated that no one seems to care -- this is the place for you. I've never had a doctor listen to my issues like Dr. Wasserman. During your appointment you have his full attention and he makes sure to ask about everything, even things that you did not think could be related to your problem, and is therefore able to make linkages and diagnoses that other doctors miss. I had severe pain in my hips and back that my GP could not fix (and did not seem particularly interested in fixing because he did not seem to think it was real). After seeing Dr. Wasserman for four months, the pain is gone most days. I have lived with the pain for years and did not know it could feel this good. I also like that Dr. Wasserman always endeavors to find the least amount of medication that will give me a good result, the most efficient treatment with the least number of side effects. I would definitely recommend this practice to anyone in pain that doesn't know where to turn.|I have suffered with Migraines for over 50 years, gradually transitioning from Occasional, to Episodic, to Chronic, to Chronic Daily.  During that process my use of Pain Management Meds changed from OTC NSAID's, to Opioids.  Their increasing frequency lead to Rebounding or MOH (Medication Overuse Headache).  My previous Pain Management Doctor had me using "old school" Pain Meds, and I found myself in a vicious downward spiral.  That dreaded day occurred, he retired and dissolved his practice.  My search for a new Doctor lead me to a Migraine Specialists, who with highest recommendations referred me to Dr. Wasserman for Pain Management.

Dr. Wasserman is focus driven, first gathering the pertinent background information and details regarding my Migraines.  We had an in-depth discussion of my current situation, medications used, and how the unrelenting chronic pain was in total control of my life.  He listened attentively to my concerns, frustrations, and hopeful objectives.  He explained in detail how my current traditional pain treatment program was doomed from the start.  Dr. Wasserman developed a new tactical approach for my pain management.  We started down a new path on a treatment program that could be tailored over time to my specific needs.  He was very careful and methodical to ramp the dose up gradually and observe any potential side effects.

The Pain Management program Dr. Wasserman put me on has made a significant and profound change in the quality of life I have now.  My wife is also very grateful for the marked improvement.  It's a Win-Win all around.  I am ecstatic that Opioids and their long term detrimental effects are no longer part of my daily routine.  Dr. Wasserman truly cares about his patients, their wellbeing, and their quality of life.  His extensive knowledge and years of experience treating complex pain management conditions is unequaled.  Julia, his support staff is top notch, there to provide first class assistance and support as needed, and you can contact him on his personal cell phone if needed.  You won't find a better Pain Management Doctor to work with.|No one likes dealing with pain, and the whole prospect can become overwhelming unless you find effective treatment guided by an effective specialist. Dr,Wasserman is just that. His expertise, while focused on pain management, recognizes that pain is a multi causal thing and requires a multi prong approach. From sleep, to weight loss, to physical therapy, to an improved medication regimen....Dr.Wasserman has addressed comprehensive treatment of all these contributing factors and is having tremendous success. His common sense no  nonsense approach is refreshing and results driven. You owe it to yourself to schedule an appointment with him and experience the difference for yourself.|Dr Wasserman is the best of the best! He saved my life. I was at the lowest point in my life before I came to his practice as a patient. Seven years later and I am now working full time, enjoying my family and most importantly, love myself again. He is creative and truly cares what is best for his patients. I have been to many doctors and hospitals in my life and have never found anyone in the entire field of medicine who truly listens to patients with chronic pain issues the way Dr Wasserman does. My first appointment with him lasted over 3 hours if that says anything. Thanks Doc for all you have done for me and my family. We are truly blessed to have you in our lives.|I have been a patient of Dr. Wasserman for over ten years. He takes more time with patients than any other doctor I've ever been to. He listens, and works with you to figure out the best way forward. He constantly looks for ways to improve your outcome.

He keeps up with the latest research and developments in the field of pain treatment, and uses that knowledge to ensure patients are getting the best possible course of treatment. We have worked together to minimize medication and maximize my ability to maintain an active lifestyle. I highly recommend Dr. Wasserman.|I have been a patient of Dr Justin Wasserman, MD. For over 12 years. I have a very complex medical history one of which is I am a Liver transplant patient who suffers from CRPS know as RSD in my right hand. Many surgeries and medical incisions throughout my body. RSD can follow from your original form of injury and can effect any additional injuries to one's body from having additional surgeries. Dr. Wasserman is an expert in chronic pain management. He's always available if I should need to have additional surgeries he's always  involved with my other doctors. If I should have a flair up in-between my office visit his very quick in responding back to me to assist me. He is the my 2nd Pain Management Doctor who I have been working with since my first doctor had retired. I value he's knowledge, expertise and compassion as he is always willing to listen. Being a chronic pain patient is a difficult disease to live with. There is no cure for these neurological injuries. As well as no one treatment for each person. I have the utmost respect for Dr. Wasserman in how he manages to help me with this complex pain syndrome. He helps make life easier to work with my pain to have a life worth living.
Dr.Justin Wasserman is a valuable part of my life and my medical Care in conjunction with several other medical professionals in which at times it's essential that he is part of that team. In working with my other specialist doctors that I see on a regular basis. I highly Recommend Dr Justin Wasserman MD to anyone who is in need of chronic pain management. FYI. Please confirm threw his office if you need to have a referral prior to making an appointment.

Stay safe wear masks!|As a clinical research professional, I've worked with numerous physicians over my 20 year career, and as a chronic pain sufferer I've also been a patient. Dr. Wasserman is the real deal. Very few physicians have his high level of ability combined with ethical standards and compassionate care. He was able to accurately diagnose my long standing pain condition that over a dozen other physicians had missed or improperly diagnosed. Before I was (finally) referred to Dr. Wasserman by another pain specialist, I'd spent the better part of 5 years and lots of money trying to find someone who would get it right. Once we had the diagnosis, he worked with me extensively to find the right non-opioid medications, titrate them appropriately so I could tolerate increasing doses, and address each symptom of my complex condition in turn. Over 18 months or so, we arrived the right balance of as little medication as possible to keep my symptoms at bay. He's meticulous in his exploration and takes copious notes that allow him to refer back to previous visits. His knowledge of pain medications and their effects is encyclopedic, and he keeps up with all the latest medical research, which not a lot of physicians bother to do. I highly recommend Dr. Wasserman to anyone struggling with chronic pain; he'll help you get it sorted out so you can live your best life.|When I first met Dr. Wasserman over a year ago, I was in daily crippling pain from cervical dystonia (spasmodic torticollis). He was referred to me by my primary care doctor. In our first meeting and every meeting since, Dr. Wasserman has been an intense investigator, rigorously searching for causes behind my symptoms. He possesses a sincere willingness to listen as well as an intense desire to search for details that allows him to develop a personalized treatment plan. I continue to have monthly follow-up treatment.

Moreover, Dr. Wasserman and his associate have been very welcoming to me. They are also attentive to me in terms of scheduling appointments as well as in terms of communications.

column48: Can the doctor  prescribe subutex or just suboxone ...???
column49:
Hi.  Thanks for asking the question.  I do prescribe subutex in appropriate cases.  Every patient is different, and all treatment for any patient with chronic pain must be individualized.  If you contact my office, I'd be happy to discuss your particular situation to see if I can potentially help you.  

Justin Wasserman, M.D.

My first appointment was at the Columbia office and it is a brand new location but it seems like I can't get a appointment at the Cattonsville office. I guess it's more patients in the Baltimore county area than Anne Arundel county. However if I can always have my appointment with Ms. Rachel Whitley I don't mind traveling out there, even though it's about a 30 minute drive. They just come into the room and refills med's and on to the next patient. Not asking you if you may need any other treatment than just meds. G.M.P.M opens doors for a whole other treatment options than only meds such as physical therapy, and different types of tests to better your health. Ms. Rachel Whitley wants to know what helps you and what doesn't. She is the first provider that wants to see your health history such as MRI results x rays and past history reports so she can better help you in your plan to get better and hopefully pain free! If you want to better your health and pain for long-term and not just every month it's the same thing, give Greater Maryland Pain Management a try and I bet you won't regret it! Ask to see Rachel Whitley NP it's worth the travel if you don't live out that way. Thanks for opening new doors to better my pain!|My pain has been managed, very well. Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Abingdon

At Complete Pain Care, we provide advanced pain management services across 5 strategic locations throughout the Baltimore Metro Area. Our team of specialized physicians and Advanced Practice providers takes a comprehensive approach to pain relief, utilizing the latest interventional techniques to help patients regain their quality of life. We offer a full spectrum of treatments including:

  • Diagnostic imaging

  • Trigger point injections

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Medial branch nerve blocks and ablations

We're proud to now offer the Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD) procedure, which has shown remarkable results in relieving pain from lumbar canal stenosis. Our mission is to reduce or eliminate pain using evidence-based interventional techniques while providing outstanding patient care. Whether you're suffering from chronic back pain, joint issues, or other painful conditions, we strive to deliver excellent service to both our patients and referring physicians. Visit Complete Pain Care or call us at +1 410-777-8971 to schedule your consultation at our Abingdon office located at 100 Walter Ward Blvd #300.
column11:
With 5 locations around the Baltimore Metro Area, our pain management physicians and Advanced Practice providers use a comprehensive approach, including diagnostic imaging, trigger point injections, epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, medial branch nerve blocks and ablations, and more.

We specialize in reducing or eliminating pain using the latest successful interventional pain management techniques. We are now also offering Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression or the MILD procedure that has been shown to relieve pain from lumbar canal stenosis.

We strive to provide outstanding patient care and excellent service to our patients and referring physicians.

At Maryland Pain & Wellness Center, we provide comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of our founder, Henry Achampong, MD, MS. With over a decade of specialized experience in pain management and anesthesiology, Dr. Achampong has established multiple locations across Maryland including Delmar, Crisfield, Princess Ann, Pocomoke, Berlin, Ocean City, Cambridge, Easton, Crofton, Prince Frederick, and Salisbury to better serve our patients.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We specialize in treating a wide range of chronic and acute pain conditions including:

  • Cancer pain management

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Spinal disorders and related pain

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Pharmacological pain management

Our approach combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to address each patient's unique pain challenges. Dr. Achampong's expertise in both pharmacological and interventional treatments allows us to offer comprehensive care for even the most complex pain disorders. We're committed to improving quality of life for our patients throughout Maryland's Eastern Shore and beyond. Visit our Maryland Pain & Wellness Center website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 443-672-2600 to schedule an appointment at our Salisbury location: 106 Milford St STE 503, Salisbury, MD 21804.

column40: Dr Henry has always treated me with respect and when one method of treatment didn't work we tried another. We have tried several things to help ease my back pain but none have seemed to work but Dr Henry has not given up today as a matter of fact I had a Spinal Cord Stimulator put in my back on a trial basis yo see if it will bring me relief, hopefully this will be the thing that finally does. I am very thankful to Dr Henry for not just saying this is what is going on and we will treat it this way and it will work or you may have yo find another doctor to find your answers because I give up. Dr Henry has always listened to me and asked what I thought about his treatment plan not treating me like a joke but a human being. Yes his office is very busy and sometimes runs considerably late getting you in and out but that is because he has many patients because he is a good doctor and human being. Thank you Dr Henry for doing ever you can yo help me find some relief from my pain.|Dr Henry is a wonderful Doctor. I have been with Dr Henry for over ten years.  He is very knowledgable with with all his patients and can do surgery in his office complex. I would highly recommend Dr. Henry to everyone. Gary T|For the third time in six month I'm having an issue with getting my prescription filled.  From not sending the prescription at all to an incorrect fill date.  Always have difficulty getting someone on the phone but they have posted a sign indicating a no notification cancelation is a 75 dollar charge. Kind of hard to notify someone when they rarely pick up the phone and the answering machine is ALWAYS full. Sometimes you get the disconnected line tone for hours at a time. Now they are closed until the 2nd.  Both other locations have a notification by the phone robot, but not this one.  So now I get no meds for the holidays while entertaining two toddlers. 2 weeks without meds unless I physically go there to get it straight.  I have a spinal cord injury and am now in a wheelchair.   I guess on the second I have to load up the wheelchair and unload it again to roll in there and get it straight.  I couldnt imagine still being in the work force and dealing with mistake after mistake frim your doctor AND having to leave work to get it fixed because its almost impossible to get someone on the phone. I've had no issues with Dr Henry and every interaction has been positive and very respectful. Grade A on him.   The rest hasn't been pleasant.|I have only had a few bad experiences there. They were with Tish. She always has an attitude and talks to everyone else while she should have her attention on the patient in front of her. I do not like that. There was one day I had an early appointment bc I worked from 10p-7a, I was getting an injection in my lower back. The whole time I was waiting NO ONE told me I was an hour early for my appointment. She also when she is giving appointment cards doesn't circle what the appointment is a follow up or procedure.|I love this practice. Dr. Henry is very attentive to his patients and I'm so happy I found him. Excellent pain provider.|I get excellent service. Everyone is cordial,  and though they have a lot of patients,  they remember me including the doctor. Sometimes the wait is long,  but they are getting better about that.|My care at pain and wellness center has been really good.The staff are accomodating and personable,the wait minimal.Dr.Henry is warm,intelligent,and very helpful.For the past 2yrs.lve had spinal pain 10 most of the time.More recent cancer of the head and neck pain before and after tx.ongoing.Without the help from this great clinic,my life and lifestyle would be unbearable!! Thank God !!|Dr Henry is great the staff not so much no phone calls that my appt was cancelled I'm been a patient there for yrs and front desk girls not doing there job haven't been  seen weeks before Xmas and final get my appt in the second week of January and go in just get told you are cancelled today with no call message nothing just told one of girls called me I said no call to me was made then told o sorry maybe they forgot so looks like look for a better place for treatment

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Greenbelt, Maryland

At Pain Management Associates LLC, we provide specialized care for both acute and chronic pain conditions under the expert guidance of Haddis T. Hagos, MD, DABA, DABA-PM, and our dedicated team. We firmly believe that effective pain management requires a multidisciplinary approach tailored to each individual's needs. Our practice specializes in treating a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis

  • Neuropathy

  • Cancer pain

We offer a comprehensive suite of treatment options from medication management to advanced interventional procedures such as epidural injections and spinal cord stimulation. Our customized care plans combine interventional procedures with carefully titrated medical treatments and physical therapy to ensure optimal results for our patients. Visit our official website or call us at +1 301-220-2333 to schedule a consultation at our Greenbelt office located at 7500 Greenway Center Dr #910.
column11:
Pain Management Associates LLC in Greenbelt, Maryland, provides high-quality care for acute and chronic pain conditions. Haddis T. Hagos, MD, DABA, DABA-PM, and the team believe the best way to combat pain is through a multidisciplinary approach.
The pain management practice cares for a variety of conditions, including back pain, neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, and cancer pain. They offer a full range of pain treatments, from medication management to epidural injections to spinal cord stimulation.
The team at Pain Management Associates LLC customizes care plans, combining interventional procedures with carefully titrated medical treatments and physical therapy, so patients get the best results.

Dr. Achampong talks me through every step in my injections and is very thorough in making sure I will not have issues. He even asks all the pre-injection questions that the tech already asked before he came into the treatment room. I am so glad that I found him.|I have been seeing Dr. Achampong for several months, he is treating my migraines and a couple other problems that I suffer with, with injections and Botox for migraines.
Great Dr , always very kind and very knowledgeable with different treatment options. Only thing I wish could change is the wait time, but it's worth sitting awhile if he's helping your wellbeing !|I have been a patient of Dr.Henry Achampong MD,MS and his Maryland Pain and Wellness Center in Crofton MD.
for quite some time now & am very pleased with him. He & his great staff are very pleasant & very professional,they also "do not try to rush you", to get to their next patient....
I give the doctor & his amazing staff much respect & gratitude....Thank you
Yes,I would recommend the Pain & Wellness Center to all my family & friends...
Pleasant stress free appointments.
If you go to see him for an appointment, tell him Linda Nice says Hello....|Dr. Henry is one of the best doctors I have ever had. Quality, caring, invested pain management doctors are RARE. Prior to finding Dr. Henry Achampong's practice 8 years ago, I had gone to two other pain management practices, both of which would basically just hand you an opioid prescription and say "see you in a month". They never seemed to care, and the only thing they were ever worried about was prescribing more medication. Dr. Henry truly cares about his patients. Just for me personally, he has always gone above and beyond, he is very invested and is always doing research and looking at every alternative option instead of just prescribing pills. I had a spinal cord injury in 2020 and was in a wheelchair and was told I would never walk again. Dr. Henry took the time to do a lot of research and read a lot of clinical studies and actually found things that would help to repair the spinal cord damage and I am happy to tell you that today, three years later I can walk most of the time, only requiring my wheelchair for long distances. I recommend him to everyone that asks for a PM recommendation and I truly just can't say enough good things about him. In the eight years I have been seeing him, I have lived in a couple different places, one of which was over two hours away from his office, but I still always made sure to make the drive because I do not think he is replaceable.|The doctor is very easy to talk too...He listens very well and is understanding.  I like the fact that he has a game plan for your treatments...very nice staff, as well..|I feel like Dr Henry is a good listener and that means a lot to me. And it was comforting to see that he was concerned about the bloodwork results I showed him. His feedback to me about it made me feel that I was in good hands.|Maryland Pain Management has been around for years .. Because Dr. Achamponag  is a knowledgeable Dr. Who knows how to listen , care for all types of body pain.. He's very nice , caring.. I wouldn't go anywhere else.. No matter where I move to , I will still want to be under his care.. His staff really listen to your health needs too.. They work very hard..  God bless all of them !! Thank you for all of the care that you'll give to me..|With several years of surgery on my upper and lower back (spinal), l am living proof of what a good professional pain management specialist who really cares about all his patients is changing the lives of many who suffer excruciating pain on a daily basis.  Dr. Henry Achampong is by far the best pain management specialist in the Calvert/Maryland area.  He has been the blessing to my recovery.  Thank you Dr. Achampong!

column40:
If there was a way to put zero stars I would. The doctor I seen today was very rude and that's putting it lightly. This was my first visit there, I won't be back. I have severe health problems and the doctor that I saw was completely rude about that, and all the areas that I have pain in. Then he got mad asking me why my primary care doctor didn't do certain tests before he sent me to him. All those things is what my primary doctor said that this doctor would do, and that was the reason why he was referring me to this doctor.  When he asked me about taking Motrin I told him that my GI doctor said I can no longer take anything with Ibuprofen products due to my stomach lining eroding and he acted like he was mad about that. To top matters off, he asked me why I came a day early for my appointment. I explained to him that their office had called me the day before and asked could I come in a day earlier than my appointment was scheduled for. Mind you like I said I'm in the examination room with him while he's complaining about why the staff is scheduling him with all these new patients  knowing how long it takes a doctor to see a new patient like it's my fault. I highly recommend if you want a good doctor that genuinely cares about how you feel then avoid this place at all costs. The staff that works at the front desk where you first check in at were the sweetest, kindest ladies. They were the only good thing about this place.|I truly trust & respect Dr. Robert Tsuji, MD
He has made my life better and more manageable. He explains my health issues in great detail. I'm very thankful.
The staff is great & very helpful.|I went to see Dr. Tsuji for another opinion on how to manage chronic thoracic and cervical pain that I have been dealing with for 8-9 years. I also wanted to get some injections. He seemed to smerk at me the entire time, even while I began crying. This pain has obviously taken a toll on my life and he made me feel like I was complaining and overreacting. He told me that "there is not a magic cure" and "it could be worse, at least you don't have cancer or multiple sclerosis."  He also made sure to let me know that he blew out two of his vertebrae and is fine now. I'm not sure if that was a hint at me not doing enough or what. He ended the visit by walking out of the room without explaining the next steps. I then walked out to the lobby and nobody was there to check me out or set up another appointment. Completely unprofessional.|John Yingling is the best! Very compassionate and listen to you. John treats everyone like a friend and that says alot these days.|I'm always impressed by Dr's knowledge and ability to ease my fears. I definitely fear pain in this day and age, and having him as an advocate makes my journey easier to bear.|It was a pleasant experience the staff was very nice and Dr. Tsugi takes his time to explain everything|The doctor I saw was competent, humorous, and heard the issues I have been having.|Asap in severna park was wondering . The 2 young ladies who were working Monday the 23rd, were so helpful, nice, joyful and very experienced too bad other places are not like this!! I would recommend ASAP in severna Park to everyone!!
