column40:
This has to be the worst and dumbest office I have ever worked with. I tried to cancel an appointment for my mother because she was in the hospital. I was told I can't cancel the appointment because of HIPAA. I explained to the person I was speaking with that HIPAA does not regulate appointments, canceling or making appointments for another person. They didn't want to listen to me and didn't cancel my mom's appointment which she did not make because she was in the hospital and then they sent me a bill for a no-show fee. This company needs to train their people better on what HIPAA is and stop making it so difficult for patience in their families to schedule appointments or cancel appointments. My mother passed away the following week so thank God I will never have to deal With this office again.|Had a consultation appointment on 7/30 for injections for my migraines. Scheduled an appointment for 8/20 to give them time to get the medication in. It's 8/22 and they have not sent the prescription to my pharmacy yet despite my repeated calls. The practice manager was supposed to call me 8/19 and every time I call the tell me she will call me back but has not. I'm now overdue for this and out $50 for a consultation and now have to start the process all over with another doctor since they won't follow up.

In response my original review on 8/22 I called 4 times that day requesting a call back and nothing until I left a review. Office manager pretended to have no idea there was an issue and completely ignored me telling them they needed to use my pharmacy and not do buy and bill. I tried calling until I spoke to the office manager at 3pm on 8/26 who basically told me they weren't going to tell me what they were going to charge for the Botox and that was between me and my insurance. I again explained that my insurance told me they weren't covering it and asked what they were going to charge. She told me would call billing back and get the information. Apparently she left the office less than 30 minutes as she had planned to do which is fine. She however did not tell me and knew my appointment was first thing the next morning and that she wasn't actually going to call me back despite literally telling me she would.

As an updated despite going in person to speak with the office manager on 8/27 it's 8/31 and this prescription was not sent as has been promised more than once now.|Ms. Darnette and Ms. Myisha, the ladies at the front desk are amazing! I'm always welcomed with a warm smile and hello. They ask me how I'm doing and are always very polite and helpful. These two ladies do not receive enough credit for the hard work that they do, and the difficult patients they deal with. I've witnessed both ladies deal with some very rude patients, and they still remain polite.
I had to stop by the office last week to pick something up, it was about 4:30pm. Everyone in the office had already left for the day or was leaving. While there, a man came in, about 4:40pm. Both ladies said hello to him, and he kept looking at his phone. It seemed like he was looking for something on his phone, but he didn't speak. Finally, he spoke up, but was not providing much information. He was saying he received a voicemail msg about an opening for a procedure. I couldn't understand why he had to come into the office to tell the ladies that information. The appointment he was asking about was for December 3rd, I couldn't understand why he was in the office asking about an appointment so far out. Ms. Darnette had to keep trying to get information out of this man because he was not giving much information for anyone to understand why he was in the office. It took several minutes and several questions for her to get the man to tell her why he was even there. I was frustrated witnessing what was going on, but both ladies still remained very polite and professional.
Over the past few years, I've witnessed too many patients being rude to both ladies, and it should not be that way. I've never seen the office manager step in to try to help resolve an issue. Ms. Darnette and Ms. Myisha both handle every situation in a professional manner, even when patients are being rude and disrespectful towards them.|While the providers I've seen have been okay and educational, this place overbooks every day and I have had numerous days wait times of over 2 hours to be seen. I would advise caution when making an appointment. It would appear they do not value your time, only your or your insurance companies' money.|Been seeing Dr Yoon for a few years now. He's so great! Completely dedicated and actually listens to your problems and wants to sincerely help. Thank you so much clearway for allowing me to be a patient of one of your best physicians!|Have been a patient of Sophia Leonard Burns for 15 years.  I feel so lucky to have such an amazing practitioner treating my neck and back pain.  Her trigger point injections are life changing for the pain, and over all office experience has been excellent!  I see her both in Glen Burnie and Annapolis.|Office is great the ladies up front are sweethearts.i been on pain management for yrs and had side effects with the shots so I just stayed on medication. I was on 7.5 oxycodone which helped.i was prescribed every 6 hrs. This pain management kept my same milligram and lowered me to every 8 hrs and didn't even give me 30 day supply. Now I have Two more bad disc in my neck and now have two in my back.and the Dr said I don't want to keep treating you with opioid I want to do injections I told him they didn't help me and gave me side effects he told me the side effects wasnt caused from the injections.i told him I'm in alot of pain and that I need a higher milligram because these new disc problems and nerve damage are more painful.i function and work well when I have my medicine.he gave me the prescription for the shots and told me to take them to the front desk for scheduling.i threw them away I'm not taking a chance of having more side effects again.so I guess I will probably have to find another pain management who is going to let me be pain free and give me my medicine that's helping Instead wanting to stick me with a bunch of needles that didn't help me.and I would have to hunt the Dr down every month to call my medicine in and then it would take him 7 to 10 days more to call it in. Now my new Dr has me on the same prescription schedule  as Dr fad. And now I'm in more pain than I was before.why cant I find a Dr who is going to give me the correct prescription so I can be out of pain.and I never had a failed urine and always taken my medicine as prescribed and never ran out|This place is definitely busy but the office staff in front are amazing. So have patience with the line.  It definitely moves fast if you do the check in on the phone. Now for the physician I saw who was Timothy Yoon he was outstanding!!  I haven't seen someone in years who actually enjoys their job.  I was extremely nervous and didn't know what to expect getting a EMG test done. He made me feel very comfortable. Great conversation and he had me laughing majority of the time.

column40:
First initial visit went well and the doctor was very adamant about figuring out how to help me and I was very appreciative. Unfortunately, yesterday I had an appointment that was cancelled due to a doctor being sick. These things happen, however I did not receive any communication regarding this. I showed up for my appointment early to check in at the front desk and was scoffed at as to why I was even there. The lady I checked in with was trying to help me to understand what happened, while the other lady at the front desk sat there and was just sitting there running her mouth about how she called everyone, left messages etc. I received no phone call whatsoever or would never have shown up for an appointment and would have rescheduled it. This lady was completely dismissive that I could have not received a phone call. The lady who was checking me in then asked if I could wait for a possible appointment today or would like to reschedule. The other lady, at the front desk goes why are you trying to help him, we are already backed up as it is. For someone who had already had their last appointment cancelled and now this one was a giant gut punch when it is already hard enough trying to get help for chronic pain, to hear this is demoralizing. When you are dealing with pain and are in need of assistance, you should not be met with constant resistance of how not to be able to treat a patient. I am very hesitant to return to this office as MY experience has been very unprofessional.|Today was my first time being at the practice. The front desk was friendly and I didn't have to wait long between my check in time at the front desk and to be triaged. The doctor came in right after he was very knowledgeable and he had a great conversation and came up with a plan. I look forward to continuing my journey with this practice.|Clearway Pain Solutions provides excellent care in a timely manner. The office is professional, friendly with great customer service.  Dr. Foo provided me with clarity and options to best meet my needs while demonstrating a comfortable doctor, patient relationship . I would recommend this office to all inquirers.|First appointment. A real pleasure from start to finish! Phone was answered quickly, my info collected and just by luck I was able to get an appointment same day.

Front desk staff helpful and friendly, Christina the nurse took me back on time and took additional info, she had already gathered previous mri's and info. I didnt expect them to have all my records on such short notice.

Met with Dr. Fadayomi, he spent the time to listen and didnt rush me. Got a plan together and scheduled a procedure.

Very satisfied, look forward to working with this office and Dr. Fadayomi.|I arrived at 12:35 pm for a 1 pm appointment today with Dr. Oluseyi Fadayomi and was not seen until 2:45. Dr. Fadayomi did not have the documentation that I provided to the front desk with him (such as the list of medications that I am taking), he was rude and argumentative and went so far as to say that I was late for the appointment and that he did not like my attitude! I have never been treated so badly by a medical professional in my life. I have filed a complaint with the insurance company and let my orthopedic doctor know that he should not recommend Clearway Pain Solutions to his patients.

I have also filed a complaint with the Maryland Board of Physicians.

Ray Boedecker|Office staff is amazing. No matter whether someone is checking in or out and there's complete chaos, they are calm and always find a way to laugh.

Dr. Foo is great at what he does. He's thorough and listens to what his patients are saying. He doesn't believe in just going from an  office visit directly to surgery to resolve problems. He works through a series of steps to determine best course of treatment. He also believes in Physical Therapy to fix mechanics of the body.|Dr Patel did not take Good Care Of My Health.... I had a Medication Reaction And He Did Not Care He Let Me Go 3Days Without Any Medication And When I Saw Him On Monday Morning I Came Into The Office For Nothing...He Knew The New RX MY RX Was Going To Be Out Of Stock And He Didn't Care Nor Did He Return My Email Of Phone Calls!|I met with Dr. Foo. He did not rush through the exam and he asked very specific questions. He tentatively diagnosed my problem which was definitively confirmed by a rheumatologist. After being in pain for two years, I am extremely grateful to him. I do want to add that the staff is wonderful from check in to check out. Even though the office was busy, the wait time was minimal.

column40:
My provider,  Elisha Carter, consistently is up to date with my pain issues and ongoing plan of care. She provides me with updated information related to my issues and any/all treatment options that may assist in meeting my needs (to minimize/facilitate my goal toward optimal pain relief). Her professionalism and individualized communication makes me feel that I am cared for as an individual and not just a diagnosis.  I look forward to my appointments and the progress that I am making. Thus far, this has been a positive experience. Pain management is challenging and individualized/patient focused care is a integral to success. I am truly grateful. And I look forward to continued quality care/outcome related to my life/pain issues.|Dr. B is the best!  He gave me injections in my back that really worked.  Just like he said it would.  I had received injections before from a local, large hospital.  Those injections only relieved the pain for 2 days.  Then a friend suggested I call pain management/Clearway Pain Solutions and I called them.  Dr. B explained he would go into my back at a different angle and this time the pain relief has lasted about 3 weeks so far.  I can't begin to tell you how much pain I was in before coming to Clearway.  Thank God I called Clearway for pain relief.  I have no  problem referring them as they definitely helped me.|Great visit as always. All of my questions were answered with thought and care. Options for my hip pain were explained and I was even able to get a shot at this visit. Great office all around. Thank You!|After receiving chemo for breast cancer, my second treatment with paclitaxel maybe after three to four treatments give or take. I began to have a numbness and tingling feeling in my hands and feet my team of doctors were all absolutely caring I was put on a few types of meds but this sensation just getting worse my Chemo doctor referred me to clearway pain solution December 17th 2024 was my first visit I'm very satisfied with my new doctor recommendations I'm more importantly I'm thankful that he has other alternatives besides narcotics. I have hope that my treatment will be successful and I would definitely recommend/refer someone who's going through neuropathy or any type of pain it can be managed.|Even though I was early, the staff got me in right away and Dr Bednarek saw me promptly, helped me with my issue and was a delight as always. The gentleman at the front desk is always so pleasant and should be commended for his efficiency and friendliness.|The front desk, nurse and doctor were professional and respectful.  I have had two appointments and both appointments started on time. I was not prepared for an on-time appointment. The doctor listened to me and explained on an easy to understand manner.|It's alot of great Doctors and Np's there
I missed Nia the real MVP . Np  Moses and Cater are great and Dr Charles Simmons was like a life saver on my first appointment  years ago. Just have to find the right person for you! Definitely had some ones that was not for me Gbmc parking is my biggest problem and they don't validate. The parking lot is always packed|Dr. Bednarek's steroid injection has greatly reduced my sciatica symptoms. He is the best.

Our Comprehensive Approach

Dr. Matsunaga takes time to listen attentively to each patient, explaining conditions thoroughly and creating individualized treatment plans. column40:
I just want to tell you how terrific Jordan is!!!  I recently had a change in my health insurance and it caused me to have to have all my prescriptions "pre-approved".  Jordan was wonderful in her  communication with me and my insurance company.  She communicated with me and gave me updates as to when the pharmacy was filling my prescriptions.  She was very thorough, friendly and just terrific throughout the process!  Thank you so much Jordan!|Dr. Matsunaga is an amazing pain management doctor. His expertise is evident in every consultation, and his compassionate approach makes all the difference. He takes the time to listen, understand, and create personalized treatment plans that truly work. His expertise and compassionate approach have transformed my quality of life. He listens attentively, offers clear explanations, and tailors effective treatment plans to individual needs. I highly recommend Dr. Matsunaga. All his staff are also kind and welcoming, this makes all the difference when you are navigating a chronic illness.|I have never been to a pain management clinic before coming here but I can only imagine this is the epitome of how pain management should be done.

I came here on referral after a spinal cord injury and surgery to fix it. They understand that there is no need to live in pain.

They focussed first on finding the causes of the pain and reffering me to options I never knew existed like in home occupational therapy and tests like EMGs to understand what my pain was, not just throw medicine at it.

Of course they give medicine but low and slow doses is the way its done and thats how it should be done. Both providers operate this way and are very compassionate. The whole office is great, kind and understanding.

I have never experienced such a professional clinic staff. They are very easy to contact if you ever have an issue and will go to great lengths to solve any issue even if it isn't their fault, like a pharmacy being out of stock.

I could keep going on and on about how great this office is of course but I want to emphasize that they truely care and if you are truely in pain they will give you all the tools you need to live a normal life again.

I have no idea why others complain in some of the reviews here... because I have only ecountered kind and professional people at this office... both providers and the staff.

A lot of people have ruined pain management in this country by abusing it. Doctors offices like these are put under the microscope by regulations because of the epidemic of painkiller abuse in this country. However, if you are in pain and you listen to the medical advise and at least give a good effort then Comprehensive Pain Center may be the best thing that has ever happened to get your life back.

I came in on a cane hardly able to do anything... and a few months later I was building legos and playing with my son and felt alive again. My journey isn't over with my medical issues but I now have all the tools I need to live a fulfiling life thanks to this great great team and office.|For over 2 years my nerves have been compressed in my neck and back causing extreme pain in my head, neck, and shoulders all the way down through my arms to my fingers. I was not getting any relief from any of the doctor's treatments until I met Dr. Mark.
Dr. Mark takes his time with you. he does many different tests to find the answers. he worked with me not wanting to take any opioids. He and his staff have helped me a great deal. I am doing so much better since I have been under his care|Dr. Matsunaga is amazing. He is so worth seeing that I travel nearly 1 hr to see him. His personality is so pleasant and he truly cares about me as an individual.|It is always a pleasure to come to the office of Dr Matsunaga. He is very accommodating and has a fantastic office-side manner. I always feel relaxed and comfortable in this office. The entire staff helps the visit, from entrance to exit go very smoothly! I highly recommend them if you are suffering from any type of pain.|I have been a patient of Dr Matsunaga for over a decade.  He is NOT a pill pusher, he cares about his patients and goes above and beyond to not just manage your pain but also tries to cure it. I have had extensive medical issues (19 surgeries, 2 cancers ect) and he and his staff are unbelievable. I wish my other Drs office were this kind & conscientious.
He wanted me to do some tests which my other Drs should have ordered but never did. Today I found out I have another rare illness bc of those tests.
Trust me. See this Dr, you will get better or you will at least have someone who actually cares about you ij your corner to help at least deal with the pain.   Wish I could give him more than 5 stars.|I've been a patient for over 5 years now and knock on wood. All of the staff are respectful, kindhearted. I know ppl aren't perfect and make mistakes but I can say I've never had any issues or problems with anyone that works there. They answer every time I call and respond quickly They listen to your needs and are very understanding and helpful. Not one of those places where they just write scripts and don't care about patients actual medical issues. They are very concerned. I live in Middle River  and they are in Columbia I will take that ride any day cause I know they have my best interest at heart!

column40:
Most of these five star reviews have to be paid bots. This place is very unprofessional, the owner himself need to loss his license and I will be reporting this guy to the medical board of medicine with my supporting documents. How could you tell someone that they drink to much water? How could you just play with someone pain and terminate their medical plan without giving them their last prescription until they find a new doctor? So if anything happens to my body since I was discharged I will be filing a lawsuit. If you are doing everything this Janak guy is telling you he does not care he still will unprovoked and with no explanation may I add when I asked what was the problem I was told that and I quote "THIS IS NOT A BIOLOGY LESSON". Which as you could imagine left me even more confused. I asked for my last few labs which came back almost identical. I add that because my last visit I was told by Dr. Daniel that my urinalysis was great. Also they send in urine samples multiple times a month when you are past your 90 days which I was told by the lady that work there that they are not suppose to do that. I will be asking for a printout of the treatment that I received so I can inform my insurance company of anything that I did not have done. Dr. Daniel Also gave me injection shots in my shoulder and in my neck and when I expressed to him on my next visit that the shots was not working anymore, like I felt the relief the first week but the second week I didn't feel a relief anymore, so I let him know my next visit that I didn't don't feel the effects of the injection. He must have forgot that he gave me the injections before he then say I wouldn't recommend you getting injections in your shoulder because the injections in your shoulder is not gonna be effective so why did you inject me in my shoulder if you know that this is not gonna be effective that's just some of the things that they do. I should've seeked a malpractice attorney right then and there. Who really want the hassle of having to find another facility. All in all I wish I could give Janak business a negative -5 stars very horrible and I forgot to add this guy pulled the I'm the boss there's no one higher then me card on me a (patient). You could have something in your urine with a 0.0? And Janak will penalize you for it. That's all if you guy experienced anything like this comment below and we I could point you in the right direction. This is my experience.|Waiting room is cold, the door barely shuts and the receptionist up front is just rude and lazy. The chairs in the back are horrible. When you go to sit down in them you fall into the chair like it's about to rip open. You can hear everything in the waiting area such as the doctor speaking with other patients. Checking out is horrible I left and was called back telling me they forgot to have me to fill out releases forms so I had to come back in. A trying to request a certain day out of the week due to my busy work schedule the receptionist sounded annoyed. She was going to let me leave again if I didn't mention anything about needed my referral for something else. After I mentioned it she handed me the paper but if I didn't say anything she would've let me leave again without everything. The doctor himself seems caring and nice but the staff up front is not friendly. I wasted almost two hours in there waiting for a 10 minute consult with a doctor.|I visited the office at national Baltimore Pike. They were friendly and very professional and The pain management Doctor was very experienced in his work/ was concerned about my feelings/pain. But the people who are answering the phone at the odenton offices not professional at all I kept calling for an appointment and they was giving me appointments for 2 months from the date that I called which I was already a patient and was in pain they didn't ask me that and was not concerned about what kind of pain I was in I asked to speak to a supervisor and they would never put her on the phone kept telling me she was in meetings she couldn't talk to me all in all the fact that I went to was very professional and handled me with care I want to thank that team at Baltimore national Pike|This place is a disaster. I came for severe lower back pain after weeks of suffering. It's been a month and I'm still in pain. The clerical staff is all about forcing me to come to the office unnecessarily to charge the insurance company and demand a $30 copayment. The doctor that runs the place is never there for a consultation and I'm seen by his young quack physician assistant (PA) flunkie who doesn't know squat. First injection to the back was a complete failure. Can't go back for another injection for a month.Save yourself the aggravation and undue suffering and find another doctor who has a real office(not a former storefront where everything can be heard in the waiting area( with real doctors and staff that isn't obsessively concerned with paperwork and copayments. This place is all about themselves not the patient.Avoid the nightmare.

Don't say you weren't warned!!|Daniel is veey caring and listens to what is going on with your body. He specializes with muscular and skeletor.  He tries to address the issues and  makes your pain more managable.|Dr. Daniel E. Talked over me, pushing me to have an injection I didn't want, and just about refused to consider keeping me on my meds.    He also dumped most of my husband's meds down the toilet, saying he would write a prescription for one medication and sent in a prescription for something else.|Very nice and spacious office, with friendly staff a physician that actually listens.|First vist was awesome! Dr E made me feel very at ease and immediately started working on a plan of action that best fits me!! Hopefully i made a good choice

column40:
I had a fantastic visit with Dr. Telles-Hernandez today. Not only was I seen on short notice, but he also took the time to explain things to me in a way that was easy to understand. Because pain differs based on root cause and the person experiencing it, I wouldn't expect to have perfect outcomes every time.  However, Dr. Telles-Hernandez was able to help me with lower back pain instantly, effectively and with such care that I hardly felt a thing!  I can't say enough about my experience and would recommend this practice to anyone who is unable to get pain relief using other modalities.|Amazing experience! Dr. Telles and his staff are welcoming, kind and knowledgeable. The team took their time to listening to my concerns, explain my options in details and answered all my questions. For the first time in months I am able to manage my pain in a way that I am comfortable with.

The office is clean and bright. The wait time from door, check-in to doctor has been less than 10 minutes each time I have been to the Greenbelt location.

Another feature I like is the office has an online communication portal with secure messages via text messaging.

Highly recommend!|A friend and I drove from out of state to see Dr.Telles for SGB (stellate ganglion block). The office was clean and the staff was so professional and kind.

Dr.Telles has the best bedside manner I have ever seen. I have been in the healthcare field for a long time and this man is a rare breed.

This procedure can be a very emotional experience for a patient and Dr.Telles was so kind and empathetic. He is not just a true professional, he is a good man.

I can not recommend Dr.Telles enough. If you are reading this, you may be looking for a provider to perform the stellate ganglion block.. look no further.|Amazing experience with Dr. Tellas. Explained everything in detail and made you feel more than comfortable. Quick 10-20 minute procedure with no pain at all. Highly recommended. Amazing staff. Thank you for everything. Look no further. Make the call|I went into Dr. Luis Telles office in so much pain that I had been dealing with for over twenty years! He did a sacral procedure on me and I got up feeling like a new woman. My mobility was very limited to the point I felt like I was an 90 year old woman. My lifestyle hand dwindle down to a little of nothing. I would recommend Dr. Telles to everyone I come into contact with that having  mobility and pain issues. Kudos Dr. Telles you are the best I have seen thus far! Be Bless Sir! The Staff is phenomenal and the office atmosphere is calming and so clean and the bathroom is to spotless and smell great!|I just went to see him for the first time today and he really took his time to listen and explaining my problems. And he is really knowledgeable of medicines and not just rush to get the injection or epidural.|I'm so happy I found Capitol Pain Center! Dr. Telles is very caring. He listened to my problems with my hips and sciatic nerve pain along with fibromyalgia. Dr. Telles has treated me and I am in such a better place in just month! I am more mobile with less pain! I highly recommended Dr. Telles and staff! The staff is so nice and caring, I'm very grateful! Thank you Capitol Pain Center!|Dear viewer, Are you looking for a true professional pain management doctor??? Have you ever been let down before with none effective methods & treatments??

At Maryland Pain and Spine Center, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Hugo Torres and Dr. Vajira Gunawardane. Our practice is dedicated to providing personalized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Dr. Torres, who is bilingual in English and Spanish, brings exceptional expertise to our diverse patient population. Located in Fulton, Maryland, our state-of-the-art facility offers advanced interventional procedures including cervical facet blocks, ablations, and specialized treatments for back pain.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Chronic pain management

  • Headache and migraine treatment

  • Personalized treatment plans

We pride ourselves on our patient-centered approach, taking time to listen to each individual's concerns and developing customized treatment strategies. Our professional team works collaboratively to ensure every patient receives the highest standard of care in a comfortable, supportive environment. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at Maryland Pain and Spine Center or call us at +1 301-490-6085. column40:
I cannot say enough great things about Dr. Hugo Torres, Angela Drewniak, and the staff at the Maryland Pain and Spine Center.  I have been seeing Dr. Torres for many years, and he has significantly helped me with my back pain.  Dr. Torres is amazing and really cares about his patients. I completely trust his skills and his guidance.  I recently saw Angela and she suggested we try a different procedure, and it was a great decision.  She is very knowledgeable, caring, and listened to me.  The office staff are very helpful as well.  I also love my "dream team" of Fred and Dave at the surgery center.  When I see their faces upon arrival, I know I will be in great hands.|Headaches are gone!
Dr. Ginawardane, Trish, Dave, Fred and the entire staff were friendly, caring and professional.  I had a cervical facet block (R/L sides) on neck and it completely alleviated the pain I've had for 2 years.
I had neck surgery 13 years ago and started to get pain that would limit my mobility but mostly horrible and constant headaches.
The procedure has eliminated the headaches and the pain.
Highly recommend|I love Angela. She is extremely knowledgeable, patient and kind. She listens intently and understands as a result thereof. I am so hopeful about improvement. It's ALWAYS a pleasant experience. The receptionist has been at this office long but I love her. She's so helpful and patient. I'm VERY pleased with the service from start to finish! I highly recommend this office. Dr Gunawardane is also great at what he does. Every procedure has helped me receive as much relief as it could. I'm extremely pleased.|Dr. Torres has always been very polite, understanding and sympathetic. I put my trust in his ability to make my injuries manageable on a daily basis. Thank you Dr. Torres for being a great doctor!|I love the doctors at this practice. They are very honest. And care deeply for their patients. I have seen both nurse practitioners. For people who sit and listen to peoples problems, they are very cheerful. They are very intelligent and focused on getting me the best treatment. Also very Thorough on exams and order the proper tests. I like that they put my safety first. Dr Torres doesn't just throw pills at me. There is many interventions you can try. But if you do have a Substantiated problem they will help you develop a care plan tailored your needs. Since they have their own surgery center, most interventions and injections are done there. But if you are seeking to manipulate a certain outcome it won't happen here unless it is in your own best interest.|Dr G and his staff have been incredibly helpful and pleasant throughout the past 10 years of my treatments there. They have treated my neck and back pain with procedures that have been simple for me to follow and recover from. My downtime prior to procedures was excruciating and debilitating pain while just hours after treatments I could move and get around pain free. Dr G and his staff have earned my complete confidence.|Dr. G is the best!  I have had an ablation in the lumber spine which has been very successful.  Recently did a great job in my cervical section.|Was my first consultation Dr Torres who was patient and empathetic.  The staff members was courteous and professional.

column40:
I love Innovative Solutions. Dr Oppong is well respected and professional and knowledgeable and really takes the time to listen and explain the process of making you feel comfortable and confident in your own abilities and working with you to make sure you have everything you need to succeed. And his office manager Brittany have proven time and time again that they are very good and making sure you understand that you matter|Heeeyyyyyyy Y'all. Okay now, you might want to take a seat for this one. It may get a bit lengthy, but Trust and Believe, it's all worth it! I've been a patient with IPS for many many years. When I first visited this office, I was quite uncertain if I was going to stay. Only because having to become acclimated to new Drs, staff..etc can be a bit Overwhelming at times. Needless to say, through the years, other than having to pry myself out of my warm and cozy bed, I NOW look forward to going into the office. Dr. Oppong...well let me just say, he grew on me. He was always pleasant and patient. It was just me that had to get adjusted. He listens to what you have to say and exhibits genuine concern. Okay on to the good part. :-)
The real reason for this post is to Brag on my Girl Brittany-Office Manager. She is PHENOMENAL, to say the least. If she isn't in the office, please just let me reschedule and stay at home. Brittany is the Absolute Best young lady that Dr. Oppong has EVER had on his team!! If you haven't had the opportunity to be cared for by her, you have truly Missed out!! Brittany is so caring, pleasant, loving, warm and kind-hearted, respectful, understanding, cheerful. compassionate, knowledgeable, personable....she is INNOVATIVE!! In conclusion, if you haven't had the pleasure of meeting and interacting with Brittany, you need to call RIGHT NOW...YES RIGHT NOW and schedule an appointment. She will make you forget about the reason you came to INNOVATIVE PAIN SOLUTIONS, you'll forget about your pain, even if only momentarily.
PS....tell them Steph referred you!!|From the time you call for an appointment until you've received excellent care; it's a wonderful experience. Staff is empowered to provide real "care" and so is Dr. Oppong. I've recommended him to everyone I know and love, including my son, who is always impressed by the outstanding care he receives.|Dr. Oppong is awesome. Excellent doctor with kind bedside manner. Very thorough. Asks good questions and answers all my questions.  Very nice and clean office with friendly professional staff. I will go back for any pain needs and definitely refer my friends.|Dr.Oppong is an awesome and caring Doctor. His bedside manner is unmatched. He is very knowledgeable and takes the time to listen to his patients. All staff members in the Office are great!!! They are very kind and treat all patients with great care.|I've been going here for about a year now and the front desk ladies are great. Always greet you with a smile and treat you like a friend. I see Dr. Forsythe and she's a great doc. Very easy to talk to and really cares about the issues you may be having related to pain management. Definitely would suggest this place as a must. This has been one of the only places that I've felt at home and not feel judged or treated badly. I've been to quite a few places in my life.|Dr. Oppong is the best! He takes time to get to know you as a person as well as a patient and explains anything in details a child can understand. The office is super clean and the staff is very professional and easy to talk to. In a nutshell this is superior pain management!|Who ever finds Dr. Joseph Oppong office will be treated like family. column38: Tammey Knight|Theresa Martirosyan|Julie Marie Owens Evans|Brian Joseph|Steven Smith|Rachel|Donna Gill|Kimberly "Kiki"
column40:
My first appointment was a very good experience at Clearway, I didn't wait in the waiting room long enough to warm my seat.  After the nurse was done doing her question and vitals on me, I may have waited for 20 minutes for the doctor.  The doctor I seen was very polite and explained things to me very well and understandable.  He answered my questions and even asked if there was anything else he could help me with. The office was clean and organized. The office staff was very nice and all spoke to me and said to have a nice day.   I'm glad I chose Clearway as my new pain management, they made my transition very smooth and painless! so far a great practice.  Thank you all!|The staff is always friendly and welcoming. Dr dodzi is amazing.  She really cares about her patients and listens to their concerns. Always gives her professional best.|The staff, including those at the front desk, nurses, physician assistants and doctors, are all very pleasant, and there is virtually no wait time, in either the waiting room or examination room. I really appreciate how organized and friendly the staff are. Thank You for running a topnotch office!!|Clearway's checkin website isn't possible to work with. I checked in four times and each time it crashed. Upon arrived at the appointment with Dr. Benjamin He seemed to review my previous medication's and history but apparently not, for he prescribed the same failed medication that my PCP prescribed two weeks earlier.
After the appointment, I asked them to send me an email so I could access their portal. They never sent it. The telephone number they gave me was for an answering service who could not connect me.  I will not be using them again.|First of all you sent this link to my email but to my son Steven Smith who is not a patient at Clearway or any other pain clinics. So I'm answering this email instead of Steven Smith. My visit was fine but the link you sent me expired before I could get to my email. We have been having some difficulty with logging into and retrieving our e-mail. I do need another link so i can pull up my test results. Thank you, Bonnie Smith.|Very disappointed. Person on the phone was nice but I wanted to know if they treated my specific condition--she told me the only way I could find that out was by making an appointment with them and talking to the doctor.

I shouldn't have to do that. I'm not asking for a consultation, I'm asking if they treated my specific condition, which should be a yes or no answer.

Instead, they want me to spend money just to find out. No other pain management place has made me do that, and it tells me their main focus is money|They are all wonderful caring cheerful brilliant hard-working people.  Upstairs and downstairs. Thank you to Dr. Ruth and his entire team of professionals|New to the area, Clearway was highly recommended due to my unique situation- I have, head to toe, health issues, including, but not limited to, Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, Fibromyalgia, Degenerative Disc Disease, Pinched nerves, Psoriasis, Osteoarthritis, Psoriatic Arthritis, IBS, Reynaud's Syndrome, Sjorgen's Syndrome, Bunyons, Very fast Rx metabolizer, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, HIGH BP, etc.
I was assigned the most popular physician in the practice, and was hopeful that I might finally get some answers and have moments where I was not in terrible pain. The doctor decided to focus on the degenerative this disease in my neck and the pinched nerves, referring me to physical therapy. my condition was far too advanced for PT to be successful, so I was fired actor three sessions. The physician then decided to do one Cortizone shot in my neck. When that didn't work, I didn't hear from them anymore. What about the glaringly long list of painfully debilitating and incurable health conditions that I'm dealing with every day? I was so upset, couldn't understand why a doctor that everybody really liked had chosen not to help me.

column38: David Lively|Sharon Boyer|Caitlin Chajkowski|John D'Ambrosio|Gregory Jones Sr|Della Nickless|Jerri Senay|Charles Shilling
column40:
On the day of my first appointment I searched for directions on Apple Maps which took me to a completely different location. After making phone calls and finally getting the right location I arrived 5 minutes prior to my appointment. Once I finally spoke with someone at the desk approximately 5 min past my appointment time I was told that it would need to be rescheduled due to the nurse practitioner have strict policies about being on time. Had this company updated an app that most people use this would not have been an issue. Do better.|I went in for an EEG. The office staff was super friendly. I received an email prior to my appointments to register so I only had a few papers to sign. The doctor explained the tests I was going to have and let me know exactly what she was doing the entire time time. She discussed the findings with me and referred me back to my neurologist for further care.|I unfortunately am suffering from a disc bulge and was given a referral to this office to begin my healing journey. I've never had to deal with anything like this before and did not understand what pain management was or if it was the right direction to go. So initially they gave me a referral for PT and submitted a request for an MRI.

Insurance denied the MRI, wanting a specific amount of PT before approval. So I returned for what I assumed was a PT appointment, to be told it was actually a follow up for the MRI that was denied. Strike one.

Finally get PT scheduled and an MRI done where the disc bulge was found. Scheduled for a epidural steroid injection where I was made to wait over an hour to be called back for a 20 minute procedure. Strike 1.5?

Had a post procedure follow up where I advised the clinician that I experienced severe and painful diarrhea and wanted to know if there were other options or something that could be done differently to avoid as I was doubled over in pain for 12+ hours.

Clinician became visibly defensive, saying surgery changes your bone structure permanently and that they had never in their years in the medical field had that happen to anyone (making me feel like a liar). Then reversing course and saying it could have been a few things that caused it.

When I again asked for other options, clinician was again defensive, but then seemingly to just get rid of me told me that they would give me a referral to a surgeon despite that not even being what I asked for. Strike two.

I decided to schedule a second injection, but this time without sedation to hopefully mitigate the side effects as that was thought to have been the cause.

Fast forward to today, my appointment is approaching and I have to take either PTO or make up time missed. The surgery center calls to move me up as they had a cancellation. I advise that I cannot make that work in my schedule. Despite this, they ask what the earliest is that I can come in, and I again repeat that I cannot come in any earlier. We end the call and I assume my time is still fine.

An hour later, I get an email that my appointment has been moved up without my consent. Strike three, though I know this isn't the same office.

I'm removing myself from their practice and don't feel comfortable returning. Please treat your patients better. I can understand if you have difficult patients wearing you thin, but I was just asking questions and trying to avoid the discomfort of the side effects that I presented with.|Didn't take me as a patient cause i was discharged from another pain management, wouldn't listen to me, treated me, you know a certain way and had the gall to bill my insurance over $600 and sent me a bill for $ 140 ! Good luck with that ! This is a pure racket !!! They don't care, NO EMPATHY!!!!!!! Calling my insurance to tell them not to pay for basically being judged as a drug addict with stage 4 cancer 2 knee replacements that are worn out and throbbing and neuropathy so bad in my feet I can't even feel him always tingling burning, worst place I've ever been to plus it was cold as heck outside they couldn't even run the heat. I don't know what the hell is wrong with them but what a racket and the office manager she's no better. She came into the room too. I'm not done with them, though. This is just a review!|After calling their 833 number and working through the call director, I finally got connected to new patient services. It was extremely difficult to understand the representative due to their limited English capability. After providing preliminary information, they had to go off the line to apparently consult with someone. He came back on the line and got a little more information and off he went again. He then came back and said that I couldn't get an EMG scheduled unless I got discharged from my current pain management provider. Any consideration I had of switching to them has now gone out the window with such poor representatives. When I questioned he why I had to be discharged from my current provider to have an EMG done, off he went for a couple more minutes. He came back on the line to tell me that he could continue adding me to the system. He asked for address which was provided and he said that he had to put it into the system, and off he went again! After he came back I told him that I had more than one insurance plan and, you guessed it, off he went again, and I'm back to the awful techno music on hold. He apparently comes back again because the techno music stops and the next thing I know is that I have been disconnected.
If this is the way that they train their administrative staff, I want nothing to do with them since they obviously have no quality control or concern about the impression they are giving to potential new patients. There aren't a lot of pain management choices in this area, but anything is going to be far better than dealing with this practice.  Forewarned is forearmed!

12-03-2024 - As a further warning, just look at their response. The issue is about the poor customer service provided through their phone provider, and their response is to call their obviously poor phone service provider again to address the issue!|Dr. Medic is very friendly and takes the time to really listen. She explained the process and procedures very thoroughly and made sure I understood the pros and cons. Her staff is friendly from the check in to checking out. I definitely will recommend|Dr Medic truly cares and wants the best for her patients. She listens carefully to make sure the plan for you fits and helps.|Nate was over booked on the day i waited for him.  There was enough clients in the waiting room to make a Tarzan Movie.
I will follow Nate's suggestion to pick a different arrival time for my next appointment.  Nate was, as always, both informative and very pleasant to work with.
Thank You!
C. Shilling

column38: Raptor Adventures|robert spring|Tonie Dorsch|Joe Marsit|Katie White|Joe|A GilldersleeveNaill|Renee Tipton
column40:
Horrible experience! I didn't know what to expect when I made the appointment but I did hope that it would provide some relief for my excruciating back pain. After waiting for about an hour the Dr came in and told me to go get 2 MRI's if my insurance would cover them. He never even palpated my back to see how in spasm it was. My insurance ended up not covering any of the bill so here I am $500 in debt to this place that did nothing but add to my stress! Go elsewhere if you  would like a proper exam.|I've gone here in the past for quite a while. I returned after several years. They now have a new PA and she is miserable. I'm 62 years old and it was the WORST appointment of my entire life. No exaggeration. I asked if they had another PA I could see, but, they do not. I had to repeat several times what I had x-rays of, the doctors I had seen, and what I had MRIs of. She wouldn't provide any options because I didn't have MRIs done yet (understand what I'm saying?). She wanted to treat the one worst pain I was having. With psoriatic arthritis, the pain moves constantly. I finally told her my hip. She asked me 3 different times if I would consider shots. Of course I would. She said she was going to get an x-ray of my hip. I asked about an MRI, too. She said no. An MRI detects soft tissue damage. The bursa is soft tissue. I asked if I should get an x-ray of my neck, also, since I don't have that. She said no. Why would she not take that since an accident caused damage to it over 30 years ago and that may be what the main pain is on the next visit? She wouldn't provide opiods because she needed MRIs first...hmmmm. If she was worried about me being an opiod dependent person, why did I stop going (on my own) several years ago? It was a disastrous appointment. It wasn't a waste because I discovered that I needed to find another pain management clinic. WARNING! Since I had seen another clinic, now I have to get a letter of discharge from this clinic because they think you're doctor shopping. Well, I am, because their nursing assistant is a potential tragedy to your health and pain relief.|I have been a patient at this wonderful Facility for well over 10 years.  They are simply fantastic!  I'm so very grateful for their impeccable workmanship & knowledge, very friendly & caring staff. Most of all, the Nurse Practitioner I have had the honor of being treated by, is dedicated to superlative superior performance & treatment.  Thank you so very much MD Pain & Spine!  You keep my body going with the pain management plan you have in place for me.  I honestly don't know what I would do without you!|Dr G is amazing, I experienced relief immediately. My pain went from 8 to 3 or 4 during the procedure.
I haven't slept in 3 days the pain has gotten so bad, the rain all weekend didn't help. Dr G has done 7 procedures over 15 years. He's been a miracle worker for me.
I strongly recommend him to anyone having serious back pain.|Let me start by saying that the front desk staff are really nice and my care from Dr. G. has been excellent. This review is specific to my experience this morning. Historically, I've spent HOURS waiting in the waiting room for appointment times in the past (each time, having to take vacation time off of work). I have never once complained because I've been happy with the care received and Dr. G's thoroughness. He really does care for his patients. This morning, I got stuck in some construction traffic on the way to my appointment and walked into the office 8 minutes after my appointment time and the nurse practioner refused to see me. Again, I took time off of work for this appointment. Considering I was a few minutes late due to circumstances beyond my control, and I typically wait on average for 30 minutes plus (to sometimes hours after my appointment  times) in the past, I was absolutely shocked that I was turned away. Life happens, please re-evaluate your policies and be transparent about them. It seems like patients just have to deal with waiting for hours on end, but when life happens and I was less than 10 minutes late, I would have thought that the practice would have extended me a little grace like I have done numerous times for them in the past, without so much as a
complaint.|Kudos to those who find this Dr. G helpful! I did not! Waiting for two long hours to be seeing and no apologies. Violation my patient's rights by bringing an intern with him into the session without asking for my consent, and treating me like I'm a charity patient is not what I consider quality customer service! I'm both a patient and a customer. He and his staff charge a lot money to my medical insurance and I pay for it. The least I expect is respect and good medical care. Dr. G did not provide either to me.|I had a very positive experience with Md pain. They were both friendly, professional and thorough.  Positive first visit!

Oct. 5, 2022. I'm still a patient with MD pain and spine, very happily so. The front office is always pleasant and quick to help or answer questions. My doctor is over the top thorough, compassionate and attentive. Honestly. I've not had an issue since I started there. Very satisfied with my experience so far.

April 17, 2023.  Still loving to go to my appointments at MD  Pain and Spine. All the office people r still helpful and pleasant whenever I go in, and my doctor is still the very best. Recently tho, I had the occasion to have a different doctor for my regular appointment while mine was on vacation. As it turns out, she was also  kind and knowledgeable during my visit. I was happy to experience the same type of professional behavior from another doctor at the practice as what I've seen so far with the other members of this office. Thanks everyone at MD Pain and Spine for always making my appointments comfortable and pleasant!! Keep up the great work!

This is now July, 2023. Guess what!  I'm still just as happy as ever with MD Pain and Spine. I have very good experiences with everyone there, no matter whether it's by phone or in person. I know I always say the same thing, but it's entirely true. Believe me, I'm the first to complain when I feel something isn't right or if I or my family has not been treated well. This office has never been anything but first class and professional with me. I appreciate that so very much.

February 21, 2024.  What can I say? Still always my favorite office to visit. I appreciate their professionalism for the reason I'm there; but, also the whole offices' social friendliness as well. Thanks for both. See u next month!

August 19, 2024.    I'm still content using MD Pain and Spine. The doctors, as well as the office personnel, are always helpful and professional, while being as friendly as a long-known neighbor. I remain very happy with this medical practice, and would be comfortable recommending them to anyone.|Wonderful place!!!
Dr. Gunawardane and Staff are caring, helpful and understanding.
I'm so glad to finally be getting help with my chronic pain.

column40:
I went in for a scheduled appointment fully expecting to get a shot to ease nerve pain caused by a bulging disc. After explaining how & why my pain was significantly lessened. I was told I didn't need a shot. That PT would be my best course of action.
Understanding that was money Clearway isn't getting from my insurance & knowing the physician could have told me it was still in my best interest to get the shot (and I would have); I greatly appreciated the honesty & integrity of the physician.

Thank you, Jeanette for your honesty & integrity! I would definitely recommend Clearway Pain Solutions in Waldorf MD!|Communication starts with the initial call,  I say this because I was very clear that we were looking for a doctor that deals with Fibromyalgia and chronic pain.  I was told AND it is in the description on our Insurance website, that they do.  My daughter suffers with the above stated chronic conditions and has aged out of the pain clinic at Children's Hospital.  We were searching for new doctors and made an appointment, only to be told by Dr.A that he works with spinal issues.  Not sure where the breakdown in communication happened, but it was a waste of time for all involved.

The front desk staff was very nice and Dr.A was also kind.|My visits are always good. Dr Shah has always been easy to talk with. And we go over a plan each time.
If something isn't how it should be I talk to her about it. But I've never had any problems.
I did although not get the Diclofinac atypical get we went over today, other than thst no problems at all|Coming to the Waldorf Pain Center location is always a pleasant medical experience. The front desk staff and medical technicians are very welcoming. Dr. Shah is a person who gets to know her patients by listening, asking what questions or concerns that you might have as well as working with you to provide the best health care for you. Thank you so much!|I was disappointed about the wait time, there was one patient in the lobby with me. I arrived 5 minutes late but had to wait 45 minutes before they took my BP, then I had to wait another 20 mins before the doctor came . Then she spent 3 minutes wrote a prescription and said comeback in 30 days. Unacceptable could done webinar or online virtual appointment.|I have been a patient of Clearway Pain Management, for a number of years. The staff, are friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient. They have offices in all 3 counties.

What I don't like about them. You can't call the office, to speak with the staff, or ask questions. Everything is fed through a call center. You don't speak to the same person, so if something isn't handled correctly, you either have to sit with your fingers crossed, it gets done, or go down to the closest office, and ask for assistance. That's not the best solution either. I would prefer that when I speak with someone, that somewhere there's accountability, when you are continuing to wait, while someone, somewhere, that has no vested interest in you, is telling you, they will take care if it. I am now 7 days later, still waiting for  a prescription, that didn't go through the electronic system, to the pharmacist.

So, if your okay, with that kind of attention, then by all means, this is the doctor's office for you!|Generally the service is as expected. Most of the staff are friendly. Lately, there have been numerous instances where nobody shows up to open the office and check folks in. Also, (and it might be related to the time it takes for people to check in), but one Dr or PA sometimes arrives to the office 45 mins or longer after the office opens. One day I was seen an hour and a half after I got into the room. I usually always have an 810am appt time.
Part 2 of this review: the surgical side is S L O W!!! Appointments don't matter unless its first thing in the morning. I live an hour away. Last time I came in for my appointment I was told they were at least 2 hours behind - so I was rescheduled. Came in for that visit - again, at least 2 hours behind. My driver has now taken 2 afternoons of time off from work. The office may not care, but we can use every dollar we can make. Again, I'm seeing a trend that is going to force me to find a different provider. The bottom line is Respect. I respect the doctor's and staff's time, i respect being on time so as not to inconvenience other patients. These doctors and techs do not respect our time. I cannot abide by that.|Outstanding, caring of your needs, communicates timely with documentation needed for workers comp. Can't sat enough great things! My doctors are awesome as well!

column38: Mz estep|Mellar Smith|Judy Boeri|Jessica Moore|Connie Bowen|Cat Y|Bernie Bean|john papier
column40:
Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Always attentive to my needs and excellent bedside manner. Amy Larson and Dr. Medic have always been great listeners as well as paying attention to what they prescribe and making sure that my needs come first.  Have been a patient since 2013 and regardless if they are booked up, the staff will always find a way to fit me in.  Thanks so much to each and everyone of you that I have had the pleasure of talking to.  On another note, they also will make sure that any of my medications do not interact with another that are prescribed from other doctors.  Great team, from the front desk, medical assistant and doctors.  I would recommend anyone to Clearway.|I always seem to get disrespected.  My husband has been coming here longer so I suppose he gets the better treatment. I was 10 minutes late and my appointment was rescheduled.  He was over 20 minutes late and they took him.  They always seem to have an attitude with me and rarely speaks but I don't know them as well and one of the nurses seem to be the flirty type.  It could just be her mannerisms she has dark hair short cut and she wears glasses.  I could be crazy but that's how it seems. When I walk in they only speak to him and ask him how he's feeling.  It makes me feel uncomfortable. I like people that are genuine especially caregivers and doctors they seem so fake however I did just switch to another Dr he seems to be much better at explaining himself and showing more interest in what's going on with your health.|Can't say enough wonderful things about our visit with Nathan Turner at Clearway Pain in Prince Frederick, MD. He always listens, and spends all the time needed to help solve our difficult problems. He's a caring, knowledgeable, compassionate person who somehow makes us feel that there is a light at the end of our long tunnel. He goes above and beyond looking for medical solutions in caring for us. The staff is excellent. Always helpful, and very friendly. We recommend them highly.|I'd like to give Dr. Medic (yes that's her real name!) five stars. She is great, she listens, she keeps me informed. But the office staff is rude, defensive, and not at all helpful. They never followed up with me when my treatment arrived (or didn't arrive) I was just sitting out here for months in pain not knowing if or when I was going to be treated. Then I got new insurance, so I needed a new appointment to start the approval process over again. The front desk told me they couldn't take my card because the system was down. I asked if she could make a photo copy of it to enter the info when the system came back up and she said no, it has to go into the special scanner. I asked if I could enter it myself through the patient portal and she told me I could. I tried, but there was no way to update it in the portal. I emailed the office and the same girl called me and got defensive, picking apart the words I used in my message and telling me the only way they can take my card is if I bring it back to the office. Obviously not what she told me while I was there, and certainly nothing I've ever heard of with any other practice I have ever used. Most allow me to enter the info manually, or take a picture of the front and back of my card. But the office attendant held firm that I would have to come back to the office and present my insurance card before they can start the process of getting my treatment approved. Anyone who deals with chronic pain knows how hard it is to leave the house at all, let alone drive 30 minutes away because the office has no workaround for when the system fails.

In conclusion, Dr Medic is great, but be prepared for some attitude and inconvenience from the rest of the office.|The whole staff  is absolutely wonderful. Nathan is great at his profession. He is understanding and knowledgeable in condition that causes me terrible pain. All of the ladies that work there are so very kind and friendly.|Zero stars. I was asked to show up 40 minutes early for my appointment. I did. I respect peoples time and understand paperwork can take a minute and being early helps them keep to their schedule. But, waiting over 45 minutes past my appointment time and being told the Dr. will still be a while is unacceptable so I left.  Can we stop normalizing 1 hour wait times for Dr's appointments, it's obscene. I would appreciate my time being valued as much as we are expected to value theirs. The waiting room was interesting as I watched a gentleman berate the receptionist for no reason, cheers to her for handling it like a rockstar!|My apprehension with a first visit was unfounded.  This is one of the first times that the previsit registration  info was used and i didn't have to redo paperwork.   The staff from check-in to triage and treatment were thorough, had an efficient process and were completely professional.  I am confident my treatment plan will be thorough and inclusive.|My wife made an appointment at this place in Prince Frederick. They overbooked the patients. The waiting room is filled to overflowing. After waiting a half hour she inquired about how much longer. They said four more patients in front of her and it will be approximately one more hour. we talked to one of the other patients in the room and they said that they regularly do this.

column38: Marianne Camino|Debra s|Michael Risinger|Rhonda Jarrett|Toyshika Bongiovano|Martha Drinks|Erlinda Plyku|Puddin S
column40:
I had a prior experience where I was left dissatisfied with the initial service where the wait time was unacceptable. However, since then, the practice has made sure to provide the best care and service possible. Including check in prior to an appt to make sure I wanted to see the same provider. Dr. Hameed has been a lifesaver. The medial branch block she administered to my herniated disc has become non existent. I only trust her hand moving forward with any procedures. Definitely recommended. The earlier appointment the better if possible.|Excellent caring doctor who listens carefully. She answers all my questions and really cares that my pain is well managed. I have cancer in my bones which is difficult to get under control.  She has no problem mixing pain medication to find something that works for me.|Dr Hameed is great. Got 2 injections in knees and she explained every detail to me. Highly recommend.|Dr. Hameed is wonderful. She listens and is very responsive to my concerns and my pain.! She is constantly upgrading my care as she becomes more familiar with my issues.|This review will be broken down in two parts. 1. I see Dr. Alex Bury. He is by far amazing, compassionate, understanding and truly cares for your well being. Getting an appointment is easy, I see him in the Laurel office. The wait is never long.

Now,  if I could rate just the doctor he would receive 5 stars without a question. Now for the one star rating and how I arrived here. I see Dr. Bury for pain medication and other medication to help with my neck pain. Then, I have to schedule my neck injections every 6 months.

You can't call the office you visit because it's a 800 number with the promise of a callback. You can't send a portal message to get answers. Twice now I have had a procedure cancelled on me without notice. Both times, it's because someone didn't submit the info to the insurance for the pre-approval. I carry two insurance plans, one that will approve the same day the secondary authorization will be automatically approved based on the primary.

Twice now, someone dropped the ball and didn't submit the pre-auth. I called my insurance Wednesday, Thursday and Friday with them saying nobody filed anything. My case worker can get any pre-authorization approved within minutes.

Now, I have been in pain for one month. Now, the next appointment for a ten minute procedure is a month away! I have to wait one month! That's two months of pain! Unreal.

I really didn't want to leave Dr. Bury, but having to be in pain for two months is not good for the quality of my life. They refuse to have more procedure days.

Update: 1. I was promised a return call on Monday within the hour. No call has occurred and now it's Wednesday! 2. The response below said this was resolved. My doctor confirmed on Tuesday the office can't figure out my primary and secondary insurance which is crazy given it's the same insurance I use for every visit and procedure. 3. I sent the email listed below with an auto reply stated that I would get a response within 48 hours after sending it. We are beyond that timeline.

To make it worse, I have no date for any procedure. My insurance has stated nothing is pending for approval.

This is ridiculous. All over a 10 minute procedure that I should have been accommodated for.

Sept 30th Update: Spoke to my insurance company today over at the Pre-Auth Dept. Found out today that Aetna DOES NOT REQUIRE A PRE-AUTH for this procedure which makes this really bad. My procedure that was canceled didn't require any authorization! Nobody has called me despite the feedback here. No return email. Radio silence. The procedure appointment they said they would schedule didn't happen.

So my advice to new patients. If you don't require procedures or injections you'll be fine going here. Dr. Alex Bury is the best! But, if you require more than the normal stay away.|Dr Hameed is the absolute best!!!
I travel from Connecticut to Maryland just to have her treat me!   She performed the MILD procedure on my back. To relieve my pain from spinal stenosis and bulging disc which was pushing on my sciatic nerve. It's been 2 months and I have my life back!!!!  I am so grateful and thankful that she was able to perform this non invasive procedure!!!
Thank you so much Dr Hameed!!!|Update:
Dr. Hameed is really good and caring but I had to wait for her more than 50 mins, that made me very sad: if the patient is late 10 mins usually you miss the appointment but when it comes to the doctor you have to wait.. I have nothing to say about her kindness and professionalism but that waiting time...
Physiotherapist Jonathan is number 1, thank you for all you have done!

column40:
I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Jesse Lou. I have been dealing with chronic bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome and cervical spondylosis for years. I had my first appointment with him today and I cried because it's the first time I felt heard and understood. He has a very warm, kind personality and his (polite) no-nonsense way of breaking things down was like an anxiety cramp letting go. I am so excited to start his treatment plan and begin to live a normal life again. I am so very grateful.|I was very pleased on my first visit , the nurse was very kind and professional. My doctor was very knowledgeable , he had all my records from my other doctors. He was completely aware of my history and he explained in detail his plan of treatment for me , the doctor explained every detail of the procedure and he also did a exam on my back.,legs and my hands.The doctor explained in detail regarding my medication that he was prescribing for me. Was very satisfied with the doctor and staff, even the nurse who brought me the back brace, she showed me how to put the brace on. Again she was wonderful. Again my doctor was very was very helpful and he knows his medical trade very well.
I was very satisfied with every one and especially the doctor.|I just got another epidural from Dr. Rodriguez. I am awake for the procedure. I have had nine. Five in my neck. Four in my lowerback. This is how it goes everytime. He guides me through it. Everything he says is alwayson point. A little pinch for the anesthetic. It's an acid it's supposed to burn . Which it doesn't. Yes, he is that good. Then he puts the a big needle in. Which I never feel. The next thing I feel is just one little sharp pain. Then when has got it in the right spot. I am supposed to feel some pressure. Which I never do. I come out wondering. Did I really just get a needle in my spine? He has truly mastered his craft. I have a phobia of needles. I never thought I could be confident getting a needle in my spine. But do to his professionalism and mastery of his craft. I don't mind getting epidurals. I actually look forward to them. When I missed my appointment do to car troubles. Dr. Yu was willing to give me one on his time. I also see Dr. Yolanda for treatment. Thank you Dr. Yolanda for all your guidance. All the physicians here are nothing short of phenomenal. I understand my body better and my injuries only because of them. They take the time to explain it in lamens terms. So I can understand. I wasn't getting the right treatment, medication, or injections untiI i saw Dr. Marrero.  I cannot thank you all enough. I wish google would let me write more than one review. I have so many good thing to say about this office. From the amazing staff.To the wonderful nurses. Thank you so much for everything you're doing, and everything you have done for me. Until the next appointment.|Dr. Lou is a very good  doctor who me great help during the visit.  He explained my situation very clearly and also gave me excellent advice on the matter.  Thank you very much for your kind assistance in this matter.|I don't really care for to many doctors.Dr.Rodriguz and his staff are top shelf.The office is very welcoming and Dr.Rodriguez is fantastic,he listens and explains and also does not rush through the appointment.Is very clear and answers questions.I really feel for the first time in a long time,I'm actually going to get some help.|Attentive staff, no matter that i end up waiting sometime. The treatment, and doctor tried to keep me comfortable during the procedure, which i appreciated|Dr.Lou was the kindest doctor I have ever been to. He was kind, patient and took the time to answer any and all questions that I had.|Doctor Daniel Rodriguez was extremely rude and unprofessional. U waited 3 hours and seen 5 patient taken back when I was first patient there. I had to ask the assistant to help with a referral several times after doctor was unwilling to provide Trigger pint Injections as my previous doctors have. He's a joke and he eyed me up and down the while ten minutes I was with him. Ps I was wearing baggy sweatpants and a long-sleeved hoodie and did not stop crying from the point I was in the waiting room being disregarded until I got home. He's very unsympathetic and I it reported him to better business bureau as well as the fda. Bc I'm disabled I was totally shocked his level if immaturity and unwillingness to put the care of his patients first. I have been to different locations and they were not as had at the one on Ovservation dr. If you go here, I warn you- He's a quack.
