column40:
I have been coming here for 3 years seeing DR Mata.  DR Mata left the practice.  I was scheduled to see Janet the NP.  Now I see why she not a doctor.  She is a terrible person.  She uses her conservative views into the medical world.  I sign a contact a year ago. I discharged myself and came back for management.  This terrible Nurse P discharged me for legal substance.  Anyone coming to All Star please don't not see this terrible person who will use her personal believes in the medical field.  She actually needs to be hired.  She needs to look herself in morning because she is a terrible Nurse.  She perfers you to be in pain, she feels like she knows best and she not even a doctor.|Awesome experience all around.  I have been a patient here for a number of years, and the care team's compassion and follow-through has been amazing.  The providers have worked with me to manage various stages of pain, and spine/nerve injury providing lots of options, and creating a care plan to keep me in relative comfort.  The support staff are fantastic at making sure you can get the appointments you need, remind you of them, and work to coordinate consults and procedures. Their staff have also worked with both my insurance, and pharmacy when there were issues obtaining various medications and procedures. I would absolutely recommend (and have recommended) this practice to anyone in need of their specialties.|I was going there for over 4 years. One day, I received a call that I was being discharged because of my urinalysis. I was told something showed up. I said, hold on, wait, let me take it again, something must be wrong. The tech said no and Janet was firm with her decision. I could not believe what I was hearing. I was very satisfied with the medication that I was getting and did not feel a need to take anything else. I often told Janet that I was thankful and satisfied for finally getting on meds that made a difference. I'm over 60 years old, still working and also have grands in my care. I didn't have a reason to seek other drugs to take. Everything was fine. The most disappointing thing is, i thought Janet and I had a better relationship than to just dismiss me, like I was nothing. We talked every visit.  I thought that she would have thought there must be something wrong. I wasn't given a chance to talk to her or to get another test. I'd never had a bad test before in the years that I was there. Something should have told her that something must be wrong. I was with this office before they changed their name to All Star. Like I said, I was satisfied. My prescribed medication was allowing me to handle my daily tasks a lot better. I had no reason to try or take anything else. I thought we had a real doctor patient relationship. Boy was I fooled. Also, I called and asked if she would reconsider and after being placed on hold, the receptionist said all discharges were final. I asked, well, what happens to me ? I never got a call back. Just that quick, I was discarded like old paperwork.|All Star Pain Management gets me back on my feet and helps me stay active, to the best of my ability, with minimal pain. Dr. Zed is very patient and explains every procedure. He also answers any questions or concerns I have. The staff is respectful and responsive. I would recommend this to anyone whose life has been disrupted by chronic pain. It has been a game changer and a blessing to me.|Would not recommend going here. Dr. Zed does not listen to what you have to say or pay attention to your medical history. After explaining I had reaction to steriods after a procedure that kept me in the hospital an additional five days, he still is only interested in pushing steriod shot treatment. These can be very dangerous even deadly to people with certain conditions. After getting a second opinion the doctor recommend not getting steriod  treatments without being admitted to the hospital ICU first.Dr. Zed is willing to do it in his  office. There are also other options that should be considered first and this is the only option Dr. Zed has offered.|I have been going to this location for over 2 years now. 4 injections done by Dr. Zed pre and post surgery. His original nurse practitioner Alina Messick was kind, supportive, and helpful. She would spend 30-45 minutes just talking to me every appointment to see how things were going. Sadly she moved on from this practice. Enter Janet Ascione. Since the first appointment with her she has been very curt and pretty much rude at times. I have been on pain pills for almost 2 years. In those 2 years I have never had any incidents, never missed an appointment, nothing. Since day 1 Janet treated me like and made me feel like I was abusing medication or something, mind you I'm prescribed a very minor 5mg/375mg hydrocodone/tylenol. In the 1.5 years before Janet I took 1 drug test because my insurance requested it, since Janet I believe I've taken 5 in the past 6 months. Today I was discharged because she asked me if I had prescriptions filled by any other physicians and I said no. She said they checked pharmacy records and I had a prescription filled a few weeks ago by another Dr. I said "oh yeah I had a tooth pulled and the dentist gave me a prescription for something, my wife picked it up from the pharmacy and it's in my medicine cabinet". It was a 3 day supply of 5mg/300mg hydrocodone/Tylenol, which is pretty standard issue after getting a tooth pulled. She proceeded to tell me that I violated my opioid agreement (that was signed 1.5 years ago) and that I also didn't mention the "surgery" when the intake girl asked, "any new x-rays, surgeries, mri's since your last visit?". I am treated here for my neck and when asked that question I think in terms of my neck and didn't realize I had to disclose having a tooth pulled. She proceeded to treat me like I was purposefully trying to hide this and began to scold and belittle me for it. I kept stating that I didn't realize it, didn't think about it, and even apologized for it. She continued to throw the fact that I signed an opioid agreement (1.5 years ago) in my face and that it was my job to know this and how this was grounds for discharge. At this point I very calmly told her that she was being very rude in the way she was talking to me, repeatedly telling me how wrong I was. As I was saying this she said "that's it we're done!". I asked what she meant and she said "I'm giving you a 2 week supply of meds and discharging you, and you can go find another Dr.". I asked to speak to Dr.Zed and she yelled "No, I'm discharging you!" She then asked me to still take another drug test to which I said I would. She then stormed out of the office and even closed the door in my face as I was right behind her walking out to go to the bathroom. I was so shocked by this whole exchange that I didn't even think to ask at the time why I even needed to bother to take a drug test when I was being discharged from their care.
I know this is a super long review but since I wasn't even afforded the opportunity to speak to MY Doctor, who performed 4 spinal injections on me, I am hoping he see's this and reaches out to me so we can talk. I also hope Janet Ascione see's this and thinks back on how she acted and realizes that it was very inappropriate. That is no way to act when you work in this type of field with people living in constant pain who obviously aren't living the best life at the moment.
Finally I hope prospective patients see this just so they can be informed of how they could possibly be treated. It's sad really. The office staff is very nice and helpful, Dr. Zed is a great Dr, and I absolutely loved Alina Messick. Janet Ascione does not fit in with the rest of the kind staff there, and sadly she is the one most patients will see 90% of the time. I hope she turns her attitude/behavior around before she drags down the rest of the practice|I have had two surgeries on my knee, ACL reconstruction in my 20s, I had seen another pain mgmt company prior to ALL STAR  . Their solution was pain medication only , although I do take a small amount of pain medication now , it is far from the amount that another pain  management office prescribed . ALL STAR/ DR Matta offers many other options to provide you quality of life. At 55 years of age ALL STAR gave that back to me . Also their staff is so kind and helpful as well... Thank you All Star|Yesterday I had my first appt. With Dr. Zed. I was so nervous .My son and I walked in and was greeted by a very nice lady. That was a plus. Then all the lady's turned around and said hi that right there showed me I was going to be taking care of. Then when Dr. Zed . Came in the room he shook my hand and my son and he ask what I was there for he was the first Dr. To listen to me and he knew just what needs to be done after many years of pain in hips he hit the nail on the head the first visit yahoo. I got a winner . I think I will keep him .Lol Dr. Zed does not rush you he let me tell her everything I wanted to about my pain even if it was little . I thank God I found a Doctor that listen to me and now I received shots in my hips and he going to keep up on my pain level .God Bless you Dr. Zed I am looking forward to taking this journey with you . I am glad I found you and Patrick i have two great people ready to make me better . You have a great staff and we felt very welcome in your office .Thank you for your kindness and hearing me out I feel much better today since I got the injections.Looking forward to getting my life back to pain free. And you are the Doctor that can make it happen .GOD BLESS YOU AND YOUR STAFF

column40:
Went for an opinion. Told I needed spinal injections. Offered a prescription for pain. 2 days later, prescription has never been sent to pharmacy. Office receptionist very snobby. Many bad reviews on Internet. Office apparently does not have a direct phone line. It's a Nation wide company that apparently uses a call center. I have received no calls back about my Rx. After calling several times. Scheduled for spinal injections 5 days, but I am going to cancel due to reasons above. If I experience any problems I probably won't be able to get help from the doctor.|This place will offer NO solutions for you or your loved ones pain problems. My mother is an elderly woman who was born without hip sockets, has had over 20 surgeries on her knees and hips and can only walk with the help of crutches. She relies on pain medication just to be able to get through her days. These doctors here seem to not care in the slightest. I understand these meds are federally regulated but these doctors refuse to work with you. They will not do telehealth, they force her to come in once a month to say the same thing each time and get the same prescription. Every single time I take my mom in there, she risks falling and getting injured. She begs them to give her a prescription that will last longer so we don't have to come in as much and what do the doctors do? They make her take a drug test and act like she's an addict. She's an elderly woman on crutches who can't drive and can barely walk, of course she isn't an addict. This place uses what I believe is a foreign call center to handle any of their calls. You will not be able to contact any doctor unless you are willing to plead with someone who you cannot understand for 30 minutes for them to transfer you to the front desk. But if you somehow get through to the front desk, the girl who works there will be mean and rude because God forbid she has to do anymore work. That brings me to my final complaint. The front desk girl. She is terribly rude, doesn't even look at you when she talks to you, and half the time she is on her phone on a personal phone call while you are trying to be helped and scheduled again. This place is an all round terrible experience and I would stay away if you can. I am now going to be driving my mother to one that is three times the distance away just to avoid the headache of dealing with this terrible place.|First visit to Clearway for my wife, who suffers chronic pain from an SI joint dysfunction as well as fibromyalgia.
We saw Dr. Finklestein and were positively impressed. He discussed her current pain med regimen as established by her previous pain management clinic and stated that it was reasonable and he would continue with it.
Then, he immediately moved to addressing the causes of her pain, rather than merely masking it with meds. This is a pleasant change from previous pain management providers and seems like a much better approach.
Dr F ordered an MRI to allow a better assessment of her SI join and scheduled a follow-up in a couple of weeks.
Dr F's manner was pleasant and professional and the supporting staff was efficient, light hearted and actually fun to work with.
We look forward to working with Clearway on my wife's pain issues and taking her life back from the pain demons that plague her.
Given that this was her first visit and treatment has not yet begun, we cannot give Clearway 5 stars yet, but will submit further reviews as things progress.|My husband and I have been going to Clearwater for about 3 years now and we live everyone there. The facility is always clean, staff friendly and caring. Doctors are wonderful. Highly highly recommend them.|If I could leave 0 stars, I would.
The office does not follow their advertised hours, no one is ever available to pick up the phone, if you leave a voicemail no one calls back, the staff is rude in person, and I don't have enough characters to share the horror that is the call center.
The only positive experience has been with Dr. Jari who has shown compassion and understanding to his patients.|Excellent facility with a friendly and efficient staff. Dr Jari was informative and explained his plan and options clearly and comprehensively. I felt very pleased and confident in Dr Jari's plan of treatment. Highly recommend this pain management practice.|Not good. Was asked to come earlier only to wait an hour. Was my first time with this doctor. He never went over my issues, reduced my meds that I've been on for years with NO addiction or misuse and have to wait 6 weeks for my next visit.|Very nice doctor. He was interested and helpful and the staff was very pleasant. I still have several visits for my back and they will be doing injection

column40:
I had 2 recent visits with Nurse Irene. Each time, she was minimally cordial & barely engaging. I experience the same energy with the front desk staff. Getting a prescription was a hassle. It was often forgotten, when calling to follow up you'd be assured that it'd be taken care of for it to be further delayed -- while you suffer.

I understand that we have our individual challenges. When you choose to work in an environment managing patients who suffer from chronic pain, more attentiveness & prioritizing compassion would be sincerely appreciated.|Cecilia is who takes care of me every month, I'm blessed to have her as my doctor. I have a lot of issues and alot of pain and so Cecilia helps me so I won't be so miserable. I'm thankful for her. And I can't forget about Maria, she has helped me alot too.|The visit was very professional, and the technicians and receptionist were quite knowledgeable.  my doctor seemed to be knowledgeable but could not locate mu X-rays which were sent to the office.  i also received a bill for compensation and was informed by mu health insurance that the bill had already been settled.|Cecilia Gramsky really cares for her patients well being. She's always great with her patients and always so Informative. She ask great questions. The whole office is Awesome all the way around. All the doctors and staff are great.|Cecelia is wonderful! She takes time to listen and explain. You can tell she truly cares. I'm so thankful to have had her during such difficult times|If I could rate a ZERO, I would. I called for an app't and was told they would reach out to retrieve my MRI report from the place I had it done. Got to my app't two weeks later only for the NP to ask ME where my MRI reports because she needs to view them before care because they don't have them. I only had the email version images that were sent to me for my own records. They were lucky enough to be able to get the same day report, while NP proceeded to see her other patients IF I decided to wait to see if they would get them. Once she got it,  she tells me the images I paid $300 for was not what she needed to see and therefore she could not proceed with care unless I got more images with her referral, one being the SAME images I already got and the other being an area that I'm not having ISSUES with. She didn't bother to see the issue that can be seen with human eyes! Not only that,  two of my doctors viewed the very same images and referred me to this company for pain management. I reached out to my primary to advise that this was the worst place to refer and to please suggest another while I was still there.  NP told me to come back in two weeks after I got what SHE needed, and maybe I could get treated. I made the app't for good gestures ( unlike the good gesture I didn't receive from the NP) and canceled from the parking lot. NP disposition was cold, and I can't even place her name because she appeared to not want to mention it upon greeting. I would have to look at the auto- text messages, and it's not worth it because, as far as I'm concerned, she represents the whole organization, at least at that location. I will say that through the walls, she sounded way more pleasant to her "OTHER" existing patients. Obviously, if someone is coming to a PAIN MANAGEMENT establishment, it's because THEY ARE IN PAIN! At least you could show sympathy instead of making me feel like I'm just whining, 'so suffer for two more weeks and see me after I ignore what your docs sent you here for and make my own assessment without really caring what you say'. NEVER, NEVER have to worry about me supporting this establishment. I've never been to a pain management place and was a little reluctant currently. However, the pain I'm in , I was willing to give it a try. End story: I was referred to another one by my primary and praying for a better experience.

Update: I decided it was best for me to look up the NP on my text because the worst experience for me was her.  Irene Bwete-Mugyenzi, CRNP. Might I suggest you have better bedside manners, specifically with NEW patients, or maybe you just didn't like me just looking at me.|My Dad is a a patient here with Cecelia Gramsky, CRNP. She has always been caring and taken care of my Dad's pain for several years now. He is able to function without severe pain and that means so much to me as his daughter and the rest of our family as well. Everyone in the office is always pleasant and caring each time he has an appointment. They have gone above and beyond for him after several of his surgeries when the surgeon could have cared less about his pain. Thank you for always being so wonderful!!|I have been with Cecelia for over 10 years and have wondered and delighted in her professionalism and nursing care during each visit.  The entire staff have also been great to work with. Thank you.

column40: I have been coming to the Pain Center of Maryland ( PCM) for almost five years. I was a Firefighter Paramedic for over 30 years. Duing that time I developed chronic pain in my knees, hips and back. I have had both knee and hip replacements. With chronic  pain for over twenty years, I have been to several pain management Doctors. PCM is the most professional facility I have used. They have used a multifaceted approach for pain relief. They have given me injections that have actually lasted for months. I would highly recommend the PCM to anyone who needs professional therapy by Licensed Practioners and a very professional staff.|While I know I'll never be 100%, they do a great job keeping me functional. Easy to work with and schedule.|Dr. Baksh and staff are A+++. Always friendly & courteous. Dr. Baksh Talks to you like you matter and addresses each concern you may have. The only criticism is the App being used for patients to access for appts, billing, etc. it does NOT work! Having access to an app would make things so much easier.  My other providers use My Chart so everything is in one place and all drs can see my records. Thaf would be wonderful!|At the time I met Dr.Baksh I had no quality of life and  had been very limited on what I could do for my mobility.  I could not go out to enjoy a walk in the park, shop for groceries, go shopping for pretty much anything. I've had to limit my time with friends due to all the excruciating pain that I had been in day after day. Then I met Dr. Baksh as a new patient. I have been being seen my Dr. Baksh for 1 and 1/2 years now. Within this time frame I find Dr. Baksh has taken a real personal interest in my overall healthcare. With the treatments that he has performed for the sciatica pain that I am experiencing Dr. Bashk had decided to go a step further and perform a Radio Frequency Ablation  (RFA) yesterday. This procedure will be a great step forward for my pain relief. I woke up this morning and already felt like a new person. Thank you Dr. Baksh for your deep concern in my health. Offices which are in Virginia, West Virginia and Maryland. All 3 are clean and he has great staff that make you feel right at home.|I love Dr Baksh and his staff. Everyone is so friendly.  Dr Baksh has helped me so much to fight my pain caused by psoriatic arthritis. His nurse Shannon makes me laugh every time I'm there. This is why I drive 1 hour and 10 minutes to come here|The service and care you will receive from this office is wonderful. The facility itself is brand new and very clean. Both Dr. Baksh and the PA Kristen are extremely kind and caring providers that will work with you and treat you like an individual, not just another person they have to see that day. The staff is also always friendly and make it a pleasant experience. I am very pleased with the care they've provided me with.|My husband has gone to this pain center for less than a year for severe back pain. Has yet to meet the dr. The PA is very rude and has no empathy for the fact that he has had pain for at least 20 years. She cut his meds in half and released him because "he broke the rules". He takes medical marijuana to help with the pain. I was with him at his first apt and the lady PA was very rude. If you have severe problems I would not recommend this pain clinic.|First impression as you get to the door is the big green sign warning you that they drug test randomly.  I went for an evaluation the reception ladies were nice enough and the nurse.  As for the P.A. that rude woman needs to learn how to be a decent respectful human being to their patients. She actually told me that I need to be  quiet she's speaking!  She talked at me not too me. Never again! Very unprofessional on her part. You can keep this place!

I left today after my visit full of hope that has sadly been absent for a good while.
Bravo Amit!|Office staff friendly, courteous and knowledgeable.  Amir Patel provided me information and thoroughly explained the issues and treatments available to me.  I truly entrust my care to Clearway Pain Solutions.

Thank you Clearway Pain Solutions in Gambrills MD.|Great experience short wait time thorough understanding of what our next move would be. Dr Patel is an excellent doctor. Although it has been over 9 years this place left a terrible taste in my mouth. Dr McIntosh was the absolute best but she left and I was not informed. I don't even know if they fired her or if she resigned but when I noticed that I was seeing the physician assistant for my appointments I asked and was finally told she no longer worked there. She gave me 3 injections that helped my pain tremendously but I had 3 more scheduled which had to be performed by Dr Ghorbani who I had never even met and when he gave me the first my pain increased and my sugar levels shot through the roof. I refused to ever go back there again. I met with Ghorbani once after my procedure and it was like the increased pain and increased glucose was my own fault. I don't know what mixture he used but it was not the same. I have never returned nor will I ever.|After I have been treating with APMI and Dr. Ghorbani, my pain is very manageable and my family said I am not that "Grumpy man" anymore.

Thank you APMI.|It's been close to a year now. Still really great. Now I referred my Godmother, my aunt, and two of my neighbors. The staff are amazingly pleasant and polite. They work with your time. Dr is firm, blunt and very knowledgeable about what needs to be to done for maximum effectiveness. I will continue to recommend as many folks as possible as I believe he' truly make people in pain lives alot easier.|Please be aware that they will try to sell you on devices that they get paid to sell. This was in their waiting room so I wasn't surprised when this is the option they recommended to me for some chronic but low level pain I have due to scar tissue.|The doctors here listen to the patient and take everything into consideration. They work with your other doctors to make sure they get the right course of action for your treatment plan and ensure that it is the right steps to take. You are informed in the process and they ensure you know all that will be taking place. Everyone in the office is really great and treat you like you have been coming there for years. I have yet to feel unwelcome or uncomfortable in this office. I can really appreciate all they have done to make me comfortable and ease my pain.|Sherry is phenomenal! The evaluation and consult were so thorough. After a month of therapy, I feel great! My flexibility had improved so much and the tightness and soreness around my hip is gone. Thank you, to Sherry and her assistant for their patience and for being so gracious to me during my sessions. You're the best!!|Dr. Ghorbani has done the best job at insuring my survival through two surgery and his aids are excellent Vanessa,  Office Manager, Michelle,  Check in person, Jay, Receptionist,  Sunni, REHABILITATION,  Kelly, Receptionist their professional courtesy and willingness to help is what all doctor's offices should practice, thank you kindly.|I have been attending APMI in Greenbelt for over four years now and so far I have zero complaints. My sciatic nerve and low back has been improving greatly since I started going back to therapy here. I highly recommend APMI and Monica Leid, PA-C is simply amazing she make you feel welcome from the time that you walk in the door she's always professional and kind she communicates well to make sure you understand everything before you leave the office. I cannot say enough positive things about the staff at APMI in Greenbelt, especially my physical therapist, last but not least I had to speak about the medical receptionist Aisha each time I walked in the door she greets me by my name and that makes me feel so welcomed. Once again, I recommend this APMI to anyone that needs Physical Therapy and Pain Management.

column40:
Just to think I previously rated this place 5 stars!!! I have been waiting for them to pivot after the recent staff change. I don't even think I can return here next month and will need to find a new practice before my next appt. I was a patient here for almost 7 years, the office used to be crowded over there next to the mall but the service and level of care was always top tier. James Hill was the best. Now he has left, I have seen 4 different practitioners, the front desk is occupied by an computer with rotating ppl coming on the screen. It would seem efficient except for when I'm waiting 20 min. For a bathroom key. Or the EXTREMELY rude virtual assistant ELIZABETH  who shut her screen off while I was talking lol it was like the equivalent of someone hanging up on you because you called their job and they didn't want to work that day.  Or how ALL staff is in the back of office and even when I'm yelling' can someone bring me bathroom key,  no one is coming to the front. Then they have the audacity to have a sign that say please don't knock on the door. The 2nd virtual assistant told me they couldn't help me and would call someone out.
When I called the billing department the lady adamantly told me I had to pay a $50 copay  eventhough I knew for a fact I didn't owe any copay due to my plan. Finally a young lady came out and beckoned someone to find the bathroom key  and figured out what was really going on with my patient account. (Wasnt a copay) then she scurried away behind the door yet to be seen again. I really wished things would've smoothed out by now. When James left I knew it would be a difficult transition but figured they would remain professional and I would continue our relationship. Sitting in an empty waiting room 1 hour and 15 mins after my scheduled appointment time, they must have decided to take an early lunch. Looking around one last time for the nostalgia, and realizing the waiting room is dingy and dusty everywhere. The owner should demand the building owner cleans the carpet at least. Surely they thought they would save some bucks and cut down on employees with this virtual assistant but I know they must be losing cause the whole setup is non functional for real life situations. Or the staff Is getting over on the owner by hiding out in the back not being attentive to patients/clients. Either way something is definitely Awry at this Choice Pain Location, and I won't be sticking around to subject myself to further mistreatment and I suggest you steer clear f4om this disappointment as well|Where you come from can be good and bad. At every place this group comes from in the healthcare industry they bring down with careless approach to medicine and nursing. Every facility they work in is an issue. Thru are falsify records or not providing decent care. This place does not answer phones, except in Gaithersburg , nurse practitioner threatened to cancel appointment if I did not come in early and was concerned zI was not taking enough pills for pain but did not counsel on a reduction of narcotics. When I asked her to switch providers she refused to put in chart and I later found out she did not put in prescription because I stated I wanted another provider. I had to report them for refusing to give me my medical records. Doctor was contacted, both ignored it. Doctor that works inside Medstar facility has a complaint against him by the DC Medical Board for not adhering to standards of a physician. It's on Google and it's published to public. There's to doctors, so you can see which one has the finding or complaint. Stay away from this practice. If you are dependent on ......, you may be persuaded to write a review but there's is no way they are accurate. Nurse practitioner sent out an assistant to listen to receptionist and or gd wanted to listen because they will pool together for any deception. It's my suspicion they came to Maryland because they are less regulated. But that's all about to end with Maryland Health Department under wrath.|I previously thought they cared and gave great customer service. The new staff and supervisors are HORRIBLE. They don't care about the patients needs. I will not be returning EVER.|This how they treat patients... Make you miss work for THEIR convenience. Don't send in your meds CONSTANTLY. Hang up on you MULTIPLE TIMES! Then make you wait on hold for THEM for at least 30 minutes! It's about their convenience not the convenience or needs of the patient!!!! I would be FIRED if I treated my patients like this!!!!!!! How are they still an operating practice? I think my next call will be to the board. Their providers are too busy trying to flirt than to do their jobs!

Since James left I don't know what happened to this place! Twice they were supposed to send in my meds and twice it never happened! I get called, told to leave my job as a nurse early, make arrangements, and they don't follow through on their job! This is horrible! I would never treat my own patients like this can't believe they do theirs like this.

James Hill helped me get my life back! I'm so happy to have found him and this clinic. Everyone here has been AMAZING! The staff is so friendly and so helpful. This is what you want in a pain clinic. Heck this is what you want in an office PERIOD! I cannot recommend them enough. I work in orthopedics and I will definitely be sending my own patients here!!!|So glad they have new staff here, once the front desk under Rochelle left it became a circus in both back and front office. I thought that I was given a thorough exam until the current staff took over a few months ago, the NA that I saw was a guy I do not recall his name but that was the most thorough, thoughtful and professional exam I've ever experienced since being in ANY pain management office and the LPN Shirley Frimprong is totally the best she actually listens does not try to force medication on you and take your concerns/feelings into consideration when coming up with a plan that meets your individual needs. I can only pray that whomever will be filling in for her while she's on maternity leave is as attentive and caring as she.  Wishing her a smooth/safe delivery and a healthy bundle of joy.|Dr. Hill is Awesome!!! It's nice to have a Doctor who spends time with you and your own situation, finds a solution that fits your needs to manage your month. Dr. Hill and his Staff are very respectful and treats they're patients with professionalism. I would definitely recommend seeking a consultation with Dr. Hill and his staff. It can change your life and the Quality that you Deserve!!! It certainly exceeded my expectations and more Dr. Hill is more then a Great Doctor he's a friend, Brother and someone I can talk to about whatever I'm going through on a monthly basis! Not much else I can say but pick up the phone and make an appointment and see for yourself!

DP|I don't even no where to start first of all I been calling since last week.when I received a call from the office manager Mohammad that once again they where no provider to see me for my appointment on July 25 1:45 2024 . But Dr obey would be sure to call my prescription in today no prescription they hung up on me I left over a 100 messages no response I had my right leg amputated failed out my wheelchair and barely can move now also I have back problem I'm in pain crying they stop taking my calls ignore me and do anyone know who I can call to complain and get help with these issues please|Not only did Dr.Hill help my severe pain that comes with my chronic pancreatitis, he listened to all my concerns. More so then any other pain specialist I've been too. His entire staff is a breath of fresh air. column40:
I have had a chronic pain condition for 10 years and tried every medication under the sun, including opiates. They either didn't work, or were only effective for a limited time. My one consultation with Dr. Dombrowski led to the addition of 2 medications which has led to a consistent reduction in my pain for the first time in 10 years. In addition, I was prescribed 2 other medications that help me manage flare ups and reduce my pain to the lowest it's ever been in 10 years. I had given up on finding a medication for my pain, but Dr. Dombrowski was able to find the right combination that made all the difference. I could not recommend him and the fantastic staff at The Washington Pain Center highly enough!|I'm really lucky that I found The Washington Pain Center and Dr. Dombrowski. I have seen many specialist over the years, and I have experienced very little to no pain relief for my situation. However, after just one of the first medical suggestion, that Dr. Dombroski performed, I felt pain relief. And that pain relief extended and increase substantially throughout his treatment plan.

I'm not only grateful for the pain relief (& the amount of pain relief of which I've never experienced during my 7 years of seeing doctors and other specialist), but I'm grateful for his genuine interest in my wellbeing and his welcoming and caring personality. He's one of the first doctors that I have seen where I'm not afraid that I'm going to be turned away because they don't want to take the time to understand my pain and injuries or where I have to beg them not to give up on me - That is NOT the kind of doctor he is. He is the complete opposite, and I am so grateful. -- I could go on because there's so much more that I could say. But, I just want to emphasize to whoever reads this that he is a great doctor and a great person, and you should come in and see/experience it for yourself - you won't regret it.

Last thing I would like to note is, the front desk ladies are SO kind and helpful. They have the best customer service and are so sweet and genuinely care about you as well.|A great office! Dr. Dombroski listens very well and explains very well and skillfully does for you whatever is appropriate.  He is a very fine, caring, Knowledgeable and skilled doctor.  Staff is great too.  I heartily recommend this office.|John was straightforward, honest and good diagnostician of my issue. He was clear and direct about my options. Put things in plain English for me, and was thorough in covering the benefits and risks. For this alone I recommend him. That his treatment approach worked is why I wish there were 10 stars.|Dr Dombrowski, and everyone in this office is consistently friendly, helpful, and compassionate. It's always a pleasure visiting them, and for many of us, he is the final answer. For me it's the renewed ability to stand up and have fun with the guitar, after over 55 years of chronic back problems...simply not possible without Dr D's intervention Thank You So Much!
Donny Owen (on right) and long time duet partner Jack Worthington, performing in Delmarva and Montgomery County, MD|Dr John Dombrowski came highly recommended.  He surpassed all of the praise I'd heard about him.  He was thorough, straight forward, charming and professlonal.  I'd refer Dr Dombrowski to everyone without hesitation!|The doctor takes his time to explain procedure and walked me through each step to alleviate anxiety.  I highly recommend him.|When I entered the office, I was greeted very warmly by the receptionist, and after waiting for a short period of time, I was taken to the back by the nurse. After meeting Dr. Dombrosky I knew I would not be disappointed. He was very friendly, professional, and extremely knowledgeable. He actively listened to me as I explained why I was there and very quickly we agreed upon our plan of action to help me. I was apprehensive about going to a new doctor since leaving Georgia however, I am happy to say i was fortunate to meet someone who is obviously one of the best, pain doctors in DC.

column2: The Kahan Center For Pain Management
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Annapolis

At The Kahan Center For Pain Management, we specialize in providing advanced pain management treatments for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located at 170 Jennifer Rd, Suite 240 in Annapolis, MD, our center is led by Dr. Kahan, a highly skilled physician with decades of experience in interventional pain management. We offer a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Advanced Interventional Procedures - including spinal injections, radiofrequency ablation, and neurostimulator implantation

  • Innovative Treatments - such as the Viadisc procedure for back pain

  • Personalized Pain Management Plans - tailored to each patient's specific condition

  • Professional Medical Training - for physicians seeking to enhance their interventional skills

Our dedicated team, including our physician assistant Kim Fern, works diligently to ensure each patient receives personalized care in a supportive environment. Many of our patients have been with us for years, trusting our expertise to help manage their chronic pain conditions. We take pride in listening carefully to our patients' concerns and developing effective treatment strategies that improve quality of life. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit our website or call us at +1 410-571-9000.

column38: Mike Vivian|Donna Freeland|Candice Darling|Shiel Patel|David Love|Ninad K|Chad Kessler|Gina Edgington
column40:
I have been a patient of Dr. Kahan's for many years, being treated for chronic back pain after 2 spinal fusion surgeries. We have tried every modality out there to try to minimize and manage my back pain as well as my sciatica.  The nerve damage starts in my lower back and ends at my toes, so I have had a neurostimulator implanted which helps tremendously.  And just recently, I had the Viadisc procedure done in the hope that it would alleviate my back pain, and what a difference 3 months have made!  I wasn't sure it would work immediately after the procedure, because I was pretty uncomfortable for the first 3-4 weeks post-op.  But after about 4-6 weeks, I realized one morning that my back didn't hurt!  Since then, and for the most part, my back pain is so much better, except when it is really cold or really damp outside.  I am amazed and pleased at how well I am doing with respect to my lower back after the procedure. There are times I even forget I have pain, and that is success as far as I am concerned I would definitely recommend having the Viadisc procedure if Dr. Kahan thinks you are a good candidate.  Go through Dr. Kahan's office if you would like to discuss with me further.

And if you are looking for a pain management specialist, I strongly recommend Dr. Kahan and his entire team - Dr. Kahan listens to you, and will make recommendations he feels would be most suitable to your condition.  Kim Fern, PA-C is great, and the entire staff does everything possible to work with you to arrange appointments, schedule procedures and make sure you have completed all paperwork whenever necessary.  If you have chronic pain, I strongly recommend you contact the Kahan Center for Pain Management.|Dr. Kahan and his staff go out of their way to make me comfortable and to take care of my pain. I leave there happy because I know will be pain free. Outstanding practice.|I have been going to pain mgmt doctors for at least 15 years.  Hands down Dr. Kahan is the best!  He will not stop until he finds the most effective solution to managing your pain.  His  staff is awesome as well.|I have attended two courses at the Kahan Center. Dr. Kahan has been an amazing teacher. I have been able to gain a lot of insightful tips and tricks to help improve my injection technique. What sets his course apart is that you don't feel rushed. His courses are kept to small groups which allows you to spend an ample amount of time practicing. Dr. Kahan will spend as much time as you need to feel comfortable and confident in performing the injections. I highly recommend his courses to anyone with an interest in gaining further knowledge in interventional pain management. Thanks Dr. Kahan!|Excellent course! Great experience working 1 on 1 with Dr. Kahan, learning techniques I've adopted in my practice. Would highly recommend to anyone interested in learning these skills.|I attended Dr. Kahan's advanced radiofrequency ablation course and would highly recommend this course. It's very hands-on, and with the small volume, I was able to work on the things I needed and never felt rushed. There is no doubt that Dr. Kahan is a highly skilled and experienced proceduralist. More relevant perhaps to this course is that Dr. Kahan is an outstanding teacher and takes the time to answer questions and personalize the content to meet the individual candidate's goals. Attending this course will ensure you feel comfortable and confident in performing these procedures.|The course was excellent. It was comprehensive and provided terrific didactic and hands on instruction.  Dr. Kahan is an outstanding teacher.  I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn lumbar injection techniques.|They're going here to see Dr.Kahan for 23+ years. The doctor has always been willing to help me and went over and beyond to help me as the ladies in the office have as well they're always very cheerful kind people that work there What are the ladies Pam even came outside one day and jump started my car or try to jumpstart my car for me! That's a real service I told you they go over and above trying to help all their patients in any way they can. I recommend this to anybody that has severe pain and can't get any good bedside manner with doctors today and still suffer with pain which is unnecessary. Jennifer (Gina) Edgington

column3:
At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), we are proud to be one of the nation's largest pain management practices, serving patients across seven states.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Since our formation in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, we have rapidly expanded our network to include over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers throughout D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia. Our mission is to bring together highly qualified pain management specialists to create an extensive network that effectively addresses the needs of the growing population of patients suffering from chronic pain. Our Bowie location offers:

  • Specialized pain control treatments

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Expert physician consultations

  • Advanced diagnostic services

We strive to provide compassionate, professional care in a comfortable environment. Our team understands the debilitating effects of chronic pain and works diligently to develop effective treatment strategies for each individual patient. Visit our Bowie location at 16900 Science Dr #100, Bowie, MD 20715, or call us at +1 301-464-7008 to schedule your consultation today.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

column40:
Outstanding, EVERYONE wore a smile on their faces, they were very professional, knowledgeable, friendly, patient, kind, a joy a talk to and the wait time for not long at all.  They made me feel welcomed and comfortable as they would explain everything that would take place from the beginning of my visit until the end of my visit.  Also, they reached out to me to make sure that I was recovering properly.  The atmosphere in the office pleasant, peaceful and kept very cleaned.   I just can't say enough about this location and the employees just 100%+ is what that are rated in my book.|I tried to make an appointment in the Oxon Hill location but got sent to the Bowie location. Now my schedule procedure has been rescheduled TWICE on clerical issues within the office. Maybe it's because my case is workers comp and they differ some of the cases. Needless to say I'm very disappointed and still in pain.|I just saw Dr. Closson for pretty severe pain that just started in my lower back that radiates down my legs.  He was so patient and kind with me, explaining what was going on and what procedures he offered that could help.  He is very knowledgeable AND has an amazing bedside manner.  The office staff and nurses are also extremely warm and welcoming.  The office is bright and very nice and comfortable.  I am a business owner and recognize and appreciate all the hard work that goes into such a well run business.  I am so grateful that I felt heard and that I left with a game plan to getting my pain under control.  Thank you again for everything!!|If I could give them zero stars, I would.
Why?  Because.....
1.) I always spend a LONG time on the phone whenever I call them.
2.) They have a call center answering service and they're not helpful.
3.) The last visit I had, I was called and asked if I could come in earlier for my appointment because the doctor had some cancellations. So I arrived 1 hour early. I waited in the waiting room for 40 minutes before we got called back.  We then got called back and waited another 30 minutes for the doctor. We spent over an hour waiting.....WHY would they call me to come in early just to wait for more than an hour??!
The doctor saw us, left and said he'd come back. He did not come back.  I had to ask the nurse and he never came back. The nurse gave me my referral for my MRI and we left.
4.) I got home and realized they never gave me my referral for my physical therapy.
5.) I called and they said they would mail me my referral for my physical therapy. They NEVER mailed it to me.
6.)  I had to drive back to the office and pick up my physical therapy referral because they did NOT mail it to me AND they forgot to give it to me when I was at my appointment.|The Dr's and the staff are always kind, understanding, caring and professional.|"Everyone" always has a smile to share when I enter the door until the time I leave. I'm always treated as though I'm very much welcome and the only patient they have. I am invariably treated in a courteous and respectful manner at the Bowie facility.

Dr. Closson is the epitome of professionalism. He is consistently compassionate and competent when performing my treatments. He lets me know what and when he is about to do something related to my procedure. This helps me to prepare myself for what is about to happen.

At any rate, I am more than propitious that I found the National Spine & Pain Center in Bowie. You will find your experience gratifying if you attend this location.|I got 4 injections at different times, and none helped. The last one, when I got home, there was a scar on my belly that no one had mentioned, and no one had checked to see how I was doing. That was my LAST visit|I can't praise Dr. Closson enough! He has been so helpful through all of my chronic pain challenges. He has been the first physician to truly listen to what I have to say and help me find solutions. I am very grateful for his help, and kind bedside manner. Highly recommended! :)

Tori is the best. She always makes you comfortable and doesn't judge you for what you're there to get help for.|The staff there are really kind and professional. Dr. B is the Best. He is very kind, listens to you, attentive and professional. It's a good place to go if you're having pain. The Surgical Staff are very kind, caring and professional. Area is is there onsite so don't have to travel far. It's literally connected to other side of the main location.|Staff in general are very friendly. Overall happy with the office staff. The doctors on the other hand not so much. The practioner that I see is awesome, listens to me and works with me, Kevin is fantastic. The main doctors that do the reviews yearly and fill in for him when he is out or sick horrible is the best word I have for it .  They don't listen and their answer for me trying to explain to them what I am feeling or going through and asking and jumping through their "hoops" is "well if you don't like us you can find another place to go to". REALLY !!! THIS IS HOW YOU TREAT YOUR CLIENTS ??? I understand you see alot of patients, but you chose this, and if you can't be sympathetic, compassionate, and listen to your clients, then quite frankly you don't need to have a job. We as clients come to you being in some of the worst pain we have ever experienced, and ask for you to listen, empathize, and try and help us. Each individual case is exactly that, INDIVIDUAL! You lump everyone in with the problem people and become frankly rude, apathetic, and non compassionate, all things as a doctor you CAN'T AND SHOULDN'T be. Then you think you are God's because you are the people that prescribe our meds and that you can just treat us as paying clients anyway you want. Don't get me wrong some people are just looking to use your tools incorrectly, but most people are looking for answers for some d the worst pain they have ever had, and it is your job and duty to give it to them if you can as doctors and people who CHOSE this field.|I love Dr. Gurman. However Kevin Reese really has more time to understand what my pain is. They are very professional and care about your wellness. I will never see Tori again. I do not like her dimenure at all. I've recommended people however I'm not sure if they followed through. Happy Blessed Thanksgiving to you all. Oh I forgot the front and back staff. Very courteous and pleasant.|Didn't know what to expect it was my first visit. Front desk staff was very friendly and awesome, the doctor I saw was very friendly, very knowledgeable and lead me in all the right directions, so thumbs up and a five star. Thank you.|Not only did I have a great experience with the staff at Clearway, I was blown away watching them interact with every single patient with the utmost care, kindness, and patience that is absolutely necessary for patients who are suffering constant pain. Thank you so much to the staff at Clearway!!|My experience with provider Kevin Reese is always a very pleasant one as it has been for years. Kevin is always pleasant, caring, respectful and very concerned about all of his patients and their wellbeing. He makes this painful road to recovery a very pleasant one. Excellent care as always.|After having a bad experience at the Belair office, I returned to Dundalk. I will travel the distance to continue going there. They are prompt, I never have to wait long and the staff and doctors take the time needed to address your issues. Thank you!

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Chevy Chase
column3:
At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), we stand as one of the nation's largest pain management practices, dedicated to helping those suffering from chronic pain find relief and restore quality of life. Established in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, we quickly expanded our reach by partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012, followed by New York Pain Physicians. Today, our extensive network includes over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our Chevy Chase location offers specialized treatments including:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Stem cell therapy

  • Customized pain management plans

  • Non-surgical treatment options

We bring together highly qualified specialists who combine medical expertise with compassionate care to address various pain conditions. Our team at 5550 Friendship Blvd #450 is committed to providing personalized treatment plans that focus on improving functionality and reducing pain. Learn more about our innovative approaches to pain management by visiting National Spine & Pain Centers - Chevy Chase or calling us at +1 301-215-4154 to schedule your consultation.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

At CHOICE Pain & Rehabilitation Center, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for men and women suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions throughout Maryland and the Washington, D.C. area. Our team of physical medicine specialists brings specialized training in pain management to each of our seven convenient locations in Olney, Rosedale, Hyattsville, Lanham, Gaithersburg, Dundalk, and Baltimore.

Our Multidisciplinary Approach

We take pride in our multidisciplinary approach that addresses the physical, mental, and emotional aspects of pain management. Our expertise includes:

  • Specialized injection therapy

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Non-surgical pain management solutions

Each doctor at our center is dedicated to providing individualized care that targets the specific causes and symptoms of your pain. Whether you're dealing with back pain, joint issues, or other chronic conditions, we offer advanced treatment options designed to improve your quality of life. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 240-786-1001 to schedule your consultation at any of our locations, including our North Point Boulevard office in Baltimore.
column11:
With office locations in Olney, Rosedale, Hyattsville, Lanham, Gaithersburg, Dundalk, and Baltimore, Maryland, the physical medicine specialists at CHOICE Pain & Rehabilitation Center offer a comprehensive array of solutions for men and women who suffer from acute and chronic pain conditions. Each of the doctors at the clinic has specialized training in pain management and use a multidisciplinary approach to improve the physical, mental, and emotional well-being of men and women in Maryland the Washington, D.C. area.
The team of experts at CHOICE Pain & Rehabilitation Center specializes in injection therapy to relieve symptoms associated with many different types and causes of pain.

God bless Choice Pain & Rehabilitation.|I love Dr Shockley he is the most gentle Doctor I've ever had most procedures I have with him I used to get put to sleep for but I don't need to do that now I love the whole place to staff and everyone especially my doctor|I was really hoping for some relief with this practice and I'm really disappointed - this is a pathetic excuse for an healthcare facility.  An employee was loudly badmouthing another patient with her coworker --  wow.  Then she asked me to tell her everything I had filled out in the forms, which was frustrating.  I didn't want opioids, so the doctor ordered meloxicam and said I can get trigger point injections, but I'd have to wait another month for that appointment -- the only reason I was there was so they could bill my insurance.  Also, I specifically asked if the meloxicam would be ok with my other medicines and the doctor confirmed, but my pharmacist advised me not to take it daily -- what do I do about the pain then?! column40: I have been to a lot of pain specialists in my life, Dr. Brian Block is the best. I receive nerve block pain relief medicine in my lower spine. He knows exactly where to go with the needle. You explain to him where you're having the pain and he knocks it out of the park. I was told by three different surgeons I needed back surgery ASAP. With my husband just passing away, that was not something I could have on my radar. Dr. block listen to my pain problems injected my back and I was good for over a year. I have been going to him for over 15 years. You will never find anyone like him and his wonderful staff. No Anne Adresini Is a wonderful nurse practitioner that has an ear to listen to everything that you're going through. They deserve 10 stars.|

column38: Josephine Mourning|Gloria Gaines|Judah Lady|Jackie M|Mitchell Wilson|Breon breon|Min Tang|Kenya Downey
column40:
I saw Dr. Soudan in October of 2024.  I loved his professionalism and pinpointing my problems.   However I have tried to get a follow up from that injection and every time I call, the receptionist puts me through to the office manager who does not answer or return my calls.  This has been going on since October 2024.  The office manager will not return my call so I can follow up from my last injection from Dr. Soudan or allow the receptionist to make an appointment for me.  I don't feel that it is Dr. Soudan, I feel it is the office manager.  I was first a patient at Bowie and when Dr. Closson left Bowie, they sent me to Columbia.  I ended up asking that my records and me be transferred to Columbia from Bowie because I love Dr. Siudan.  Bowie transferred my records.   But now the office manager at Columbia refuses to allow me to come back for my follow-up or to make an appointment for my next injection.  If anyone knows how you can get in touch with the Director of this facility, please share it.|I love the personable atmosphere of the location and the staff at the Columbia, Md., National Spine and Pain center. Dr. Sudan is the best! Tamika is, a wonderful person who really listens to your problems and help you to get the best care needed in a timely manner!|My initial appointment with Dr Soudan, I immediately felt he was not taking me serious at all. Upon him reading the different diagnosis that attributes to the severe pain I endure daily. Dr Soudan verbally downplayed how serious the issues and the pain I deal with daily, by telling me "I think they misdiagnosed you having SLE Lupus and Peripheral neuropathy ". I looked at him and told him I had seen many specialist, Rheumatologist, Neurologist, Hematologist, and my PCP. They then diagnosed me with SLE Lupus, amongst other diagnoses. I felt humiliated because I was there for help and relief for some of the pain I deal with daily, to be treated like I'm some addict seeking drugs. The straw that broke the camels back was the most recent visit, I asked to speak to the Ofc Mgr and after speaking to her, verbalizing my concerns, she sends in Dr Soudan. He entered the treatment room clearly annoyed. He had the audacity to tell me I can find another Doctor. He is the Medical Director there. I asked him why? Because I am advocating for myself and you all have had me on the same medication since 2022, with which my body has become prone to and their is really no relief of the severe pain I endure daily?! He proceeds to tell me " I do not increase no one's medication, you can find another Doctor." I told him I just want to get help for the pain I suffer, and they are the closet facility to my home. He was verbally disrespectful and I asked him what happened to your bedside manner?! I also elaborated that I too was a former health care practitioner. He proceeds to say "y'all are the worst to try to treat". I was not only dissatisfied, I couldn't believe he was so nonchalant and gave me all the verbiage that he cared to NOT treat or help me. He then proceeds to verbalize to me "I don't treat Lupus, go to your Rheumatologist". I told him based on all the Specialist I had seen, my PCP referred me to pain management. I have made a complaint, praying something changes for the better, for future patients. Finally, I told him I'm usually a very friendly person and I've had conversations with other patients in the waiting room, and other patients indicated their meds had been increased, but it took a lot of request, some even elaborated that they feel they are getting relief. Then I knew it was a bias against a certain persuasion of patients. All I want is some relief with regards to the chronic pain I suffer daily. It's unfair that some Doctor's stereotype certain people because of their own biases. I've had many injections and tried many different treatments, and suggested procedures at other facilities to no avail. I'm at the point to just give up hope with regards to getting proper care and treatment for the pain I deal with daily that affects my DLA. I've seen many different Doctors with NSPC since 2013, after I had several blood clots in my lungs in 2012, then came all the different diagnosis. I must say several Doctor's did try to give me some relief. ATP I'll just deal with the pain, rather than be verbally disrespected and made to feel like I don't deserve proper treatment, and be kicked out by the "Director" of the Columbia facility I was referred to. It's sad that the empathetic bed side manner has gone out the window since the pandemic. Many Doctors(NOT all) seem to be preoccupied with their own lives and are doing the bare minimum to truly accommodate patients. When I advocate for myself I was casted out like I don't matter, and or mean nothing to said Director. I have another upcoming appointment with the NP. She verbalized she has been trying to advocate for me, but Dr Soudan is firm with regards to not increasing my pain meds. I've decided to be treated as a human being, I'll transfer to another facility. Good luck, if you deal with chronic pain and are seeking relief and help, and you're melanated and go to the Columbia office. I pray you don't  be verbally disrespected, humiliated and made to feel like you're just some junky seeking drugs.|When I moved here I had to find a new doctor to take over my treatment. Dr. Soudan listened to my problems and has helped me have quality of life. Front desk is patient and helpful. Couldn't recommend him and his staff more!|Dr. Soudan was incredibly dismissive of me today at my first appointment and only spent five minutes with me after I waited almost an hour and a half in their waiting room. I have neck pain that has disabled me to the point of needing to take medical leave from my job, and global pain due to a connective tissue disorder I have. He immediately on entering the room and hearing this told me "We don't treat global pain. Unless imaging can find something mechanically wrong in your neck, we cannot treat your pain." He then laughed a bit and said "And since you're only what, 21?", Implying that it was unlikely there was anything wrong with me because I am young. Firstly, he got my age wrong - I am 23, so evidently he didn't check my paperwork. Secondly, I informed him that due to my disorder, many of my joints were mechanically damaged.

He then told me to see a rheumatologist for my pain since it was due to connective tissue, which I told him I had done in the past and then was dismissed from their practice since my connective tissue disorder was not arthritic or inflammatory. He had the audacity to try and correct me saying that connective tissue disorders ARE inflammatory, which they are not! (At least not mine.) I told him the only inflammation in my disorder is from microinjuries due to instability from connective tissue laxity, and it is not rheumatic or autoinflammatory whatsoever. He then went silent on that topic and soon left the room to write my referral, and never returned to the room personally.

My PCP referred me here specifically to be treated for my pain. It is a pain clinic. Of course they CAN treat my pain, they just won't. I left this appointment with no options given to me for ways they could help with pain management, only a referral for an MRI where the doctor misspelled my (very basic and common) first name multiple times. He clearly didn't read any of the 50 freaking pages of paperwork they had me fill out before my appointment in which I was very detailed. I was condescended to based on my age, I was "corrected" about my own disability which the doctor was wrong about, and I was sent out of the office crying because I am so sick of being ping-ponged between doctors who are unwilling to help me and insist on referring me to someone else to deal with me.

If you have any kind of complex medical history, don't see Dr. Soudan, especially if you are young. He was very explicit that he ONLY treats spinal issues, and clearly thought that my pain was minimal simply due to my age. It is not. I am in an 8 or 9/10 pain many evenings each month and average a 5 or 6/10 pain every single day.|Absolute horrible service scheduled me multiple times for injections each time they canceled my Appointment and on the last visit they had me waiting in the waiting room for a hour after my scheduled appointment. They said the doctor had a meeting that is so unprofessional of Ashish g shanbhag. Treating her time like it's more valuable than mine. If you scheduled appointment honor it. there's no reason for a doctor to have you waiting in the waiting room for over an hour while she talks on the phone.|My appointment for the injections was at 1:30pm, and they asked me to arrive At 1pm. I arrived on time, and it was already past 3:15pm when I left the place. absolute horrible service. they had me waiting in the waiting room to long. I feel I wasn't taken seriously the first and last time I visited this office. I never returned and would not recommend this office.|I feel I wasn't taken seriously the first (and last) time I visited this office. I wasn't seen until an hour after my initial appointment time even though I was on time. I've suffered 2 stress fractures of the spine in a one-year span with no particularly traumatic mechanism of injury involved. As a young adult who really shouldn't be sustaining these kinds of injuries, I was pretty disappointed by the lack of concern and options I had been given. Literally every other doctor I've consulted about this has said the frequency and MOI of these injuries is abnormal for someone my age (and I agree.  It's affected my quality of life a great deal as a physically active person). Yet, all Dr. Soudan had to offer me was an anti-inflammatory prescription. Even after insisting that the lifestyle advice I was being given was already part of my normal routine, there was seemingly nothing more integrative or aggressive that could be done for me, not even suggestions for blood panels. The cherry on top was being told by Dr. Soudan that I should schedule my follow-up for 4 weeks after that initial meeting. During checkout just a few moments later, I was told it would be almost 3 months til I could be seen again. I never returned and would not recommend this office. What for?

At the Potomac Center for Chronic Pain Management and Wellness, we specialize in providing personalized, compassionate care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in Upper Marlboro, MD, our dedicated team of pain management physicians works diligently to develop customized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs. Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Kunal Sood, MD
column3:
At National Spine and Pain Centers, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert care of Dr. Kunal Sood.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Dr. Sood joined our team in July 2018, bringing exceptional expertise after completing his interventional pain medicine fellowship and anesthesiology residency at Wayne State University's Detroit Medical Center. With his medical degree from the American University of Antigua and background in biological sciences from the University of Maryland, Dr. Sood combines advanced medical knowledge with compassionate care. We offer a wide range of interventional pain treatments including:

  • Specialized back and neck pain management

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Interventional pain techniques

  • Comprehensive treatment planning

Our approach focuses on understanding each patient's unique pain challenges and developing personalized treatment plans. Located in Germantown, MD, we're committed to helping patients find relief and improve their quality of life. For comprehensive pain management solutions, visit our website or call us at +1 301-528-2810 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Kunal Sood, M.D. joined National Pain & Spine Centers in July 2018 after completing his interventional pain medicine fellowship and anesthesiology residency at Wayne State University's Detroit Medical Center Earning his medical degree from the American University of Antigua, Dr. Sood was part of AUA's twinning program studying basic medical sciences at Manipal University in India. He graduated with a Bachelor of Science in biological sciences in 2008 from the University of Maryland, College Park. Dr. Sood was drawn to anesthesiology because of the diverse cases, procedure variety and helping patients navigate a stressful time in their lives. While practicing anesthesiology, he was attracted by the pain management aspect of the specialty.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - White Plains
column3:
Leading Pain Management Specialists in Maryland

At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), we are proud to be one of the nation's largest pain management practices, serving patients across seven states. Since our formation in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, we have rapidly expanded our network to include over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers. Our White Plains location exemplifies our commitment to comprehensive pain management solutions delivered by experienced specialists.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Customized medication management

  • Innovative non-surgical therapies

  • Specialized spine care

Our mission is to bring together the highest quality providers in pain management to create an extensive network meeting the needs of patients suffering from chronic pain. Through our strategic partnerships, including our 2012 affiliations with Capitol Spine & Pain and New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), we've established a strong presence throughout D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia. Visit our White Plains location to experience our patient-centered approach to pain relief.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.
