At check in  they told me I had a balance and refused me service until I made a Minimum payment I made the payment just to call billing and I don't have a balance on my account. They refuse to refund my money and every time I talk to the people over the phone they tell me it will be handled but nothing has been and every time I call to follow up, they tell me that they don't have record of me speaking to the previous person about the refund I asked to speak to a manager multiple times and have not they have people over seas handling the office through a computer|The Dr was very nice. He was concerned about how im taking my medication and it made me feel like he actually cares. I have had doctors that literally spend 2 minutes with me and push me out the door. So thank you for caring about my health.|Dr. Shockley is great! I trust him completely with my injections and epidural's and he does a great job.|I love, Dr. Tristan Shockley, he is an awesome, Doctor.
He doesn't rush you, to move on to other patients.
He really seems to care.
Thank you Dr. Shockley|Been my Dr since 2006 I believe?? So that should tell you the level care I receive, I get treated very well and love going there.|Dr. James Hill was amazing, so sad he is no longer there.  Smiled alot, listened to you with his full attention to your pain elements.  Between the time Dr Hill left til mid-August I saw Shirley F, Gaithersburg office, have been  seeing her for about 5 visits then she went on  maternity leave.  Now I am seeing Dr Shockley he seems like a busy man and a Lil stressed, due to staffing  needs.

The front office girls are very  cordial and proficient.I

But one thing is lacking...I left 3 voice mails with in this week and nobody/human answer the phone, justso had to leave messages.  received a recording...this phone call is being recorded and to leave a  message it's been
3 days and no one called back yet. Then today late afternoon, I spoke with Charity at the call center after 2nd ring, she truly is a compassionate lady and is always on target to follow-up
With you, and diligently makes every effort til the problem is solved. I wish there were more people like her that haven't lost integrity.

Current situation, due to delayed order of 10 mg oxycodone, by the manufacturer,  it was undetermined when it will be available, but they have 5 mg available, which was to last 30 days it was advised to take when needed and/or  5mg every 6 hrs, but the 10 mg are now available. So with a spine surgery coming.up L1-L5 and sciatica and then in 8 weeks, a  total knee replacement,  I am in chronic pain everyday cause  I am the primary caretaker of my 88 yr old mother with dementia and I really have no standby,  I don't know how much longer I can get by being neglectful and her needs due to stairs (split foyer. walking bending, sleeping. household chores.  Everything is a struggle  I i told Dr Hill all about my situation l  I can't afford assisted living nor nursing home.

So please don't let me go 2 weeks without pain meds, the medical profession knows this because this is not sufficient of my regular refill  and very oncerning to me due to abruptly stopping this medication. You need to gradually wean off it, withdrawals can be dangerous and not easy, might even have visit to  emergency room to get stabilize if it gets that bad.
When only a new script can be written (the pharmist said that would be acceptable) and sent to pharmacy within 10-15 minutes of my original monthly refill.
Please reconsider my situation and what level of pain I have everyday,  I am expecting a phone call back tomorrow.   I just want a normal quality life back again I should.have the 2 surgeries taken care of by December. I  apologize for this very very  long review and I hope one of the Dr's reads  this and continues to manage my pain like it has been from the beginning. Thank you so much and God bless.
Overall this practice has been great. With 1 exception.
Please advise.|I gave it one because you can't give it -0. Dr Shockley is the ONLY good thing about this place. The Rosedale location has a VERY unsanitary restroom. Cross contamination ALL OVER the place!! Dr Shockley needs to be told about the "policy" of having people come in EVERY 2 weeks instead of being discharged! I had a UA back in JUNE that was questionable. I wasn't told untill August, when the ruling body of Khyanne returned from Kenya! Then she had me coming every 2 weeks, for 12 weeks I did it! Then the last UA somehow contained Methadone AND Suboxone!! I know what those medications are used for and DON'T have access to them. Khyanne however does, with her specialty being MAT (Medication Assisted Treatment) for getting off meds like Hydrocodone, Oxycodone, Dilaudid etc. BEWARE FOLKS, the next "bad UA" could be yours!
Dr Shockley is wonderful, and knew just how to get around A LOT of scar tissue to do a lumbar epidural! He is GREAT!!!|I can't imagine how anyone couldn't like or recommend Mr. Hill! He's efficient, quick, explains everything thoroughly, actually researches your conditions/treatments, loves to consult with other providers for adequate and continuum of care, he's caring, empathetic and I can say so much more. But above all those things, the best thing I love about him is that no matter how much pain you're in and how hard it is to bare, he always seems to make you smile and laugh. He takes interest in you as a person and not just a patient. I highly recommend him, and it's always a pleasure seeing him on my appointment days. I also appreciate this clinic as a whole!

column40:
I'll be pursing a malpractice case and seeking a full investigation into this provider, and as Yale Law grad, with 2 MPH with expertise in this area, I know what I just saw and experienced--I just had another appointment with Dr Hough, this time recorded, because as I had previously reported, he was argumentative, constantly interrupted me and claimed that I "didn't trust him." (You don't get to tell me what I think or feel). I have been his patient for over 10 years, and he had previously been an excellent, kind person who listened to patients. Clearly something happened because others have reported, he does have an acerbic, aggressive bedside manner. In all my appointments, he misstated facts and talked down to me (a woman of color) repeatedly, something demonstrated in research is a real problem with women seeking pain tx.  A year ago, Hough did a routine left hip injection that resulted in an unusual side effect which numbed my leg--not unusual in that it happened, unusual in the length of time. I've had the hip injected many times without issue.  Hough maintained then as he does now that it had nothing to do with his injection. I've had this same hip, same area injected 8 times under ultrasound guidance, and instead of outright saying he would not do the hip injection again a yr later, he sent me on a goose chase of additional imaging, which was negative (I told him it would be negative), and additional appointments. He actually changed his records to reflect a "clinical finding of back pain," despite telling him it was my hip and that rheum + ortho confirmed HIP. But for pain management, I was willing to jump through his hoops--finding pain management isn't easy and oral steroids+opiods is terrible for long term tx.. I was and am concerned he was repeatedly twisting my words and constantly interrupting me, even after asking him to allow me to finish, but even with my husband present, he talked over me, then called ME adversarial. Disagreeing isn't adversarial, especially when he has incorrect information, and all patients should be interested in ensuring physicians have accurate information. Hough was supposed to obtain records from the 8 other injections, and failed to do so. He then stated that he was not willing to do the procedure--WHY the hoops and WHY not tell me that four appointments ago? He was unprepared for the appointment. Although he maintains his injection was no where near any nerves that would cause temporary leg numbness, the only reason he would both refuse to continue to treat, while assuring me the leg numbness wasn't his procedure, was that he in fact committed medical malpractice. He made no attempts to find out why it happened, and then blamed me for "not trusting him" when he came unprepared and with incorrect information.  As such, I have reported him to my insurer, to his professional board and to the Maryland oversight agency to investigate. This provider has no care for patients anymore--I don't know what happened--but if you are a woman or person of color, you should exercise caution as this physician is dangerous and causes harm in what he did to me--gaslight, cause harm, talk over you, raise his voice, and dismiss you. I've seen other reviews consistent with my own experiences with him in 2024 and 2025. Ironically, he responds to Google reviews faster than portal messages or patient requests.|I have been seeing Dr Hough on and off since 2012. He has always been an exceptional provider. I came in for a joint injection, a procedure that has been done a dozen times and that was confirmed as a *procedure* with Sandy.  Dr Hough said the "never so that," which has not been my experience, and if I had known that, I would have requested a virtual appointment as I am bedbound and getting to appointments is extremely difficult and painful.  So instead of the procedure, he flat out refused to do it, ordered an MR, and sent me on my way.

What is especially frustrating was that he was so cold and unkind about it. He knows my history  and that I've been a pain patient for years to an inflammatory autoimmune disease.  No other treatment options were provided other than my regular opioids, which is obviously terrible long term pain *management.*

What absolutely shocked me was that I was visibly upset and crying, and he literally could not care less. He was almost frazzled and frustrated, which was crazy because EYE am the one in pain and in need of a very routine injection that rheumatology has done and that he has done.

It's fine to disagree, but it's never okay to dismiss a patient's pain, to be so thoughtless, uncaring and unkind.  No alternatives were discussed or offered.|Office got me in immediately. Dr Hough was very compassionate with my pain. And worked me very quickly to get me some pain relief at first appointment. And has continued to help for weeks afterwards. He immediately answered many questions I had through patient portal. Nothing but great things to say about Dr Hough and his Staff was fantastic.|I went to see Dr Hough after having an unsuccessful back surgery  that left me with the same amount of extraordinary pain if not worse. Dr. Hough had a very cold, and curt bedside manner. He ordered me to have a CT scan which three days later after the scan, I had to call his office to get the results on unfortunately. He then had his assistant call me who simply stated," The procedure I had done by the other doctor was done correctly". Dr. Hough knew how much pain I am in as he had to order a controlled substance for me to be able to lie down flat in order to take the CT scan,yet he didn't even have the decency to call me back himself and spend the time with me explaining what he saw on the scan. His assistant basically told me there was nothing he is prepared to do other than what he has done and I should see my regular physician and tell him that I have osteoporosis. I feel after this experience with Dr. Hough,that he at  no time showed any care or compassion for me as a human being or his patient.|Dr Hough is exceptional in his field. We met at the hospital about 10 years ago while admitted for 2 disc that were unbearable. He explained the injection in my spine. Answered all of my scary questions, gave me prognosis of others he had done this procedures & said I would have to come office a couple more times to his office. He even agreed to have my mother & church officials to come in prayer hospital room to have prayer first recognizing that he his a great physician but God is the greatest physician I also had an extreme situation in the early part of covid. We did video calls and one visit to his office that was extremely difficult to ride in car to office. His staff was awesome. They got a wheel chair and took me outside with a smile... I'll never forget it. It took a while of tryinag different measures but we finally got there. I'm not easily impressed by Drs but I completely trust him & that says a lot coming from. Thank you Dr Hough for who you are.|Thank you Dr. Hough!  Your knowledge and experience guided you to the right place for the administration of the shot in my back to completely relieve me of the pain I was experiencing!  I had the best night's sleep the night after you administered the shot that I've had in the past several months!   Thanks again!!!|From my first call, trying to get my new patient appointment, I was treated respectfully and helped immediately.  The office staff was professional, friendly and helpful.  The doctor educated me and explained what my pain was being caused by.  He took a great deal of time with me and showed me images on the computer that explained and supported his findings. The doctor's assistant during the epidural steroid injection was calming and reassuring.  The information email, complete with video exercises to do at home is fantastic.|Been a patient for quite a few years.  Dr. Hough cares about his patients, never rushes through appointment, always takes his time to understand your medical situation.  Can't say enough about his staff, they are great! Always accommodating, courteous and put forth every effort to assist you.

At the University of Maryland Pain Management Center, we specialize in treating both chronic and acute pain conditions with a multidisciplinary approach focused on improving quality of life. column40: My partner goes here - this place is  percent UNPROFESSIONAL....she hasn't been able to get her prescription for 2 weeks because of their total incompetence and also serious and blatant discrimination probably because she's a Medicaid recipient. We call the patient advocate - it didn't help AT ALL. I wouldn't send ANYONE here - they aren't a cut above the rest....the level of disrespect with which she has been spoken to by almost EVERY person in this place is probably grounds for a malpractice suit which we will be looking into. If you can't write a prescription properly and send in the appropriate paperwork, you probably shouldn't be doing pain management of any type. I don't care if you are the Universiry of Maryland, you suck. I thought doctors took an oath that said first do no harm somebody not able to get their medication because of complete and total incompetence is not doing no harm. These are horrible, horrible people running this place. Terrible humans. I can name names if necessary and will to our attorney. Awful, horrible, heartless, disrespectful, unprofessional, incompetent staff. And that's being kind. We will be seeking legal counsel at this point....for discrimination and malpractice.|I've been very happy with the care I've received from my doctor and all the staff here. column3:
At Advanced Pain Management, we provide comprehensive pain relief solutions under the expert guidance of our highly qualified physicians.

Expert Medical Team

Our practice is led by Dr. Abed, who is board certified in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. He received his medical degree with honors from Tufts University School of Medicine in Boston, Massachusetts, followed by a four-year residency at the distinguished Pennsylvania State University Program and an interventional pain medicine fellowship at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center. Working alongside him is Dr. Tzvi Grossman, who specializes in the newest and most advanced forms of treatment. Dr. Grossman attended Medical School at Temple University in Philadelphia and completed his residency in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine fellowship at Jefferson Hospital.

We offer a wide range of interventional pain management services including:

  • Spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Kyphoplasty for vertebral fractures

  • Advanced diagnostic procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

Our team combines extensive medical expertise with a compassionate approach to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. Located in Timonium, Maryland, we welcome patients seeking effective pain management solutions. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 443-652-3850 to schedule a consultation.
column11:

Dr. Abed further advanced his training by completing an interventional pain medicine fellowship at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center in Pittsburgh, PA.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - St. Agnes
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Established in 2011 through a rebranding of The Spine Center, we've rapidly expanded our network to better serve patients suffering from chronic pain.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

At our St. Agnes location, we provide specialized care through our team of experienced pain management physicians. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Conservative pain management approaches

  • Advanced diagnostic services

We've grown significantly since our founding, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012 and later with New York Pain Physicians. Today, we operate over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia. Our mission remains consistent: bringing together high-quality providers in pain management to create an extensive network meeting the needs of our growing patient population. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or to schedule an appointment at our Baltimore location.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

column40:
Greetings! I would be very happy to give my opinion on the choice pain management office,The Doctors and staff are very pleasant ,I'm always happy with the service when I go. I would surely recommend your office if I were aware that someone is in need of physical therapy or rehabilitation   .I've had a family member to recieve help and he was back to work in half the time initially given by another company  He is happy with the therapy he recieved as well.   Thanking you always for adding to my quality of life I have now ! we are happier and he's able to perform better on the job.... thanksa again for the great  services. ,|Mrs Kiyanne and Bruce are the BEST BUT YOU'LL NEW PHONE SYSTEM IS TRASH SO IM TAKING 3 STARS AWAY FOR THAT

Also after reading reviews showing doctor Murray. Even my psych doctor wouldn't talk to him via phone ( which he got upset and accused her of trying to get me hooked on benzos) because she stated he was too unprofessional and the way he spoke to me she didn't want to talk to him. He talked to staff the same way with such disregard. I gotten a surgery for weight-loss and he said to me you'll have problems ( in which i didn't) Hey told me that another one of his white patients died from overdose being on the same medicine I'm on in which had me terrified but like my psych doctor said SHE OVERDOSES which meant she took more than needed. She was trying to explain to him that a overdose is a overdose and if a patient don't take meds out of term then it won't happen. He kept disagreeing and told her she's just a NPC and he's a MD. HE'S gone now but I got anxiety EACH VISIT with him. SO GLAD HE'S GONE. IMMA TAKE ANOTHER STAR JUST FOR HIM|Excellent professional!! This provider has great bedside manner. She calmed my concerns, gave the care I needed and follow up was right on time.|Staff is friendly...Dr Bruce Abraham answered all my questions and concerns feel very comfortable with talking and discussing my health concerns and medications....|The minute  you walk in the staff greet with a smile then the service in the back is very fast and friendly  and they listen to your concerns|I went to the Choice Pain on Reisterstown Road. I had only one bad experience with this site.  The doctor I saw was belligerent and condescending.  I voice my displeasure with him and instructed the staff to not schedule me with that particular physician. after that interaction they matched me with a much better caregiver.  They worked well with us when we moved out of state to North Carolina and had to come back to Baltimore to be seen by Doctor McCutchens.  They were very accommodating because we were coming so far to be seen.  I would like to say thank you all for making a difficult situation much more tolerable.|I had an incredibly disappointing and unprofessional experience during my visit at CHOICE Pain & Rehabilitation Center on Reisterstown Rd. in Baltimore MD, with the CRNP, Murray Obanye.  I arrived with high hopes, carrying over 150 pages of extensive medical records, including diagnostic tests, previous doctor diagnoses, MRI's, CT scans, ultrasounds, X-rays, medication histories, and more.

To begin with, this doctor failed to show any genuine concern or professionalism.  He didn't even bother to take a cursory glance at the extensive medical documentation I had brought with me (which I had to PAY to get from all of my previous doctors & specialist). Instead, he immediately judged me based on my appearance (I have tattoos) and age, and proceeded to dismiss me and my condition, which is anything but trivial, and suggested that I seek another doctor who might be "more willing to prescribe pain management medication."

To make matters worse, he didn't take my situation seriously at all and cut me off mid- explanation to then suggested that "I get an inhaler for my chest pain from my primary care physician instead of seeking pain management".  Had he taken the time to review ANY of my medical records, he would have realized the severity of my condition.  My records clearly show the presence of masses and tumors in my chest, which should not be addressed with a mere inhaler.

Furthermore, the doctor's lack of assessment of the portion of my records that showed my medication history, was completely off base.  I was not seeking medication as a first resort; in fact, I had previously explored nonconventional treatments under the guidance of my previous pain management specialist while living in CA. My move to a new area prompted my search for a new doctor, NOT an eagerness for prescription drugs....

Perhaps the most disheartening part of the appointment was when the Dr. openly LAUGHED at me and at my situation. This unprofessional behavior was not only hurtful but also extremely unbecoming of someone who calls themselves a "medical professional".

While I was in the middle of trying to explain to him of my condition to the best of my ability, the doctor walked out of the room, and returned about 10 minutes later and handed me a printout of another pain management specialist and casually suggested that I might have better luck getting prescribed something there. This complete lack of empathy, understanding, and professionalism was disheartening and disappointing.

Medical conditions can affect anyone, regardless of age, appearance, race, or sexual orientation. Patients should not face preconceived biases. This experience highlights the importance of consistent professionalism and ethics in healthcare, treating all patients with respect regardless of their appearance.
Not to mention, I was charged $170.00 for my initial appointment regardless of the fact that they conducted ZERO test and the doctor gave me MAYBE 2 minutes of his time, after I waited for over an hour to be seen by the CRNP, Murray Obanye.

I STRONGLY advise for ANYONE who's seeking genuine medical care to really think twice before considering this doctor, and I'd recommend avoiding CHOICE Pain & Rehabilitation Center's together as a whole. My experience was nothing short of a nightmare, and I hope that my review helps others avoid the same ordeal.
I am now being seen and treated by Greater Maryland Pain Management and have not a single bad thing to say about them.  I'd start there and avoid this mess of situation you'll most likely end up in if seen by Murray Obanye.|Lovely front desk and staff, however,  the CRNP, Murray Obanye, treated me like I was a drug seeker! Because he cannot see my pain on my scans, he basically told me I don't have pain. If you're a patient with Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's disease, or any invisible illness, DO NOT GO! This man laughed at me and told me I just have opioid dependency! I've been a chronic pain patient for 5 yrs (so obviously, my body is dependent on the medicine) After being bed ridden for 6 months and almost losing my job, I agreed to go to pain management and pain meds gave me my life back! I went from 0 quality of life, to being, gratefully, able to go back to work and care for my family. How hurtful for a doctor to tell you nothing is wrong with you, and basically, in other words, call me a liar! I wish I could switch bodies with some of these Dr's who took an oath to treat patients with chronic pain.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management & Psychiatric Care in Bethesda

At Point Performance, Dr. Hassan Majeed brings exceptional expertise as a board-certified specialist in adult, child, and adolescent psychiatry, addiction medicine, and pain medicine. We believe that emotional, physical, and social well-being are fundamentally interconnected, which is why our approach integrates multiple treatment modalities for optimal results. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Medication management with personalized approaches

  • Psychological interventions including cognitive behavioral therapy

  • Meditation techniques for mind-body healing

  • Advanced pain management procedures (injections and minimally invasive surgeries)

Dr. Majeed's unique dual specialization allows us to address both the physical and psychological aspects of chronic conditions, creating truly holistic treatment plans. Our goal is to empower patients to achieve long-term health and well-being through our integrated approach. Visit our website or call us at +1 301-579-7760 to schedule a consultation at our Bethesda office located at 6400 Goldsboro Rd #340, Bethesda, MD 20817.
column11: Dr. Majeed is board certified in adult, child, and adolescent psychiatry, addiction medicine, and pain medicine. Dr. Majeed believes that a person's emotional, physical, and social well-being are interrelated. He combines the best application of medications, psychological approaches--including cognitive behavioral therapy and meditation--and physical interventions (injections and minimally invasive surgeries) that will enable his patients to achieve long-term health and well-being.

column40:
" Dr. Majeed is a wonderful doctor! He is caring and kind and easy to talk to, he listens and explains difficult concepts thoroughly and completely and he is very prompt! The office staff is helpful, friendly and efficient. Dr. Majeed is one of my favorite Doctors! "|I consulted Dr. Majeed because of extreme cramping in my back, hip and thigh, which was painful and debilitating.  He observed my condition, asked questions, listened to my answers, and responded with medication and a prescription for physical therapy (which was available in the same Point Performance office).  Over a period of several months, my condition got markedly better.  When the condition subsequently recurred, he observed the condition and offered additional treatment, which seems to have helped a lot.  I am grateful for Dr. Majeed's careful attention and calm, personal approach.|Service provision by Dr. Suros and his staff was fine. Unfortunately, the immediate relief that lumbar epidural typically provide did not occur and I've had pain not only immediately after the procedure but in the subsequent days. My follow up is not until sometime in February, which is two or three weeks away thus I will be contacting me Point performance medicine to determine my next course of action.
As always service was courteous, professional, and informative.|I found Dr. Majeed through a referral from my orthopedist, who suggested I see him for his creative and holistic approach to healing, which has made a lasting impression on me.

When I first reached out to Dr. Majeed, I was recovering from a long and deeply traumatizing medical crisis. My previous doctors had told me that my life and career aspirations were too lofty given my complex medical situation. I was living with new chronic pain that felt insurmountable with traditional medical approaches and was struggling to find a doctor who understood my unique needs and challenges.

From our first meeting, Dr. Majeed validated my experiences with empathy and dedication, and I found his demeanor to be remarkably gentle. He is a patient listener, making it easy to discuss even the most challenging topics without ever feeling dismissed or unheard. Scheduling appointments with Dr. Majeed is remarkably efficient, and his office staff are both quick to respond and highly professional, ensuring a seamless experience. He approached my care with innovative solutions tailored to my needs, seamlessly blending his expertise in psychiatry and interventional pain management. Because of his extensive training, Dr. Majeed neither diminishes the challenges of psychological pain nor those of physical pain. This unique combination allows him to address the emotional, physical, and social aspects of health in a comprehensive manner, ensuring well-rounded care. This personalized approach has made me feel truly supported throughout my recovery journey.

Since working with Dr. Majeed, my symptoms have become significantly more manageable, allowing me to focus on my personal hopes and aspirations. Dr. Majeed's approach has not only met but exceeded my expectations by fostering a collaborative and affirming relationship. He has played a pivotal role in helping me thrive in grad school, something I was told by other doctors would not be possible given my complex medical situation. His care has renewed my confidence in pursuing my goals while managing my health, allowing me to approach life with a sense of resilience and possibility I hadn't imagined.

To my disabled kin reading this: Dr. Majeed is one of the few doctors I have found who affirms the mind-body connection we understand so well as a community. I rarely feel this aligned with a doctor, and I cannot recommend him highly enough. His creative, knowledgeable, and collaborative approach to care has been deeply affirming. If you are seeking a doctor who will take the time to exercise compassion, tailor their care to your needs, and collaborate with you to achieve your goals, Dr. Majeed is an exceptional choice.|Dr. Majeed is thorough in his evaluation, empathetic in his manner.  His treatments are successful, and he will not recommend therapies which are not necessary.  He has been very responsive to my concerns, and to those of my wife, who needed a cortisone injection for shoulder pain.  He is a doctor who we respect very much, both professionally and personally.|I had severe pain throughout my whole body and it felt like lightning was ripping my cells apart. None of my doctors knew what was going on and then after a month I found Dr. Majeed. He immediately knew what was going on with me, explained how to treat it, and told me he could give me hope which was very comforting as my anxiety and depression had skyrocketed due to the pain. The treatment plan he explained to me was 4 ketamine infusions. He gave a lot of information about the process and what to expect during the infusion and made himself very available for questions. Overall I had a great experience with him as my doctor and after the treatment he recommended the pain is completely gone.|I have seen Dr. Majeed for evaluation and treatment of lower back and hip pain on two occasions a few years apart (multiple visits on each occasion). In my experience, he is a knowledgeable and caring physician who is perceptive and who treats patients in the full context of their lives. He works closely with the physical therapists at Point Performance, who have been instrumental in helping me recover function and reduce pain (thank you Ally L!). He has prescribed medication when I have needed it but is not a pill-pusher and I feel fortunate to have him as my pain physician.|I went to Dr. Majeed with a very unusual pain complaint. He listened quietly and carefully to my history. He proposed a compound medication that other doctors had not considered. Within a month my pain syndrome abated almost completely, with no medication side effects at all. I am quite pleased with his help. I can recommend him for non-invasive pain management problem considerations.

column40:
Awesome vibe here, Doctor Rodriguez was super understanding and explained to me everything that was going on with my knee.  They had me back on my feet within 24 hours.  The office was super clean and all of the office were professional and super nice.  I definitely will go there again in the future.|Easy to communicate with staff and office. David Rodriguez was my provider. He was very thorough, kind and professional. Thanks again!|The staff at Laurel are very friendly and kind.  They ask before they touch you as they want to make sure they are not causing you any additional pain.  The office is clean and tidy.  Amit Patel PA is kind and extremely competent.  He gives me more informatIon about pathology than my Dr.'s and I understand what he is saying. I really appreciate his kind compassionate and knowledgeable care. He has been a real blessing to me!|Due to an Insurance change, I had to find another pain management doctor. Which was fine, because my old one was always late by 1-2 hours on every appointment and so I ended up always wasting my time. Anyway, when having to switch doctors sometimes they want to reinvent the wheel.

I showed up with all of my notes. I included my medications I've been taking, the treatment plan I've had for years and anything else I thought was helpful. Dr. Alexander Bury was simply a fresh breath of air. I'm 44, been in pain for over 20 years from a roller coaster accident. He listened, appreciated my notes and info and provided a wealth of information on the pain device. He said let's not deviate from my regular plan. It's taken me years to have a plan that allows me to function with my kids and husband.

Definitely recommend this business especially this doctor. Thank you for your compassion!|My first appointment was today with Dr PATEL. I thought he was wonderful! Very nice and listened to all my health history. He said we're gonna get you where you need to be. And I felt like he was genuinely concerned about my overall health as a patient. The front desk receptionist was nice and everyone else was very nice too!!! I really like him. Wonderful Dr|The front desk and the nursing staff were courteous and polite. And the Physician Assistant Patel will definitely be an excellent doctor. He listened well and answered my questions professionally.|So the PA Amit Patel is a very kind and compassionate doctor and the office staff and MA are very good. Here are the problems:
1)I have been seen 3 times over almost 3 months with no treatment plan.
2)They can't seem to get the records from my other doctors in a timely manner.
3)You cannot call there office and actually talk to a human being.they have a call center that passes on a message I have left many messages with no return call .
4)They have a patient portal that the doctors don't respond to the messages you send
5)Their check in system that calls you never works so you can't check in unless your at a computer.
So my summary of the system they have is that they have great doctors and staff but they see you frequently without actually treating anything. The reviews of 5 stars are the only ones you will see because reviews like min never get addressed. There system keeps you from communicating with your doctor and doesn't allow the doctor time to address your real issues. This company makes a lot of visits and money but the patients are not receiving the good care. They are apathetic and make no effort to resolve problems as they occur in real time. I'm a nurse for 23years and have given my all to my patients. I have destroyed my body giving care to others, yet this group couldn't even call me back, doctor Patel you said you would let me know if you could get my records which is the only thing stopping me from getting treatment why didn't you care enough to call or email. Do better people don't expect perfection just compassionate caring attentiveness!
UPDATE 8/2/23
SO I increased my review of this pain managment office to 3 or 3.5.Dr Patel and Candice in the office are amazing they receive 10 stars. The doctor did finally get the information from my other doctors and he has made a plan that allows me to function like I used to while I strength my body, stretch and work on flexibility and mobility and balance. He has given me back my ability to move beyond my past comorbidities. He has treated me with respect and non judgement. I can now heal. It was a rocky start and we will see each other in Columbia as the laurel office is getting a facelift. I will say this I would recommend PA Amid Patel to anyone with chronic pain issues that is trying to get better and just needs to be treated like a human not a medical diagnosis.....He is very empathetic!!!!! The patient portal is the only real way to connect with your doctor should you need to the phone situation with this company is janky at best but it does allow the doctors to spend more time with the patients and less time in the phone.|I love my doctor. Dr Patel is always informative and meets all of needs. Gives great advice on my health issues. He's the best! Thank you for being a great person to talk to about anything! Happy Holidays to the entire Clearway family!!

column3:
Founded in 1998, Pain Management Specialists has been serving Rockville and Frederick, Maryland with dedicated, comprehensive pain care for over two decades. Our practice specializes in the optimal treatment of pain caused by spinal conditions, nerve injury, surgery, and cancer. At our core, we believe that effective pain management requires a personalized, multimodal approach. Our board-certified physicians, Dr. Stuart Hough and Dr. Ramani Peruvemba, take the time to thoroughly understand the intricacies of each patient's pain condition before designing an individualized treatment plan.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of treatment options including:

  • Interventional pain management procedures

  • Specialized treatment for spinal conditions

  • Nerve injury management

  • Post-surgical pain relief

  • Cancer pain management

  • Patient education and guidance

While our expertise is in interventional techniques, we understand that the best results come from a comprehensive, patient-centered approach. We're committed to helping you find relief through carefully designed treatment plans that address your specific needs. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you manage your pain and improve your quality of life.
column11:
PAIN MANAGEMENT SPECIALISTS

Founded in 1998, Pain Management Specialists in Rockville and Frederick, Maryland, is dedicated to optimal treatment of pain caused by spinal conditions, nerve injury, surgery, and cancer. While their expertise is interventional pain management, board-certified physicians Stuart Hough, MD, and Ramani Peruvemba, MD, believe that the best results are achieved through comprehensive, multimodal, patient-centered pain care. They take the time to uncover the intricacies of your pain problem, and to design a plan of care that's right for you. Their treatment plans may include everything from simple education and guidance, to more complex, interventional pain management solutions.

column40:
Dr. Hough is the best of the best. After witnessing how kind he was to my friend (the patient) who had severe back pain, I ended up making an appointment myself for my sciatic pain. Dr. Hough was just as kind to me and I scheduled an injection with him, which brought months of relief. I have recently been diagnosed with Lipedema and over the years, I have had COUNTLESS doctors blame everything on my weight. Dr. Hough didn't do that and I left there feeling heard and taken seriously. I would absolutely recommend him to anyone (and I do!!) who needs help with pain management. You won't find anyone better.|Loved Dr. Hough's no-nonsense attitude and truthfulness. He also included a lot of information on possible pain relief strategies. I highly recommend him!|I have been very satisfied in my consultations with Dr. Hough.  He is personable and took his time explaining my medical problems in detail in understandable language.  We discussed ways to address my concerns.  I would recommend him.  Getting an appointment was not difficult.|I was able to get an appointment for chronic back pain within a week. Dr. Hough looked closely at my scans, etc., explained very clearly what was happening, and suggested a new procedure that he has trained in called INTRACEPT. His patient coordinator Cindy kept in touch with me!|Dr Hough took time to look at my x-rays and explain exactly what they showed. He also was very straightforward about current medications I was on and how that could affect any sort of treatment that he would do. He also gave me a plan to follow for now and then suggested I come back.|This visit was exceptionally good.
It was on time.
The check in process was thorough and cordial.
Dr. Hough took time to listen to my questions and asked pertinent questions regarding my situation. He took time to thoroughly explain my MRI results so that I understood. I felt I was in the best hands. I really felt like he cared about my situation.
I would highly recommend Dr. Hough.|One of the few medical offices that places being on-time for their patients a priority, friendly staff that always help resolve your issues!!
Listen to my pain and mobility concerns, then designed a pain management strategy to reduce my overall pain level that allowed for better sleep and increased daily activities!!|The virtual appointment was ontime and worked well (I was able to clearly see the MRI views). Dr. Hough spent a good amount of time explaining what he thinks is happening in my back and the resulting pain in other areas. I feel I got good information and advice.

column48: Do you have formulary doctors or just doctors that do in injections
column49: Not sure what a formulary doctor is, but our practice specializes in interventional pain management. Generally we do not prescribe opioids except for acute and cancer pain.
